description:
The Mint Mojito iced coffee at Philz will change your life in the best way and make you rethink how you like your coffee. Personally, I love a good unsweetened black iced coffee on the daily but Philz makes the best coffee drink out there. This was the first location I ever went but am so glad they have expanded all over California and even to DC. I'm impatiently waiting for a NYC location to open one day. 

The Mint Mojito usually comes sweet and creamy with delicious iced coffee, made fresh right before your eyes on a simple drip device. The drink is served with a fresh mint leaf stem, giving the drink its unique incredibly fresh mint flavor. The flavors come together in perfect harmony for the best tasting coffee drink you can imagine.

This place is a must for locals and tourists alike and should definitely be on your list!
author: Courtney B.

description:
I always enjoy Philz coffee from the storefront to doing a pour over for myself at home. I didn't realize I lived so close to this Philz location. 

Went in and for once, no wait! I ordered my drink and while waiting voted on the "beard vs no beard" board. Beard of course.

Got my drink in a flash. Super friendly staff!
author: Nick F.

description:
What bad could I possibly say about Philz Coffee? Recommended to me by several different people this chain specializes in the classic pour over in a variety of different flavors. I told my friend it was a must, at least for one of the days we were here, so I'm happy that we were finally able to cross if off our list.

We arrived around 8 AM on a Friday morning. When we walked in they had just opened and had only one person waiting for their coffee. The space itself is not too large, but it shares a seating area with another coffee shop adjacent to it within the same building. Within the space where you order your beverage they also have a counter with pastries you're able to purchase as well.

When it came time to order I settled on the Philtered Soul and an Almond croissant (around $8 all together). I was surprised the second I sipped on my drink. I usually put a half a sugar in my coffee for flavor purposes but this drink was amazing as is! Not too sweet and not too bland, they definitely knew the right proportion of hazelnut and chocolate flavoring to make it an exceptional cup of coffee. I was extremely impressed.

All I can say is that if they had this chain on the East coast, especially in NYC, I'd almost certainly be making a trip here every week.
author: Nicholas C.

description: I noticed this sign on the door the other day. Closed until January 2019. This site is obviously not updated .
author: Miguel S.

description: I am not a coffee drinker. But Hubby ordered a Minto Mojito Iced Coffee and I figured I'd give it a try. I'm not crazy about mint, but oh my goodness! This drink was good!! It had the perfect balance of all the flavors and sweetness. While nothing was too strong or over whelming, all the layers really came through. Service was fast and we loved the location. Our kiddos ran around on the grass while we enjoyed the caffeine.
author: Katie H.

description: There's nothing like an ice cold mint mojito to start your day off right. When I'm in town, Philz is an absolute must stop. And when I'm away, morning coffees just aren't the same. As they expand to new locations, wait times have gotten better, but trust me the coffee is definitely worth it!
author: Hira A.

description:
This location is small and orders are strictly for to go. There is a small table with a couple chairs - next to the ordering-line - but it's not exactly spacious nor a private spot.

However, you're allowed to go to Stoner's (https://www.yelp.com/biz/stoners-san-francisco) next door to sit. Otherwise, after ordering and paying, you'll stand and wait at a small gap between the ordering-line and the register. The register is opposite side of the coffee station (odd setup really).

The times I've gone (late mornings and early afternoons) there's been no line to a line out the door so YMMV whenever you show up. Surely, it's crowded during the morning commute hours. Still, the place is relatively clean and so is the restroom (which requires a code to enter).
author: Peter L.

description: The Civic Center branch of Philz is definitely my favorite because it lives up to Philz's "sweet and creamy" coffee trademark. All I get is the mint mojito, which is dangerously addicting!! The barista was kind and shared much of his knowledge of how to make a delicious mint mojito. He told me the details of a drip coffee machine, how to get a strong mint flavor, and how to make the milk extra frothy. They put a generous amount of heavy whipping cream, which gave the drink such a decadent, rich flavor. Only complaint is that the mint mojito is quite pricey for the large cup: $5.60. That doesn't seem sustainable... I'm also kind of confused about the layout of the place. So you have the actual Philz place, which only has one 2-person table, and you have a common area across the cafe in a separate room. Unlike some other branches, there are very limited food options. Other Philz stores have avocado toast and many other goodies.
author: Louis Suo L.

description: I order 3 mint mojitos with extra sweet and also ordered two sausage burritos. I left with three bitter Mojito's never added any sweets with three sausage burritos paid over $33 and then didn't even get what I had requested. It's my fault that I didn't check but I feel like they should have listen to me as well. For $33 small coffee, I was expecting a better service. Also the breakfast burrito sign didn't describe everything that's in the burrito. If only said said sausage and eggs. I'm lactose intolerant so I wasted money on 3 burritos that can't be eaten. What's a great morning. Thanks Philz
author: Linda G.

description:
Love the coffee, (want a coffee to put hair on your chest try a tesora double poured)

Location as of Sunday the 14th is closed until Janurary for renovation.  The location on Golden Gate and Larkin is still open
author: Jason L.

description:
First timer!

I went here late in the evening, a few minutes before they were closing. The barista was very pleasant and didn't get upset I was there so late (I probably would have been haha) 

I ordered the Mint Mojito! And it was absolutely scrumptious! The mixture was surprisingly very good(with soy) 

I appreciated the fast and efficient service. The gentleman at the payment counter was friendly and tried to start a conversation and wasn't just transactional.  

The area was clean and tidy. The restroom was also very clean. 

Street only parking (obviously) but given I went late it wasn't too hard to find. I was in and out within 5 minutes. There was a couple homeless people panhandling close by but the worker there didn't let him in. 

I will definitely be returning when I am in the neighborhood! 

Best of luck!
author: Yousaf Z.

description: I'll start off by saying that Phil's Coffee is hands down my favorite coffee spot of all time. This location on the other hand is very poorly managed. It's the closest to my apartment so it's convenient but I've only been there twice where they actually made my drink well. Today when I went I got a large mocha Tesoro and there was coco powder overpowering my drink and making it taste chalky. As you can see in the picture. On top of that there are always loud grungy kids hanging around there that don't buy anything. The people who work there are lazy and joke around. Overall, it just needs to be managed better and held to the standard as the other locations. I have two stars instead of one only because it's my favorite brand of coffee.
author: Rick R.

description:
Philz Coffee! Is there anything else I need to say? This location is near city hall and is great, but can be hard to locate if you're using google maps or Waze because it will lead you to the side of the building instead. 

Philz coffee is a great option if you're looking for coffee or just a nice yelp or Instagram picture. Definitely a place to try out if you're in the city. My favorite is the mint mojito, the perfect blend with the hint of mint. There's also a good amount of mint inside the coffee as I noticed this after I had finished my cup. This location offers a pretty nice seating area that is across from where you order your drink. The seating area was weird as no one is in there but it does the job. The service was great and I didn't have to wait too long for my drink. Philz Coffee, is there anything else that I need to say? Try it out!
author: Chris N.

description:
A nice alternative to the Golden Gate Philz, which tends to get crowded. The set-up is interesting... Ordering and sitting areas are separated. Probably because of how the building is. It's actually kind of nice, because it makes the sitting area a little quieter :P

My recommendations:
- My favorite blends to drink black are probably Philtered Soul and Hazelnut.
- Sometimes I like doing half Philtered Soul and half Yerba Mate, which gives the coffee a more herbal flavor. Not everyone's cup of tea (haha get it), but it's an interesting alternative if you wanna try something different.
- If you want something on the sweet side, go for a White Christmas - 1/2 Greater Alarm + 1/2 Hazelnut with cinnamon and nutmeg in the filter, sweet and creamy.
- On a hot day, look no further than the Iced Coffee, extra sweet, extra creamy. Terrible for the arteries, wonderful for the soul :) The Mint Mojito and iced Mocha Tesora are also great options!

Parking is... Well, what you'd expect for SF. It's easy to find parking on Sundays since there isn't much here for locals/tourists to do.
author: Joe M.

description: First time I had coffee and didn't need to add anything do it. Which is impressive because I'm a "I will have some coffee with my cream kinda girl" but I added nothing! The concept is great and each cup unique!
author: Vanessa J.

description:
Great coffee and a funky atmosphere! The workers here are really nice! We spilled coffee and they were quick to give me towels and help me clean off shoes.

But mostly the coffee is fantastic!
author: Adri L.

description:
I had a really bad experience with the Philz on Van Ness yesterday. I bought a cup of coffee to go struggled to get the top to fit on the cup, and then it appeared to fit on and I left.  After getting in my car I put the cup in my cupholder, while I was driving I picked up the cup and attempted to take a sip from the cup and the cap fell off when I tipped it into my mouth and hot coffee spilled all over me.  The frightening thing about it all is that it stunned me and I had to slam on my brakes almost causing an accident.  

I had to pull over to collect myself and wipe the coffee off of my chest, neck, etc.. What really makes all of this much worse is when I called the store to tell them what had happened some guy got on the phone and was incredibly rude and then started to tell me it was my fault, followed by some other sarcastic comments. 

This afternoon I went to Reveille on 18th in the Castro and they had the same cup and paid particular attention to the top and how it fit on the cup so as not to have another incident like the day before and their tops are different than the ones used by Philz and fit securely and clearly made for that cup.  Philz charges close to $5 for a the cup I bought as does Reveille​ and cutting corners on tops that do not fit their cups is pretty absurd, as was rude and defensive guy on the phone.  I would say they made some pretty bad customer service decisions in this case!
author: Bryan G.

description:
Service was friendly and welcoming. They were pleasant when answering questions I had about the menu. Pastries were available for purchase, and there's a seating area across Philz, called Stonerz, where they sold bagels and sandwiches. 

Street parking only.
author: Joy S.

description: This is a small location, they don't have water and when I went they didn't have the Philz stamped napkins either. However, it doesn't matter because they have a great staff that are good at making the drinks and the same coffee/tea menu. They also have baklava as one of the snacks you can buy which is something we don't have at my favorite location in Cupertino.
author: Apoorva D.

description: Couldn't have chosen a better way to start the day. The coffee is amazing! Yelp is a vital tool when visiting the city and it continues to not disappoint. My wife and I chose the Tesora medium roast and wow, we were pleasantly surprised. Now it is a must have anytime we visit.
author: Bryan W.

description:
Oh, Philz. I first had Philz Coffee at the Santa Monica location in So Cal, and it may have been my imagination, but it just tasted better in San Fran.

My friend and I made a stop at Philz early in the morning before going out for brunch on a Saturday (we were going to Brenda's French Soul Food, and this location was super close to it). Because it was around 7:30 a.m. on the weekend, we didn't even have to wait in line at Philz ... in fact, there was no line. 

I liked this Philz immediately because of the adjoining room, where there were outlets and multiple tables where you could just hang out and enjoy your coffee. We both only ordered coffee because we were on our way to brunch, but the pastries and snacks at Philz definitely were tempting ... they all looked delicious.

Service is always great at Philz, meaning the baristas have always been helpful to me and great at making recommendations ... and not getting impatient when I can't make up my mind. My friend and I went with our tried-and-true favorites during this visit.

Note: If you bring your own cup/mug, you can pay the price of a small at Philz (or so I was told). Great way to cut down on cup costs.

Here's what we got: 

"Mint Mojito Ice Coffee": This is one of the most well known drinks at Phiz. It's minty, sweet and creamy. I don't love mint, but my friend does, so this is one of her favorite drinks. It's refreshing because of the mint and it's something totally different (not your traditional latte). This drink has to be one of the most photogenic items on the menu because of that signature mint leaf. 

"Mocha Tesora": While you can get this drink hot or iced, I opted for a hot drink because it was a chilly morning. I got the Mocha Tesora during my previous Philz visit in So Cal, and it was as good as I remembered it to be. This specialty coffee consisted of fine cocoa and it was earthy and rich. The menu description embodies this drink perfectly. I felt like I could taste the cocoa grains in each sip, and I loved the rich, dark, earthy, chocolate taste. This is a great option for anyone that loves mocha. I ordered mine with soy and was grateful that there was no extra charge. 

"Gingersnap Ice Coffee": This drink came highly recommended, and since I love gingerbread, I contemplated ordering it for a moment. But, given that I had to choose between this and Mocha Tesora, the mocha (chocolate) won. If I'm ever wanting to try something different, though, I want to order this option. It's spicy, sweet and creamy, the perfect option for anyone that especially likes ginger. I also wanted a hot drink, and this one was recommended as staying iced. Perhaps if I'm in town on a hot day, I'll opt for this best seller. 

"Philtered Soul": This was another drink I had contemplated ordering, just because the ingredients sounded so good. The "Philtered Soul" is a medium roast and includes hazelnut, cocoa and syrup. I love hazelnut, so I was curious about this drink. Perhaps, one of these days, I will deviate from the Mocha Tesora I love so much and try something new. I'm sure I would like this because there's hazelnut in it.
author: Kelli S.

description:
I get it, it's 10 mins before closing and everyone just wants to go home. I was super stoked because I wanted to introduce my friend to Philz! But was let down. I first let her tried both drinks, ginger snap and mint mojito. She said it tasted like water and i was sure that's no possible. She proved me wrong, it was absolutely watered down. Not creamy nor sweet. 

The cashier was also super rude. The barista was a lot nicer, she even help me adjusted the drinks. I get it, it's late, but hey, you're not closed yet. Please treat your customers well, you are in customer service. Wasted $10 on watered down drinks.
author: Cheryl L.

description:
This Philz location isn't as big as the one on Larkin but it's less packed. 
You can order your coffee and go or walk next door to their lounge area to enjoy your coffee and do some work. 

There are plenty of seats, tables and outlets on the wall and coffee came out really quickly!
Baked goods shelf can be empty depending on the day you come here but they always have baklava readily stocked. 

You can never go wrong with a mint mojito or any coffee really. You can also get blends of different beans so you can mix and match to your taste preference. I also see lots of people get food elsewhere and eat it here with their coffee. Staff are super chill here and won't come over to check on you or what not. 

Pretty great study spot, just be sure to bring noise canceling headphones as the music they play can be a little rowdy. Also, people around you might be having pretty loud conversations. There's also an ATM machine in the lounge area but not necessary as they take cards.
author: Kelly L.

description:
They're low on ice. Therefore they cannot make my Sumatra iced but if I ordered from the iced coffee menu then they could make my drink. 

What?!?!

They literally wouldn't make an exception on my Sumatra with light ice because they're almost out of ice but if I ordered a mint mojito they would have made it. This is an hour before closing and the place is empty. 

Terrible and ridiculous!!!!
author: Dalia K.

description:
We had been raving about Philz coffee and customized service to a friend who was visiting from out of town and were incredibly disappointed to be treated with such hostility at this location. Even if the barista was "having a bad day," there is absolutely no excuse to treat customers like she did. Everything could have been handled very differently. 

Instead of a simple apology from a manager or the barista, her friends have sent us messages accusing us of being *gasp* "selfish, greedy techies ruining the "uniqueness of the Bay Area." Because only techies can be upset by unprofessional, rude behavior? Which is a viewpoint that I'm sure Philz would not want to be perpetuated. Smh...

We ordered ahead 4 iced coffees on Caviar. When we got there, we were greeted by the cashier and told to wait at the last station for app orders. No problem!

After patiently waiting for 15 minutes, no coffee. The barista at the end hadn't produced any coffees and her antagonistic behavior was escalating. First she complained aloud about working her station and the iced coffees orders. Then she said she wanted to KILL herself in front of everyone in the store as her coworkers laughed it off and the customers looked around at each other. ???

Seeing that she was overwhelmed, we continued to wait patiently. She continued to slam coffee liners down and complain aloud about her job. After another 5 minutes, two people dared to ask about their orders. She scolded both of them with, "Whats your name? I don't know you! I can't make your coffee if I don't know you're here." (Um, wait what??) After she made their coffees, I asked about our order and she pointed to a line of small print on one of their signs saying to let her "know you're here" and that she NEVER makes iced coffee ahead to leave on the counter because it gets watery.

Rudeness aside, I can accept that we missed the memo to explicitly tell her to make our coffee, but it could have been kindly pointed out to us. Ultimately having to place your order in the store defeats the entire purpose of ordering ahead on Caviar!! As we left, she asked her coworkers if the manager was in the office to talk...
author: N P.

description: I LOVE PHILZ! I always have a great coffee experience and LOVE how it's made-to-order. Freshly roasted and ground. They have 3 brewing stations and beans you can take home if you wish!
author: Karen L.

description: Coffee is amazing! But customer service is bad. I was excited to try this place because I've heard good stuff about it but the young dude with the beard claimed to be off the clock but would still ring people up. He would give customers attitude and when he rung me up he was so rude, i never write reviews but his service was terrible! I will definitely drink Philz Coffee again but from a different location.
author: Eva S.

description:
My friend and I had heard great things about Philz Coffee. A quick Google search showed us that there was a location semi-close to the hotel we were staying at, so we decided to pop in on Sunday afternoon.

I had the Ecstatic iced coffee (supposedly with notes of nuts and toffee), which was good. It had a nice flavor to it but it wasn't anything outstanding. But my friend had the Mint Mojito (+$1), which is also iced, and I really liked it. I liked it so much that we hunted down another Philz location in the area we happened to be exploring the next day, and ordered myself one. It sounds a little weird and you'll probably think of the alcoholic drink - but it isn't really anything like that. It's sweet and creamy, and has a light mint flavor.  I would say it's as if somebody blended a piece of Andes chocolates into your iced coffee.

The reason for the three stars is really just due to its price and their speed. At $4.50 for a mint mojito, that isn't something I can really justify getting everyday if I lived in San Francisco. As for the speed, if you're in a rush, it's probably best to skip Philz. I'm sure it takes extra time for the baristas to craft one of the drinks, but I just can't find myself to silence the New Yorker in me. The speed is a bit slower than what I'm used to.
author: Mel T.

description:
I hate to do this because I LOVE Philz, but I had THE WORST experience at this location. TLDR; the barista working when I came to this location was horrendous!!

My group of 4 ordered ahead using the Caviar app, because we were kinda in a rush and we know that good coffee takes some time. We walked in and let one of the baristas know we were here for an online order. He told us that we could pick it up at the last station. The barista looked busy doing stuff, so we figured she was making our coffee. We stood right in front of the station, in sight of the barista, and patiently waited.

Things got really awkward when the barista started complaining to her coworkers about how she "wanted off this station" because there were sooooo many online orders and how she was "going to kill (her)self"... I'll also add that she did not complain quietly and was basically yelling this out loud in front of our group and other customers in the store. 

After about 10min, 2 other people stood next to us, waiting for online orders, and one guy asked if his was ready. The same barista who was complaining earlier sharply told him...."Well what's your name?! I don't know you..." GEEZ!! He told her and she quickly made his coffee.

The same interaction happened with the other girl who had ordered online and with our group. She was extremely sassy and rude... telling us to "read the sign" and that "she doesn't know who we are"... she basically blamed us for the 30 min wait. I completely understand she doesn't know us, but there are good and bad ways to handle the situation. Not to mention, she made the worst mint mojito I've ever had. The other employees weren't rude, but weren't very helpful either because they saw us standing there and didn't say anything.

She completely ruined my Philz experience, which is usually like a small taste of heaven.

Needless to say, I won't be coming back to this location.
author: Tia O.

description:
This is possibly the worst Philz location of all. It feels awkward and uncomfortable. If you're into Feng Shui, I bet it would be full of bad Feng Shui, with doorways and spaces running into each other and having totally the wrong flow. It's on Van Ness, a big boulevard that's odd, foggy, chilly and uncomfortable itself. There's a reason Opera Plaza's theater is "only" about $10 for regular tickets - people don't want to hang out in that area. 

They have the oddest two-storefront getup here - the counter, register, and a small table are on the right side, and the main seating area is at another storefront right next door. You have to enter one store to buy the drink, then go out and enter the store next door to sit down. And that main seating area has always felt awkward and uncomfortable. 

Employees have gone way downhill since Philz first opened, when it was a renegade indie coffee shop with a supposed passion for Turkish-inspired coffee. Philz used to specialize in excellent, warm customer service and very knowledgeable employees - but now the employees seem cold, indifferent, and dumber than rocks. 

The last time I was here, the young hipster girl with the clear glasses and cutoff shorts actually asked me, "Did you order at the bar?" WHAT? She thought I didn't belong at Philz, and singled me out for that question, when I've been to that location and all other Philz in SF many times. In fact, I've tried all 12 of their coffees, plus iced drinks, multiple times each. My friend had never been to Philz before, and didn't know that you  had to order at the bar first - yet she didn't ask him that question, and she didn't ask that to anyone else, either. WOW. It's shocking I'm always assumed to not belong - my first time there and clueless - at places I've been to 50 million times, places I know like the back of my hand. 

Anyway, I'm never going back to this location again.
author: Valle H.

description:
Crazy delicious coffee. And amazing customer service. Kind and heartfelt staff just made the experience all the better. My co-worker and myself are kind of coffee snobs. (only kind of because we don't know shit about coffee)  I don't prefer dark roast :) 

The staff were so informational and offered great suggestions on what would taste best over ice. 

I can't wait to finish the ground coffee at work, so we can get a lb of Phillz coffee.
author: Kat D.

description:
I don't know why it took me 2 years to update this review. I guess you now know how bad of a procrastinator I am. 

I'd like to think of myself as an even "bougie-er" coffee connoisseur now, as opposed to 2 years ago when unsweetened Starbucks Iced Coffee = life (I know ... I am embarrassed). 
After my original "average" review of Philz, I have since returned. Multiple times. Too many times. And my god, Mint Mojito where have you been all my life?!? I am so sorry I did not give you the 5 stars you deserved initially. How foolish of me. 

To make things ever better, the owner of this Philz joint actually emailed me after he saw my review (2 years ago lol), offering me a gift card to try their coffee again. I suck, so I didn't respond (no one slides into my DMs successfully-- it's not personal lol) but I read your message and thank you for being such a wonderful business owner who genuinely cares about their customers! 

Philz, I love you. Pls take more of my money.
author: Chelsey C.

description: You have to try their mint mojito coffee. It's really good. The flavor is creamy and reached a good balance of sweet and bitter.
author: Big B.

description: This is a very small Philz that only fits one small table with 2 chairs inside. Nevertheless, their mint mojito was still good. They do share a second room right next door that we are allowed to go into with more tables we can sit at.
author: Wesley S.

description: I've been going to this location off & on, depending on my work hours, since they opened their doors (2005?) it's been awhile in any case.  I think it will always be my favorite.  For some reason, the exact same coffee from any other location doesn't taste the same for me.  Maybe I'm sentimental.  Or maybe they just make it the best.  It's always nice to run in to Sammy here too.  Great guy.
author: Karen O.

description:
Having lives in CA for the first 31 years of my life I'd heard of Philz coffee but only tried it at age 31. It's great. I love a business with a good story/ this one's worth reading. They make your coffee experience nice and I appreciate the taste of their efforts as well. I love my morning coffee and although I limit myself to that one cup each day for both caffeine and coffee intake, I would go so far to say that I love coffee. It doesn't give me the energy boost, it calms me. I love the possibilities Philz creates with their menu. 
If in SF, stop by here and try.
author: Julie D.

description: This is the location for people commuting on van ness who need their coffee "to go"! It's walking distance to the bus stops making it convenient if you need to grab the 47/49. Great staff and it's always cozy inside (perfect if you need to warm up on a chilly morning). Highly recommend the Philtered Soul, perfect for anyone who loves their coffee sweet. Best served "Philz style" with medium cream and medium sugar.
author: Sarah N.

description: Really nice people, explained everything very nicely to someone who normally only just orders lattes - basically they don't have espressos, everything is blends, decaf, or tea. I had Jacob's Wonder and I enjoyed it! There's a lounge right next to it where you can sit.
author: Catherine R.

description: Came here for an iced coffee. Friendly service and good menu. Only complaint would be my iced coffee wasn't that cold. Could have used more ice to make it more appealing.
author: Laura E.

description:
My small Philtered Soul was perfect. A nice hazelnut flavored coffee with a slight chocolatey after taste. Made complete with a hint of creamy sweetness. Philz is my go-to coffee spot when I need a pick-me-up (on a Monday morning).

If you like cocoa flavored coffees, I also recommend the Silken Splendor which has a  butterscotch aftertaste. Looking for something cold? Definitely get the Instagram worthy mint mojito.
author: Christina L.

description: Philz coffee needs to be on every street corner putting Starbucks out of business. Love the Mint Mojito and the Mocha Tesora!
author: Yaz B.

description: Tiny store = tiny menu. Don't expect all the variety of coffee beans you get from other store - you'll find them at this location also because they don't.
author: Gina H.

description: Philz coffee is always great. I like Turkish coffee with mint, Blue Mountain, and Smatra. This branch doesn't have a long line, but a bit slow making coffee, but still nice.
author: Kaori M.

description: Service was o-k.  I got a small Tescana coffee which was very good.  I also ordered the avocado toast with an egg white on top.  Now, I love avocado toast.  I have had many-a-avotoasts in my life. Sadly, I was not impressed and that is why I gave 3 stars.  For starters, the avo didnt taste fresh at all, and the egg white on top was not fresh either.  Maybe they buy hard boiled eggs elewhere?  But it didn't taste good at all.  I will come back again and give it another try though.
author: Victoria C.

description: The coffee here is simply some of the most delicious you will ever haveif you're in the area it's worth treating yourself to a philz :) oh yeah my go to mocha tessora when I need a boast/ the so good and philharmonic are also house favs. Glad to have the choice to sub cassia almond milk - nothing beats philz ...
author: Coco J.

description:
Phil coffee never let me down... Love this place... I bought my out of town gf here and she loves it too!

There's two separate areas - one place is where you can order the drinks and next door is the lounge where you can sit and have ur coffee!

Philz.. The mint mojito and half sweet is the best!! They put tons of mint and can totally taste the favor! 5 stars!!

Must get- mint mojito!
author: Mindy Y.

description: I never drink coffee. Ever. I'm a tea guy. My friend begged me to snag a sip of his coffee (he ordered the Gingersnap), so I took a sip just to get him to shut up. LIFE CHANGING EVENT. My stay in SF lasted 3 full days. I consumed 5 cups of coffee. And these were the first 5 cups of coffee I've ever had in my life. It's that good.
author: Mikey L.

description:
I'm so glad this is walking distance from my work! Their coffee is always velvety smooth and delicious. Also the baristas are always friendly and helpful. I usually get Silken Splender, Philtered Soyl or Tesora, medium cream, medium sugar. If your looking for something cold, definitely get the Mint Mojito!

Tip: Bring your own tumbler and just pay small cup price. Just tell barista you have personal cup.
author: Sandy C.

description: Workers were using a lot of foul language not to professional. I didn't order any coffee because the atmosphere didn't feel right. I'm all about having a good time at work but it is a time and place for everything.
author: Janine C.

description: Love Philz Coffee, but really who doesn't? This location is very cozy, but very helpful and friendly! I got my usual Mint Mojito (Fresh Mint, Sweet, Creamy) and it was pure perfection! Philz, please come to Houston! I love you!
author: Debra T.

description:
Actually, my kids are more the fans than myself.  I don't normally get tea, etc. from any of the establishments like Philz, Starbucks, etc.  The ordering process is great and I like the fact that the drinks are made at the time of order placement.

Their quality is consistent no matter the location, be it in NorCal or SoCal!
author: Gene D.

description: At this point, why are you even reading these reviews. I could say that this is the worst coffee in the world, but you'll probably still go and get it. Yeah service can be hot and cold, but they've established themselves as a SF mainstay for coffee so you know the coffee will always be good.
author: Derrick W.

description: went in today and got a full traditional philz expirience. Was helped by the assistant manager, Joseph. Was recommended to try a Julies Soul, a unique drink that I, a Philz fanatic, have never had at any other location. The cashier, Gustavo, recommended it and revealed that it was a formula of his own making. I was running late, per usual, and wasnt sure that I even had time for a coffee, but the drink was ready by the time our conversation ended! new favorite drink and actually my new favorite location (right next to castro!)!!!
author: Silver M.

description:
Good place to get coffee but bad spot if you want to get work done. Wifi was down and staff did not fix when asked. Also, all of the table seating is in the joined cafe. The cafe is not well ventilated so if you sit in there long it will make your clothes smell bad  I studied there for an hour on my lunch and now I have to go to a meeting stinking of fried food that I didn't even eat.

Stay away if planning more than grabbing a quick coffee on the run.
author: Greg M.

description: This Philz used to be good but the last two orders that my husband and I had were just awful. Today's order, I asked them to fix it twice and still ended up with coffee that tasted like it came from Starbucks.  There's literally zero quality control at this location and I'm not sure if they put their baristas through the same training as the other Philz :/.  We'll just have to make a farther trek to get our Philz fix.
author: Christina L.

description:
Nice place. It was nearby the hotel I'm staying at and needed to get a caffeine fix before I started my day.

As I entered I noticed how small of a place it is, good news it wasn't a busy morning or it could easily be shoulder to shoulder at peak times, I would imagine.

The employees seemed to be in "cruise control" or partly zombie mode, net very engaging. No immediate greets when customers walk in.

I noticed all coffees are made to order and are done Melitta style. (pour over), which is great, you'll enjoy fresh coffee with less of the acidity.

The one person I chatted with was Angelica, she was nice.

There are limited pastry offerings and oatmeal to go , so if you need a small bite to get you started, you may find it here.

I took one star away just for the customer experience. I felt like there was only one happy person, all the rest were disengaged, perhaps drinking your own coffee could help give an extra lift.

:)
author: Ryo Hanalei Z.

description:
I "Phil" in love with Philz on my very first trip to SF in 2015. 

Ever since my sister made me to try the Mint Ice Coffee Mojito my mouth salivates and yearns for it all the time. Its like i found what was missing all my life. The taste in Philz is what coffee dreams are made of. (Since im exaggerating i might as well go with it.) ^_-

All jokes aside, this has got to be my FAVORITE coffee shop when i visit the Bay Area. Everytime i visit i make it my mission to get my mint ice coffee in addition to Philtered Soul. 

I'm sad they only have it in SF and LA, i really wish they opened one up in San Diego. However, if they did it I wouldn't want it to quickly become overated. So my secret relationship with Philz Coffee will be the best reason for me to always go back.

My favorite drinks... you must try IF:
Mint ice coffee mojito: Creamy, sweet, refreshing and great drink for relaxing.
Philtered Soul: For all you dark coffee drinks that love something warm, creamy, dark and something nutty.
author: Michelle M.

description: I happened to walk in 3 Saturday's ago and as I walked in, they were playing what was explained to me by my friend, "trap" music. To me, it sounded like horrible NOISE! This young Asian girl with false lashes took my order and as she was preparing my coffee, she was "rapping" along with the noise they were playing and dancing! I'm all for having fun while you work and I love music but this type of "music" and her behavior along with a few of the other employees was absolutely unprofessional and a turn off ! I looked around at the other customers and you can tell they didn't like what they were witnessing either. One gentleman even shook his head while waiting for his order. Unacceptable and I will never walk into this Philz again. They need some serious training and suitable "cafe" music. Too bad because I love Philz :(
author: This Is M E.

description: Definitely lives up to its reputation! If there's better coffee in SF, I don't know about it.
author: stan w.

description:
It was my first time visiting this location and I have to echo what a lot of people have already said on here - this place was disappointing. 

It was around 9:30-9:45am and it wasn't too busy. There was hardly any greeting but I didn't care about that. Male barista was juggling 3-4 orders already and asked what I wanted. I said "large iced mint mojito, medium sugar and cream" and then I waited. It took maybe about 10 minutes tops, and I paid at the cashier while waiting for my drink. Cashier dude was nice, hence the extra star.

After a little while, I noticed a (medium-sized) drink was sitting on the counter by its lonesome self and I wasn't quite sure if it was mine. Eventually, more customers were leaving and I was one of the few remaining so I went up there to ask if this was my drink. My barista said yes, so I proceeded to ask him if this was a large since this looks like a medium. He dryly said, "I heard you said medium." When I nicely corrected that I said large size but medium sugar & cream, he just shrugged and "re-made" the drink (although I'm pretty sure he poured the same drink into a larger cup since he basically gave it back to me after 10 sec). There was no apology or anything about the misunderstanding. On top of that, another barista was talking shit about another customer that had left, right in front of me. I'm not against shit-talking, but working in customer service myself, I'm pretty sure you should wait until other customers are gone.
author: Tee C.

description: Good coffee, bad service.  It's like being served by Jess in Luke's diner...Low on ice-so no iced drink; the second barista had head phones in so he couldn't hear anyone; and I overheard the third worker say, "oh my god I've been here for an hour and I already hate my life"
author: Gina L.

description:
My one & only Philz trip up north! Honestly thought I would've visited this place more. But regardless, Philz delivered both in coffee & in service. 

COFFEE: Got the oh so famous mint mojito. Things always taste better when you're in the city that it originated from. But also, ANYTHING tastes better when it's free! Yes friends, free. My original mint mojito ordered was asked to be made with almond milk.. But got into a good conversation with the barista who got distracted enough to forget my choice of milk. He redid it quickly & because there really wasn't much of a crowd, he gave me the other drink on the house which was perfect for my friend! Mint mojito was refreshing & crisp for coffee! The almond milk added a good kick of sweet. 

SERVICE: The barista was awesome. It was my last night in SF & he gave me some good last minute suggestions but I was so sad I couldn't fit them in because I was already leaving the next day! Anyway, these are the best types of conversations with baristas.. It's exactly how you become a favorite of theirs! 

See you again, Philz!
author: Julienne D.

description:
Coffee is great. Location & space not much. The one in the Castro / Embarcadero/ Market st is way cozier. However it doesn't matter if you are taking to go coffee :-) 

Mint mojito is my all
Time fave. :))
author: Hester D.

description: I saw Turkish coffee on the menu and got excited because it's not easy to find, so I ordered it. Major disappointment. Turkish coffee is made a special way with finely powdered coffee, resulting in a thick rich liquid that has a residue of coffee mud on the bottom. This was reasonably good regular coffee with a couple mint leaves in it. Please be clear on what you're selling. Call it mint coffee or something else.
author: Mike Z.

description: They have great blended coffee that's made to order with any way you like concotions.y personal favorites are the large mint mojito on hot days and their Either on those cold wake- me- up work days
author: John N.

description:
We already have Philz in LA, but coffee just tastes better in SF when the temperature is cooler. I have tried the Mint Mojito Iced Coffee before and loved it. This time, I went for the Tesora. I am no coffee connoisseur, but this blend was so good! The descriptor they had was butter, nut and caramel, and I could definitely relate what I had with that. 

This location is small, and most people grab their coffee and go wait in line for Brenda around the block. We came here after our brunch at Brenda and sat at the Philz lounge/Deli shop next door to fight our food coma.
author: Eva I.

description: Best coffee in San Francisco. Pleasant staff! I come in here and study all the time super cozy and pleasant
author: Alejandra V.

description: I don't know what it us but the smell and taste of their chai coffee just puts me to ease! Very nice and cozy place to get some work done or meet up with some friends! Highly recommend it!
author: Karim C.

description: Stopped here on my road trip to San Francisco. Glad I did. Delicious coffee that packs enough of a punch to keep me going on the road. Pretty unique in the way they make the coffee (at least to me).
author: Eric T.

description: Cheers to the gentlemen that was on the right side of the store (white shirt, hat, barista)! He literally made my morning just by his smile! Thank you Philz for teaching me its ok to cheat on Starbucks
author: Jay P.

description:
The workers here are awesome. ECSTATIC iced coffee is my fav! No added syrups or artificial junk needed. Just some soy milk and it's perfect!! The mint mojito is always a go-to as well but can be a lil sweet. 

Use the order ahead app and skip the ridiculous lines. Just go pass the line and pick up to your left.
author: Chanel H.

description:
I was visiting San Fran and just had to see what the fuss was about. Checking out a local coffee spot is usually on the agenda anyway since CG is a big coffee drinker. Alas, this place is awesome! 

We ordered the gingersnap iced coffee as well as the mint mojito iced coffee. Both of these were damn delicious but the mint mojito definitely stole the show. The coffee is mildly sweetened and had the most subtle mint flavor, topped with a delicious creamy froth and fresh mint. I've never quite had anything like it. So refreshing. CG loved it as well. 

This location was rather small but the staff was very pleasant and the drinks were made quickly. We grabbed seats at the seating area/bagel shop just a few steps away.

Ugh Philz, come to New York!
author: Joanna N.

description: The sandwiches are delicious, but a little bit pricey. However it's a good value for your money if you pick up beans. The vibe is also certainly excellent.
author: Lane B.

description: Great coffee. Lackluster service. Specifically, more often than not, my order is wrong and it takes and unusually long time to prepare. The folks behind the bar seem very new to the process
author: Adrian N.

description: This location has a great manager and that really cares about customer service. Definitely a spot to go for coffee. Amazing coffee and fast service. Was recommended by a good friend and this place doesn't disappoint.
author: Brixton N.

description:
First off, I like a coffee shop where the people legitimately seem like they want to be there. #firstworldproblem But, there's nothing worse than knowing you'll pay upwards of $5 for a cup of coffee when the person serving you is being a jerk. I'd like to point out they're not over the top nice but just, like, a chill sorta nice. 

I ordered the Ambrosia and it was so good we bought some beans to take home. Even after they've been in the canister for about 2 months the coffee is still good. Roasted to perfection. I noticed they also had Blue Mountain and I was tempted to get it but I wasn't about paying $100/lb. Maybe one day.

I'm happy there's one near me in Huntington Beach but if they opened one in DTSA or something that would be great. (That was a shameless attempt at someone from Philz reading this and hoping they open a location in DTSA).
author: Temenah C.

description: I LOVE PHILZ! Surprised that there was no line when I visited this location. Sweet! Got my usual mint mojito! Thank you! There's also space next door where you can sit and enjoy your drink. Cool~
author: Cindy K.

description:
*5 stars - 0.5 star for inconsistency = 4.5 stars*

If I was Beyonce, I would put a ring on you, Mint Mojito. 

Oh, Mint Mojito. You make me crave you with your perfect amount of sweet and creamy. But sometimes you are just a little too sweet or just not so sweet. I just can't figure you out. Yet, I still come back for you every time because I know it's not your fault, but your creator's.

There are times in which your sweetness is hidden at the bottom of your soul. And with every sip I take, you get sweeter and sweeter... Let me just stir you...

And Tesora, you are aight.
author: Solongo B.

description: Service here was wonderful, never had a barista so invested in my enjoyment of the cup of coffee he was making for me. Had the Turkish coffee as a latte type drink. Delicious!
author: Niaz N.

description: I have never had such a poor experience in a Philz Coffee. This location was particularly unprofessional. It started when I ordered my drink (ecstatic sweet and creamy) The barista began to tell me how unhealthy the sugar in my coffee is and that I should consider honey as an alternative. I told him I would just like my coffee normal. When I received my coffee I tased it and what do you know its made with honey... He claims he just wanted me to give it a shot. I then noticed another twist in my drink...almond milk...because that too is a "healthier" alternative. As it would have it I have a sever nut allergy and this could have been seriously worse. He did not ask me to put almond milk or honey in my drink. The only reason I am even giving two stars is because he remade my drink. I will never come back to this location.
author: Iesha Y.

description: I have to give 5 stars no matter which philz coffee I checekd in because it is my favorite coffee!!!
author: Jane D.

description:
I've visited this location because it was the closest location to where I was staying, but would've loved to try other locations as well because this place seemed too small. Nonetheless, their coffee was outstanding. 

Their Mint mojito ice coffee didn't disappoint me. Every sip I took was delightful and very refreshing. I applaud for their creativity and originality. Next time I visit SF, this will the first place I stop by. I hope they will keep this item on their menu until I return! 

On a side note, you may need to ask one of the workers for the code to get you into the bathroom, but this seems to be a common thing around this area.
author: Annie L.

description: This is a fairly normal Philz, if not a bit small, on the edge of Tenderloin in San Francisco. Excellent coffee. Shares a patio / lounge area with the Panini deli next door, which is excellent for working.
author: Benjamin C.

description:
Killing it. They allow the order ahead app, which is amazing because it cuts down on line time. Just order it on the app, pick it up and go. 

I'm not a huge coffee connoisseur, but my fam/friends love the Tesora and the Silken Splendor. So many of these drinks are so strong that you can smell the caffeine-- which is what people like :) I suppose
author: Lai-Nin W.

description:
This is my first time at any Philz location. I finally made my way over on a Sunday morning at 8 a.m. while taking a day trip to SF.

I was able to find free parking on a Sunday on Eddy Street around the corner from this location. While free, it's definitely sort of a dangerous area and there was a guy picking a fight with a homeless man right outside my car.

This Philz location is also kind of a dump too unfortunately and barely has any seating. I did have good customer service though and they explained to me that they don't serve espresso and only have pour over drinks. I never drink pour over and always order an espresso drink...

I ordered the Mint Mojito Ice Coffee which was actually pretty good considering I rarely get my coffee drinks iced even when it's over 100 degrees outside. 

The neighborhood is just the pits though and I just saw a homeless man take a piss as I was finishing this review. Maybe other Philz locations are in a better area than this one.
author: Regina W.

description:
I must have been ordering wrong this whole time y'all.. because this gingerbread iced coffee is off the CHAIN! If you prefer sweeter coffees, like me, you will love the gingerbread iced coffee. It reminds me of Grandma's house at Christmas with a hipster twang and some dank foam.

Another highlight of PhilZ is the service is always prompt and professional. Even if the line is long, the baristas always make the extra effort to make it a great experience for each customer.

I love you, PhilZ.
author: Nicole W.

description: Come on Philz, make this location cozy, clean and friendly like all your other locations. This is the one that I visit the most because it's on my way to work but every time I get coffee here I walk out with no smiley greeting, no Philz Coffee energy whatsoever in the atmosphere and it's ridiculously untidy and dirty. And I can assure this place has been in this condition for way too long. Not sure why this Philz is left out like this but please do your magic and convert this place into one of your cozier Philzs!
author: Göksu K.

description: Steve totally hooked it up and crafted my black ice tea like magic. It's Baristas like him that keep me loyal and dedicated to Philz and only Philz! Thanks amigo.
author: Matt T.

description: The coffee is good - I bought the Tesora blend to keep as my special occasion coffee.  And I drank something called an iced mint mojito that I wish could just be on an IV drip into my stomach veins - that's how it works, right!
author: Timothy C.

description: Philz, you are way too delicious. I only you weren't so incredibly slow, but hey. I keep coming back, don't I? The mint mojito is to die for, and I always make sure to pick up a few bags of beans, usually whatever is suggested by the barista. If you want to open up a location in Livermore I won't be mad ;)
author: Heather G.

description: Very good coffee. I had the Mocha Tesora. If you like coffee a little more sweet, this iced coffee is for you. The staff is friendly. I would go again.
author: Nicole H.

description:
Despite my usual disclaimer "I'm not a coffee connoisseur", my two visits here makes me a true believer that Philz Coffee isn't just your typical hyped up coffee shop. Nah, you don't have to be a hipster, tech yuppie, or wanderlust to enjoy one of their many unique caffeinated concoctions.

Their mint mojito iced coffee is best enjoyed on a warm summer day - rare in foggy SF, I know - but leaves an amazing aftertaste following every sip. The drink is on the lighter side on coffee and is sweeter as well.

The Philtered Soul is a medium roast with hazelnut. I opted for a bit of non-fat milk and a small pump of hazelnut flavoring, which didn't overshadow the bold brew. I definitely struggled to finish the larger size!

The menu can be a bit overwhelming as everything looks so good and the names are pretty catchy! the staff are friendly and provide great recommendations. Here's to hoping they'll consider opening a location in San Diego!
author: Christina T.

description: I went to San Fran for vacation for 4 days and we got Philz everyday! I love the layout of the place - each barista has a station to take orders and make the drinks. It's quite entertaining watching them make the drinks. I tried the Mint Mojito and I loved it! It was such an interesting twist to coffee; I couldn't get enough of it. I also tried the Mocha Tesora and Jamaican Blue Mountain, both were just as great!
author: Dana Y.

description:
This Philz location is pretty cool. It's split into two rooms - one to order food and beverages and the other to do work. I ordered my usual medium Tesora, Philz way. I also got a chocolate croissant which was delicious. Would recommend. Went perfectly with my coffee, especially because the barista warmed it up.

The "work" room was a little dirty, but it was passable. It looks like a private events space. Or perhaps there used to be a kitchen there? WiFi is fast. Overall great experience if you're looking for somewhere to work remotely.
author: Stefanie C.

description:
San Francisco, CA:  Philz is my new favorite coffee shop in California.

Very friendly and patient barista. Replicated my delicious, initial Mocha Tesora with almond milk made at the Westborough Blvd. shop nicely. Beans and payment for coffee occurs across the lobby from ordering area.

The more I try smaller coffee houses, the lower down the preference ladder that seamaid brand drops. There are times when there are limited choices available. However,  when other options present themselves,  I'm taking the alternate road nowadays. Philz, please come to Washington state!!

This location is a small, older shop. One table. Four stars for minimal seat space.  Most customers ordered and went, including me, with a very broad smile on my face and a happy heart.
author: Shal W.

description:
When I first had Philz in LA, I was instantly hooked and constantly looking for my next fix. On this trip to SF, I was excited to be in the birthplace of Philz because I would finally be able to have it in its hometown. However, I was quite disappointed with my first Philz experience in San Francisco. I didn't go to the original location, I went to the one nearest to my hotel. I ordered my usual large mint Mojito iced coffee. It just did not taste good. It tasted watered down and burnt/acidic. I drank most of it because I felt I had to but I couldn't finish the whole drink because it was just a cup that was too full of disappointment. It pains me to give it 2 stars! It should be 1, but it's Philz!

The space itself looks like an express Philz. There is a separate seating area across the way where there were many people working on their laptops. The staff appeared to be friendly. When there were no customers (other than my friend and I sitting at the little table near the front counter), they were sword fighting with a child (I think she was one of their kids?) and just messing around, running around the tiny shop.  I am going to try the original location some time during my trip and hopefully Philz SF can redeem itself.
author: Christina T.

description: I've been to a bunch of Philz locations... this one is not my fav. Girl making my coffee right now looks miserable and basically did not even acknowledge me.  On the other hand, coffee is bomb.
author: Vanessa S.

description:
Oh how I wish there was a Philz in New York! I was here for a short vacation with family and found this gem and couldn't stop myself from going back everyday. I needed a cup a day in order to fuel the exploring we were doing.

The Mint Mojito is a must try. The coffee itself has such an amazing aroma and does not at all taste too sweet. I love that the mint does not overpower the coffee itself. That was the first cup I had and it definitely had me hooked. For the remaining days, I switched between Philtered Soul and the Mocha Tesora. None of them disappointed me.

The set-up is pretty interesting. You walk in and order at individual stations and pay at the register behind. Your drink will be called so pay attention!

Time to come to New York, Philz!
author: Nancy Y.

description: I like mint mojito but they need to have it standardized so it's the same yummy every single time of it's every single sip.
author: Auroshikha R.

description: The truck in the Marina Nov 11th was a joke ! STAFF UP PEOPLE....35 minute wait for drip coffee ???? Nobody is that good, what a bunch of dummies we are waiting in this massive line - LETS MOVE !
author: Lucy R.

description:
Giving five stars for this location. Great service and great coffee. The staff goes above and beyond to help you choose your perfect cup of coffee. Awesome personalities all around! They also have so many flavor ranges of coffee beans to choose from. I got the Tesora, Philharmonic, and Philtered Soul blends to bring back with me to NYC and I love them all. I also tried the mint mojito iced coffee. It was okay. Definitely smooth but too much mint for me. 

Wish they had a shop here in NYC.. I'd be hooked.
author: Jessica H.

description:
Great coffee! Love the cardamom and mint leaf notes. Very skilled and chill baristas.

Unfortunately, all three of my to-go orders kept dripping out of the lid and cup no matter how many times I tried resealing them.  Obviously, dripped onto our clothes when we tried to enjoy the awesome coffee.

Go for the coffee. Beware of the lid that doesn't really close?!??  We ended up drinking without the lid on instead of constantly getting hot scalding coffee on our shirts and pants.
author: Christina H.

description:
Matt came through for me! I was coming into town and wanted to bring a few coffees in. Ordered through Caviar and everything went through. Unfortunately, they've changed their hours and I arrived to find them closed and nearing completion of their nightly clean up. Matt heard my story and answered my pleas. He came through with the coffee and I had some happy managers when I arrived at work for the last night we were open. A happy ending for coffee.

Thank you again!
author: Stephen B.

description:
Step by step guide for pre-brunch at Brenda's:

1. Arrive at Brenda's
2. Use chalk to write your name and number of people in your party on the blackboard
3. Walk to this Philz (only a block away)
4. Order coffee - preferably Mint Mojito
5. Chill at the bagel shop that's connected to the coffee shop (Oh my god, the smell of bagels is so amazing... but control your urges because you're getting brunch soon.)
6. Hang out for 30 minutes to 1.5 hours, depending on how many parties are ahead of you.

If you're not done with your cup of coffee, bring it back with you to Brenda's. Don't worry, you'll be joining the rest of the crowd because EVERYONE is holding a cup of Philz. Cheers!
author: Christine S.

description:
I love Philz :) mint mojitos are my fave! they're super refreshing on a hot day. i like how philz is a chain so it's convenient but it doesn't have that sterile corporate feel like starbucks. my favorite ones are the one on shattuck in berkeley and this one.

I was really surprised to see the 1 star reviews here because i've never had a bad experience here and especially since the barista they mentioned by name, zoe, happens to be my favorite barista! partly because we share a name, but also because she's hilarious. yes she can be sarcastic but that's why she's fun to talk to! it's too bad they had a bad experience but i can't help but imagine they weren't exactly kind to her. zoe is sweet and funny and her dry humor is  perfect for the hip coffee shop vibe
author: Zoe L.

description:
I heard a lot of raves about Philz Coffee for a long time before I made my first visit.  $3.50 for a small coffee and $4.50 for a large.  The large was really just a medium-sized coffee.  It was a smooth and tasty, medium roast.  I'm not partial to fancy coffees, however.  A lot of fuss and preparation went into making my coffee, which I found needlessly pompous.  "Want me to recommend something for you?" the young male cashier asked me when I told him I just wanted a regular cup of coffee.  I noticed on the board over our heads listing the coffee menu that there were no prices for any coffee and no offerings for organic coffee either.  

While the coffee server was friendly and the cashier polite, the place was dark and no one offered to tell me where to find napkins or extra cream if I wanted any.  The staff impressed me as young people who cater familiarly only to regulars, not newcomers.  (As I paid for my coffee, I heard the cashier recite to a female customer what the code was to use the lady's bathroom.) The sweet offerings on display in a glass case nearby the cash register were pricey as well. I felt I was visiting the financial district -- except the prissy decor was absent.

I had to exit the shop and walk through another doorway to enter the coffee shop proper where seating was.  The music was jazz-rap and it was unpleasantly heavy in volume.  Nobody came in to clean up the detritus left by other customers.  

Poor lads and students with connoisseur taste in coffee find this place "cool."  But outside of the tasty if pricey coffee itself, this hangout place to be was little more than a claustrophobic, noisy, oversized closet with one picture window. I removed myself from a table to avoid the loud music and took another table farther away, but the removal made no difference at all.  The sound someone deemed "music" continued to penetrate irritatingly everywhere in equal measure.  

The H20 Café on Polk Street, which is frequented by the homeless and crazy as well as the working class, has a coffeehouse ambiance that, by comparison, actually is one step above this place if you want to read, study, concentrate or work.  That is, the music isn't as loud, the coffee is cheaper, and there's no connoisseur pretense whatsoever.
author: Charles S.

description:
This was the only coffee shop open early enough to get my caffeine fix before heading out to Oakland Saturday morning, and what a pleasant surprise! When you walk in, you're met with three friendly baristas at each of the three individual stations ready to take your order. The board of coffee choices was overwhelming, but I'd done my Yelp research and knew to order the Tesora. They have almond milk, so I had them add a splash to my coffee and was in and out of there with my cup of joe and a bottled water in no time flat. 

I'm a bit of a coffee snob and my beverage was perfectly brewed and not too acidic. Strong, but not bitter or burnt, like so many large chain coffee shops. If you haven't tried Philz, don't let the branding put you off, it's a carefully crafted coffee that won't disappoint even the most discerning tastes.
author: Zinnia M.

description:
I don't even drink coffee, yet I love Philz Coffee. 

I know that doesn't make sense, but sometimes I bend the rules for a great cup. I love the mint versions, the iced mint coffee and sometimes even the iced mint tea. Those two are my favorites and what I've had here so far. 

I will chug the whole glass of coffee and before I realize what happened, I'm wired. Which isn't such a bad thing, since I often come during my work day. Let's say I'm Productive after Philz....
author: Rebekah T.

description: I absolutely loved this coffee place! I was visiting San Francisco and had local friends rave about this coffee shop, so I knew I needed to try it. I had the mocha tesoro and it was just perfect! The right blend of coffee and sweetness with a hint of exotic flavors that kept me wanting more. I wish they had more locations across the country. I would definitely come back the next time I'm in the city.
author: Christine N.

description:
This was the best coffee shop in San Francisco ! If you come here this is one of the coffee shops you have to visit (No joke). Why?

Pros-
-There's only 29 locations as of January 2016 and it's pretty good at making the drop coffee there and also a major player in making third wave coffee. 
- The baristas there are very sweet and would recommend you try it first before you leave the store so you can be satisfied with your drink! They all seem very professional. 
- The Mint Mojito Ice Coffee here (A classic favorite here) is delicious and priced at $5.00. Not bad!
- No taxes here!
- Famous drinks here that are exclusive to only the West Coast! 


Cons-
- If you want to get coffee before you go to work, good luck. The line here are pretty busy here in the morning around 6-8 AM in the morning!
- The coffee is pretty if you ask me. Was it worth it? I personally thought it was but I wouldn't drink it everyday. I would be broke by the end of the week if I ordered the coffee here everyday which can be ranging from 5-10 dollars per drink! 
- There are usually no seats here unless you get here really early or come when it's less busy.
- The coffee takes a while to make especially when there is a lot of people. 

Helpful tips-
The ordering here is kind of different. What happens if that you get in line and order your drink. After you order, you pay where the cashier is. You do NOT pay your barista. But you do have the option of tipping them.
author: Ashley Z.

description: This is probably one of my favorite coffee spots ever. The iced soy mint mojito is the only one I've tried but I won't hesitate to try something new
author: Azalia R.

description:
Certifiably fantastic coffee - not to mention tons of varieties thereof - as is to be expected from Phil's. Fairly warm and efficient service too.

This specific outlet is on the small side, however, and sees so much traffic that things can get quite messy overall. It's better suited as a take-out shop than as a place to lounge around or work. Other than that, it's a typical Phil's outlet.
author: Vincent L.

description:
Mint mojito iced coffee....try it! 

Best coffee I've had in a while.  Much better than Starbucks!
author: Katrina E.

description:
I will start by saying that the Apricot Bar was Spectacular!!! It tastes muuuuuuch better than it looks, give it a try. 
My husband had a coffee and he liked it, it was "different" he said. The weird thing is the sugar/splenda is offered.
The coffee is on a cornet, you can miss it if not looking careful because there is only one small sign that says the name of the coffee next to the door.
I got there thanks to other yelpers - it is not a coffee bar you would find if not going there on purpose. 
Very recommended!
author: Daniela M.

description:
I worked at this Philz and I'm here to give you my honest opinion about the place and a little run-down of how Philz works in comparison to other coffee places. I think it's safe to say that compared to most coffee chains, Philz offers a richer, stronger cup of coffee. And one of the reasons for that is that they grind the beans individually for each cup and each cup is a pour-over single. So the blend you chose is prepared in a single serving just for you. 

Being someone who has a pretty low tolerance for caffeine I can say that this coffee IS strong/ stronger than most places. If you are looking for that mega caffeine boost this is the place, and you can get it without the espresso shots, because the coffee is truly that strong (varying between lighter and darker roasts of course). But if you're looking for lots of sweet, whip cream covered specialty drinks, this is not the place for you (although we do have a few specialty drinks). Philz specializes more in straight up coffee blends.

So here's how this place works: the menu is about 3/4 coffee blends broken up into (light, medium and dark blends). Each blend is unique and it might take a while for you to find the blend that is your favorite. (Literally every regular customer has a different favorite. Mine is the Ambrosia, but that's just me!) 

Once you've selected your blend and size you specify to the barista how you want it creamed and sweetened. The baristas do all the adding of cream and sugar themselves, which is different from most places, therefor you just let them know how you usually take your coffee. The standard cream and sugar options are heavy whipping cream (before it's been fully whipped into whipped cream) and brown sugar. I like that the modifiers to the drinks are so pure and straightforward. There's no syrups or artificial flavoring, just good ol'fashioned cream and brown sugar. You also have the choice of different cream options if you prefer: whole milk, nonfat milk, 2%, almond milk, soy milk and vanilla soy milk. For sugars they do keep the main alternative sugars on hand (Splenda, Equal, Stevia etc). 

And that's it! Once you're drink is done the barista will usually ask you to taste it and let them know how it is (except if it's black of course). This is because they add the sugar and cream themselves so they wanna make sure they get it to taste. Please DON'T BE SHY about asking for more or less of anything. It's no trouble at all for the baristas and they do it all day. 

In addition to the blends, Philz features a few specialty drinks: a mocha, a chai, a sweet, minty drink called the Mint Mojito, a sweet, spicy drink called the Gingersnap and hot chocolate. The Mint Mojito is clearly the most popular on Yelp and in the store this proves true too. Perhaps it's the fun, photogenic mint leaves on top. However, I must say the Gingersnap is by far my favorite of the two. Absolutely deliciously sweet and spicy like a Gingersnap cookie. 

(Pro Tip: A secret menu specialty drink is The Oatmeal Cookie. Also DELICIOUS and somehow defying all science tastes exactly like a liquified oatmeal cookie)

Finally, there are several teas: green, black, Yerba mate and chamomile, in addition to a few specialty teas as well. I don't recommend the green tea, the black tea is decent, I personally despise the Yerba mate and the chamomile tea is decent. But in general, if you're a tea connoisseur, go to a tea shop and not a coffee shop. Coffee shops know coffee better than tea generally speaking. With that said the Istanbul Treat (one of the specialty teas) is quite nice with a little honey. (Honey is also always an option if your prefer). 

And there it is! A full overview of the Philz menu from an insider perspective. Happy sipping!
author: Tamara S.

description: I'm sad to say that this San Francisco favourite let me down. After ordering what is one of the most popular beverages, the philtered-soul, I found my first sip to be only the taste of hazelnut. As the coffee cooled it continued to taste more and more of just hazelnut so much to the point I couldn't finish it. I drank a third of this coffee The rest went to a storm drain.
author: Conor S.

description:
Went to Philz when I visited San Francisco.  I have to say, that Philz is one of the best coffee shops that I have been to.  You get your very own barista who makes your coffee exactly the way you want it to.  And the coffee is sooooo fresh and tasty.  I tried the Jacob Wonderbar and Tesora, and those were very exquisite.  I really wanted to try the Mint Mojito, but they were out of mint that day :( 
I was totally bummed out, but it's ok, their coffee is soooo good that I was instantly gratified with other order.  I just wish that there were more Philz Coffee (or coffee shops like it) near where I live.  All in all, awesome coffee!!!
author: Joe G.

description:
Definitely just contributing to the overwhelming positive reinforcement....but hey, every review counts right?!

Totally thought this was going to be a "tourist-trap coffee rip-off" place, but I was completely wrong! Got the mint mojito coffee and it was DELISH. They make your coffee to exactly your taste. The dude making my drink asked "you want it sweet and creamy??", and I responded, verbatim, "can I get it half sweet...Actually somewhere between not sweet and a little less than half sweet..??" (Obnoxious right? Who orders like that..?? Not my proudest customer moment) 

But my drink was BOMB! It was perfect in every regard :)  

If you're near a Philz and haven't tried it definitely stop by! :)
author: Katie 2.

description:
If I'm being honest, as dedicated as I am to Yelp and writing about my food and beverage, I'm often reluctant to write up coffee shops. The variables are endless and the product difficult to diversify, but my experience at Philz was such a good one that I simply must give them a shout based on my visit. Go here. 

Star 1: How were the service and atmosphere?

I'm not particularly picky when it comes to my coffee (or more commonly, my tea), but after walking what must have been three miles or so around SFO with a friend, I was desperate for something cold and caffeinated. My experience at Philz provided much needed relief in addition to showing me how a true coffee shop should be run. At the end of the day, does it make sense for you to place your order with someone who is simply going to relay it to the actual barista? Of course not! At Philz they've split the process, and they've done so for the better. You place your order with your actual barista, who is full of knowledge and helpful tips. After that, you turn around and you pay at the counter, handing over your cash to a quick and friendly man in my case who kept me laughing. Brilliant. Star Granted. 

Star 2: How were the portions relative to the cost?

"What can I get you?" the barista asks, in a way that's friendly but tells me that this man is an expert of his craft. Goodness me what do I want? I know very little about coffee, but I know that I like things low on the sweetness scale but with some good flavor. Oh and I want it iced for sure. "Ecstatic Ice Coffee would be your best bet - I can tone down the sweetness". Let's do it. A large? $4.00. Brilliant. Star Granted. 

Stars 3 and 4: How was the food?

Wow. Again, this was seriously some fantastic coffee, and that's coming from someone who has little appreciation for good coffee. My barista dished up exactly what I was looking for at the time and temperature that I wanted it, and I was smitten with the blend. The one downside was that there was an absolutely ridiculous amount of ice in my cup, which quickly melted and dulled the flavor pretty quickly. Besides that? This was excellent. Single Star Granted. 

Star 5: Would you eat here every day if you could?

I absolutely would. The layout, the menu, the people, the prices, and a fantastic soundtrack would have this as my regular spot in SFO. Star Granted.
author: Paul V.

description: Only gotten the mint mojito twice here and it never disappoints. The mint monitors are minty cause it comes with a handful of fresh mint, creamy and heavenly. Brought my friend here and she absolutely love it. She wanted to order another! The baristas also seem to genuinely like their jobs and their drinks. Good vibes and drinks.
author: Cynthia L.

description: The coffee ia great. But the service is horrible. Customer service in a Turkish prison is probably better.  It is slow, people who work here seem indifferent and I heard a comment that was borderline rude to a fellow customer who was confused about the ordering process.
author: Chris W.

description:
Oh how I wish Seattle coffee was like this!

This is a chain coffee store but you still get that local business feel. The baristas are very nice and attentive. They are a great asset in helping you pick out a drink if you've never been in or are on the fence. 

The first time I came in I got the Tesora, This is heaven in a cup! It's creamy, smooth, and sweet. (I like my coffee on the sweet side) Gave me warm and fuzzies. The second time I came in I got the mint mojito iced coffee. Great summer coffee drink! The only thing I didn't like were all the mint leaves that came with each sip. I didn't realize I would have a bunch of mint leaves in my drink. I figured there would be a garnish, but that the mint was just flavoring. Nope, it's real fresh mint leaves in your coffee! Fancy huh?

This place has lots of choices, which is something I like in a coffee shop. I want more than just choosing between an espresso, americano, and latte. I also like that they have different flavors and they also describe those flavors on the menu to help you choose your coffee. 

Oh can't forget the pastries. I haven't tried one, but they look delicious!
author: Eva C.

description:
I've heard all the rage, all the fame and all the glory: the mint mojito.

Let's keep this simple...

I find it weird that they had a small and large option but no medium...a medium would have been perfect! Anyway, I'd of course pay a little extra for the bigger option and got myself a $5 coffee ;)...a large was unfortunately a little too large for me!

I got it sweet and creamy. They have a minty option too. Once you get past all the froth, you get a delicious minty and iced coffee. Is it even possible that once the ice melts and dilutes the coffee, it became even stronger and more delicious?? Well it did. End of story.
author: Lisa Z.

description:
Nice coffee and super helpful staff to help us chose what we would like - they got it spot on. 

My mistake, but my wife wanted a latte but there is no espresso here.
author: Steven H.

description:
If you're a first timer, try the mint mojito iced coffee. Be sure to inform the barista how creamy you want it. An interesting observation I noticed was that your urine will smell slightly pungent afterwards.

Definitely try the seasonal fruit muffin if it contains blueberry and peaches. Their cookies are also on point. 

Don't get the apricot crumble. It tasted like basic oatmeal with gooey apricots.
author: Jeffrey Y.

description:
Thank you for the fuel to get my entire team and I through our engagement shoot. I have been up since 4:30 am and I'm still wired. You never disappoint... 

Mint mojito, sweet and creamy! Just how I love it! So good. This is the 2nd cup I had this weekend, and I'm not a regular coffee drinker. Uh oh!! Could this be the start of an addiction forming?
