author: Jenn R.

description:
Mint Mojito Iced Coffee. 

I was only in SF for a few days, but I had to get this. It was so good and creamy and delicious. I never had anything like this before, definitely no where in NYC as far as I know. The mint was not overbearing and was just enough. Shared one the first time and got a large for myself the second time around. Baristas were friendly and I watched in awe as they made this marvelous drink. 

There needs to be a Philz in NYC!
author: Kimberly H.

description:
The Mint Mojito Iced Coffee definitely lived up to the hype! I don't drink coffee so I don't have much to compare this drink to but this was an AMAZING start. I got a small for $4. I usually get a bitter aftertaste or a headache after drinking coffee but I steered clear of those this time around. The drink was so refreshing, creamy, smooth, light, and had the right amount of sweetness - I wished the mint flavor was stronger though. I noticed there was a huge chunk of mint leaves at the bottom so I swirled and smushed it a couple of times to strengthen the flavor. 

If there was a Philz back where I live, I would definitely come by in the mornings for this drink to start off my day.
author: Jennifer C.

description: I've wrote a review for another location before. I like Philz a lot but the thing I notice is that there is no consistency. The only drink I ever order is the mint mojito iced coffee and every single time I've ordered it, it tastes different. Even when I order it at the same location it tastes different. Sometimes it's not sweet enough, even when I mix it. This time, it is way too sweet. Doesn't even feel like I'm drinking coffee. What's up with that?
author: Annie H.

description:
This Philz is efficient. Although the room where you order and pay is on the smaller side you won't be in there too long. Next time I'm in town I'll fersher take advantage of the order beforehand option!

There's a few sweet treats (hello peanut butter and chocolate cookie!) and of course beans by the pound to take home. Nothing ever stops me from grabbing an $18 pound of Jacob's Wonderbar beans to savor later.

I love to get dirty with my drink here and go for the mocha tesora... This location always delivers but it's still a little sweeter (as in sugar-ee tasting) than to my liking.
author: Sarah M.

description:
OK. Good but overrated.  
I even tried their coffee beans but nothing special in my opinion.
author: Ryan G.

description:
tl,dr; 4 stars: I would recommend, for being open until 8pm, spacious seating, and decent wifi, in an area where all of those things are not common.

The layout of this Philz is a little different from what I'm used to. It's two stores with doors that face each other. You order on one side and sit on the other side. The staff on one side has cameras to watch the other side.

Ordering was fine and what I expected from Philz. I got a Chai Tea with milk and honey.

The seating is spacious: There is a counter by the door, 9 small tables that can be grouped together for groups, and a round table that could seat 5. Wifi is steady, moderate speed.

It is surprisingly hard to find a cafe with wifi to work from in the Hayes Valley / Civic Center area. The Peet's across the street has really tight seating. A lot of the Hayes Valley shops have slow wifi or close early. I'm pretty happy to find this.
author: Miguel C.

description:
I do not consider myself a coffee person but I did enjoy my visit here.

Coffee
- I think i got the mint mojito coffee it was very minty! the coffee didnt have that coffee taste which made it even better to me

Price
- Fairly normal for coffee

Parking
- Only street parking which sucks.

Service
- The person helping us was very helpful since we told him we were from so-cal

Recommendation
- I recommend pretty much anyone that likes coffee to check it out! it is worth!
author: Alexander C.

description:
MOJITO MINT ICED COFFEE.. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/philz-coffee-san-francisco-4?select=B90TD4l3w-Aa_KV1F4RJuQ#cSxPfjTjpYude1KbpFTimw 
Muddled mint on the bottom of my coffee cup is an ingenious idea. 
-- Because it was a signature drink, as expected, it was a bit sweet (I'm a black coffee person), so I asked them for half the sweetness and it was perfection.

On my last day of SF, I picked up regular iced coffee too.... very solid.  Iced coffee also comes in the same hot coffee cup, no clear plastic cups exist here!

I liked my FourBarrel coffee experience slightly better than Philz, but I say that Philz is still excellent at what they do.

ALMOST deducted a star because some LA-hating sass, whatever Philz hipster guy with the afro! 
But I digress... in the name of good coffee.

Shoutout to SF mastah mama Susy C. for the great rec!!
S/O to JY too.
author: Jessica Y.

description:
the hype is so real.

Ecstatic Iced Coffee
Mint Mojito Iced Coffee

You have to try this place. Went twice during my visit to SF.
author: scott t.

description:
The mint mojito iced coffee is seriously just as delicious as everyone says!
I've been dying to try this place but still a little skeptical of how good it truly could be.
I took my first sip... and I had no words..!
UGH OPEN ONE IN SOCAL PLEASE!
author: Lan L.

description:
MINT MOJITO COFFEE. Probably one of the best cups of coffee I've ever had.

It's the perfect mixture of not too strong and not too sweet. Plus, the mint leaves really give it some novelty. There are A LOT of mint leaves so I definitely wouldn't recommend it if you don't like mint leaves.

$4 for regular and $5 for large. A bit overpriced considering the amount of ice per cup, but I wouldn't be able to resist not coming back.

This coffee shop has plenty of space to work, too. They own the shop next store that is entirely dedicated for seating.
author: Emily C.

description:
My friend (along with the rest of San Francisco) loves Philz. I just tag along when she wants to go, which seems to be every time I see her. Up until this year, I've been able to avoid coffee dependency but now with work and school, I've noticed that my coffee consumption has gone up significantly. Hopefully, I can acquire an appreciation for cheap coffee because I certainly cannot afford to be drinking $5 Mint Mojito Iced Coffees every day. Yes, I know that the small is only $4 but with the amount of ice, mint, foam, and whatever else is in those cups, a small doesn't cut it.

Honestly, I don't think Philz is that amazing. I know I'm not a connoisseur of coffee; I like Starbucks Frappuccinos just as much, if not more, than Philz ice coffee.
author: Yi Z.

description: I am probably the BIGGEST PROUDEST Philz addict ever.... but this location is a horrible representation of Philz! The facility was of poor quality compared to the others, they didn't have any selection of pastries/food than all the rest do, the service was terrible, and the coffee was poorly made. All Philz have a tasting bar for everyone to try their drink before they take it with them. I tried my drink and tasted bad so I returned it for the mint mojito (thinking it would taste better since it's their signature drink) and it tasted worse. I live in LA and have visited all the southern CA locations on a daily basis  as well as a few of the SF locations when I am in town. Don't go to this location if you want to get a good representation of a coffee that has changed my life!
author: Willie D.

description:
The Mint Mojito Coffee truly lived up to the hype! I will definitely return when in SF.

I hear they have a location in Los Angeles as well. I plan to check to it out.

I noticed that the shop also had Jamaican Blue Mountain brewing. Very nice!
author: Elliott P.

description:
I feel like grumpy cat waiting for this place to open.

I just found out about their mint mojito.

Yes, I'm behind the times.

I usually pick one of their chocolate tasting coffees but stumbled upon their mint monitor when I saw everyone else's drink.

I wondered to myself...why is there parsley in their drink?!?

Oh, it's a mint!

A mint mojito!

Wow that sounds neat. Tastes refreshing to.

Finally got my drink.

Maybe it'll wake me up from this uptown funk.
author: Jack R.

description:
Philz is becoming a dangerous habit for me.  This location is a block from my house and too convenient for me to skip in the mornings.

There is little to no line when I arrive around 8am.  I'm typically in and out within 10 minutes.  It can get cramped in their small location, but they make it work.

They also have OrderAhead, although I've yet to try that option. Everyone in the shop is incredibly friendly. Bring in your own coffee mug and get the small price (regardless of the size) and help the planet while you're at it.
author: Michelle K.

description: Visited this location while vacationing in San Francisco. Very good coffee and pastry options. This location is in walking distance to other great spots around here! Great service. The iced coffee comes in the same cup they use for hot coffee, not an issue, but may be something people aren't expecting. Loved every day we went here.
author: Stephanie C.

description:
I love philz because I can always expect a consistently good cup of coffee and great & passionate baristas who love what they do but this Philz really, truly, needs some quality control. 

3/5 times I will have baristas here re-ask what my order was. 4/5 times I walk in and am greeted with a sad and weary "next" and just as often, I have walked away being disappointed with my drink. Fine, I understand there's a level of customization with each individual order and I also understand that people can have bad moods or shitty days but I live within a 2 minute walking distance from this location and my frequent visit has indicated that this is not an occasional happening but an actual issue. 

Also, NEVER have I ever asked for an adjustment to my drink after giving it a taste to have the person working actually give me attitude for asking except for at this Philz. This is not the type of quality and attitude I expect from anywhere..especially not Philz. 


This may be one of the older locations, but it no longer carries Philz's traditional values. Go to the Philz Coffee closer to Civic Center on Golden Gate and it will definitely be worth the extra walk.Or if you just need a caffeine fix, Peet's across the street is much more consistent.
author: Shelly L.

description:
Walked in during a not-so-busy hour, workers didn't acknowledge us at all, okay not the biggest deal ever. Set up is confusing... do I pay or order first? Absolutely no one explained anything even though they knew exactly what we were going through. However, the barista who attended us was very friendly, which some what made up for the confusion. BUT, another customer walks in, barista closest to the door salutes him by name... WTF? 
Will I be returning to Philz? YES, but not this location.
author: Rafael P.

description:
I went here expecting a lot. I mean look at the number of reviews and 4.5 stars, it must be amazing right? Came all the way from so-cal to try this place and there was already a long line outside the door. I tried the iced mint mojito and guyfriend had the philtered soul.  It was good and unique, but nothing amazing.  The baristas were nice, but you can tell they had the hipster attitude going. I definitely had better coffee in OC aka Kean, Coffee Code, and 7LC. So I was really disappointed. Oh well, at least I know now.  

Also, if you check in on facebook you can use their wifi for free.  Good marketing tactic. I like that.
author: Cindy T.

description: I could tell that they really cared about their coffee here and it was nice that they had many pour over stations set up.  They were really great about describing each item on their menu as well.  I ordered the philtered soul because it seemed like a unique flavor with cocoa and hazelnut.  Although the syrup flavor was a little strong, it certainly was an interesting flavor!
author: Jenny L.

description: Small location but the staff was friendly and exuded a real love for coffee.  I tried the Ecstatic Iced Coffee which features a Combo of Philz Blends - It was my first time trying this beverage and so I took it with the recommended cream and sweetness.  My companions all ordered the Mint Mojito Iced Coffee which is described as: Mint, Sweet, Creamy.  As we waited to other customer came in and ordered the Mint Mojito.
author: Mary N.

description: Mint mojito iced coffee.. that's all I have to say! I came to San Francisco looking for Philz and was surprised that they were all across town! That place did not disappoint! We went to the Embarcardero location the day after we tried our first one to find that it closed early. Bummer.. nevertheless, amazing drink!
author: Vanessa Z.

description: Put it this way, I strategically planned to take a flight with a long layover just so I could go into the city to get my MINT MOJITO. I drive down to Santa Monica every chance I get to get me this coffee. It's not just a cup of coffee, it's a cup of minty deliciousness. I wasn't a coffee drinker but I had one cup of their mint mojito and now I'm all about coffee. The coffee is made to order and crafted so well. People can draw designs in coffee and call it art, but Philz definitely makes coffee making an art. Till my next visit unless, you FINALLY bring it out to Vegas.
author: Zara-Maria S.

description:
$4.50 for coffee!? F*** you.

They literally would not let me pour my own cream and sugar.  This place should be a smoldering crater.
author: Dan J.

description:
This was my first time trying a mint mojito at Philz Coffee. I wish I discovered this earlier because it's REALLY good. Can't go wrong with it. :) It tastes refreshing on a sunny day, and you feel so cool walking down the street with a Philz in hand. haha

I paid $4 for a small mint mojito.
Plentiful "paid metered parking" along the streets right out front.
author: Yonnie C.

description:
Philz Coffee was everything I expected. I was always jealous of my Cali friends who post up pictures of the mint mojito iced coffee on Instagram. So I made it a goal that the next time I am in NorCal, I shall get one and I did!
Seriously mint and coffee go really well together. They need to bring this to the east coast!!
author: Jessica K.

description:
MINT MOJITO ICED COFFEE WHERE HAVE YOU BEEN ALL MY LIFE. 

I love coffee but not so much the idea of mint mojito in my coffee but I decided to give it a try since everyone was raving about it. I gave my coffee a sip and I am instantly a fan. The mint mojito flavor wasn't as overwhelming as I thought it would be and surprisingly went perfectly with the coffee. My only regret was that I ordered a regular instead of a large. Lesson learned. Will definitely stop by the next time I'm in SF.
author: Jennifer W.

description: A little pricey for a small mint mojito ($4) but so refreshing and so good! Plus the staff is very nice. Came here on a Sunday at 4 and there was no line. I love how there's a lounge across the counter as well! (Inside Delish deli sandwiches). Can never go wrong with the Philz. And I rarely drink coffee!
author: Cherrilyn B.

description: I can only have a few times a week max b/c of heavy cream used, but this is my favorite place by far. Mint Mojito iced on a hot day is great too. Have fun exploring the menu!
author: John O.

description: It's not like Philz needs another review on how great the iced mint mojito is, but it really is THAT good! I knew I wanted to check out Philz while in SF, and so glad I did! I didn't have to look at the menu and just got the iced mint mojito. It was heavenly! It was the perfect blend of coffee, creamy, minty - LOVED it! The baristas were really friendly too. 5 stars!
author: Jonie L.

description:
Why 5 stars? Because my previous review was written by a person with an unrefined coffee palette. 

   ---   ---   ---

I think that I would probably rank Philz as one of my top 10 favorite businesses in the country. It's fairly bizarre that after my first visit, I only felt that they were worthy of a ho-hum, 4-star review. I assume it was because I was newer to the hardcore coffee scene. I still wouldn't call myself an expert, but I am definitely a helluva lot more into it than I was in 2012.

So what makes Philz so great? They offer a very large variety, which means they can even appeal to your caramel frappuccino-drinking girlfriend, or yourself, who asks for a good light roast blend.

Philz has some phenomenally caffeinated beverages. A cup of Philz causes me to perk-up more than coffee from any other place I've visited. I'm not sure if it's the beans or the master-baristas, but they are just the best at what they do.

Oh, and something many don't know: light roasts have the most caffeine! Don't make the same mistake I made for years - dark roasts may have more flavor, but light roasts are where it's at when you need a pick-me-up!
author: Brett N.

description: Ahhh yummy mint mojito iced coffee and just a stone's throw from Brenda's. I was worried that this might be weird but it was done just right, deliciously minty, creamy, not too sweet.
author: Tammi T.

description:
There isn't much to say about Philz since their famous mint mojito iced coffee speaks for itself! It's something everyone must try at least once, whether you're a coffee drinker or not. If you end up not liking it, then at least you gave it a shot.

One thing I have noticed though.. The mint mojito iced coffee tastes a lot better if you swirl it around and let it sit for a bit to let all the flavor really develop!

Warning: Little pieces of mint leaf will find their way into your mouth while you're drinking your iced coffee. Don't swallow it on accident and don't get annoyed at it either :P
author: Melody Y.

description: Love this place!! Everyone knows what they're talking about and seem to love their job. Got the super expensive Jamaican blue mountain coffee ($10), but so worth it.
author: Kaitlyn R.

description:
What a surprising little coffee shop authentic Turkish coffee with delicious pastries what a pleasant surprise for me as I'm walking up Van Ness if you're in the city you need to hit Phil's ! The staff is very friendly and welcoming -:) 
Needless to say I'll be back!
author: Gina N.

description: I love me a yummy iced mint mojito! Anytime I see a philz, I will stop to get one. Not really for the energy, but because it's so yummy and creamy and wonderful! Not for you if you want something to kick you in the face to wake you up or if you're a black coffee only person. Their place black coffee is pretty good, but I can have good black coffee at a few other places.
author: Erika C.

description: One cup in the morning charged me up for the whole day. Love it so much I make Philz at home every morning.
author: Cara F.

description:
Can I just say ADDICTION???

I love their coffees. They have flavor and it tastes like real coffee, not some bullshit watered down latte wannabee Starbucks. 

The mint mojito and the tesora are my faves!!! Smooth and lovely!
author: Sharon B.

description:
Philz philz philz
Again the best coffee N this planet
I walked in there and the smell of coffe 
Just wakes me up..I love there coffe
author: Manuel H.

description:
Thank you Yelp for leading me to the best coffee I've ever had in my life!

Line was long but there are 3-4 baristas ready to start your cup of joe so I didn't wait too long.  Keep your ears open because one of the baristas was only making iced coffee so I got lucky with the line!  I went with what was popular on yelp and ordered the Mint Mojito with skim milk.  Don't be alarmed to find this iced coffee comes in a regular hot coffee cup and not a clear plastic cup.

It was AMAZING.  I didn't have to add a single thing. It tasted just right - lightly sweetened, smooth, and just bold enough.  

I hung out in the bagel shop next door and just soaked in all the yumminess while jamming to some awesome indie music they had playing.

Can't wait to visit SF again just so I can try the other flavors.
author: Michelle N.

description:
This is one of those places where we see the reviews and think, "Okay, that many reviews, we need to at least see what's up."  And what's up is a crowded coffee shop with good coffee but not better than anywhere else that has "good" coffee really.

Luckily found parking right out front.  There was a bit of a line but not a long wait.  We went up and ordered.  The girl taking our order was friendly and did her best to help give suggestions.  We then turned around to another counter after giving our order to give our order again to the cashier...I can't help but feel there's a better way.  Granted, it's not like we had some super elaborate, complex order, but it's a bit of a pain to essentially order twice when that happens...nowhere else as far as I know.

There also wasn't clear direction for us newbies.  We weren't told that the one who takes the order is the one who calls your drinks.  This seems obvious maybe, but it's confusing when they call out drinks we ordered at other spots on the counter and no one else claims it so we're left to wonder if it's ours (cleared it up quick, no trouble, just would be nice to know that going in).

Mocha Tesora was good, but again, it's a mocha coffee drink that I've had elsewhere.  The mint mojito iced coffee...it tasted like pho.  How does it taste like pho?  It was bizarre and not exactly pleasant.

Philz gets a "meh" out of me.  Meh seems to be a default for me in general, though, so take that how you will.
author: Tim O.

description: Life's good when coffee is this good! Love how welcoming everyone was. Parking wasn't too bad. But I can see how it can get pretty bad if it gets busy. I got the gingersnap iced coffee, which was great! A little on the sweet side. All in all, definitely a recommended spot for your cup of joe!
author: Kaneca K.

description:
This may surprise you, but......

Tantalizing Turkish is NOT the name of an Istanbul drag queen.

I just wanted to clear that up before letting y'all know that Philz Coffee is where I experienced a Tantalizing Turkish for the first time.  I'm not even a coffee drinker, but the Tantalizing Turkish is one of the tastiest brews I've ever come across.

The Tantalizing Turkish was the perfect accompaniment for my bagel and cream cheese.

Philz knows how to make good coffee and snacks, but it has no idea how to manage a queue.  There's no reason for it to take ~45 mins to order coffee and a bagel when there's only 5 or 6 people ahead of me in line.

It must be the laid-back SF way of doing things.  =/

I guess I'm just impatient......
author: David G.

description: Not to be misleading about the product, I LOVE PHILZ COFFEE.  I have been to this location 3 times now in the last month and found the staff to be incredibly rude each time.   I used to frequent the truck in the fidi but my office moved.  I have found myself missing the truck and their friendly smiles.  Word of advice, opt out of this location and visit one of the others to get the true Philz experience.
author: Christine P.

description:
Organized chaos is good. 

Plain chaos? NOT.

I understand this isn't Starbucks and will patiently wait even if the line goes out the door, but if you have a barista trying to make your customized cup while running to the other side and ringing up people's purchases, it prolongs MY wait time. Add more staff Philz! it's the weekend. We need our caffeine fix.

LOVE the Jacob's Wonderbar and all of its nutty, chocolate-y flavor without any bitterness. So, thank you for that.
author: Janice C.

description: I've been a big fan of philz and have gone to many locations all over the bay and have never had such a bad experience. Zoe, the barista, provided hands down the worst service I've ever received at any coffee shop, restaurant, etc. She kept on complaining on and on about how she wanted to be removed from her "station" making the online orders from the caviar app. I've used online ordering in multiple locations and have always been able to walk into the store and my pickup time and pickup my coffee. Today on the other hand, I walked in and was told to wait near the end of the store for my online order. Zoe continued to go on and on about complaining about essentially doing her job (while not doing it, she made 1 coffee when I was there for 15 minutes patiently waiting). We finally asked for our coffees after waiting and she rolled her eyes and said I don't know who you are how am I supposed to make your coffee? I order online so I wouldn't have to wait for my coffee... if I had to check in with her I would've just ordered it at the store. She proceeded to make my coffee orders, sighing, slamming coffee filters, etc. and then placed them on the table. Three iced mint mojito's (no mint provided...) and one ice tesora. I looked at the cups and tried to figure out which was my personal order, the iced tesora. She rudely stated "tesora is written on the top..." and proceeded to roll her eyes, again... Literally not even one letter of her chicken scratch was discernible, so I did not appreciate her attitude on top of the whole experience she had already provided for literally just doing her job. It was very unfortunate as I've always had such great experiences at all other Philz locations and ordering online before hand.
author: Dustin S.

description: Ehhh... I'm not really sure what the hype is. I had that mint mojito coffee or whatever and the mint was very overpowing. Had you ever had smitten's mint ice cream? (This reminds me that I need to write them a review) it's like their ice cream but weirder. I guess if you're a die hard mint fan it's for you.
author: Yvonne L.

description:
I've ordered the some kind of iced mocha coffee here and I don't even remember the name of what i've ordered but I enjoyed it and got me buzzin' a little. I think it had a weird Aztec name, I don't know what the f*ck. 

I remember standing there looking at their menu in front of the counter and they had unique names of different coffees to choose from, with that it may have a brief description in what it contained and its own jive story. I'm not sure why maybe I stood in here dazed or maybe I was wired even before they served me my iced caffeine.

Anyways what I do remember clearly was that my wife ordered their most talked about MInt Mojito Iced Coffee. She shared it with me and that tasted awesome! I never had anything like this before but hey its highly recommended! Just don't try to be funny like what my wife was doing when she plays with those mojito leaves on her tongue to expose at me, while drinking it.

Overall excellent joint! I've been to a few coffee places that serve boring standard coffees but this place wins with its uniqueness for Iced coffee, that feeds Iced blooded hounds like myself!
author: Jon B.

description:
I normally am not a huge coffee drinker, but I will always make an exception for the Philz Mint Mojito Iced Coffee! I love love love it, it's definitely worth the hype! :) 

This location is a really cute spot, and I loved how it was split into two sections. It was perfect since the people working at the tables at the deli side weren't bothered by the long lines over in the coffee section. And it looked like there was an ample amount of seating as well. I will definitely be back!
author: Angela D.

description:
I got what everyone seems to get here, the mint mojito coffee and was not disappointed. Though it's a rather simple concept of making coffee mint-flavored, it was a good cup of coffee (and I don't normally drink coffee).  This location did not have much seating space, so don't come anticipating a place to sit down (unless it gets really slow).  I didn't get a chance to try other things on the menu, but will definitely come back.  

PLEASE ESTABLISH A LOCATION IN SEATTLE!!!
author: Nick A.

description:
Philz coffee never fails whatever the weather may be. 

I got Philharmonic last time and it was a bit too bitter for me. So I got on the bandwagon and ordered an iced mint mojito. Wow. I understand why everybody goes crazy for this drink. The mint mojito adds sweetness to the flavor yet you can still taste the bitterness of the coffee. Even though it was raining and cold outside, I never thought "omg I'm so cold" but rather "omg this is good."
author: Sarah K.

description:
Highlights
- The Golden Gate location is close by and larger, but this is the original that I used to frequent and extremely useful when pinched for time. 
- They offer Order Ahead with a designated pick-up area, so you just order and pay via phone and pick-up at the counter, viola! They also don't put the ice until you arrive if you order iced drinks so it doesn't get watered down. 
- They offer bagels next door with a larger seating area unlike the other Philz locations where it is all combined. 

Improvements
- When it gets crowded, there isn't much space to stand and wait around. 

Tips
- Parking can be difficult since it is all metered parking on a busy street or the smaller shadier side streets. Order Ahead and thank me later! :)
author: Tracy T.

description: Not a coffee drinker at all, but I love the mint mojito! The service was fast and decent. Parking is an issue.
author: Mila C.

description:
I've heard a lot about Philz from everyone who swears by it. I figured I'd check it out and see for myself.

Worth it! Sure it takes a few for your coffee, but it truly is made "one cup at a time" after all. Good ambiance around noon on a Saturday (a busy one with the St. Patrick's festivities in nearby Civic Center Plaza).

My barista was awesome and super friendly, even though the place was sort of busy! Nicely done.

Oh, and the Turkish coffee was delicious!! Great flavors - really hit the spot.

Needless to say, I'll be recommending Philz to others if they are in SF. Thanks and keep up the great work :)
author: Justin V.

description: Amazing Iced Mint Mojito!!!!! I've never tasted anything like it. It is so refreshing and I generally avoid coffee!! Thumbs up.
author: McShirley M.

description: With a bunch of my friends who are all originally from the Bay I heard Philz Coffee all day. They couldn't stop talking about it. It got me all hyped up and I had incredible high expectation. It's indeed good but not worth hearing your friends saying the name 20+ times within an hour.
author: Tim C.

description: I finally had a chance to try this place! I ordered the mint mojito iced coffee and it was absolutely delicious. Now I know why people rave about it. I am definitely going to come back and try the other drinks as well. 4 stars from me!
author: Nimita P.

description:
What can I say? I was completely impressed by my cup of Jacobs Wonderbar. Nutty, chocolatey goodness. Apparently, it's named after Philz son, and I pretty much felt compelled to Yelp about it as soon as I finished my cup! 

Add to that this amazement, my ham and cheese croissant was off the charts! Since most coffee shops have weak azz pastries, I find that particularly notable. Plus, they heated it up so I got my grub on immediately. Pausing before getting back in my car and going to the office...so super-yum.

I've long been a fan of the original Philz, but this was my first visit to this location. The each cup made to order approach is noteworthy. They'll add cream and sugar for you if you'd like. And who doesn't prefer encountering kind and friendly baristas when you're trying to get your day started. Why deal with an azzhole as your first interaction with a human in the morning? 

Hey Philz, when you gonna come to the FiDi???
author: Ted R.

description:
Philz is already awesome, and this one is no different. Located on the other side of the block from Brenda's, this is THE place to wait! (Just look -- everyone waiting for Brenda's has a cup of Philz in their hand 8)!) The workers are awesome and the coffee is delicious. You get your drink and then go to the adjacent bagel/sandwich shop to eat. Lots of people chilling there and doing work; it's an awesome place to hang out for 30+ minutes until it's your turn at Brenda's!

My recommendations: Ecstatic Iced Coffee sweet & creamy. :)
author: Stephanie S.

description:
The lines are ridiculous sometimes, but I love the concept of baristas crafting your perfect coffee (as a bartender would craft your cocktail). Also, the coffee is so good obviously.

You can't go wrong with mint mojito, but since I prefer warm caffeinated drinks, I always go with the Tesora (light on the milk and sugar).
author: Tiffany W.

description:
Their mojito hits the spot everytime. 

I'm no coffee connisour, and I don't really drink coffee... ever, but for their mojito, I'm head over heels every time. It's the only thing I ever order
author: Kaje Y.

description:
My review will be pointless. Just warning you. After all, this is my 4th Philz review and the 4th time I'm giving him five stars. Granted this is a different location, but what is the point of being so redundant? Because I think Philz is still in the upper echelon of caffeine nirvana. Sure, I like Blue Bottle, Stumptown, Ritual, Four Barrel, Sightglass, and all the other usual suspects, but good ol' Phil is like the uncle that embarrassed you at family get-togethers when you were little and he had his undershorts on outside his pants. I don't see him often (...weddings, funerals and the occasional bar mitzvah), but when I do, it's comforting and what's more, I get a first-class cup of handmade java.

Jamie W. and I just happened to be walking on Van Ness, a rarity for us since Van Ness always makes us feel like we're walking on the side of a highway and that we should be wearing orange jumpsuits and picking up trash. Alas, I tend to forget this Philz is even here since it's on the compact, nondescript side with a surprise adjacent room for actual socializing. For the first time, I tried the $4 large cup of the Silken Splendor, which is what I believe is one of their newer blends. Buttery and chocolaty but not overly so like a mocha. It's medium-dark and plenty rich enough for me to savor as I brave the crosswalk to Opera Plaza. OK, maybe this review wasn't that pointless.

COFFEE - 5 stars...oh Uncle Phil, put your underwear away
AMBIANCE - 3 stars...tight quarters here
SERVICE - 4 stars...waiting for the drip is all there is
TOTAL - 5 stars...it's about the flavor, stupid
author: Ed U.

description:
I am a coffee addict and Philz Coffee is a sure win in my coffee shops I have been to for the past year since I became addicted to coffee!

I must say that I have relied on Yelp to recommend a drink I should order here and boy am I so glad to have done so!  

I LOVE LOVE LOVE their ICED MINT MOJITO!  It is so refreshing and at the same time, it wakes you up with the caffeine!!!  The mixture of coffee and mint goes so well together!  Plus, they top it off with the mint on top of the coffee.  The ice they use looked kind of fake sometimes!  It is truly a work of art!  You have me as a regular customer with that Iced Mint Mojito!  

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/philz-coffee-san-francisco-4?userid=I-FmdvI28N7OIIt4JZOgIg#uVvJr_0VuN5SF_qCyddu-w

I did try their Philtered Soul and didn't quite care for that one.  However, I will be definitely trying plenty of other coffee drinks here!

I like the layout of this place because you order in one room and there is another room for seating area right across when you enter/leave.  

Free Wi-Fi is a plus! Thanks! 

Service is cool - you order in front of the barista and pay at the register once you get your coffee. 

I only heard about this place when I moved back to SF!  I can't believe that I haven't heard about this SF coffee chain when I was around in the Bay Area!...BUT now that I have tried this place, I am head over heels with their coffee!
author: Tiffany D.

description:
I feel as if I have been deprived of good coffee all my life for when I first tasted Phil's Ecstatic iced coffee it was love at first gulp!! I don't know what they put in there but it is addicting!! I'm just sad they don't offer this as a take home coffee blend since its an accumulation of several different coffee types. I've also tried their mint mojito and you've really got to like that minty taste in order to enjoy this drink. 

Lines are always long and the wait time is usually 10-15 minutes depending on how many baristas they have working. Workers are really friendly and they instill the honor system there where you are responsible for relaying your order to the cashier. Not a great place to actually sit down and study/chat since it's always crowded but they do offer limited seating at some locations (i.e. the downtown San Jose, Berkeley, and Palo Alto locations) 

This is, by far, my FAVORITE coffee place to go to and I wish they opened one up in Sacramento!
author: Steph M.

description:
I have been wanting to try this place for awhile now and I am so glad I finally did! Being a person that loves coffee this place was a must for myself especially after hearing about their "mint mojito ice coffee". Two of my favorite things combined! Mint flavor & coffee!

This place is a far distance from the main "touristy" are of San Francisco, which was where we were staying. After a 20 minute cab ride we finally arrived and surprisingly, it was not that busy. The way you order there can be a bit confusing because you go up to the barista first to order and then they your order while you are paying, or at least that was what happened with us. I honestly did not look at the menu because I knew what I wanted, but I know that everything there was purely brewed coffee. My boyfriend isn't much of a coffee drinker, but he ordered the same drink that i did, except the only difference was his is on the creamier, sweeter side. They brew each order in batches or individually, but they are all hand poured which I am a big fan of. 

When our order was ready the barista asked us to try it first before we left to insure it was to our liking which it was! The taste is SO different, but in a good way. There are a lot of mint leaves at the bottom, but I do not mind and I take it out before it become too overpowering. I am so happy that there is one in Santa Monica now because I am officially in love!
author: Angelica E.

description:
For people who are Starbucks freaks, they have definitely never tried Philz coffee. You can taste the difference and there is a big difference. The coffee at Philz is creamier and its a calm place to study. 

The pricing there isn't too pricy and its pretty decent considering other coffee prices around the Bay Area. They are willing to hook it up if you bring your own container and you only pay for the price of a small coffee.

Anyone who's coming to Philz for the first time, I recommend the mint mojito ice coffee or the ecstatic ice coffee. Once you try Philz you can't go back
author: Wesley G.

description: Just listen to everyone and get the mint mojito iced coffee. Just do it. You won't regret it... My hubby hates coffee (says its worst than medicine ) and even he loved it! I was visiting San Fran from Dallas and now I'm obsessed and have been trying to make it at home (I fail miserably everytime)
author: Monica H.

description:
First visit to Philz coffee finally today on Memorial day!
Been long due since I stayed just a few streets away for more than a month already.
Passed by this cafe many times and got attracted by the aroma of the coffee beans that the cafe exudes. Could not understand why because the aroma is extraordinary and many cafes which I passed by has no aroma at all! Finally understood today as they sell freshly grind coffee powder from beans in the store. 

Stepped into the cafe and was very surprised that as a coffee lover myself, I was taken aback by the names on the menu board! First time ever, I didn't know how and what coffee to order! They classify their coffee beans according to dark, medium and light roast with fanciful and elaborated names (see photo attached).
No worries about that as the barista here is extremely friendly and approachable. I told the barista that this is my first time here and I ask for his recommendation as the names are too fanciful for me. Barista Chargo (sorry if I spell the name incorrectly) is very passionate and very confident about his coffee. He said he could make me the coffee he drinks and if I don't like it, he could make me another one.
I was immediately convinced by his confidence and professionalism. I told him my preference of strong tasting coffee with milk but I needed to sleep so higher caffeine content is not the requirement. He clearly understood and recommended a customised blend of silken splendor plus philtered best. Good on him! 
I went to the cashier to pay and chitchatted with the extremely friendly cashier and the other barista. The whole experience was very pleasant.

Then my coffee was ready and I took my first sip of the freshly made coffee. Barista Chargo asked if I liked the coffee and was concerned. I was astonished by the unique taste of the well blended coffee with the very balance taste of milk. The aroma of the coffee lingered on still in my room as I wrote this review live. 
I told Chargo that I rate his coffee 4.7 upon 5 and he was very pleased. His passion for coffee is so deep you can see it from his expression if joy. It is thanks to people like him that makes coffee so awesome for us coffee lover to enjoy! 
I will definitely come back and will definitely become a fan of Philz coffee. I will forget about Pts and SBucks. Those seem like a joke ever since I knew this very high standard Philz coffee.
Good job and keep up the excellence! You guys have made me very very happy!
author: Am T.

description:
I think the idea of ordering with your barista is pretty cool. You line up until a barista calls "next". Order. and pay at the counter behind you. 

I had to try their famous mojito ice coffee and it was AMAZING. I took a yelper's advice and stirred mine before trying it to even out the sweetness. It was perfectly balanced between the coffee, mint, and sweetness. 

I'm so glad they're in LA now because I need this in my Life!
author: Marvel Z.

description:
Yes, it's not cheap here but it's also not your neighborhood Starbucks. Philz has awesome custom blends and all the 4-5 star reviews are there for a reason. Once you walk in you might be overwhelmed by the extensive coffee menu, so here are my favorites:

- Turkish -- bold, strong in taste, with mint
- Greater Alarm -- for maximum caffeine intake
- Philtered Soul - nicely balanced, with a hazelnut twist

You can't go wrong with these blends. You're welcome.
author: Sebastian F.

description:
Sorry, Philz, this location is definitely a "meh I've experienced better" at other Philz locations around town and the south bay! This location has workers that just seem unhappy or grumpy, it lacks the character that many of the other joints have, and is dirtier. In particular, in the Delish side that I was in, the workers never wiped the tables in the 2 hours i was working here, even though there was old lettuce and a cup at the empty table next to mine. My table itself had crusty stuff on it despite me wiping it down with a napkin, and there were other tables with leftover napkins and cups. The workers left at 3:30pm on a Saturday w/o doing any cleaning out here! The only upside was the wifi speed, at 42d / 11u.

update: the peeps at Philz mesged me and are looking into it; thanks, looking forward to cleaner standards!
author: Linus W.

description:
I'm a kid of the 80s.. I don't quite understand the whole hipster vibe.

That being said, Philz coffee is wonderful. Their chamomile tea is the best I have ever had.  The dude behind the counter taking my order seemed to think it was cool to whisper while talking to me.. that was a bit irritating. Just raise your voice a bit so the patron doesn't have to say, "What?" ten times while giving you their order... (hipster)... anyway...

Not a lot of room to sit in this place, so you can take your coffee to the weird bagel sandwich place next door.
author: Mary C.

description:
I was on the line and for some reason, the barista just smiled and after 5 minutes of not serving anyone, she asked if I was waiting for something and that the line was behind me. I responded that I knew that and I was in front of the line. She rudely said that I should stand closer to the line because it would confuse her. Um, ok. Not sure what warranted the rude service, when I was just patiently waiting!

They can definitely work on their customer service.

Tried the iced mojito and it was good. More of a cold, sweet treat, than a regular coffee that you can have every day But with the wait and bad service, I would skip this place.
author: Diane Z.

description:
My first Philz coffee experience...the mint mojito iced coffee was surprisingly delicious.  I am not a fan of sweet, flavored drinks so almost did not order the mint mojito iced coffee, but the overwhelming reviews convinced me to.  The selection and flavors of coffee offered at Philz was amazing.  

I ordered the mint mojito iced coffee and banana nut chunk coffee.  The cookie was so good!!!  I loved the texture of the crunchy banana chips on top and wonderful pronounced banana flavor in the cookie itself.  The ice coffee was surprisingly not overly sweet.  The mint flavor was a perfect compliment to the coffee.  I might have to start adding mint leaves to my coffee at home!!
author: Selina P.

description:
Like everyone says, the Mint Mojito Iced Coffee is bomb! I can drink it at any time of the day whenever I need something smooth and refreshing. They also have the ecstatic ice coffee which is cheaper and smooth too! 

I'm so happy to live a few blocks away from Philz! Yessss. They're quick and friendly! But like other Philz shops, the layout is a bit strange to me. You buy first and walk to another spot to pay. It's different, but it works.
author: Priscilla T.

description: Coffee was pretty good but noting out of this world, I got this piece of cake but I forget the name of it. I do know it weighed like 5 pounds and was VERY filling.
author: Thomas S.

description: first time at philz coffee and it was SO GOOD. me and my mom both got the mint mojitos and they were so delicious! such a great drink, will definitely be back
author: Melanie L.

description: What more can I say?! Everything! This place is everything. Best coffee ever. Wait time is eh. But the coffee and service and the serverS, everything!
author: Walter P.

description: Quality coffee. Good service. Ordered the Tesora nothing too special about it. Definitely a good spot to chill with friends or study.
author: Noy C.

description:
Remember that amazing movie from the early 90's with Arnold. Total Recall. He's talking to this bird who I recall was dead as Dillinger and he's like, "consider it a divorce." That was hilarious!!! 

Well, much like Arnold, I have filed for divorce from Philz Coffee. I didn't really want to. We gave it a shot in therapy and I followed the therapists recommendation. Try new things. Try to be different. Try to be less selfish. I tried it all. And I came up with the same result. The coffee sucks! I used to love it! I used to enjoy every drop in the cup, but something happened. I know what it was too. I started drinking real coffee from real coffee producers. I've dated Victrola in Seattle, Stumptown in Portland, Verve is Santa Cruz. Verve is smokin' hot right now too. After all of those amazing coffees I'd come back to this gal and she was still the same girl I knew from way back when. I just decided to say it. Say it out loud to be heard by all. So the other night, after another date, I was all like, IT'S NOT YOU.... IT'S ME!!!!! 

I used to love her, but now she's just a girl. A girl who isn't that much fun anymore and now she's less adventurous and I am SUPER adventurous n stuff. So, allow me to say it from the rooftop for Yelp to hear. This coffee just isn't for me. It's boring, it doesn't taste good, it is way better than Evil Mermaid, but that's the thing. I don't get down with that broad either! So, a quick note to the person who is going to drop me a message in my Yelp inbox, don't sweat it hun. I still love all y'all. I love Phil, his hat, his Mo. Love em all. I'd even suggest that a friend try it out if they have never been. I just can't drink sub par to bad coffee anymore. 

I know it's tough to cut the cord and often times that starts, for me at least, with ripping up pictures, defriending from FB and blocking your calls. Done, done and yes, done. 

Thanks for showing me that coffee needs to be better. Thanks for giving me the space to feel my feelings, to understand my high maintenance approach to coffee. Thanks to all the baristas who asked me to try the coffee to make sure it's perfect! Thank you to all the people who waited on line in front of me and allowed me to practice patience as I stood there waiting and waiting and waiting. It's time to move on to the next little guy cause y'all are big enough now and I gotta find the little guy, the same way I found you when you were the little guy.
author: Hector G.

description:
After hearing all the hype about Philz Coffee, I was determined to go try it for myself. So far, I've been here three times. As I didn't know what to get on my first visit, I asked the barista for suggestions. I ordered the Tesora Mocha, which I thought I would like. However, I found it to be very sweet. Sorry, but Blue Bottle is still my all time favorite for mocha. The FI ordered the mint mojito, which I thought he'd like. Unfortunately, it was too bland & minty for him. On another visit, I ordered their iced coffee. IMO, it was too bland. The FI ordered the ginger snap iced coffee. This is really good for all you cinnamon lovers out there. On my recent visit, I tried Jacob's Wonderbar, recommended by my cousin after I told her I thought the coffee at Philz wasn't comparable to Blue Bottle. 

I actually really like Jacob's Wonderbar. It's not too bland and has a nice nutty & chocolately flavor. I'm addicted!
author: Candice H.

description: Stopped by this location and got good parking today on a beautiful clear and sunny day in SF.  Got my favorite drink the Tesora.  There was no line today guessing its a weekday at 10:30 AM and experienced fast and friendly service.  Philz Coffee tastes great and smells good.  Good quality beans every time!  I'll definitely be back.
author: Jesse C.

description: very shady business here their service is very dissapointing i really happen to like their products but how they treated me a devoted customer is just malice all im doing is spending my money but they have to f with me for no reason
author: Kaylie B.

description:
Not much more I can add with over 1000 reviews but...

The one cup at a time brewing method is simple and brilliant.  Fresh coffee with every cup! The Mint Mojito iced coffee sounded kind of weird, but it tasted great.  Loved the fresh mint with the coffee.

Wish I lived closer so I didn't have to depend on Starbucks with their coffee that just sits there all day. Thanks Phiz for spoiling coffee for me! Reason to move?  Maybe...
author: Jim G.

description:
I'm pretty impressed with this location.  I think Philz made a good choice when opening up this little spot.  Although not the easiest of accessibility located on one of the busiest streets in the city, this is surely a coffee hot-spot.

The store was clean and welcoming with a chalkboard sign posted out front inviting guests and patron's alike to come in and check out a new fresh approach.  Philz is not for the plain-Jane's of coffee drinkers so have an open mind and be prepared to be amazed. The Ambrosia Coffee of God was my drink today and let me tell you - this light/medium cup was just the drink I needed to kick off my morning.

This location even includes a bagel-bar where all of your doughy needs can be met.  If you have a little time, step on over to the other side (literally) and take a load off while sitting in a room with like-minded folk just enjoying their morning wake-up call.

Check out Philz and you wont regret it.
author: Kevin J.

description: I love the Silken Splendor at Philz! It's so good I haven't tried any of their other flavors...
author: Lola P.

description: Cool place to grab nice cup of coffee with unique flavour. Worth to try and easily fall in love to this coffee
author: Unyo N.

description:
Really, really good coffee. A place where I feel like cost and quality are comparable. I typically drink iced americanos sans sugar/milk because my roomies and I have a 6 pack club pact. I ordered a Gingersnap coffee drink though, and at half sugar it was absolutely delicious. The barista was right when he said it tasted like Christmas. 

And now I am like - 12 packs into the 6 pack club.
author: Jonathan Y.

description: The coffee was prepared perfectly and the barista was super nice. It was really cool that they were opened at night
author: Alberto S.

description:
Mojito mint coffee is the best 

I should just quit my job and open one up in east coast. 

Watch out blue bottle in New York.
author: Millie H.

description:
Looking at other reviews, definitely had high expectations but it was a total letdown. First of all, service is super slow... Next they ran out if everything rood related, then no espresso machines and they said adding milk is just like latte and they can microwave the milk as they don't have steamer.... Wth? Microwave the milk? Then they insisted it is similar... Um no don't think do.

The monitor iced coffee got rating reviews so decided to try it, it was meh... Hardly tasted any mint... Don't understand the high ratings...

Value 3/5 ok pricing
Amenities 2.5/5 vibe is fine but they ran out of bagels, burritos, etc
Service 2/5 extremely slow snd the young people w raking there do not know much
Quality 2.5/5

10/20
author: Nina S.

description: I tried the mint mojito iced coffee and it was so good! I've never tried a coffee with this flavor! Very sweet and refreshing!
author: Allison G.

description: This is my favorite coffee chain. Honestly they could stop serving everything except the Mint Mojito and I would still come. I balance all of that praise by saying that there are some better small coffee shops out there, but for a chain this one is excellent.
author: David S.

description:
Had my first cup of mint mojito iced coffee a couple of weeks ago in LA so I HAD to make it back to Philz while in NorCal. Didn't disappoint on the mint mojito so applause for being consistent!

I got the boyfriend a cup of the Istanbul Tea and it's one of the best teas I've ever had (outside of London's teas)! I don't like my teas sweet so if that's you, then opt for something else. 

The 3 baristas in there were soooo friendly and nice. Parking can be a B, but it's SF so what do you expect?
author: Jennifer N.

description:
I'm a huge fan of their Mint Mojito and I can never get enough of it. I usually go to the one located on 24th and Folsom but decided to come here since it was on my way to work. This location is smaller than the one I used to go to but their drinks are spot on. 

As usual I got the Mint Mojito and that tasted awesome. It was not water downed and they were not holding back on the mint leaves for the drink. The staff were nice and I came early enough that the line wasn't too bad. Just be careful when you park in the area because some meters are from 7am to 6pm instead of the traditional 9am to 6pm.
author: Stephen W.

description:
There's some pretty cool people who work here - easy on the eyes too...must be a prerequisite to work here.  

Believe the hype because its true. Philz make My heart go pitter-patter because this is some strong ass brew. The roasts closest to me heart is the philtered soul, Tesora and Jacobs wunderbar.  I lean towards the beans with a touch of cocoa not so much the fruity bouquets. 

Love the per cup brew system don't really mind the wait. My partner in crime loves the Turkish. He is known in this Philz. They know him by name - that really makes him feel special. I once walked in with him with  a Peets coffee at hand.  They didn't seem to mind. The ranger said, "I'm not mad at cha' just come back when you want real coffee."  Oooooh, He told me.  I told him the caffeine issue - makes my heart go beat beat. Half caf/decaf, he suggested. Bingo. Got a problem? They'll solve it. It's coffee your way, whatever you want however you want. 

Just don't ask for a shot, an americano, A latte, or any frou-frou drink. This is straight up coffee - it's Philz way or the highway.
author: Michelle B.

description:
The gingersnap coffee was pretty good but the mint mojito coffee was DEF worth the hype. I didn't get the mint mojito coffee because it just sounded a little too "interesting" for me and played it safe with the gingersnap. However, I had a sip of my friends and it was so delicious! I can taste the mint mojito but it didn't overpower the taste of the coffee.
If you're in the area, give it a try!
author: Sophia K.

description:
I always get the mint mojito it's my go to drink. Sometimes I get mad at myself for not venturing out of my bubble but if it ain't broke why fix it? Always order a large over a small it's only $1. 

Only wish the drink didn't costs so much. $5 for a large.
author: Liz N.

description: My boyfriend was in great need of coffee after a huge brunch at Brenda's so we came here! He really liked his Silken Splendor medium roast coffee! It was really fresh and smelled soooo good. Wish there was a coffee shop like this in SB ):
author: Heidi L.

description:
2 words: Mint Mojito. Just do it. Very much worth the hype! Super creamy and smooth with a nice minty kick. In my ideal world I'd have a filter or sieve to catch the mint leaves, because I don't want to chew on the leaves with every sip. That's just me though. 

Also got the Philtered Soul, which is a medium roast with nutty notes. My dad enjoyed it black! 

If you like trying new and "different" coffee, Philz is definitely a great alternative to Starbucks or your other everyday coffee chain.  

The docked star is more about the actual surrounding area, not the coffee. There's plenty of room to sit but it can get super loud with the outside street parking with car alarms going off constantly and the sound of impatient/rowdy drivers. This is downtown SF afterall, so that much is expected I suppose. Overall still well worth a visit if the noise doesn't bother you!
author: Celine L.

description:
Philz to the rescue for all those mornings you just NEED that extra kick! 


My drink of choice for the moment: 
***Silken Soul = Philtered Soul + Silken Splendor*** No sugar, light cream -- and your on your way to that Happy Giddy Feeling of sipping delicious hot coffee. 

Service is always amazing. May take a bit longer since every cup is brewed fresh with love. 

I always get the Philz ground of the month, it's $14 for a 16oz bag. Really can't beat the quality or price!
author: Ellen W.

description:
The many great things I could say about the staff (including the "black girl" lol ), coffee, and teas....I'll keep it short, all GREAT!!! 
thanks so much :)))
author: david s.

description: This is delicious pour-over coffee in every variety you could ever imagine. Plus this girl named Gabby works there and she is basically the definition of someone who loves her job. She's always unbelievably friendly and authentically happy. She will literally make your day. Add caffeine to that and you've got pure magic.
author: Andrea C.

description:
Aaaaah how lucky am I to have Phil's literally in my backyard!
I now know the meaning of hop, skip and jump :P
Their fruity and earthy Ambrosia always transforms the sometimes murky SF days. Also I know for a fact that if I ever offer to walk to Phil's for a Philharmonic, my husband becomes by biggest cheerleader... Such is the love for coffee!
Smiling servers, quick service. Place can get a bit cramped at times, but most of the times I'm in and out so no complaints :)
author: Shruti D.

description:
Yummy iced mochas to be found here.  The barista asked me how sweet I wanted my mocha, which is cool because most places don't ask you that.  The chocolate flavor wasn't overwhelming nor was it overly sweet.  I liked it and would try it again.

There is also a decent decaf coffee section and they even use adjectives to describe each coffee.

The main seating area is in a separate room though.

For cold drinks they use the same cups and lids as the regular hot coffee, which is a bit weird.
author: Danielle C.

description:
Here are the Philz Coffee shop locations I visited:
1. 3101 24th St at Folsom St
2. 201 Berry St at 4th St
3. 399 Golden Gate Ave at Larkin St

Walked by this location before and I had the intent to try a new beverage, so I did. I came in and ordered a large cup of New Manhattan from the light roast selection of the menu. The New Manhattan is now one of my new favorite beverages at Philz. Overall, positive first time experience here with efficient services and friendly staff members.

Some of the other beverages I tried before are:
A. Jamaican Blue Mountain Coffee
B. Hot Chocolate
C. Mint Mojito Iced Coffee

The chairs and tables are moved one door over. One side for customers to order, pay and pickup their beverages and pastries. Another side for the sitting area - props to the owners for taking this approach.

Davies Symphony Hall, City Hall and AMC on Van Ness #14 are all within walking distance from here. This is also a great spot to get a cup of coffee before or after the concert.
author: Bennett W.

description: I love love Philz! Iced mint Mojito for sure! I also tried the silken splendor? I don't really know how to choose different roasts, but this was def good brewed coffee still if you don't want a minty drank. So smooth. No coffee aftertaste. It's a bit pricey for a non espresso beverage, around $4 for a 12 oz, but totally worth it in my opinion. Actually, I started getting the larger 16 oz now bc 12 oz is just not enough! This location was a bit smaller/slower than some other one I went to in SF.
author: Kathleen C.

description:
Went to this particular Philz on a Sunday afternoon. Service could have been better. It was my boyfriend's first time there, and I had only been to the San Mateo Philz like once or twice. Needless to say, we were Philz noobs. So, a little bit of help would have been great. But did we get it?.....Nope!

I did my best to order (got the iced mint mojito and mocha) and turned around to pay--I was pretty friendly with the cashier, but was met with something close to a scowl. Nice. Personally, since I had received such great service from another Philz location, I had higher expectations. Of course, I'm sure it varies per location, but really, it shouldn't, since there are Philz poppin up all over the place! Also, the mint mojito iced coffee was a bit watered down. :( Oh well--probs won't be in that area too often to grab my Philz fix. I would head over to a different one to experience friendlier service. Thanks anyways!
author: Mariel A.

description: Fast and delicious. The staff was friendly and efficient. The coffee was balanced and not too acidic. I will return soon.
author: Gilbert P.

description:
All you need to do when ordering coffee here is be yourself, period. Tell those brilliant baristas your likes and dislikes, and I ensure you they will take care of you. 

Was at this famous coffee shop last month for NYE and I could possibly say that I will come back whenever I'm in the Bay Area. I love love the fact the the barista {forgot what her name was} was very friendly, very patient with me {lol} and very informative. 

The selections are amazing here! Weather you're a medium roast person or a bold lover, they got you. 

They even have pastries for you to pair your coffee with at the checkout counter. Philz Coffee offers way beyond my expectations as a coffee shop. There's no reason why I wouldn't give them 5 stars rating!
author: Sasi M.

description:
JY is a huge coffee drinker, I however, am not..... But since we were in SF, we had to see what the locals tend to rant and rave about.. Coming off a piss poor experience in the mecca of coffee in the North West, A.K.A. Seattle we were excited to try Philz infamous "Mint Mojito Coffee", thanks for the suggestion Susy C! 

Coffee: EXCELLENT. I don't even drink coffee but when I tried a little of the Mint Mojito coffee, it was extremely tasty.... JY loved it and got two cups actually! Overall, we came to Philz about 3 times in our stay in SF. 

Service: It's got that super hipstery SF feel to it. One thing that bothered me about this place was the sheer arrogance of one employee upon when we inquired about other Philz locations... We had no idea Philz was  geographic specific with SF. However, with a roll of the eyes and a "No... We're not in LA" that capped off my experience with Philz... COOL BRO. Thanks for letting me know that........ 

Overall, good place for coffee. Though, a bit put off by my experience at this location. Hoping next time will be different... 

J "HOW RUDE" Y
author: Justin Y.

description:
Honestly Philz Tesora isy fav drip. It's insanely strong, so sensitive caffeine people be aware; you'll get the jitters. Ambiance is lacking, kinda crummy, but several tables and lounge open til 5'. 

Opt for a small and head to the lounge for wifi and work time.

Back to the crush!
author: Roy C.

description: Loved the iced  house coffee at first taste here!  Service is quick and efficient and this is a convenient location near City Hall/Civic Center and the 47/49 bus stops on Van Ness.  They expended the space for more seating.  Good move,
author: Maile N.

description: What a delicious treat! Loved the famous iced mint mojito coffee that had just a touch of sweetness and creaminess but loads of mint flavor!
author: Joanne K.

description: My 1st time to be here, tried amprocia coffee of god, pretty good! Will definitely try others when I am in the city.
author: Kiana L.

description: I love philz coffee and I like local vibe that every single cafe has. This place is small but very efficient. The only downside is lack of table to seat and work(they only have one). I bought 2 large Tesora medium roast coffee and found it pretty good!
author: Ilmia N.

description:
Probably one of the MOST hyped drink on instagram, but was STOKED to finally try it. 
I gotta say, very hipster. very. Honestly it is over the top hyped, but I can't say I wasn't pretty impressed in its originality. It is nothing my tastebuds have ever tasted before. Mint mojito iced coffee...very delish and rich. But is it just me or does the coffee kinda taste oily after a while..like no lie it get's kinda weird at the end and starts to curdle. 
But overall, really delisioso coffeeeeee :3 Pretty too! Oh, make sure you stir it before you drink it because ALL the sugar is set at the bottom!
author: Joyce L.

description:
Let me start this off by sayin I am not a huge fan of coffee, but my girlfriend literally can not live without it. I have been to many a coffee shop in my life and never found anything I throughly enjoyed outside of tea.... Until we drove up to the bay and checked this place out. 

What an incredible selection, and taste. If I lived up here I could definitely frequent this place for much more than buying tea leaves haha.
author: Aleks R.

description:
4 stars for my Philharmonic. Kept me fueled to do work in their Philz Lounge next to the cafe. 

2.5 - 3 stars for their lounge. The lounge used to be a deli sandwich shop. It looks completely stripped down (compared to other Philz locations), but it has your basic needs: free wifi, tables, chairs and outlets.
author: Jesi M.

description: First time here. I ordered the mint mojito iced coffee. It was light and refreshing. It tasted more like a tea than coffee. But nonetheless very good.
author: Christine L.

description:
Bathroom was nice, well lit, comedic stickers,  & comfortable ambience. Just enough toilet paper for me and my family to share. 

Could use a routinely clean up on account of a turd floating in a toilet which my cousin found. Other than that good coffee and a clean bathroom!
author: Kevin A.

description:
First I need to respond to Regina's review - there is TONS of seating at Philz. You may not have noticed because it's split into two areas - the coffee shop side and the deli side. The deli side has many many tables. I spent several hours there working last week. It might not be in the fanciest part of town, but I didn't once feel uncomfortable and I wouldn't warn anyone away from going there because of it. 

I'm primarily an espresso drinker. I rarely enjoy the taste of brewed coffee because it's rarely done well. Trader Joe's cold press is by far the best I've experienced anywhere. 

BUT Philz has made a believer out of me. They have a huge selection of different coffees and they do a pour over style, so the coffee is super fresh. Several have light creams and sugars in them, if that's your thing. I had a nutty with hints of caramel coffee with a little soy milk and it was quite tasty (and they didn't charge me extra for soy)! Again, I'm really not a straight up coffee kind of woman, but I would gladly go back to Philz.

The staff was outrageously friendly and helpful. They were cracking jokes and making me feel like I've been going there for a long time. 

I will say $4 for a coffee seems high, but with the craftsmanship and quality I guess I can understand.
author: A C.

description:
I'm not a coffee drinker but I heard so many good things about Philz. I had my first cup of fresh brewed chai with vanilla soy today. It was good. Not as creamy as Starbucks, but very flavorful. What I really loved was the apricot bar... YUM!!!! 

Service was really great. All the baristas were cordial and nice. Wait's a little longer than other coffee houses but that's expected since they do "one cup at a time".
author: Stephen Y.

description:
I absolutely LOVE Philz. Their coffee is top notch. They do not do espresso so be aware of that. But if you are all about an amazing cup of Joe, this is the place to get it. As oppose to single origin they do blends, and have tasting notes, similar to what you experience when wine tasting. I always have fun letting the server know what I like and getting recommendations, they have never let me know. 

The only downside is because they are all pour overs it does take longer. 

But otherwise the service is great, the locations are clean and comfortable and it is always a pleasant experience. Unfortunately there is not one near my home, or I would surely be a regular.
author: Sara P.

description:
Same great coffee as all other locations.

The line was somewhat of a mess the morning I visited, with most of the pastries already gone.  Went for the mint mojito iced coffee and it's great as always.  So damn refreshing.  My barista ran out of mint so I had to ask the next barista over if I could grab 1-2 for mine haha. 

I was able to grab a the last meat quiche.  It's good, but a little too buttery for my liking.  I can see why people love their quiches though.

Accessibility is a bit hard unless you are walking along Van Ness, but man, tons of people were getting dropped off and picked up on Van Ness as they rush it and out to get their caffeine fix.
author: Duke C.

description: Awesome location. Great staff. The bathroom walls are tagged with graffiti and humorous stickers. The lounge area is a nice place to hang out and people watch.
author: Frank Z.

description:
The hype is real.
I usually don't drink coffee, but the mint mojito iced coffee is worth the wait, worth walking through sunshine or rain, and worth dealing with the tourists who order everything off the menu and cause a longer wait.
I would also recommend the Philtered soul.

In addition, the mint is very photogenic. Not just snapchat-worthy, but insta-worthy indeed.
author: Chelsea P.

description:
Wow! Finally get to try this place! 

I was waiting to go eat brunch and I decided to walk to Van Ness street to check this place out. 

I came here around 1pm and there was a long line. I went to ordered the famous 'mint mojito ice coffee' ($4.00) 

The taste was really fresh,minty, and overall refreshing. I love the flavor and I wish they would have something like this in Southern California. 

What I also like about this location was that there was seats on the other side of the coffee shop where people can sit, eat, study, and chill.

Definitely coming back!
author: Adam J.

description:
It seems that Philz really cares and value their customers. After my last review about not receiving the best service at this location, I was reached by the owner who then mailed me a card for me to come back. My second visit at this location turned out to be great. The coffee, as always, is the best!

What stood out the most for me is the fact that Philz management team do take the time to read our reviews and go above and beyond to please their customers. That's a plus in my book. Good job Philz! For not only making the best coffee around, but also for your awesome customer service.
author: Wendy H.

description: It was my first time at Philz Coffee and I was very excited to try their coffee because I had heard so many great things about them. The group I was with ordered about 15 minutes ahead of time on an app and I got a iced mint mojito coffee. We were told to wait by the online ordering area when we arrived at the shop. After waiting about 20 minutes and listening to the barista working in front of us openly complain about her job and treat other customers who had also ordered with the app rudely, we inquired about our order only to have that barista disrespectfully put the blame on us for the wait because I guess we were required to let them know when we arrived. Doesn't that defeat the purpose of online ordering? Even so, it would've been helpful for another employee to tell us what exactly to do, instead of telling us to simply wait on the side. To have a barista openly blaming customers and arguing with them is just not good business. Truly disappointed by the entire experience
author: Kourtney W.

description: The "turkish coffee" sign outside is what pulled me in, I'm glad it did. Just moved to sf from overseas and couldn't find the rite coffee place for me not to mention I tried literally every coffee shop in the area normally after a sip or two I chuck out the cup.. but philz coffee is different, real high quality and made perfectly coffee. Location is great and the service is extremely delightful. Now go treat  yourself to a good cup of coffee
author: Ivria S.

description:
A bit hit or miss these days :\

It's hard to grow but quality control is key.
author: David K.

description:
I hate writing bad reviews... but I was honestly so disappointed with my experience at this Philz location. Ordered a large mint mojito and specified that I wanted it "EXTRA sweet and creamy" bc I know everyone has different definitions of "sweet & creamy" so I wanted to make sure I emphasized that I wanted it so sweet that it could give me a cavity. (We all enjoy our coffee differently, I just like mine as a dessert!) There was only one guy making drinks at the time and there were a few people in front of me, so it took about 20 minutes to get my coffee. After grabbing my drink and jolting out the door, (my meter was going to run out) I took a sip and it was so freakin bitter....pretty much the complete opposite of what I wanted. Not sure if he skipped out on the sugar entirely and just added creamer? Anyways, I knew that there was no way I could take another sip of it without some sweetener so I ran back in and asked if he could make it a LOT more sweeter- emphasis on the "LOT." After finishing up his other drinks, he gladly obliged and fixed up my drink. I grabbed it, and jolted out the door yet again. Shook it a little, took a sip, and it tasted EXACTLY the same. I'm not sure if he did anything at all or just handed me back my old drink. At this point, I was already a block away and it was pretty much undrinkable so I just tossed it. 

The barista looked really occupied with the rush so I understand how that can be difficult to manage, but I just hope that next time they'll pay more attention to detail :(
author: Marny N.

description: I am from the East Coast and we have no coffee as good as this. Starbucks doesn't come close to the quality of this wonderful brew.  Be prepared to wait a tad bit longer than normal because they manually brew the coffee by hand with hot water and filters.  It is worth the wait.  This is def a place I will miss upon my return to the East Coast.  Philz, you have my heart.
author: Marshal C.

description:
This place is amazing! Thank you to all the locals who recommended Philz to me! 

When it comes to coffee, San Francisco totally beats NYC. The Bay Area is home to great coffee shops and Philz Coffee is the best coffee I've ever had. At Philz, their motto is "one cup at a time" and they do only coffee, which they nail phenomenally. Plus they don't have a higher-than-thou attitude like other coffee shops try to be. 

The Gingersnap iced coffee was a recommendation by the barista who was completely knowledgeable of what he was doing. The flavor of the iced coffee was smooth, perfectly sweet, and had a nice spice action going for it. Those who like chai (like myself) will love this. I can't get enough how awesome Philz is and while it's a bummer tey're only in the Bay Area, you can order their beans online (again thank you locals!). At around $3+ for a cup, it is well worth it in my opinion. 

If you're ever in San Francisco and want the best coffee, go to Philz. Can't wait to go back!
author: Raymart D.

description:
Ok, the workers at this Philz need to be a tad bit more pleasant. I'm not sure what happened on this day but both female baristas had some attitude issues going on. I ordered and smiled and waited. I stood in the corner and they just barked at waiting customers with nary a smile. I can help the next customer in line. I CAN HELP THE NEXT CUSTOMER IN LINE! said the big bad wolf. It wasn't even that busy. When I got my coffee, I didn't even get the customary, "let me know how that tastes" or the small talk that usually comes with the Dancing Waters.

When a customer is spending $3 or $4 for a cup of joe, do us a favor and at least fake a smile. Take a page out of the awesome baristas at the UC Hastings location.

That is all.
author: Kris P.

description: Always coming back for the Mojito coffee. I just wish they have standard recipe for this coffee so whoever makes it will have the same result. I like it when my fav person makes the coffee, she makes it good and perfect. I just wish everyone can make it as good as her.
author: Olivia J.

description:
First time at the Van Ness location!  This Philz Coffee is set up to have 2 separate areas.  One area with cafe tables, free wifi and a clean bathroom and another area for coffee and pastry ordering.  We split a Tesora Mocha and thought it was coffee-chocolate deliciousness at it's finest.  We asked for vegan pastries and they pointed to the Big Oat Bar and said "this is pretty much Vegan".  Uh, what is "pretty much Vegan?".  I read the ingredients and it had nonfat yogurt in it which makes it Non-Vegan.  We bought it anyways to try and was disappointed that it was dry, flavorless and less satisfying than something you buy from Quaker Oats in a box.  

Minus 1 star for the lame pastry and lack of professionalism to dietary restrictions.  The coffee is still damn delicious though.
