author: Yue L.

description:
Everyone told me to try Philz Coffee when in SF. It was a very good cup of coffee. 

I tried what everyone suggested, Mint Mojito. 

I got it hot because it was freezing outside but I bet it would have been better cold.

I enjoyed it, it was a very unique taste. 

I would try it again but iced next time!

Don't drink Starbucks in SF, drink PHILZ!
author: Kevin W.

description:
I love philz coffee...BUT...yes, there's a huge BUT here.  There is a such a difference between the morning crew and the night crew when it comes to friendliness.  

The morning crew?  A++ 
Always friendly, awesome, asking if your drink is alright...smiling, efficient.

The night crew?  D. 
Angry, looks like they hate their job...unfriendly...not so kind.

The coffee is all around great from location to location.  That's the magic of philz.

Parking is horrible in this neck of the woods...but I've never had an issue finding one somewhere.  

4 stars.
author: Jen W.

description:
Mojito coffee is soooo good!!!!!! 

Came to SF for a visit, and my friend recommended the mojito drink.  YUmmmmmmm!!!  Wish San Diego has something similar.
author: Brandy C.

description:
I really like this Philz. The store is divided into two sections. On the left they sell food such as sandwiches and paninis. The place is actually called Delish sandwiches but the Philz logo is in the door so that's a little confusing. I don't think they serve coffee.  On the RIGHT is where they sell the stuff of the gods.  

Parking: there usually is parking in front. Metered. Or maybe I've just been darn lucky every time I come. 

My ULTIMATE favorites are: 

Mint mojito. Light ice. S:$4 L:$4.5
New manhattan. Medium sweet. S:$3 L:$4 

coffee per lb. is $16. They grind it on the spot if requested. Make sure that you tell them what method of coffee brewing you are using because it requires different coffee textures. I.e I use cone dripping ( the same as them) and the grind is Medium/fine . This significantly changes the aroma of your coffee.

For a quick read on this visit :
http://mobile.drinks.seriouseats.com/2011/07/coffee-techniques-best-grind-for-espresso-french-press-fine-vs-coarse.html

I heart coffee. I can't survive without coffee. People appreciate that I've had my morning coffee. That is all.
author: Mily W.

description:
Mojito coffe? I'm in. Coffee ice cubes? So simple and yet so genius.
The Ecstacy is just as good as the name implies, and I'm not even a coffee person.
Which may be why it kept me up til nearly 4 AM, twelve hours later.

In any case, the service here was a little on the slow side but after you grab your drink it's cool to grab a seat across the hall in the lounge area- easily found a table for three in the middle of the afternoon on a Sunday, which is usually pretty impossible. Quiet enough to get some work done, eclectic mix of music: specifically noticed that there were two songs playing at once, unsure whether one side of the store was playing different music and the sound drifted or if it was a customer's music I overheard.
Only complaint is that all trashcans were beyond overflowing throughout our visit and no attempt to empty them was made, even when there were no customers in line. This includes the lounge area, where the employees behind the counter only sell food items (sandwiches, bagels, etc) and didn't have a single customer in the half hour we were there. Take some initiative, guys!

Can't go wrong with the mint mojito or ecstacy iced coffees, great afternoon treat. This coming from someone who usually turns DOWN coffee.
author: Stefany V.

description:
Mint Mojito Coffee. 
D-e-l-i--c-i-o-u-s !! This drink came with fresh mint leaves! It's really good, I swear.

The concept of this coffee shop is amazing. They brew each cup one at a time. Also, their coffee selection is big enough for them have all those coffee lined up against the wall! Customer service was amazing here too. People loved them so much that while waiting for my cup of coffee, I saw people dropping those dollar dollar bills in their tip jar. 

The only con about this location is the way you order the coffee. You have to walk to stations--order, pay, pick up. Their stations are put in an awkward way. You literally walk in a circle. There's not alot of space either..and it seems like they tend to have long lines.
author: Amy L.

description:
Everytime I am in SF, I come to Philz. I can't drink caffeine because it keeps me up all night, but I'm willing to stay up for Philz. 

The last time I went, I was a little disappointed. I always order the Mint Mojito Iced Coffee but this time it was watery. I told them and they made me a new cup, but the same problem! I fished out all my ice and then when I got to the bottom, it was super thick. The barista probably did not mix my drink properly. 

I was sad since I got watery at first then thick and sugary last. :( I will go again, but I'm still sad that I didn't get a good cup of iced coffee. Especially since I can't go all the time.
author: Hae A.

description: If you're a coffee lover, this place is the best. Brewed one cup at a time, they are truly masters of their craft. I've never had such good coffee.
author: Thomas L.

description:
There's only couple words I just want to say about this place.

MINT MOJITO!

Geez-us Cryst it was good!  I guess what this place is known for is this coffee concoction and they do it real well.  At first a Mojito is a drink you would think comes with alcohol.  Needless to say, the Mint Mojito coffee is just as good.  Matter of fact give me some Kahlua and we're golden!

Overall, a great drink and just another way to spice up my coffee.  The mojito part of it gave the coffee a sweeter and thicker texture.  I'm a texture guy so sludgy coffee is good and perfect to my palates! - Enjoy!
author: Bao H.

description:
Get a tesora in the morning with a beef sambusa for breakfast.

Order a mint mojito in the afternoon, when you're about to crash.

Thank me later.  

Best coffee in SF!
author: mike j.

description:
I've been to another Philz now, and this one does not disappoint! Seating is very limited in the main area, but fortunately they have additional seating next door. There is even a deli there!

I got the mocha tesora again, and it was very good. Hand crafted at its best.
author: David T.

description:
Dear Philz,

After 2 years of being clean, I gave into the caffeine high again this morning; not just with any coffee establishment but with YOU! Your aromatic scent is enticing and your taste is tantalizing; rich, silky, full-bodied (yet mellow) and nutty. A touch of cream and sugar gave you an indulgent creaminess with an ever so light touch of sweetness. *swoons*

Thank you for making my first time with you COFFGASMIC! 

Love,
Cherylynn

P.S.- You got me hooked on you!
author: Cherylynn N.

description:
Don't trust what the other reviewers say. If you appreciate an awesome cup of latte, don't bother going into this place. 

Not worth it!!!

Ps: I want my money back!!!
author: R P.

description: I am addicted to philz coffee. I love the ides of custom prepared coffee in s big chain coffee shop. Staff is always friendly. I love their tosaro and if course mint mohito. Their pastry suck though, always dry and seem like they have been sitting on the shelf for a few days.
author: Mark C.

description: Good strong coffee if you need to wake up. Friendly staff but can be crowded during the morning rush hour. It's worth a try If you  a coffee person
author: Jo K.

description:
I am a big fan of Philzs.  I really like that this location was expanded because it was tiny before with no where to sit , which was a negative. Some of my favorite coffee's are Greater Alarm(most caffeine), the Soo Good, and Tesora, Jacobs, come to think of it, I haven't had a flavor I didn't like.  It's really about personal preference.  My normal location is the Philz on Berry Street, which I love, but whenever I have a meeting in this area I go here.  I also really love the Berkeley location too.

Parking is almost non-existent at this location and you need a code to get in the bathroom. If you are a coffee drinker, then for goodness sake you must try Philzs coffee!  Enjoy!
author: Megan M.

description: Not bad! I got the mint Mojito and it was delicious! Fresh and creamy (I ordered the creamy option). The drink had just the right amount of mint in it, so it wasn't too strong. A tad pricey, so I come only when I have a few extra dollars on hand.
author: Sylvia O.

description:
Mmmmm mint mojito iced coffee!!! Yummmm :)

Always a good philz experience! :) great customer service and atmosphere. The baristas are always chill/nice too
author: Heather I.

description:
I had sample of their Tesora coffee at one of my races and I loved it!! So decided to give the mocha tesora a try too--it was very rich and chocolate-ty and bittersweet.  The best part about it is that they give you options on how sweet you want it.

 My sister and bf are addicted to their mint mojito iced coffee-- I had a sip from my bf cup and it was creamy, fresh, minty and coffee-y :) and the closer you get to the bottom of the cup it taste even better!!! 

Not much of a coffee drinker anymore like I used to be, but I'd drink Philz Coffee any day!
author: Junaline G.

description: The iced Tesoro & iced Mint Mojito are my favorites! I also had a great conversation with one of the baristas... They're all super friendly! I'll definitely stopby for my coffee fix whenever I'm near one of the locations.
author: Rynel V.

description:
4.5 stars

mint + coffee?! what a weird combo... and i'm not a huge fan of mint either, so i wasn't too excited to try it. but it was apparently THE drink the get, so i gave it a shot... and was pleasantly surprised! the iced coffee drink was super smooth and the mint wasn't overpowering (which was surprising considering half the cup consisted of mint leaves). the only downside is that since there's so much mint in the drink, plus ice, you don't actually get that much coffee for the amount you pay-- and philz isn't cheap! i also gave the tesora a shot but it wasn't all that memorable. just come here for the unique mint mojito iced coffee!
author: Ann H.

description:
This is a little coffee shop.  Where you take out coffee.  No seating here, but you could go next door to the breakfast place to sit down I suppose.

Very small area to wait for your coffee to be prepared, but if you are in the area, the staff are very nice.
author: E A.

description: i love philz coffee!! my cousin lived across the street and i would definitely have to stop by here in the mornings when i visited!! my uncle would even request beans for me to bring back with me. haven't had a bad cup of coffee here EVER. everything is brewed to order so you can adjust the level of creaminess and sweetness to your personal liking. good quality coffees. and definitely try the mint mojito iced coffee. sorry, no alcohol - but once you take a sip - you won't even care.
author: Patty W.

description:
This Philz Coffee is almost strategically located. Why? Because around the other side of the block is this place called Brenda's French Soul Food. That place averages a wait time of an hour to an hour and a half. So when you're waiting to grab a table at that restaurant, you walk on over this Philz Coffee in the mean time. No joke, there's a trash can in front of Brenda's and it's filled to the rim with Philz Coffee cups. I think they got tired of all the litter.

This is the second Philz Coffee I hit up, the Mission location being the first. Let me tell you, same name, same tasty coffee, obviously a different staff but same friendly atmosphere. Amazingly, the line wasn't so bad for a Sunday afternoon. 

They have a lounge next door if you want to chill out. Also, they have a little pastry/snack bar as well. 

We all got our caffeine fix and went straight back into that dreadful line at Brenda's. Thanks Philz Coffee for easing our suffering.
author: Smitcha B.

description:
So..umm...Hi.
*trying so hard not to gaze and get lost in a stare
I haven't seen you in awhile. Yeah. I know you are busy...
*shuffles feet.
Yeah yeah, I am doing good, thanks.
Yeah.
That is good. Thanks. 
Wow.
Why is this so hard?
What happened to those days we would just sit for hours reading? Sipping on coffee, people watching, not really talking but still... 
we were together.
*grumbles**lifehappened

But just because life happened...
doesn't mean...

Oh, I know...
I know there will be others. You are right in saying that.

I have been going out. Some are good. Real good. but still....
No one dances in my head throwing rocks,
like you.
You are something special. But you know that, there wouldn't be a line of people vying for your affection.

Oh, you gotta go? Yeah. Ok.
I will take an ecstatic and an ambrosia and a slice of hope to see you soon. 
Thanks.
author: Rossi H.

description:
Okay. So here's a little secret. I've stopped drinking coffee. I KNOW, RIGHT?! I used to drink coffee ALL THE FREAKIN' TIME. However, I've stopped, due to health reasons. But here's another dirty little secret. The only place that I would drink coffee is at Philz. THERE WE GO, I SAID IT.

I'm a sucker for the Philtered Soul, Philz Way. Soooooo good.
author: Joanne W.

description:
First coffee of the New Year and first time trying Philz. There was a line but it moves really fast! Great coffee.. scratch that - AMAZING! They have lots of choices on the menu and it was hard to make a decision. Menu is split up by light roast, medium roast, dark roast, and their specialty drinks.

It was a cold afternoon, so I chose a hot drink instead of a cold one. Next time when it's warmer, I will def be getting an iced coffee!

PHILTERED SOUL.
Hazelnut goodness. Just amazing.

I'm a big fan of hazelnut coffee and Philz is doing it right.

I love that they make every drink individually and it's not a batch order. Asked for cream & sugar with mine and they even asked to make sure if it was enough - added a little more sugar in mine after I taste tested it.

Coming back here to try the Mint Mojito Iced Coffee on a warm day!
author: Wing L.

description:
Oh how I love the mint mojito iced coffee. 

It was the only thing that kept me motivated in between classes and made me want to stay in graduate school...

Its just that wicked good.
author: Court S.

description:
man i've missed you

used to sniff and sip your goods every mon - fri around 8:50 am as a daily indulgence. sometimes again at 1pm and on weekends 

have since met others named bibo, hub and peerless when offered as absence truly does make the heart grow fonder

i'll take what i can get on my short visits as you're too good for me

those romcom cliches are right as i didn't know how good i had it.  here in the civic, mish, soma wherever you are ill come to you

a staple everytime im back and an lb of jacobs to go of course
author: Clark G.

description: 1st time here at Philz Coffee on Ocean, SF. The best coffee i ever had. I tried the Iced mint mojito coffee and it was delicious. The employees were all nice and friendly. Too bad we don't have Philz Coffee in the Inland Empire area. I love this coffee shop.
author: Marierose Q.

description: Even though Philz coffee opened up in LA, I still like to visit philz in sf. Compared to other coffee brands, you get a subtle feeling of awakeness and I never get jittery from their coffee which feels more clean to me. I personally enjoy their mocha tesora it's a mixture of dark coffee roast with a hint of chocolate flavor. The flavor is on the nuttier side. The light roast I tried the canopy of heaven which was more acidic. Philz also has a secret menu, so look into that :)
author: Sarah L.

description:
I am a coffee addict, and my friend introduced me to this place while I was visiting SF. Thanks to my friend, I now have an addiction for their Mint Mojito Iced Coffee. It's the freshest tasting cup of iced coffee, EVER!

I made it a point every day to stop by a Philz to get this while I was in SF. They need to bring this to Texas, I would go there every day. Anyway, I will be back for sure anytime I'm in SF.
author: Jonathan F.

description:
Awesome, soo tasty.  Every time :D  Nice to have a place that doesn't serve gallons of burnt low-quality coffee.

The only thing is the layout of this Philz is a bit weird and there aren't many places to stand while you wait for your drink.  I try to avoid going at busy times.
author: Chelsea M.

description: Sometimes you love a brand very intensely and don't know why. I really enjoy their iced mint mojito coffee...though if you don't care about the mint, just get an iced coffee and ask for super sweet and creamy. It is my crack-cocaine and it is delicious!
author: Paul W.

description: I love their mint mojito but when I was at the shop I was looking closely at their pastry to see if I wanted to get something and I saw a fly go inside one of the spinach croissants, there were a few tiny flies buzzing around the food. I told the girl who works there and she threw it right away.
author: Jennifer F.

description:
There simply isn't a better cup of coffee in town. No fancy espresso drinks here - just ground beans, hot water, and cream/sugar, brewed individually.

Also, the baristas rock - most especially Lexi and Tonni.
author: Aaron T.

description: The Philharmonic coffee was amazing!! I wish we had a place like this in Florida! Ended up here while waiting for brunch at a place nearby. Was busy on Sunday morning, but line moves pretty quick. I loved how they made each different coffee fresh to order.
author: Lauren B.

description:
I got the mint mojito iced coffee because so many of my friends post pictures of it on instagram and I decided to jump on the bandwagon
I was very impressed with the flavor of it. Definitely not pepperminty, so don't expect something that tastes like the peppermint mocha from starbucks. It's more of a subtle, yet strong mint flavor.. They put sooo many mint leaves! The whole bottom of the cup was jam packed with mint
The coffee has a rich flavor, not tooo coffee-y, but a very nice, rich, good flavor. It's hard to explain because I've never tasted this kind of coffee tone before but everything mixed together very nicely
A large was around 4.50

This location is split into 2 it seemed like.. one side was where you ordered/paid
and across in another room was a seating area

They have a lot of locations in the SF area and also by UC Berkeley
If I ever come across, I'll be trying it again!

I also love how each coffee has a 3 word description. Concise and informative- just the way it should be.
author: Kimmy U.

description: Excellent hot and iced coffee! Delicious! Came here almost everyday for 2 weeks while on tour. Tried to get a different coffee each time. Wasn't disappointed!
author: Jessica W.

description:
Iced Mint Mojito Coffee & A Pumpkin Cookie W/ Cream Cheese Frosting!

That's all you need to know about Philz
Go
Order those two items
Thank me later
author: Craig R.

description:
Coffee shops are an interesting entity. Philz with a "z" fits the bill. There's some eclectic coffee drinks that no place has, particularly, the much spoke about Mint Mojito. 

Unfortunately, I wasn't in the mood for coffee and opted for hot chocolate. Not very sweet, but not super chocolately either. It's a powder, whatcha expect?  I had a sip of my bro's Mint Mojito since he kept talking about it ever since we got into SF. Gotta admit, it is refreshing in a weird way. 

This shop is broken apart where the barista is on one side of the building and  seating in another entry way. Good place to recharge your phone or a quiet place to study, but wish there was some outdoor seating, though it's located on a busy street with not much pedestrain traffic. Ehh, so much for people watching. Maybe the other Philz offers some loungy, relaxing quality. I'm willing to come back again at another shot of coffee.
author: Jackie M.

description:
I like my coffee black when I don't want a sweet blended drink.

I love the quality of Philz Coffee.  First thing I did with my friend when I went to SF to visit her was meet her here.

Great service and great coffee.  Freshly brewed and mixed before you.  I thought the price was cheap for the quality.

You can bring your own mug like other places.  How green!  I love it.

Luckily every time we came we tend to get the hot manager.  He's cute.  Small world.  On her way to New Orleans last Mardi Gras, she ran into him on the flight.
author: Phillip N.

description:
Love Philz!! 
Line is long, but goes by pretty quick. There are so many kinds of coffee. I love the mint mojito iced coffee.
author: April Y.

description:
I stopped in earlier prior to a conference nearby. I was a bit confused by the ordering process but just watched and soon enough figured it out.

I'm not a coffee drinker so I ordered a hot chocolate. The barista asked if I wanted to muddled mint in there and I said hell yeah! I can't tell you how good that hot chocolate was. One of the best ever. And the barista was just super friendly and super cute too.

Looking forward to trying out other Philz spots around the city.
author: Art O.

description:
Whenever I have an out of town guest, I bring them to Philz. This isn't the type of coffee you sit and contemplate; the recommended style is heavy on cream and sugar. Not just cream, heavy cream. With all that, you really can't tell the difference between any hot coffee you choose.

On a warm day, their iced drinks are spectacular. The iced mint mojito is a classic.

I'll sometimes buy the beans for home, because they're high quality and reasonably priced-- half of what other fashionable coffee shops charge.

Next door to the Van Ness location is a deli, which is technically a separate shop, but owned by the same people. It's common to buy your coffee at Philz and walk next door to enjoy it. The wifi is free, and no hassle to get online.
author: Ben S.

description:
Wow!!! I should have visited this place earlier...Its been here for quite a while. I ordered the Mocha Tesora  and I absolutely loved it......Loved the aroma and the taste. 
I ended got another one and sat there enjoying the lovely flavor. 
Definitely will be going there more often....
author: Michael R.

description:
My friend is less coffee enthusiast, more coffee addict (yes we are aware of the hyperactive side effects). 

Anyway, she had been on my tail to go get Philz for about a year, finally I appeased her. We walked in, and the first thing I noticed was the extremely long line. I'm not talking Starbucks long, I'm talking holy-cow-is-brad-pitt-inside-long-line. 

I was wondering what the commotion was for, but the cool thing is the line soon cleared as the people who had ordered picked up their drinks and slowly emptied out of this joint. We ordered our coffee within about 10 minutes. I ordered the chai latte. I was honestly expecting nothing grand. I've had the tazo chai latte many a time now from Starbucks - and was expecting something similar. 

I HAD A SIP... 

THEN I CAME - TO MY SENSES. 

I literally had been knocked out into oblivion after tasting the first sip - hearty, flavorful chai to DIE for! My friends coffee smelled amazing - I'm no coffee drinker so I opted to not try hers. 

But HOLY F-word, my chai was AMAZING. 

I could see why as well - the people behind the counters were literally hand crafting the coffee as if it was porcelain china. Anywho, I finally realized what the hype was all about, and I loved it! 


MOS DEF COMIN' BACK!
author: Raji R.

description: Best coffee ever. And try those health nut cookies and apricot bars. They are devine!
author: Ralph R.

description:
Only Philz has my coffee heart..

Every time I've been to sf I have to go to Philz now and ordered my ecstatic iced coffee. It's all I ever want from a coffee shop now and yet all I ever been was disappointed. Ever since I tried Philz I seriously dislike any other coffee shop I've been to because they're wack. I don't know what it is that Philz offer me but it's like a cupid has struck me with an arrow and I only see you now. How about we just closed down all the Starbucks and open some Philz in socal! PLEASE
author: Ernest Y.

description:
I almost took away a half star but then I figured it's not Philz fault that this place gave me a panic attack.  While I waited for my name to be called at Brenda's, I strolled over here for a cup of coffee and the line was out the door!  It moved surprisingly fast though and when it was my turn, I hadn't even read half the descriptions.  Had a mild to medium panic attack and then just did what the Yelpers say and ordered Tesora.  Great choice!

Believe the hype.  The coffee here is fantastic.  Just be prepared for a fast-moving crowd and way too many options!!
author: Heather H.

description: Tried the ever recommended mint mojito iced coffee at this place. The small size was really huge!! I was disappointed though - it was hard to taste the mint till halfway through and I could not taste any tinge of the mojito. It was more like a watered down iced coffee with no bitterness!
author: Annie Z.

description:
came here for the first time. order/cashier area at this place is separate from the seating area. the line here is crazy that it goes out the door. you get what you want first but since they make their coffee fresh so you'll have to wait a while to be the next person to make your order  and then you go to cashier at another section to pay for your coffee. then you have to wait to get your drinks once you pay but you have to remember which workers who was making your drink since there are three workers who makes the drinks.

i had mint mojito ice coffee since it seems to be the popular item here so i wanted to give it a try. this coffee is soooo good, it's light and sweet at the same time. the mint somewhat make it have a slight mint flavor to it. i would definitely get mint mojito and also try other coffee as well when i am in this neighborhood.
author: Julie N.

description:
I love the mint mojito iced coffee.

One of the few places I'll wait in line like a pleb.

I can't handle a large.
author: Casey F.

description:
Philz is a wonderful company but this location sucks!!!!! Perhaps it's because it doesn't have the big store vibe like the mission or at&t park location. I am an avid drinker of Philz but every time I have come here there is 0 culture. The workers are clearly uninterested and have been super rude so many time for i don't know what reason! Not to mention that they've screwed up orders multiple times and given me attitude when I say I wanted one blend in a small and the other large. I've been here so many times, enough to where i know i shouldn't give them my money anymore. I don't know if it's the manager (whom i don't even know who it is) or what it is about this place. The african american girl with the afro especially! She's always gossiping about whom I would assume is one of the co workers? 

Avoid this branch please.
author: Anonymous ?.

description:
I always plan my route along a Philz whenever possible, and this is one of them.  The Ether here is not as great as Berry St. location, but it's still better than anything else. Plenty of seating, and a sandwich bar next door.  

-1 star for dirty furnitures at times.
author: Chi T.

description:
I tried this place wondering if it was worth the hype - and bottom line: IT IS. 
Came here about 1PM on a Wednesday, and yay, NO LINE! I was quite overwhelmed by the selection of coffee - i didn't know what to try - thank got for Yelp for helping me make a decision.  Iced Mojito Mint Coffee - my absolute FAVORITE. It was very sweet, creamy with just a hint of mint. $3 for a medium sized drink - not bad at all! What i like about this location is there is another area where you can sit down, go on your laptop and/or read a book. So convenient - plenty of tables to sit at. 

I'm a fan!
author: Mya M.

description:
Mint mojito iced coffee, you are divine.

You have earned a place in my heart.

Fantastic baristas at this location, very passionate and friendly. Adjacent space with lots of seating (although it is often crowded), very laptop friendly. Parking can be tough since it is located on such a busy street, but I do like this location for its convenience.
author: Ashley K.

description:
Not as friendly as my favorite Philz (Castro) but still the best damn cup of coffee this side of the Mississippi. 

No line, fast service, nice people, perfect coffee.

I found this Philz by mistake as I was on my way to the Castro location.

God bless Philz.
author: Bianca U.

description:
Philz coffee is on another level of coffee. It is just the best thing I have ever tasted. I love the philtered soul medium cream and sugar...heaven. I also love the iced coffee. 
I like this Van Ness location has good bagel creations as well. 

Just like at every Philz I have been to (there should really be more of these around btw) each barista specialty pours your coffee and asks you if there is any way they can make your coffee better. Great service!
author: Daniela J.

description:
God, why the hell you one star-ers care so much about a damn coffee shop? What? Too slow? Other locations are better? Workers look gloomy? JESUS CHRIST. ITS JUST A GODDAMN COFFEE SHOP.

Hotdog joint just need to make good dog. Noodle shop just need to make good noodles. You care so much about little hygiene problem but I doubt you one star lovers ever worked in restaurant or whatever. You eat and don't get sick then you are FINE, you big mouth no nothings.

Paying system bothers you? Philz knows that they take more time brewing coffee so they take the order first. Why don't you get that. Yeh it's a little weird but you take out a star for that? Why, do you live just like the others? It's their own way. Suck it.

Anyway.

1. They brew fine coffee. Overall bitter but in a good way. If you think the bitterness is a sign of over-roasting, sorry you are wrong. I know coffee.

2. They have good selection. It's kind of too much but some coffee lovers go crazy about huge selection of coffee. I've tried few menus as well and so far everything tasted just fine. So yeh.

3. Unique coffee like Mojito. Dude this alone deserves one star. No I don't like mint in my food but this is good.

So I'm fine with 4 stars. If you live around the area try 'em.
author: Brandon K.

description:
Their mojito coffee is really unique and coffee that you should definitely try!
Perhaps if it was little less sweet could be even better-
Has a pretty hipstar atmosphere and good place to chillax although it is little crowded.
author: Danny C.

description: I've heard so much about Philz and how great their mint mojito was, so I was super excited to finally try it. OMG was I disappointed! It tasted like watered down mint water! I had to send it back and had the mocha instead. The mocha was watered down too. My friend had another barista make her mocha and it was fine, but still not the best mocha. I think I got a bad barista! It's so weird that they barely put any ice in an ice drink! It was barely cold! I have to try Philz at a different location!
author: Susan P.

description:
If you're into the flavored coffee drinks, go for the mint mojito and the mocha tesora. However, you can't go wrong with any of the regular coffee choices. When you order, you state your preference for cream and sugar. The barista will have you try the drink before you leave and they will adjust until you are satisfied. 

If you become a regular, it can get expensive, but you can save some money by bringing your own mug/cup and that way you'll be charged for a small.
author: Cindy N.

description:
Five Stars
Ordered a small ice coffee on a hot "summer" day. $3 for an hour worth of caffeinated bliss (but seriously, Philz is my coffee of choice). Not a coffee connoisseur or anything, but Philz is a big deal. Service, superb.

Tips and Fun Facts
They have a separate room for seating/lounging. Dear Philz, can you please open a location in North Beach or FiDi please?
author: Linda X.

description:
I'm from SoCal, so I've tried the Philz in Santa Monica many times and I love it. However, everyone raves about how much better the ones in NorCal are, so I had to stop by when I was in SF. 

I ordered the mint mojito (which is what I usually get in SaMo) to offer myself a comparison of the two. If anything, the one in SF has a tad bit more flavor, but in comparison the Philz in SoCal doesn't suck and they are both pretty much equally as good. 

However, the baristas at this Philz were all pretty rude, and it made me uncomfortable ordering and waiting for my drink. I definitely prefer the Philz in Santa Monica, the atmosphere is 100 times better and the coffee is just as good.
author: Sarah C.

description:
I've never had a coffee taken black that was as smooth, nutty and sweet as the Philtered soul. And, one sip and I could feel the caffeine high already.  The force is strong with this one.
The mocha tesora was perfect. As good if not better than any mocha I've ever had. Very smooth and not overly sweet. Strong caffeine hit with this one too.

I know they don't do the single origin stuff, but the baristas are great, and the coffee is really good.  I've been brewing my own Sooo Good at home and it's nice and smooth with no bitterness.  Love it.
author: Ed L.

description:
I was on my way to city hall when I stumbled upon Philz! I've been deprived of the Mint Mojito for three months. Despite being in a food coma from lunch I couldn't resist the urge!! When I arrived at 1pm on Thursday, there was no line. 
The Mint Mojito is happiness in a cup! It's delicious, refreshing, and it gives the perfect caffeine boost for a long day. Sweet and creamy goodness.

Prices are a little different than the one I usually go to in San Jose ($4 for a large Mint Mojito instead of $5), but that's understandable since it's in San Francisco.
author: Fanny H.

description:
TWO WORDS: MINT MOJITO

all the baristas are super friendly and always check how you would like your drink prepared. they even tell you to take a sip just to make sure you like it.  sweet, creamy, frothy, you name it!  What did we do before Philz?! a great chain for coffee
author: Christina K.

description:
Must visit coffee shop in SF. 

Mint mojito.
Sooo good.
Tesora.

I don't even know why I'm listing drinks I like here as they're all ridic good.

Warning:
They add the cream and sugar for you so taste before taking off
sorta weird ordering style/ payment dealio (not hard but not your standard sbux)
one washroom = waits
author: Sam W.

description: My coffee addict heart is so happy every time I am at a Philz location.  The epic mint mojito is the best creation ever.  The coffee bean is unique and delightful, the refreshing mint leaves your tongue tingling for more, and the sweet and creamy texture just becomes addicting with every sip and savor.  I hope that created a nice coffee visual for you. So what are you waiting for, go out there and experience it for yourself.  This is all fellow yelpers. Cheers:)
author: Angela V.

description:
The following conversation is real and unedited:

Eugene C: Let's go to Philz
Me: What's Philz?
E: Are you serious? You've never been to Philz?
M: No...why is it so special?
E: Because it's the best coffee in the city! You have to try the Mint Mojito Iced Coffee!!
*20 minutes later, at Philz*
M: OMFG this is the best coffee I've everrrrrrrrrrrr had!!! NOMNOMNOM SLURPSLURP... etc.
E: Now bow at my feet
M: Ok.

Mint Mojito Iced Coffee FTW. 
Finite.
author: Christina L.

description:
Please do not forget to try the lentil and potato sambusa. (Similar to indian Samosas). With a nice mint coffee. 

Nice coffee variety
author: Varun S.

description:
Tesora: Seven years in the making and the first blend to ever be created, the tesora is a treasure that consists of the most valuable and complex jewels of coffee. if it is your first time visiting philz coffee, we highly recommend you order our tesora blend. tesora, a grand representation of our coffee and the way coffee should taste!

Amazing. The flavor was rich, bold and refreshing. One of the best cup of coffee I have had in quite some time!

Overall Thoughts

Philz Coffee sure knows what they are doing!
author: Eddie W.

description:
When I'm in town, I love going to Philz. I normally get the philtered soul (which I love), but I recently went and tried something new. I got the mint mojito. Really good! I wasn't expecting it to come iced, but nonetheless, still good. By the end of it though, it was getting too minty and I open my cup to take the mint out to find a bush of mint! So beware people! But can't wait to go back soon. 

Oh and this location has a jointed lounge area. It's nice because you can come and study or sit and talk without having to smell like coffee or hear the coffee grinder go off every 5 seconds.
author: Chris K.

description:
My first time at Philz, I had to try it given the fact that it had been so well recommended. Tried the Tesora light cream and light on the sugar.  I felt like it was a good cup of coffee... However, I'm not sure what kind of sweetener they used but it was overpowering and off putting. I would give it another try and next time just order the coffee black and if in the mood will add sugar in myself.  My wife really enjoys the Iced Mint drink which is very popular.. again I personally think they put too much sugar in that drink as well.   

Overall the experience was great, the barista was very nice and helped me sort out the menu.
author: Frank C.

description: Need I say more, Philz is the best coffee Ive ever had in my life! I never was a coffee snob, but then Philz happened and thats pretty much the end of the story. This location has the best staff ive ever encountered. And ive been to many different locations. There has never been a time when i was in there that ive gotten bad service. Smiles are just everywhere at this place, wish more Philz locations were like this.
author: Angelo C.

description:
The anti- starbucks in that it is extremely s---l---o---wwwww, so make sure you allot yourself at least 10 minutes for your coffee. 

The standout for sure is the Mint Mojito coffee, so be sure to try that and see if you like it. If you do, you will be hooked and won't mind waiting 10 or more minutes for your coffee.

USEFUL TIP: Every month, one coffee flavor pound bag is put on sale for $12, so be sure to keep an eye out and hoard them, especially if they're your favorite flavor!
author: Joshua L.

description:
Been all over the world and met all kinds of girls and asked them out to coffee, but no one and no where has matched the taste of Philz Tantalizing Turkish.

Top 3 reasons I moved back to the Bay Area: Philz, weather, Philz. 

Got that?
author: Joseph M.

description:
They've added another iced drink to their menu: ginger snap.
pretty delicious but I still prefer the mint mojito.

Philz now has a bagel station. They moved all the tables and chairs over to onto the left hand side of this building and call it the "Philz Lounge"
author: Susy C.

description:
I can't get enough of their Feta-stic bagel!  Plus, the bagel guy is super nice.  He was rapping some Nate Dogg this morning.  Gotta love the classics!

And their coffee is just as good as ever! To cut my sugar intake, I now get coffee with vanilla soy milk.  Then I add agave syrup at my office.  Not as sweet as they make it since they use raw organic sugar, but it's just as good.  If I'm craving a cup of coffee to stay awake, Philz is where I go.
author: Vira P.

description: Amazing coffee. If you're looking for something cold, definitely get the Iced Mint Mojito. I also tend to like nutty/chocolate flavors in a roast so the Drinking Water and Philtered Soul are solid options. A go to anytime I'm in town.
author: Aaron C.

description:
I just wanna say that the tesora will change your life.

I'm not a big coffee drinker (cannot tell the different between types of espresso, types of coffees, etc. - I'm that girl who gets caramel macchiatos from Starbucks and it makes me happy), but THE TESORA WILL CHANGE YOUR LIFE. Mint Mojito is good too, BUT THE TESORA WILL CHANGE YOUR LIFE.
author: Chrystal Z.

description:
I prefer my coffee black since I dislike the sweetness (and extra calories) of mixed bevs. One sunny afternoon I decided to splash out, swayed by the buzz surrounding the Mint Mojito Iced Coffee. 

Thumbs up! It was light, refreshing, not too sweet and made with fresh mint. Kudos Philz for a blend well done!

PS: This location has two wings. One for ordering and the other for plugging in ~ with many hushed bodies honed into their screens during my visit.
author: Cathy K.

description:
I love coffee. And this is probably my favorite coffee in the USA. It's always rich and perfect. It's my happiness in a cup. If you are a joyful, coffee-loving person...Philz may change your life. 

I usually go for the Tesora with cream and sugar. On a warmer day (which we've been having a lot in SF recently) I always get the iced mint mojito - it's phenomenal. 

When I'm feeling rich ($18 bucks a bag) I get some Tesora beans to take home and brew for the week too. 

SIDENOTE:
They've also been doing the Philz truck on the marina green on the weekends. It's much closer to my house and has been a fantastic addition to my weekend morning walks with the pup recently.
author: Aggie N.

description:
I like coffee, I like San Francisco, I like a table & chair, I can't be the most difficult customer right? However Uncle Phil here, disappointed me. The dining experience wasn't good: I was pushed around while waiting for my coffee. Uncle Phil didn't really feel as family either: I didn't feel welcome. 
And the coffee? Just such and so.
author: Judith S.

description: C'mon, the coffee is pretty good indeed, but it is not worth a forty minute wait and four dollars.  This is an example of hype exceeding reality.  If you're lucky enough to find a location without a ridiculous line it's with a try, but you'll find there are plenty of adequate two-fitty coffees that are just as good (and, of course, plenty that aren't).
author: Feliz R.

description: With the newer Philz on Golden Gate, I get to the Van Ness location less often.  But made it back to my old stomping grounds the other day and it felt SO GOOD to be home! I love this place and was pleasantly surprised to see the faces of my favorite baristas still there. Nice change from the GG Location which is swamped with Law Students these days. Keep up the good work Philz I love you SO much.
author: Chelsey G.

description:
Come on! How can you go wrong with Philz?! During a weekend trip back home to SF I took a few friends here on consecutive days because 1) Philz is awesome and 2) we were going to eat at Brenda's the next block over. Ever since I had the Iced Mint Mojito a few months back, that's all I've been getting. You get the minty-ness with the fresh mint on top and a nice, cool coffee flavor until the last drop! 

This is one of those things that makes you kind of sad when you're done. Just give me more!!!!! I want mooooore!!! At some point I'll venture to other drinks (I've had a couple others, but am stuck on the mojito) and I'm sure I won't be disappointed! The Mocha Tesora has my name written ALL over it!
author: Aaron Y.

description:
Mint iced mojito! Mint Iced mojito! Mint Iced mojito! Mint Iced Mojito! 
 
Need I say more?  
 
My friend was telling me about this beverage how amazing it is. So one day, my friend and I decided to go try it. Wow, it looked gourmet when they hand the beverage to you without a lid, some mint leaves protruding out from the nice brown mixture. Bold enough of a blend with just the right amount of sweetness (which is a tad), and the fresh taste of mint (not overpowering). Whenever I am on Van ness in SF or Shattuck in Berkeley, I am an addict that I must stop by for a cup regardless of the time of day. I am hooked!
author: Becky Q.

description:
On my last trip to SF I had to try Philz Coffee shop for the first time and so I did and....

Philz Coffee is a cool coffee shop! Very small but not to the point that I can't walk lol. parking can be a pain if none on the streets. I parked at the cvs parking lot on Eddy St it's free for cvs customers lol. Anyway, I ordered the famous Iced Mint Mojito and it was delicious! I've never had anything like it! All my pass mojito's contained alcohol! Lol this was a first coffee mojito! And it was fresh you can really taste the mint and with the coffee it blended in nicely, a very tasty cup of joe. The only negative feedback that I have has to be that I would get pieces of mint leaves in my sip not all the time but sometimes. But other than that the coffee it self was very yummy and unique. I would differently order this again. 

Service was on point! Felt welcomed as soon as I walked in, very friendly. 

When they hand you your drink they ask you to take a sip of your coffee to make sure is what you expected! Ive never seen that. 

If you haven't tried Philz Coffee, you should.
author: Luis G.

description:
Best coffee!
I really love the ambrosia here.
and the veggie bagel sandwich (yummmm).
The people here are so friendly and sweet, they make my day!
Now it's become like a ritual to me, picking up coffee here, go to civic center and sit in the park under the sun...
author: Namrata J.

description: The hot chocolate was delicious and the service was great. Everybody was nice and friendly even though I had no idea where to order or pay ( was tired and not reading the signs) super recommended!
author: Victoria N.

description:
Shh, but I'm actually here while I'm writing this review...

The first coffee shop that I had ever tried in SF was Blue Bottle Coffee. I had raved and raved about it to my friend and he said, "GET OUTTA HERE, PHILZ IS BETTER" so I decided to take him on his word and came here to study with my BF. One word to describe my experience here: ADDIIICTTIIVEEE!

Within a span of a couple hours here, I had already ordered two different types of coffee. Man, my first sip into that Mint Mojito was like no other. The mint mojito is a perfect blend of sweet, mint and coffee. Somehow miraculously, all those flavors blend soooo well with each other. If you're in for something stronger and not so much a "dessert coffee" person in MY words, go for their "Philtered Soul" Definitely a darker blend but still UH-MAZING. I also ended up trying their "Tesora" today but will have to say I like the Philtered Soul better although the Tesora definitely does taste darker. 

I think the best part about this place is that I've never been to a coffee shop where they create such unique coffee drinks. Most places have you standard fraps, mochas, lattes etc. Here, they add your milk and sugar to your choice of coffee blend and somehow they create a love prodigy baby of amazing coffeeness? Too weird? Sorry.

Anyway, they also have a bagel side bar. We tried their lox and bagel and it was definitely pretty good as well. You can study in the separate room they have across the coffee shop (it's separate) where they have several tables and plenty of outlets. Their internet is free too! It's usually pretty crowded so you should come early. 

Best part? I can get a large BOMB-DIGGITY coffee for less than $4. GET OUT OF HERE STARBUCKS. So at the end of the day the question is, "Is Philz REALLY better than Blue Bottle?" Yes and no. They're both different in the types of drinks they have and both have their own uniqueness to them. Both are DEFINITELY a MUST TRY if you're in the city.
author: Vicki L.

description: This locations rocks. I love the location. On a busy street good spot. Philz Coffee should have more locations on a busy street like this one. This location makes me feel like I am at a Starbucks. This location rocks. All Philz Coffee locations rocks. I love Philz Coffee.
author: Isaac H.

description:
Beyondddd excited to finally come here since it's been on my bookmark list for so long! The moment I walked in the barista greeted me with a smile and asked us what we would like. I asked him for his recommendations as this was my first visit. He recommended the mocha tesora, a.k.a. the house blend, for the BF. It was phenomenal-- the coffee was rich and satisfying, not at all bitter or acidic! I had the ecstatic iced coffee, which was awesome too. I love the touch of mint in both, and the fact that we don't have to add the cream/sugar ourselves. It was simply magic!

I read a poster explaining Philz's commitment to being green-- apparently you can bring in your own mug, at any size, and only be charged for the price of a small coffee. At $3.25, what a steal! So bring your own mugs! The atmosphere was great too-- it was nice and quiet, and easy to find places to sit and relax. I wouldn't have minded spending an afternoon in there, but the SF weather was too beautiful to stay indoors. 

Bottom line: it was so good that we came back the next day and each bought a cup to-go for our six hour drive back to LA. :)
author: Allison S.

description:
Apparently I have not been to this location in awhile because I didn't know they expanded. They now have a dedicated study/laptop room!

Tip: This month only (August), Philz has a promo $85 for $100 gift card. Niiiiice.
author: Jess C.

description: I love love love Philz Coffee and my only complaint is that you guys aren't in Arizona! Always great service, amazing coffee, wonderful atmosphere - everything you could desire from a coffee shop. I love that it's always the same... high-quality, friendly service, DELICIOUS COFFEE YO.
author: Sadie L.

description: WORST customer service EVER!!! I went to get coffee with a co-worker, was not greeted, when inquiring about types of coffee and their names was given no help or info. The cashier did not look at me or respond when I greeted her and politely thanked her after ordering. The barista did the same when I thanked him. When my co-worker picked up her drinks not only did he respond nicely but told her have a good day. I WILL NOT BE BACK! The one on Golden Gate has EXCELLENT SERVICE, indiscriminate service, and great coffee! Van Ness location could use some tips on basic customer Svc skills. It's an unfortunate situation when you find yourself in a coffee shop for a pick me up and instead are dragged down by lifeless, RUDE, baristas who clearly do NOT enjoy people. You'll find me at the GOLDEN GATE LOCATION where they enjoy their jobs and take pride in the quality of the product they serve!
author: T M.

description:
Philz just mailed me a $5 gift card in good faith.

Any business that wants to keep it's customers happy is a business worth visiting again.

I look foward to being able to give the 5th star next time I go. 

Thanx Philz!
author: Chastity C.

description:
I tried mint mojito ice coffee. it is d real deal! You can really taste the minty flavor and a nice brewed coffee at the same time :) 
it's kinda pricey but totally worth it!
i definitely will come back and its only 2 blocks away from my school! i was fully satisfied!
author: Miss G.

description:
How do you do it?

That's what my friends keep asking me..

I go to school full-time, I work full-time, I'm a weekend warrior (literally), find the time to balance a relationship with my girlfriend of 3 years, and furthermore, still make "me" time to hit the gym for at least 2 hours, three to four times a week. And of course, stay Yelpin' (thanks for reminding me, Jen C.)

So, how DO I do it?

Three simple things:
1) Good time management.
2) Self-motivation.
3) A strong cup of Joe.. from Philz.

Sorry Starbucks. It's not you, it's me.. and Philz.. (well, I guess it is you then).
author: Albert L.

description: There's really only so many ways one can imagine a cup of very freshly brewed coffee, and a nice branch of mint leaves mingling into an elegant cup of Mint Mojito Ice Coffee. It was a pleasant surprise. Plus the $1 after hour ham and cheese croissant nicely toasted, there's no better SF afternoon.
author: Richard Y.

description: This is the first coffee place that wowed me in San Fran . Mint mojito coffee !! That's all I have to say.  Way better than Starbucks and  I'm not an avid coffee drinker but whenever I pass by it's a must get.
author: Sophie H.

description: I'm a big coffee drinker and although I'm a bigger fan of the little mom and pop shops in SF for coffee, i had to see what Philz was all about. I'm not sure what the name of my drink was but it was a gingerbread cinnamon iced tea latte of some sort. Whatever the name was, it was great! I actually ordered it one more time before leaving the city! Now I need to find something like it in LA. Challenge accepted!
author: Angelie D.

description:
I always get TWO drinks here.

One Mint Mojito.
This is what you should drink by default when you come in to Philz. 
It activates your senses.

Then a cup of Philtered Soul..

Mmm yeaaaaaaaaa...
author: Ji K.

description:
I love Philz and prefer going to one over Starbucks, so long as it's reasonably closer. I live in Sunnyvale, and frequent the Cupertino location, which almost always has a line out the door. Nonetheless, the service is friendly and drinks are almost always perfect. 

A friend and I decided to pop in this Philz on our walk to Brenda's French Soul Food one Saturday afternoon. This location is split into two parts, one with just tables and seats, and another with the cashier, pastries, counter, and a table and two chairs. I was surprised to see that there wasn't a line, and only 4 or 5 other customers waiting for their drinks. When I walked up to the counter, I almost thought I had walked up to the wrong one because the barista didn't say anything to me. Instead, she just ignored me and started fixing her hair - not that I have anything against that, I don`t want hair in my drinks, but she could have at least acknowledged me, or said that she would be right with me. 

Anyhow, after a minute of uncomfortable silence as I waited for her to finish with her hair, I ordered my drink [small Mint Mojito] to the inexplicably grumpy barista, and went to pay at the cashier - who was a bit more friendly. Then I headed to the restroom. After coming out, two people were getting their drinks. Supposedly, they had ordered two large Mint Mojitos, but the barista made one large and one small. During the confusion, I mentioned that I had ordered a small, and while the barista looked at me, they all ignored me. The couple then decided it was okay and left. With what I`m sure was my drink, because I ended up sitting down with my friend afterwards and waiting for another 5-10 minutes, and getting nothing.

Finally, the cashier came over to the counter and realized that we were staring in her direction. She asked if I was waiting for something, so I told her my order, and she made it for me. While the barista I ordered the drink with was off doing nothing. And no one even offered to upgrade it to a large for the trouble, which is what they would have done at Cupertino. The drink itself was okay. But 50% of the cup was crammed with mint leaves, and 25% of the remaining space was ice! It was like they were trying to get rid of all the mint leaves before they went bad or something. I was surprised to see that there was no line, and so few customers - except for the people in the other section who were studying and using WIFI - in an SF location on a Saturday afternoon, but now I`m not surprised.
author: Elizabeth H.

description:
Mint Mojito Iced Coffee. That is all that needs to be said. I crave this coffee like 3 times a day. They must have filled it with crack because it is out of this world good. I didn't realize coffee could be so creative and delicious until I ventured over to Philz. 
The lines are insanely long always for all of the Philz locations (for good reason) and there are times when they have run out of the Mint Mojito Iced Coffee (completely devastated). I hear their coffees are super solid and have a huge following as well. Someone I know mailed a few bags of coffee all the way east because the person in the east loves Philz just that much. If you have not tried out Philz, you are completely missing out.
author: Dan M.

description:
Mint mojito iced coffee, mmmm. It's pricey at $5 (large) a pop. But it's exquisite. I'm just glad I don't get to frequent Philz, because I'd be broke otherwise. Oh, wait, I'm broke anyway. Oops.

This location is a bit funky in that you go in and kind of line up to order. I say kind of because it really looks more like a crowd of people in the narrow space between the order/ pick up counter and the cashier counter. Despite the remote semblance of a line, you have to ask people every time, "Are you in line?" And after you finally order at the counter, you walk away and wait for your order to be called out. It would be perfectly fine if each barista made one drink at a time. But no... They take a few orders and make drinks in batches. And they don't take down your name, so the mere calling-out of drink names quite puzzles me. It's amazing that people are still willing to "line up" for such seeming disorganization. It's amazing that I am still willing to do so, too. Most importantly, it's amazing that Philz somehow makes it work, despite the hundreds of spills that must happen every day because people have to squeeze by each other to get to the counter to pay.

But it's okay. Mint mojito iced coffee, mmmm.
author: Wendy C.

description:
Love Love Love.

Great coffee, great service. :)

The line up is worth the wait. I am going to be more adventurous next time I am in town and try something new.
author: Robin D.

description: Mocha Tesora is the way to go! Their pastries are pretty standard. The coffee makers were pleasant and patient when we went but the cashier was kinda snobbish for some reason.
author: Alex D.

description: Can't get enough of the mint mojito... However, be warned that they do use heavy whipping cream, so for all of you who are lactose intolerant, I highly recommend substituting Soymilk (vanilla) for that! It will save your stomach later on :)
author: Jessica X.

description: Everyone told me to get the mint mojito hot.. and I did.  I thought it was pretty watered down although I did taste notes of mint in the coffee.  I'm am no coffee connoisseur in any way bc I rarely drink coffee actually, but I felt a weird snobby vibe when I walked in here.  Ok, so I don't know what I should order or what I like, but I'm here and open to it... isn't that enough?!  I will say, however, their music was pretty darn awesome!  I know I gotta give it another shot bc even my close friends rave about Philz!
author: Christine C.

description: Had my first Philz experience today and it definitely lived up to the hype. I ordered the mocha tesura and absolutely loved it. The chocolate tasted really rich but not overly sweet and the coffee is nutty, making for a great mocha. The service here is awesome as well, the baristas have you try the coffee when they hand it to you so they can adjust your order if needed. Can't wait to come back for the iced mint mojito drink!
author: Allison D.

description:
One of their smallest locations in SF but the baristas are probably the fastest.  They have your usual pastries and breakfast burritos here.  They also have a dedicated bagel station which is pretty awesome.  The seating area is across the hall in a different room which is why the coffee area is so small.

I still get my tongue burnt every time the baristas ask me "taste it and tell me if it is OK".  I'll learn sooner or later...
author: Danny P.

description: Great service! I wasn't sure exactly how I wanted my ecstasy ice coffee and upon request the barista fixed it up to extra sweet & creamy.
author: Dru C.

description:
SO GOOD.

The first time I had Philz Coffee, I was blown away at the fact that MINT and COFFEE, the two things I had never imagined together, could taste SO GOOD.

I had Philz every chance I can for like a month after that. Of course, the novelty of the taste wore off b/c I knew what it tasted like, but I still enjoy a cup whenever I'm around Shattuck.

Price is reasonable at $5 for a large size. I think they have a dollar or 50 cents off if you bring your own cup. Very eco friendly of them... It's just that I forget to bring my cup.

Some baristas can be cranky. The manager looking baristas are very nice and accommodating though. 

They will make the coffee, ask you to taste it to see if it's just right for you. If it needs more sweet or creamy, you let them know and they make it right, no problem.

You stand in line to order, go to another register to pay, come back to the waiting area and wait until the barista you ordered from calls out your drink. I thought this was a little confusing at first.
author: Kristina K.

description:
Of course all Philz locations taste the same because they use the same beans. So this review is for customer service. 

Coffee is suppose to make u happy. 
Drinking coffee makes me happy, but purchasing my coffee from this location doesn't. 

These people have no emotions!!! Why! 
I went in on International Happiness Day, and they were not happy at all. 

Be happy! Smile at customers, greet them! geez.
author: Vee 2.

description:
Alright let's face it guys, if everyone only orders their Mint Mojito and raves about it, how the heck do we know how their rest of the menu is like?? I like to be the rebel and try new things, I sacrificed my first time with Philz by ordering half Philtered Soul (Light Roast with a hint of Caramel and Hazelnut) and half Its So Good (Light Roast w/ a dash of Chocolate). That's right guys, you can mix your own drink on their menu! 

This is my experience:
First sip...a bit watered down....not enough flavor
Second sip....oh, it gets better as you drink more of it
Half way through....I CAN'T PUT DOWN THE CUP!
All gone.....[turned the cup upside down] NOOOOOOO, I WANT MORE!!!!!
author: Elaine Y.

description:
4 Stars for Philz ! Sorry, you don't get 5 stars because the Mint Mojito Iced Coffee is not strong enough :)

Coming from a vietnamese iced coffee feen explorer like myself, I always tend to expect super strong ice coffee flavors. Yes, yes, I know, this is NOT vietnamese iced coffee. But anyways, this blend inside this crazy Mint Mojito Iced Coffee is perfectly balanced. Not too bland, not too sweet, not too strong, not too bitter AND with a touch of MINT leaves mixed inside. Ahhh, Just right. Even a non coffee drinker will enjoy this cool sip of iced coffee.

PROS:: There is a chill area to sit down next door to enjoy your coffee and kick back and relax. I havn't tried any other flavors yet, but the Mint Mojito Iced Coffee is what you should first try here since the hype is out of control. 

CONS:: Long lines, no name for your drink so remember what you ordered and hope they do too. Parking can be horrible on Van Ness St, but there's parking right in front if you're lucky. The large cup for $4.50 seems smaller than a star bucks size.. hmmm.. 

Oh Philz Coffee you got me hooked and found my San Diego K Sandwiches Viet Iced Coffee replacement of ICED MINT MOJITO COFFEE for SAN FRANCISCO BABY!!!
author: Christopher J.

description:
I had my first cup of Philz at a Startup Grind, and have been a fan ever since. The Tesoro is my favorite - rich, creamy, and super tasty.

The only thing I'm confused by is the shop. Phil himself says that the shop is "an experience" but to me it's just a coffee shop. Not sure where the magic is, other than the coffee. 

I hope one of these opens up in San Leandro. Excellent brew!
author: Kevin K.

description:
I have to admit, if I was in San Francisco a lot more, I would convert from Starbucks to Philz as my coffee spot.  

The atmosphere here is a typical coffee shop, with the main seating in a separate room, but it's as "coffee shop" as it can get, with the different aromatic smells of their coffee tingling your senses. 

The service here has ALWAYS been friendly and excellent for me, and the barista's always remember their customers which makes this place feel super homey.  

The Mint Mojito Iced Coffee is whats always pulling me in, with real mint leaves on the bottom of the cup! WOW! 

IF you love coffee, then this is one place you must stop by!
author: Kevin D.

description:
Dear Philz Coffee,

May your business live long and prosper! *vulcan salute*

The extra star is given not for their coffee, but for their personal customer service, they DO read your Yelp reviews!

I was so ecstatic after receiving their message on Yelp that I ranted about them on TWO other social media platforms..yeah you guessed it...BOOKFACE & TWEETER.  I can't wait to use the giftcard they sent me! 

Sincerely,

Your newest fan.

P.S. daaamn, flying my giftcard firstclass? you classy, Philz, you classy.
author: Bernice C.

description:
I'm a Jacob's gal. What are you?

Some people think that the overly caffeinated servers are too much, but I like them just fine.  After trekking through the good ol' Tenderloin to get here, it's nice to be greeted with a big smile and friendly chit chat.  

Every cup is brewed to order and they add the sugar and cream for you.  If you tell them you like it "regular" it'll be fairly rich. They use regular cream (not half and half) by default which makes it taste extra magical, in my opinion.  I used to love taking my Jacob's this way until I spent four month drinking itty bitty espressos in Italy.  Now my regular is a little too rich for my taste, so I'll adjust my order next time I drop by.

I feel like San Franciscans like to debate over which cafe makes the best cup of coffee and they are loyal to their favorites. Philz (and Jacob's Wonderbrew) fo' life!
author: Jenn C.

description:
I didn't think I could fall in love again - just did.
Flat out a great coffee spot - names are funky but the taste is glorious.
Worth the darn walk my colleague took me out on to experience this marvelous great tasting coffee.
I will come back time and time again - unless they get big (Starbux ehem)
author: Al S.

description: First time ever to experience bad customer service from this location! Asked how sweet my mojito would be with alternative sweeteners and barista shrugged her shoulders lol. So rude to the point of it being comical. Officially my last visit to this location
author: Charmian D.

description:
I'm not a huge coffee fan but I always get the mint mojito when I go up to SF. It's a little heavy on the ice, and I usually get light cream and sugar, but I can see why everyone is such a fan. 

Good vibe for a coffee shop, with good service. The wait always takes a while though, so you can get order ahead of time on your phone through the app and shave a few minutes off your wait if you time it right. 

If you're a real coffee snob (like one of my friends) and just get the plain black coffees, I'm not sure the quality of the coffee beans, etc. stack up, but from my understanding, it's more about the specialties like the mocha tesora and mint mojito anyway. Regardless, it's worth trying it out if you're in the area, as Philz definitely lives up to its reputation.
author: Jonathan K.

description:
Like the blockbuster movie you've been waiting to see since it was announced two years ago, this one didn't live up to expectations.

Meh coffee.

I'll leave it there and suggest you check out my list of what I do think are the best coffee spots I've been to...
author: Jeremy M.

description:
I typically come to this Philz after filling my tummy with a large delicious bowl of pho at Them Ky. It is so conveniently located that I often stick around to do my work and use the space as a home office for the rest of the day. In addition to their reliable free wifi, their coffee is the best in the City and their customer service never fails. The place is managed by the relative of Phil Jaber, the founder of Philz, and their list of coffee and pastries is the same as all other locations. The primary difference that makes this particular store unique is the new but smaller and cleaner facility. The café also attracts the on-the-go professional crowd with which resulted in a more transient store culture than their 24th Street hangout.

There are three things to like and remember about Philz: Freshness, customization, and personalization. They get new beans once or twice a week and each cup is made to order by hand. They use cardamom and mint leafs as baseline enhancers for taste and presentation, and it is up to the customers to determine how dark, strong, and sweet they want it to be. Personally, I don't buy into their motto of "one cup at a time" since I often sit through multiple cups with each visit. For $3.50, a large cup can be had and I'm typically asked to taste it on the spot with offers for a new cup in case it wasn't satisfactory.

Their staff is highly knowledgeable about every bean in store and the process with which to make a good drip. As for me, I tend to stick to Tesora (medium roast) as the go-to cup and if I need something stronger I would opt for the Arabic or Tantalizing Turkish. Lately I've been enjoying their Either (dark roast) and I typically take it with a splash of vanilla soymilk and three bags of Splenda. I've also tried their Mocha Tesora but thought the chocolate was sweet but not dark enough to keep me intrigued. This is how I like my coffee, strong and dark, since I like the sensation of using my computer with hands that tremble. Somehow that plays a part in easing my stress.

In all, Philz regardless of the location is a special place that brings it. I'm still a doubter about their pastries but their coffee is 5 plus spectacular stars all the way.
author: Daniel L.

description: Pretty standard Philz. No seating in Philz itself - you have to go over to the cafe next door. Drink was delicious, employees were extremely friendly, but -1 star because the cafe seating area closes at 7:30pm and Philz closes at 8. Nitpicky but important when you look for a coffee shop to work at :).
author: Derek R.

description:
Came in on a Sunday morning needing caffeine after a long Saturday night.

I asked the (very friendly) barista to choose for me since everything was still pretty hazy.

Walked out with a delicious, delicious mocha.

Thanks Philz!
author: Teiki K.

description:
Philz Coffee; the story here (and I'm sure every other of the 1 million reviewers have said this) is each cup is individually brewed.  Hooray for that?  As a small-time coffee drinker, do I really know the difference?  No.  But I can tell the difference between single malt and a blended whiskey... at least that's how I relate the two.

Upon entering, there's a hoard of people who I assume know the drill.  But there is the cash register immediately in front of you, some baristas brewing up the coffee, and a bagel monger at a completely different kiosk.  First instinct, cashier.  WRONG.  First put in your order with Ms. Bagel if you're hungry, then make your way up to the brewers, pick from a list of somewhere around two dozen coffees of names that may or may not correlate to the type of coffee you're getting, then go to the cashier and pay on an honor system.  Start at the cashier, and he berates you for not knowing how things work in "his" shop.  Once I figured out the process, I ordered the iced mint mojito, because it was one of the few things whose name was actually the drink.  It was good, if I went back, I'd probably order the same thing... and this time in the right order.
author: Sean L.

description:
Wait, what just happened here?

I was in SF for the weekend and trying Philz Coffee was on my to-do list above Painted Ladies, Haight-Ashbury, Golden Gate Bridge...

And when I finally arrived at Philz and ordered the Mint Mojito Iced Coffee and then received my order and then held that signature brown cup in my hand and sipped it...I was disappointed. My drink had absolutely no mint flavor and although I asked for slightly sweet, it seemed sweet-less. My friend who got the mint mojito in its regular form also couldn't taste the mint flavor nor was hers any sweet as well.

I'm trying to do detective work to figure this out. Did the barista not make our drinks correctly? Was he new and didn't know what he was doing? Was it the hype that made it so anti-climatic? Did I order the wrong thing? Am I being a hater? I don't know because I wanted to like Philz. No, I wanted to LOVE it. And I'm definitely not picky with coffee, if anything I'm a coffee slut so it is all too confusing. Regardless, the only way this mystery will be solved is for me to try it again, and hopefully soon.
author: Jaimie L.

description: I love a good coffee and Phillz doesn't disappoint. I tried the iced mint mojito coffee with soy. A word of warning, it has 2 tablespoons of sugar, regardless of the size you order!! I ended up halving the sugar and it still tasted delicious. You don't need that much sugar in a coffee. I'll definitely be back!
author: Nikita K.

description: Chamomile latte with honey is a must. Consider this as a non caffeinated beverage. My favorite go to drink during pregnancy!
author: Sophia N.

description: Best drip coffee in town. Lines can be long, but definitely worth it. Staff is always very friendly.
author: Brenden K.

description: The coffee was fantastic but our experience was dulled by a patronizing barista.
author: Joey C.

description:
Okay...I just finished a LARGE bowl of Pho Ga the other day.
So...I ran into Philz Coffee STAT
Order up...they ran out of hazelnut syrup.

WTF?
No Philtered Soul?
Apparently...

The cute asian barista suggested a Mocha Tesora.
She must have read my mind!
That's my second favorite coffee flava...

BTW...they were playing retro 70s/80s R&B.
"In My House" by the Mary Jane Girls
...big smile!
author: Derek N.

description: I highly recommend the mint mojito, iced. There coffee is strong, freshly grinded, and dripped. I can appreciate a good cup of Joe especially since they put so much love into it. It's a good change up from the typical Starbucks... Not too sweet, just right
author: Reena R.

description: Best coffee place!!! Their mojitos are to die for....They are always super cool, coffee made to order, their food items are great as well. A good way to make your morning or afternoon a great one!
author: Natalya V.

description:
customer service here is so poor. 
Not only my barista forgot my order, but she gave me attitude about it. She told me "its okay. It's only going to take me 5 seconds to make yours." She did not apologize when I waited for a good 7-10 mins for my drink. 
However I give it two stars because I absolutely lovethe Iced Mint Mojito Coffee.
author: Emily H.

description: They have a new place on Castro Street near 18th. The place is crowded and the coffee and tea are excellent. Great Staff.
author: Richard M.

description:
"Attention all units; please respond to a 'Code-33' inside a Philz's coffee shop on Van Ness and Turk!" 

"WTF!?!"

In the basic police code, "Code-33" means emergency in the air and sky-units must respond. But Philz is located on the busy streets of Van Ness Ave. Unless you're in a helicopter with miliitary personnels, there are no sight of endangerment happening in the Bay Area. "We hope not!" 

But my emergency-stop did land me at the newest Philz for the "Code 33" coffee drink. For $4.00, I get one of the strongest and highly-octane coffee drink the coffee shop has to offer in a small 12 ounce cup. The workers will guarantee that I'll be dancing all night on Halloween. Or in my case, "dancing dangerously in the air".

A potent coffee beverage that is most definitely right up my alley, despite my decrease in caffeine-intake within recent months. But unfortunately, my busy Halloween-night for the last 12 years has been a working night. This strong drink absolutely has done its job in keeping me up for a long and busy night.

All coffees are manually dripped, so you know you'll definitely get a fresh cup of coffee. After reading some of the reviews from this Philz's location, one Yelper suggested- Philz should use Clover milk instead of Berkeley Farms like both Blue Bottle and Ritual use. I absolutely agree. 

This Philz's location is not a big location compare to the others. Just get your cup of Joe from here- leave and sip with a happy-face!!
author: Matt G.

description:
Not to upset all the other yelpers out there but I personally did not like the mint mojito... I gave it a shot but I'm not too big of a fan with minty drinks so I guess it was a no-go for me. 
On the other hand, their gingersnap iced coffee is SO GOOD. If you're like me and don't like minty drinks, definitely give this a try because I loved it. You definitely have to get a large size to be completely satisfied with the drink but it's worth it if you're not from around here. Never had anything like it.
author: Chie T.

description: Delicious and unique tasting Chai Tea! The line is usually long so be prepared for a slight wait. Definitely a place to visit if you are taking a trip to San Francisco!
author: Quintin W.

description: This review is for the mint mojito they serve. Basically, if you have not had one because you've been hiding under a rock for the past 3 years, you're missing out in life. Its that simple! Best tasting coffee I have ever had. Not to mention they get me wired (must drink it before 12pm) or it keeps me up all night!!!
author: Margarita M.

description:
This is really good coffee. No joke.  And I mostly drink decaf. 

Forget Blue Bottle or Ritual.  La Boulange coffee tastes like dishwater swill and is not even hot most of the time.  

But Phillz..  Oh yes.  You don't even need sugar because the flavors are so complex and delicious.
author: M S.

description: I love Philz. I used to be a person who would brew their on coffee at home ( sometimes I still do). But, Philtered Soul Coffee and Mint Iced coffee are my new before work routine. It's always a little bit of a hassle to get in and out quickly in the morning rush, but as a coffee addict himself, I can understand this. Its worth the wait.
author: Brian K.

description: Friendly and fast service. I've heard a ton of good things about their creamy & sweetened mint mojito. It certainly lived up to its name, but was on the heavier side for me since I don't drink coffee regularly. I would recommend.
author: Wesley C.

description:
I've been to many Philz locations except this one so I finally got to check it out the other day. The baristas always know what to suggest and how to brew a quality cup of coffee.

The place to order coffee and the table areas are in 2 different rooms. It was really quiet when we got to the table area so we were whispering to keep the peace. We brought in yummy sandwiches from Saigon Sandwich a few blocks away.

It looked like a nice place to study--lots of laptoppers.
author: Marlon T.

description: Yum yum yum!!! Such a great place for coffee!!! Everyone is very friendly and there lots of different options to choose from! My absolute favorite is the ginger snap!!!!! Just so damn good and if you want to know a secret get the potato samosa!!!! Talk about a coffee break!!! A quick trip to heaven is more like it!!!
author: Brianna L.

description:
They have great service and a good reputation, but none of the five coffees I have tried have tasted any different from each other or any less like gasoline.

I'm over it, Philz.
author: Sam D.

description:
I am a loyal Blue Bottle Coffee fan, but i have got to say this place has won me over.
