I came here for the first time after hearing so many good things about this place. I opted for the Philtered Soul. It was great! Service is excellent and they have you try your drink right when they give it to you so that they can make any adjustments.

Love Love everything about this place. Service, selection, and atmosphere. I will be back for sure!!!!
author: Phuong K.

description:
This was my first time at Philz Coffee.  I stopped here shortly before meeting one of my friends for lunch on our overnight stay in San Francisco.

Philz is a small cafe, and I have to admit the setup was a bit different so I was confused as to how things worked at first.  Like typical places you make your order first, but unlike typical places, you don't pay at the same place you order. Instead, that is reserved for a counter that sits across from the coffee bar.  My barista was very helpful on her recommendations and descriptions of the beans and drinks.

Also a bit confusing, I found that a lot of people were picking up their orders before me, even if I had ordered before they even stepped into the store.  I had to wait past 7 people who ordered after me before I got my drink, but they had pretty much ordered the same thing that I ordered. 

Based on reviews, I got the Philtered soul for myself and a Mint mojito for my wife.  She had a headache and I thought that it would be refreshing for her.  I have to admit, I really liked the Mint Mojito much more than the Philtered soul and if I find myself at Philz again, I may just order that.  Additionally, I purchased two bags of whole bean coffee, the Jack and the Tesora.  I have yet to appropriately taste test these coffees at home against the other coffees I purchased on my trip, but I will get to it soon.
author: Katherine L.

description:
There is always a big line everytime I show up but so far I've been coming here almost 3times in a row this week and its a nice place to get a cup of coffee  if your welling  to stand in line. This is the second time I get asked for change when I step out of there door step by some teen or an old man that always hangs around there. There's a better place and bigger place then this location. 

Staff there seem friendly even when there is lots of people so they are A O-K
author: Anthony G.

description: Who doesn't love Philz Coffee? Whenever I need to wake up from work, this is the place I go. The main drink I get here is the Philtered Soul (medium roast with hazelnut), plain soy milk and two packets of stevia. It wakes me up for the rest of the day and it tastes so good. I usually get a lot of anxiety when drinking a lot of caffeine, but I take the risk when it comes to Philz. The staff there is also very friendly and helpful. You need to try Philz if you haven't already!
author: Vivian L.

description:
They have a separate lounge with ample seating across the way which is super convenient. We didn't actually go in there, as we chose to have our drinks outside. Downside though,  there's no outdoor seating here. 

Another downside, this place is pricey! $3.00 for a Small Chai Tea? That's pretty ridiculous!

What's even more ridiculous?
The chai tea had so much grainy bits in the bottom of the cup that left a horrible taste in my mouth. Ok, a little but would be fine, but this was about 10 - 15% of the cup! I had to take a swig of my boyfriend's coffee to rinse the grit out of my mouth. Not cool! 

When I ordered, the barista was super nice though (scruffy guy with a beanie who looked a lot like one of the guys from Bear in Heaven). I kept the disappointing chai to myself though as I was in a meeting, so I'm not sure if they could have or would have done something to correct it.
author: Rebecca G.

description:
if you want simple drip coffee, this place is NOT for you. 
I heard philz was better than blue bottle, so I was excited to try their coffee. 
I ordered the so good drip coffee and I found it to be medicinal and bitter.

Everyone raves about their mint mojito, however I don't usually take my coffee with cream or any dairy, so I don't know if I would go out of my way to try it.
author: Amy K.

description:
I have heard so many great things about Philz, but I actually was left quite unimpressed. I ordered everyone's favorite- the mint mojito- and it was cold and not even minty.
I have heard from friends though, that the Philz on Van Ness is actually quite bad in comparison to the other Philz, which have much better drinks. A friend told me that the drinks here are more "dull" and not as flavorful, which could account for my bad experience.
I want to try another Philz soon to see what everyone is talking about!
author: Azinda M.

description: That mint mojito latte! Refreshing and tasty. Cafe next door with free wifi.
author: Irina P.

description:
I'm a coffee pleb.  I don't understand words like "smoky" except in reference to actual smoke, "full-bodied" unless you're trying to be nice about a fat girl, and "majestic" unless you're talking about an eagle soaring over the Grand Canyon while firing an M-16.

Nevertheless, even the least perceptive of man children can tell the difference between a fast car and a slow car, or a good blowjob and a bad blowjob.  Philz coffee is a fast car.  It is a good blowjob.

The happiest I've ever been was double-fisting two Philtered Souls while waiting for a cab to Chinatown.  The unhappiest I've ever been was 10 minutes later when I came hauntingly close to shitting my pants in the cab.
author: Kevin C.

description: Amazing coffee. Whenever you have time for a good cup of Joe, then go to Philz, it is rewarding. Not many things in life are worth being in line for, or waiting. Philz is worth it!
author: Joseph H.

description:
PHILZ!!!

ahhh. I swear, I am becoming a huge coffee addict.  I don't necessarily have to drink it everyday ( i guess im not really in the working life yet), but I definitely enjoy coming here every now and then.  Philz is simply on the top of my list, followed by Blue Bottle.  And if you have not have either one, don't talk to me until you try them! Justtttt kidding.

You simply have not been drinking the right coffee..until Philz.  My very first visit, I had The New Manhattan, which was a light roast blend coupled with an earthy aroma and a wine-like taste.  I absolutely enjoyed this and fell in love the first time I had it.

Julie's Ultimate is also a must try.  The dark blend is complexly smooth and satisfying with floral highlights.  It awakens you up and adds a bit of floral-ness.  

Their mint mojito iced coffee is also quite famous! If you're in the mood for an iced coffee, definitely check this one out! Refreshing, flavorful, but it does not neglect the coffee taste.  

So glad I have found you Philz! The staff here are simply amazing, accommodating, and friendly.  Your coffee never goes wrong here.  

I will drive out to the city anyday...just for Philz :)
author: Stephy L.

description:
HO-LY-SH*!

While on my recent visit to SF my buddy's new girlfriend introduced us to the mint mojito ice coffee. THIS THING IS INCREDIBLE. I already love iced coffee and I'm not the type that usually deviates from a plain old cup of light roast, but this drink completely blew me out of the water. It's unique, surprising, and most importantly, insanely delicious. And it's one of the most refreshing drinks I've ever had. Almost 1/3 of the cup is stuffed with fresh mint that they pick off of the stem right in front of you.

Needless to say, his new girlfriend is now my favorite girlfriend.

I'd now include a stop at Philz as an absolute necessity the next time I'm even near SF.
author: Al H.

description:
I am anti-Starbucks as a rule. Not that I don't love a caramel frapp as much as the next gal but I really feel strongly about giving to small business. So when we were walking from the parking garage back to the Hayes district and stumbled upon this place I was excited.  My fellow yelpers seem to like it and I followed their suggestion and got the mint mojito iced coffee and it was divine. Creamy, sweet, and refreshingly minty without being too sweet minty. My wife got a gingerbread iced as well. She said it was spicy in all the right ways. 

My only complaint was that as someone who had never been there the come here order coffee, go pay over there, come back here for your coffee had me a little confused. One of the patrons was nice enough to point me in the right direction so that quickly resolved itself. 

Would I come here again, yes! In fact I can't wait to try some of the other flavors.
author: Angela C.

description: First visit!  Delish! The Mint mojito ice coffee is so refreshing, light minty and sweet creamy.  The Silken Splendor is medium roast and smooth black (no cream and sugar). Perfect temperature for immediate consumption.
author: Lorene P.

description: BEST coffee in SF. Each cup is handbrewed. Be sure to get a mint in it! When it's hot, the mojito coffee is the best refreshing pick me up there is!
author: Leah B.

description: I'm not a huge coffee drinker, but this place is AWESOME. I had the Soooo Good light roast coffee, and lemme tell ya, it was SOOOOO GOOD!!!! If you're walking around San Fran, please check this place out!!
author: Hannah P.

description:
This is my 2:30 groggy feeling remedy. The people there are friendly and the mint mojito iced coffee is fantastic. 
I recommend this place to my coworkers all the time. The only catch is that a large is $5... Worth it, but I can't go everyday.
author: Ezra T.

description: Smaller than the Berkeley one but still very delicious. The service was very good and Philz is just amazing.
author: Jennifer C.

description: A local told me to try this place so as a coffee obsessed person I had to. I got the mocha tesora, very sweet, I never sweeten my coffee so it wasn't for me, but I imagine if you like mocha normally then you will probably like this. Also, for some reason it wasn't hot. Now... My husband got this iced mint mojoito coffee that actually had mint sprigs in it, sounded like it was going to be horrible but I was surprised, it was amazing and refreshing! Don't let the wacky sounding flavors deter you, I think you'll be pleasantly surprised that you may like it. Very unique concept that I can't imagine being able to try anywhere else. I read an article that says they are the coffee that fuels Facebook, kinda cool.
author: Amandaa S.

description:
mint mojito FTW. i can't gush enough about my favorite coffee spot ever. check out their new location in the castro-- cool spot and same fun loving people! i've never ordered anything i didn't like. they take such pride in making your drink(s) perfect. read all the other reviews-- there really isn't any need to be redundant. i've had many coffees in many places, but this place is the best by far! beats blue bottle, albeit SLIGHTLY. i'm not really enthused about their santa monica location because philz is close to my sf native heart, but that's aiiiight i guess. i'm not hating.

#teamphilz
author: Vanessa D.

description:
This place was recommended to me because I was volunteering at the Free Farm around the corner. I wanted a hot coffee, but I went with the iced coffee because it was an unusually hot day in the city and I was pleasantly surprised!

So good! Paired my small iced coffee with some vanilla soy milk and one sugar and I was good to go.

Highly recommended. Even though it was busy the staff were quick, friendly, and very helpful!
author: Jennifer S. C.

description: Like this place so much more than Blue Bottle.
author: Ellen C.

description: When I got a new job and found out there was a Philz a few minutes away it became my go to place to treat myself when I was having  a rough day.  i still treat myself with a nice cup of coffee, but tend to stay clear of here since other great places have opened up, including another Philz.  the space is a bit weird and cramped and I always feel like I am standing in someone's way no matter where i stand.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
This one's a pretty roomy location. It's split between two stores, one side is your coffee shop and the other side is your study room/lounge area. It's the one that has most seats available thus far (I've only been to the Berkeley and San Jose locations).

I came here before hitting up Aids Walk volunteering on a Sunday morning. Opening at 6:30am, got in there at like 6:20am. Lots of cops seem to love the coffee here too. I saw them walking in with faces like this :| and then after their first few sips, their faces became this :D

I tried the Ambrosia Coffee of Gods this time. Sounded like a BOSS. It's a bit on the more bitter side, its description was "nutty". Very aromatic. Had to ask the girl who made my coffee to add more milk. I guess for everyone had different preferences in brewed coffee so it's better to start out with small amounts of milk/sugar and then add on. Don't be afraid to let them know how you want to customize your coffee.  Matter of fact, within an hour, I was so hyped up and in such a good mood, I was sure I felt damn godly!

Cute names for their coffee, I'll definitely try another when I need to feel like Hercules again.
author: Connie C.

description:
Mint Mojito Ice Coffee!!!

But all there other coffees are just as good!! I love this coffee joint!! Service is super nice and fast!
author: Joan T.

description:
On a cold day, Jarrett C and I met up and came here for some coffee. Little did I know that this place would be my new favorite local coffee stop. 

Philz coffee has an interesting setup at this location. On one side, its the coffee area and restroom, while on the other side, it is the Philz lounge area.

I'm not much of a coffee drinker, but I do love a strong mocha. I went with a Mocha Tesora. I thought it would be like a Peet's or Starbuck's mocha like any other. Boy was I wrong! 

The Mocha Tesoa had a roasted cocoa bean fragrance, a peculiar nutty smokey flavor and a full bodied RICH finish. I swear I think I am addicted now!

Philz Coffee and staff, ya'll are totally AWESOME!!!
author: Jason C. J.

description:
Thankful that my first time at Philz was w/ a veteran Philz goer. I just followed and went where she went haha. The barista behind the counter calls you up. You place your order and then you walk to the register where you pay. Then you patiently wait until your coffee is ready.

The veteran thought I'd like the mint mojito iced coffee as my first Philz drink. She was right. It was pretty freaking delicious. She also recommended the mocha tesora. I'm definitely down to give that a try next time I'm near a Philz. Or maybe I'll just get another mint mojito iced coffee bc that was tasty!
author: Justine O.

description:
I'm relatively new to Yelping, so I'm unsure if it's common for the places you've reviewed to message you privately and offer to make up for your dissatisfaction. Now THAT'S customer service.

You'd be mistaken if you think the 5-star bump is attributed solely to their impeccable customer care. I finally tried the Mint Mojito Iced Coffee yesterday and holy, why didn't I know about this drink sooner. 

Philz, you've made a repeat customer out of me. I hope you don't mind seeing my face over and over now.
author: Tom P.

description: Makes Starbucks, StarbSucks! This place was Awesome!! Best iced Coffee drink Ive ever had I had the Gingersnap, fantastic and perfectly done. In comparison I would say "Fuck Starbucks" and seek out Philz!!
author: JD H.

description:
Stopped by this location with Ashley H. on our way down to LA from a wedding in Sonoma, not knowing a Philz opened up a location in Santa Monica.  Things are always better in SF anyway!  The line wasn't too long, albiet stagnant - took about 15 minutes to get served with maybe 15 people ahead of us.  I was expecting to wait longer.  Even scored free street parking, since it was a Sunday morning!  

The mint mojito iced coffee is delicious.  Loved the subtle yet robust flavors of the coffee and mint with the right amount of sweetness.  The only thing missing from a perfect cup was the rum.  

I also bought some of the Philtered Soul coffee beans for $16.  Quite a hefty price tag, but I'm excited to have some Philz right at home.
author: Eunice J.

description:
I don't really get the hype about this place. I went to Philz and was told that it was a MUST to get the Mint Mojito Iced Coffee. So I did. I was so excited - I love mojitos, and I love iced coffee. The mix of the two sounded fabulous and delicious. I stood in line for quite some time, which is what I was expecting, so it didn't bother me at all. The guy who took my order absolutely killed my vibe. He looked hugover, pissed off, and when I asked him where I had to order he said, "Right here. Wait in line. When I'm ready for you to order, I will tell you. If you don't have any more rude questions to ask me, you can step back."

I almost left. The other baristas quickly apologized. After ordering my drink, I went to pay. I then again waited, but this time it was for 20 minutes. The same guy either forgot my order, or was purposely giving people who ordered their drinks after me to them. When I finally got my iced coffee, it was just okay. 

I definitely won't be coming back here.
author: Jackie C.

description:
I think people who yelp about Philz are probably looking more for location-specific quirks rather than Philz-specific reviews.

With that in mind, I'll say this Philz earns my 5 stars for a barista who didn't poke fun when I asked what the "sweetest drink" was the other night. He calmly gave us a few options and even made recommendations about what he liked. Exactly what I want from a Philz barista. 

The flow was more clear in this location than I've seen in others, and I actually rather liked the separate area for tables and studying next door. On a night where the cafe was closed, it made for an almost library-like experience. This side room closed at 7:30pm, and an employee was patient with us at closing when it took us a bit to get our stuff packed and out the door.

Will be back!
author: Alison C.

description:
"Are you a teacher?" She studied me with her dark, soul piercing way that snapped my gaze up to her from my iPhone.
"Uh....yes. Math." I admitted awkwardly, flustered by her warmth. I sorta realized where I was and it was as though I'd woken up from a robotic programming. She had noticed me carrying three boxes of pencils and a pad of paper and deduced "you're either a dad or a teacher."
My heartbeat thudded and I muttered confused understanding and I walked about the coffee shop waiting with pleased interest for my mocha tesora. Lovely group; students in a bundle like a burrito on the play couch, a mad hatter on a deep cappuccino buzzed discussion with scarf dude, two broad bimbos cheerfully chortling at what I sensed was work or me. After all I heard one of my favorite songs on the radio and was in just the right groove to bounce a little to the beat.
Unusually the barista had suggested it as preordered with the "classic style." I had agreed and was totally bemused by a seemingly disappointing lack of whip. I luvs the whip!!!
But not this time.
Stronger and less sweeter and the chocolate bitter but better in an aftertaste. Not creamy or sweet at all, and the froth was less cold than id expected. So totally differently made than Peets, Starbucks, or any of a dozen local places I'd been that I felt like I had a new coffee that wasn't my favorite to get daily but instead a treat to get once in a while.
Still I don't know if I could go back. Too many bodacious barista babes with beautiful brown eyes.
author: Mike P.

description: How do they do it? A question for the ages. Patience is truly a virtue here - there are no shortcuts for a perfect cup of Philz coffee. I can't claim a favorite because I'm still experimenting with the menu. Who knew that the basics of coffee - beans, water, cream and sugar with a mint leaf flourish - could be elevated to something so magnificent?
author: John O.

description: Coming from seattle I was very skeptical when my friend mentioned it was the best coffee. Oh man, it was absolutely delicious and refreshing. Coffee was very smooth and unique. Highly recommend Gingersnaps iced coffee.
author: Mitren C.

description:
If you love coffee...I mean *really* love coffee, then you can't help but love Philz.

They do coffee right. Your choice of roast, a few fancy coffees and beans to take home. 

LOVE the tesora mocha, hubby loves the mint mojito, and I am in heaven with all the different drip coffee roasts I can try.

Remember, they make it when you order it, so be prepared to wait (don't be grumpy).

LOVE PHILZ! Fo' REALZ!
author: Christy L.

description:
I love Philz and I loved the Ecstatic they made for me the other day, so why three stars you may ask?

Service. 

I was a bit turned off after coming to this Philz because every time I've been to a Philz, their service is always imppecable. Always smiling, always friendly, always "sugar and cream?", always "let me know if it's alright" after taking a sip. But this Philz? No smiles, no warmth, it was all serious business. Bleh, me no like.

I was also a bit surprised because my friend (who also ordered a Ecstatic after he tasted mine and my boyfriend's) told me that the barista didn't even ask him how sweet or creamy he wanted his coffee. Strange. That doesn't seem to be right. 

Perhaps it was an off day for them? Either way, I probably won't be coming back. It's out of my way and there are plenty of Philz around with much better service.
author: Judith L.

description:
This is a coffee shop to try all different types of coffee blends, hand dripped style. Haven't had one I didn't like. They customize the coffee EXACTLY the way you want it. 

Tesora. Anesthesia to the upside. Silken Splendor. Greater Alarm. ALL time favorites. 
Mint Mojito Iced Coffee that everyone else raves about is good. But very sweet and personally not enough caffeine for me. Nice to try but not something you would get everyday. Sometimes line gets too long but they have an app to order it online!

Highly recommend. I always load up on this whenever I am in the bay!
author: Michelle K.

description:
I already love Philz, but had only been going to the Berry St. location because it's closer to where I live.  I decided to come to this one to study with my friend after school.

Two things:

1. Bathroom was really clean... this means so much to me!!  

2. The place is split up so that ordering / food is in one room, and the tables are in another.  I REALLY liked this because it was good for studying!  No loud noise of people ordering coffee / food interfering with my studying :) :)
author: Jennifer L.

description:
Two words: Mint Mojito!

That's all you need to know.  I get mine with 3 packets of splenda.
author: Stephanie C.

description:
Everyone knows that whenever I am back in town, no matter what part of the trip, I have to get my Philz Coffee fix. 

The location is a bit tiny but I am not here to dine. I am here to drink. 

Will I be back? 
Hell yeah!
Taking advantage of that Google discount!
author: James S.

description:
I had heard forever that Philz coffee was the second coming of coffee christ.  Well, not really heard, but saw everyone and their mother checking in here.  I figured it must be good.  

I walked in, unsure of how to proceed.  This isn't your average stroller-pushing housewife's coffee shop.

They walked me through the process, and soon I had a cup of delicious coffee.  So good I came back here the following week to do some work while enjoying a different blend.

Great place to work, great staff, great coffee.  You really can't beat it.  Even after saying 50 coffee hail marys.
author: Pam S.

description:
This coffee has forever changed me. No coffee I have compares now. Seriously, worth the wait. It's just that amazing. 

Try the philtered soul. You won't be sorry!
author: Krys J.

description: this is the best coffee in san francisco period. i have been here many times and its always a good idea.
author: Brian L.

description:
I love the mint mojito iced coffee!! so tasty and refreshing!

You should always get the large size even though it is .50cents more, trust me a small is not enough!
author: Janet Z.

description:
I'm not much of a coffee drinker, but I'm a Philz drinker.  Super great coffee and I love that you place your order with the person who makes your coffee; you can customize however you want and they'll adjust your drink to make it perfect for you.  I LOVE the mint mojito and the mocha tesora.  

I cannot wait for the Philz near my place to open up so I can go EVERYDAY!
author: Thi D.

description: Today i had the gingersnap ice latte with almond milk and stevia. Delicious! ! Order first then pay. Enjoy!
author: Wynn N.

description:
My acupuncturist  told me to lay off the coffee. 

.... Yeah. Not going to happen. (She also told me I've got blood problems and when I googled it, Webmd told me I had cancer so... eff it, if I have cancer, I'm going to keep drinking coffee.)

(Why the eff did I go to acupuncture???) 

Anyway, there's this little column thing I write that I somehow convinced my school to publish that critiques food and stuff.. and deadline is TOMORROW. And it's a mess. (Like my life.) BUT I needed to review Phliz before I write about it telling people to go there. 

So I went there. It took a long time (15min) as it was 9:30 on a thursday but whatevs.  I got Julie's Ultimate, a dark roast. SURPRISE its delicious. Mission accomplished.
author: Emily D.

description:
I've only purchased their beverages, twice.  And had plenty of it at a certain business cafeteria. ;)

Always delicious.  I love their Tesora.   And somehow, I am thinking of the Italian word for treasure, tesoro now.  Sigh.

Always friendly service.
author: Fannie S.

description:
I actually don't like coffee much, but I still never refuse a cup of coffee from philz, in fact make it a large. (Only small and large available). I don't even add lots of cream and sugar, light on both, but it's just so good. My go-to favorites are philtered soul and the tesora. 
Also all the baristas are always extremely awake, it's like they feed off of each other's optimism. Never met am employee that looked like they were not happy to be there
author: Peter M.

description:
The Mint Mojito iced coffee was EVERYTHING I had imagined it would be! Great taste and am definitely now going to add mint to every iced coffee I get back home. 

A fan of Starbucks, Peete's, Coffee Bean and now...Philz!! Super dee-duper-licious!

The only down fall of this location...yup you guessed it..parking!

Oh well..no biggie.
author: Busy L.

description:
Oh my. Do my gustatory organs beguile me or is this really love? It must be the latter, because my tongue has never come in contact with such minty smooth richness before you, Philz. 

MINT MOJITO ICED COFFEE. GET IT!
author: Natasha H.

description: The first time I've ever had Philz coffee and it didn't disappoint. Definitely a great coffee chain that needs to expand more in the SoCal area! Ironically I've never been to the one that opened in the the LA area. But from what I hear they are opening up another location in downtown LA to accompany the Santa Monica location which is great news. So far I've only had the New Manhattan and the Ambrosia and the were both great coffee blends. Very different from other coffee chains and quite refreshing to have something other than the norm.
author: Harry M.

description: This guy that owns this place is dope. I"ve partied with him and done promotions for this place. Gotta love the TUrkish coffee here its hella bomb. The coffee here has a great energy kick to it that I really dig. They got fraps here too. They taste richer, more flavor,  an better in my opinion too.
author: Luke S.

description:
This place definitely live up to its hype! I was impressed. Mint mojito iced coffee is the way to go! Tried it at another place down in SD and it was nothing comparable to Philz! My now go-to spot for coffee whenever I'm back in SF. Their Mint Mojito has the perfect texture to it. Nice, smooth, creamy with a minty flavor to it. It does not have a strong minty flavor to it just a hint of it to complete the drink. For around $4.25 for a medium sized cup it's a bit cheaper than Starbucks. My friend who is not fond of coffee went with their Mint Tea and she was amazed at how great it tasted! I believe hers was around $3. I tried it and it was delicious! Great for those non-coffee drinkers! She now goes there to get their mint tea crave fixed! Both the mint mojito iced coffee and the mint tea was very flavorful! Especially recommend it if you like minty things as well but don't expect it to have a strong mint taste to it! 

This location is conveniently located near the City Hall so it was easy to get to! Parking wise, eh. Probably have to park near the Tenderloin, not sure if that's so safe. As for the store it's pretty small compared to their lounge area that is 2x the actual store area. I thought it was kind of weird how you place your order then go pay and not pay after you order. Maybe that's just me. The lounge area is great for those who wants to chill at a coffee place to catch up on their work/study. Free WIFI! Typically only those who are working since it is SO quiet in there! Everyone looked up when my friend and I walked in. I will definitely be back! Wish they have locations in SoCal though.
author: Shanna C.

description: Just try their heavenly iced mint monitor, and you'll keep coming back. You can chug the whole cup at once and ask for another... I can! The Philz on Van Ness is a small coffee shop with a local vibe and super friendly baristas. They have plenty of options for coffees and flavored coffee drinks, and you can't go wrong with any of them. If you're new here, go with their signature drinks: mint mojito, Tesora or Philtered Soul; they are all superb!
author: Jennifer S.

description: I've been only a couple of times but I usually get the same thing. philtered soul medium roast lightly sweetened is the best! Try it!
author: Miko L.

description:
Coffee: 5 
Service: 5 
Ambiance: 5 
5's all around!

Hands down my favorite coffee. Philz 100% lives up to all the hype. I've had julie's ultimate and philtered soul with just a little cream and sugar, both amazing. I've never had coffee that is so flavorful, smooth, creamy, and delicious. 

The baristas are always the best, super friendly and helpful. 

Of all the coffees with a bunch of hype (blue bottle, intelligensia, and a whole lots of boutique cafes), this is the one that actually meets and exceeds expectations. 

Next time I will not walk from Market St. through the heart of the tenderloin to get there though, I would try to avoid Turk and Golden Gate if you can.
author: Maleenee B.

description:
Despite the less-than-sub-par experience here my prior visit, I was delightfully surprised when the manager reached out to me regarding my visit. This gives me confidence that the management really cares about the customer service and seeks to improve it.

I'm proud to be a loyal customer of Philz. I'm really hoping my next visit at this location will be amended!
author: Jamie Y.

description:
So I'm not even really a regular coffee drinker. In fact, I actually barely drink coffee at all unless it's while driving during long road trips so that I don't go off the 5 and run into the cows at Coalinga.

But then I tried Philz and shizz just got real, real good that is. Holy mackerel, the mint mojito? I mean what kind of divine brew is that? At first it's like whoa, mojito! Then another sip and it's whoa coffee! Then it's like all at once an explosion of minty, sweet, creamy, light, refreshing tastes from the moment it touches your lips to all the way down your throat. It's like you want to be able to come up with a word to describe the taste and experience but you are left perplexed and speechless. It's just fricking the most refreshing taste I've ever experienced out of any coffee drink. I mean, it's like bottling Spring in a cup and serving it. Amazing.

The tesora is also an amazing brew. It's earthy, aromatic, a little nutty, and a whole lot of deliciousness. I strongly suggest this if you do not want to go the mint mojito route. Seriously, try them all, they are all lip smacking, c#nt puntin', punch me in the gonads and call me Betty fantastic!

I now know why everyone raves about Philz, consider me a Philanderer...wait, I think that's already a word....
author: Edison T.

description:
so, so, so obsessed with this stuff-- I have taken the plunge and become a Philz fan along with everyone else in the Bay Area. My favorite order is Tesora (medium sweet). 

When I came on a Saturday afternoon, they were out of the ingredients to make the mint mojito coffee, which is what I really felt paired best with my trashy magazine I had brought to read. That was a bit disappointing, but I understand its probably tough to keep fresh mint leaves around all day long.   T
author: Bailey M.

description:
Best coffee in the city. Well, my personal favorite of course. They don't serve the typical espresso drinks, but instead they make some amazing drip coffee. I do tend to like espressos better, but Philz changed my mind.

Their coffee is phenomenal. I try to get a cup and some beans every time I am back in the Bay Area. It's that good! Every cup and every sip make me so happy and help me unwind. I'm serious. I enjoy it that much.
Favorite drinks/beans: The New Manhattan and the Philtered Soul. Yes, the minty Mojitos are the most famous and most popular drinks, but try something else next time! The other drinks are pretty awesome too.
author: Alex L.

description:
As a hardcore coffee addict, Philz is my all-time favorite caffeinated indulgence. My roommate and I are so obsessed with Philz that we will walk from our apartment in the Panhandle all the way downtown because we "need" their iced gingersnap coffee. It's one of those rare things you taste and never, ever want it to end. 

If you want to drink something that will make you feel like it's Christmas every day (both because of the heartwarming ginger-cinnamon, creamy taste and the fact that it's better than any gift you could ever receive, ever) please, try this beverage. It might change your life.
author: Meredith C.

description:
Best coffee in San Francisco, hands down.

I live one block from the original Blue Bottle,  2 blocks from Ritual.  Yet I almost always find myself dragging my bootay all the way to 748 Vanness to get my Philz fix.  Can't put my finger on exactly what is so much better... It's never bitter, it has tons of flavor, it's soooooo smooth.  

Also, if you like decaf, you should never, ever go anywhere but Philz.  Their decaf is lightyears ahead of anyone else.  And they have swisswater version. :)

PS.  Be warned though, they only do drip coffee. No lattes or espresso here.

PPS.  They have about 30 different kinds of coffee, they are listed from lowest caffeine (darkest roast) to highest caffeine (lightest roast).  Don't go for the one called "Greater Alarm" unless you plan on being up for 3 days and/or running a triathlon.
author: Evelyn N.

description: The mint mojito is seriously the BESTEST. I would drink it again and again and again.
author: Dominique F.

description:
During my trip in nor cal, I got hooked to Philz. As our family wrapped out hiking in Muir Woods(which everyone should check out. It is absolutely gorgeous), I was craving Philz' mint mojito ice coffee...so we went out of our way to drop by this Philz. I was glad that there was only 3 customers in the store, but, ultimately to be sad because they had run out of mint mojito. Sad face. I settled for their regular iced coffee, with light sweetness. Man, these guys are just on point. One of the, if not, the best iced coffee I've ever had. And I know it's not processed because they made it right in front of me, and waited for my confirmation that it was the way I wanted in, both in amount of milk and in sweetness. 

I know this doesn't really affect my review, but I ran into a friend from our elementary school days, so that was pretty crazy. 

Basically, Philz coffee is pretty up there in the coffee world. Even if the item that's really popular isn't available, the other items can really leave a great impression. 

Oh, I came in at about 5pm on a Sunday, so that's maybe why it wasn't so crowded. And this location isn't really right next to any tourist spots.
author: Daniel L.

description:
Mint Mojito Iced Coffee- was definitely the best coffee ever. I am not a coffee drinker, so I often stick to my chai latte, BUT, this one is soo deliciously addicting that it'll be silly to pass by the chance! 

The service was awesome, all the baristas are attentive and great!

I tried their chai tea, and I have to say that I've been used to getting the Chai latte that I totally forgot that the tea with cream and sugar taste differently. Lesson learned: Need to read the menu carefully, but I was just too excited to try what other delicious drinks this place can give me!
author: Josie H.

description:
Im still not sure what i like the most about my trip to SF... if Philz coffee or Stevie Wonder at Outside Lands.

BTW... It was the best concert of my entire life, so you can get the picture!
author: Juan F.

description: One of the best perks of my current employment is my proximity to this Philz. Not only is the coffee quality and variety excellent, but the people who make it for you are too. Be sure to tip them on busy days (i.e. the weekends)! I personally recommend the Philharmonic. If you want a serious caffeine boost, go for the Red Sea and bring your own mug to pay for a small. Just don't get this on an empty stomach..
author: Robert H.

description:
The only thing you need to know is get the mint mojito. 


Thank me later.
author: Jenny U.

description:
Their coffee is great, but not so much for the baristas. They are supperrrrrrr slow........ So be patient enough for baristas to be done with chatting. There was a posting of an app that you can order ahead of time at the coffee shop so you may wanna check that out if you are in a hurry.
I am happy with the awesome mint mojito iced coffee but I think the service could be faster. And here unlike Starbucks, your order doesn't get communicated over from the counter to barista or vice versa so you have to tell the cashier what you got. 
They have their own lunch place right next to coffee shop-panini, sandwiches and etc. 
If you are sick of starbucks, it's time to make the move to Philtz;)
author: Monica C.
Pauline P.

description:
I'm not a huge coffee drinker at all. I'm that girl who goes to Starbucks to get a passion iced tea. Guess I'm a little weird... I just try to stay away from coffee unless I really need it. Basically, I mainly drink coffee only on those sleepless nights of studying or those early mornings before my clinical rotations. 

With that said, Philz is a whole 'nother story. I come here not because I need it but more because I crave it. It just makes it a plus that it's near my work. Pete's is closer to my work but Philz over Pete's ANY DAY! 

This is what I get:
1. mint mojito iced coffee 
2. ecstatic iced coffee (recommendation by Helen Z.)

I also have to compliment the workers here on their great service and friendly attitude! They're always welcoming and they go above and beyond my expectations. You guys are awesome here!

Oh! Did I mention my boyfriend always gets jealous when I get Philz? Good thing they are opening a Philz near him in South San Francisco soon!
author: Connie Y.

description: I'm not a huge coffee drinker but if I had to, Philz's Mint Mojito would be my #1.
author: Derrick C.

description:
The best coffee I've had in San Francisco by far. Super friendly and knowledgable staff. If you don't know what you want, no problem, someone will start rattling off all the different things you can try. 

If you're looking for something new to try:

Hot: Philzharmonic 
Cold: Mint Mojito Iced Coffee
Decaf: Swiss Water Peru

The original Phil on 24th in the Mission is cute if you're looking for a slightly more authentic feel, but the coffee is just as good here as it is in the Mission.

If you're venturing to Philz on a Saturday or Sunday morning - plan and expect a bit of a line going out the door.
author: Tara K.

description: I have been coming to this location for 6 months, I love coffee and I consider philz coffee as the strongest coffee there is! I am a coffee addict, I mostly drink Starbucks coffee because of the gold reward card. When I come to philz I usually get the greater alarm with milk, keeps me awake longer! I came last Sunday and the line was out the door after my mom and I ordered and paid for our drinks. We were waiting awhile for our drinks so we decided to get a pound of the philtered soul, but they were out; so the woman offered the greater alarm for the same price.
author: Alix J.

description:
You know, I love Philz Coffee and have been to many other of their locations. Their coffee itself really is incomparable; it's so smooth and silky. 

The reason I knock a star off is because of the first time I visited this location, I just didn't have that pleasant of an experience. Granted, I arrived 35-40 minutes before closing time, but that shouldn't alter the quality of a business' service.  

I walked up to the counter a bit uncertain as to what I wanted to order and the barista just wasn't that receptive. I asked for a mug instead of a paper cup and was told they were closing soon so I should get a paper cup. That's fine if closing time was in 5-10 minutes, not 35-40. I wasn't going to be there long anyways. Then I finally sat down, I was there for 5 minutes when someone came by to say they were closing that side of the cafe. I wasn't upset, just a bit disappointed. A business shouldn't start shutting things down until it's actually near closing time. 

Regardless, I love the coffee and love Philz. I can only hope for a better impression next time.
author: Michele P.

description: Vegan bagels ....amazingly strong coffee. Great environment... The people who work at all the Philz locations are super cool and down to earth.
author: Desiree G.

description: Great experience, especially for a couple of tourists in town for a little while.  We wanted to grab a few bags of coffee to take back home to LA with us and they were very cordial about flavors and styles!
author: Abeer S.

description:
Dear Starbucks, 

I'm sorry to say that my feelings for you have changed. I know... I know you gave me your gold card. It's me not you. I'm on the road to self discovery right now and along the way, I met Philz. He's introduced me to "Tantalizing Turkish" and has "Philtered my soul!" You just don't understand Starbucks, but when I'm with Philz and I'm drinking my sweet "Mocha Tesora," I start to realize that it's my "Canapy of Heaven" and it make me feel "Sooo Good!"  We can still be friends Starbucks, I just won't be seeing you as much because of Philz. Well lets just say "It'z the BEST " I've ever had. 

Love,
Rosalyn


PHILZ  COFFEE IS THE BOMB DOT COM. I love their Coffee and I'm addicted to it. It's my crack to get me going in the morning!
author: Rosalyn T.

description:
The only place close to where I used to go to college where they serve coffee that actually kept me up throughout my 6hrs classes. 
This location will always remind of the coffee runs I used do with my classmates :) 
I love everything on their menu but if I had to chose I'll go for an iced mint mojito and that divine lox bagel.
author: Meriem B.

description:
Oh Philz, how I miss you when I am not in NorCal/SF.

This is the Philz I have frequented the most. 
There are two sides to this coffeeshop. On the right is where you order your coffee and food, and on the left is where you sit and drink. 

For you (Van Ness) Philz noobs: walk up to a barista and tell them what you would like. I'm usually a black coffee drinker, but at Philz I always get cream and sugar. 
In the corner is also a bagel station, and I usually get something (any, cause they're all good) while I wait for my coffee.  Walk up to the register and tell them what you ordered. Leave this part of Philz and walk straight across to the other side with tables and couches (through the door). 
Log on to their free wifi or chat with your coffee buddy.

The lounge-y section usually isn't too crowded in the morning. Most people get their coffee and go, with a handful reading newspaper or killing time.

Mint Mojito Iced Coffee or Tesora are my favorites.
For you non-coffee drinkers (like I once was), the Mint tea is amazing and my favorite. Again, make sure you get cream and sugar!
author: Rebecca H.

description: When buying coffee beans - Check your coffee bags to make sure you actually are getting a full pound of coffee.  On a recent trip to visit my daughter in SF I was shorted by 1/4 or more of coffee. Not real cool. When I called to let them know, I received was avery flippant response & nothing was offered to rectify their mistake.
author: Christy C.

description: I'll just be another voice in the crowd urging you to get the mint mojito! Get it the house way...sweet, creamy and delicious.
author: Georgia J.

description:
Love their coffee! I usually do not like coffee or mint, but after many pushes from my friends, I gave in. And, Oh boy, the mint mojito iced coffee was amazing. It was so good that I got another the following day. The price was not bad either; 5 dollars for a large personalized drink.

Please open up a shop in San Diego, and I will be so happy.
author: C H.

description:
As many fellow yelpers have previously stated: Iced Mojito Coffee is the way to go. Wow. By far the BEST Iced Coffee I have ever drank!

The baristas are very helpful... for you first timers, they will point you to the right direction. 

Oh do I wish there was a Philz in L.A. *hint - hint*...
author: Kaori T.

description: I'm very glad there are multiple locations throughout SF because the coffee truly is amazing. The wait is longer than you're average coffee shop --cough-- Starbucks but it's worth the wait. Each cup is slow filtered and they have some exotic beans.
author: Cam C.

description:
Drove past a gay block party.
What else to do, but park and join the fun!
Yelped to see what else was around and found Philz.
The iced mint mojito coffee was refreshing!!
Will have to try to duplicate it back home ;)
author: Michelle T.

description:
This isn't your typical coffee joint.. This is what true coffee is! No flavored syrup needed! 

At Philz, you can never go wrong with what you order. You can get your caffeine fix with the delicious goodness of the mint mojito iced coffee. This is always a good one if you are having a tough time deciding. This is my go-to cup 95% of the time. Just think of that bitterness and sweetness in one! Oh coffee...

This time, I've tried something new. I ordered a Tesora with a little sugar and cream. It's awesome how the staff makes it in front of you can asks if you would like cream & sugar. That's a true princess treatment right there! (You'll still get the same treatment if you walk in in your sweet pants and your morning messy hair style. They'll still treat you with the same service. ) Hahas. Tesora has a bit of a nutty feel to it, but it ends smoothly. The after-taste doesn't linger as strong either. I would totally recommend this.
author: Jane C.

description: The mint mojito works wonders for my body.  I've only had it 2 times but each time I had this liquid refreshment, my mind goes bonkers and my metabolism speeds up like the road runner escaping from Wild E Coyote.  Talk about body cleanse.  Who needs colonscopy when we have mint mojito!
author: Linda N.

description:
Be prepared to wait 30 min on a weekend!  But definitely well worth the wait because I know this place produces high quality coffee and the baristas really put in their time to give you a good product.

My favorite: mint mojito - I prefer cold since the I don't really like warm mint leaves
author: Michelle W.

description:
Philz stands out among the amazing coffee in San Francisco. I might be biased because it's my neighborhood place. I take all my friends and visitors as part of their visit to San Francisco. They brew every cup individually and to order. The coffee menu reads like a wine review, and surprisingly all the coffees do have a unique and flavor as described. 
The baristas are very knowledgable and friendly. They will gladly describe the differences and help you decide. They will also make to order - putting in your requested amount of cream/sugar, etc. You can taste and have them make adjustments as well.
Everything ordered here is fantastic, including the iced drinks and all the food items. This is a very popular place, the line can get quite long, but well worth it.
This is the only location that I have been too, but I am sure the rest are equally wonderful.
author: Dusty S.

description:
Very possibly the best mocha I've had!! 

What differentiates Philz's mocha the most is how you are able to customize the sweetness level (unsweetened/ medium/ sweet) with no compromise on the cocoa flavor/ level. Philz uses some cream in the mocha, different from how many cafe mochas from other cafes use only milk, and this definitely makes the mocha richer, more flavorful and full-bodied. Other than that, I like how they always serve the drinks piping hot and not lukewarm.
author: Olivia P.

description: Probably the best coffee I've ever had and I think that's saying a lot from someone who drinks specialty coffee on the regular. I don't know how they get to such exquisite tastes, but whatever they're doing, they're doing a great job. When I go back to San Francisco Philz will be my first stop.
author: Joelle C.

description:
What do you do before Brenda's? All the smart people go to Philz to get their caffeine fix and then you can wait out the crazy long line at the aforementioned brunch zone.

Philz runs a brisk but effective service with separate bagel and coffee lines. You go up to the counter where there's about three baristas waiting to make your cup o' Joe, just the way you want it. Their coffee is arranged from light to dark roasts and they have some fantastic seasonal favorites like a lovely iced gingersnap. But my hands-down fav is the iced mint mojito made with fresh mint leaves. 

Bagels are also boss. Get their namesake that comes toasted, drizzled with olive oil, salt and pepper, tomatoes, cucumber and cream cheese. Boom, a breakfast of champions has just been born.
author: Faith Y.

description:
I am a Philz Phanatic (see what I did there)

Philz is never "on the way" to anywhere I'm about to go, but I definitely go out of my way for my Philz Phix. The employees at all the locations are super knowledgeable on their blends and great at recommending new concoctions. My favorite is the mint mojito coffee, it's refreshing and gives me just the caffeine kick that I need. 

They even sell their beans by the pound just in case you want to try to recreate these amazing drinks at home.
author: Mindy T.

description:
Worst customer service ever. No wonder there are lines when you have 5 staff on duty and I ,the one and only customer in the shop, am told I need to wait for the girl who is on the phone to finish her call and slowly walk to the coffee machine. That same girl (who was apparently the only one authorized to make my coffee) then proceeds to ask what I want and seats down to have her breakfast while the people who could not serve me earlier make my order. I had the audacity to ask for milk and was told by a smug staff member that everything is behind the counter (no milk was given). Excuse me if I didn't go to the Philz school of no-customer service and thought staff are actually there to serve customers instead of lecturing them on how your inefficient operation works (or rather does not work).

Update:the manager was very quick to apologize after receiving my feedback via email response to their e-mail receipt.  He issued a refund (which I had not asked for or expected) and said he will investigate what happened.
author: Elena M.

description:
+1000 reviews....

If you love coffee...go here. 

Jamaican Blue Mountain is worth the $$$$.  I also buy a pound of their coffee to take home.
author: Rob B.

description: Don't come here if you have an addictive personality, because no substitute chain muck will ever satisfy after you've had the best.   BEST COFFEE EVER.   Little pricey but worth the extra change.
author: Melanie K.

description:
YUMMMMMMMMMM!

I am not big on drinks, but Philz Mint Mojito Iced coffee is so goood!! Even on a cold day :)
author: Jen H.

description:
Must try's -

Jacobs Wonderbar
Sooo Good

If you like coffee, you'll Love Philz!
author: Terry C.

description:
I am always a fan of Philz coffee because of the realness of their coffee. When they say their coffee has a smokey and clove taste they mean it unlike basic big chain coffee shops like starbucks that say its a dark roast when it tast no where near a typical dark roast coffee.
Who also doesn't love the freshness of coffee by the cup with a fresh mint leaf in it.
the reason for the 4 out of 5 stars is because the place is so awesome that it seriously needs more space, it is just far too small for the amount of people that come in for their amazing coffee.
author: Cescilia A.

description:
Sunday evening coffee run with friends turned into a nice 3 hour outing just chilling inside the coffee shop. I ordered a decaf sumatra (I didn't want the caffeine keeping me up all night) with a little bit of cream and sugar and a fresh mint leaf. $3 even gave me a small warm beverage to drink on a chilly night.

This was my second Philz visit, but my first for this location (my other visit was at the one in the Mission). It was a complete 180 compared to the other Philz. Instead of a warm homey and rustic feel with dim lighting and old school couches, this place had a sleek look brought on by modern furniture and plenty of lighting. Aside from the hipster music and the laid back look of all the employees, this place definitely fit the downtown feel of the surrounding area.

I liked that there was a second room for people to set up their work or study stations. Even with all that extra seating, it was really crowded when we went. We ended up standing around and then pouncing on a table once it opened up. 

For some reason, I remember the coffee being tastier during my first visit, but I was still satisfied with my beverage. I still haven't decided if I like the fact that they add the sugar and cream for you behind the counter or not... Next time I want to try the Mint Mojito Iced Coffee... Even if it may be loaded with fatty creamer. Haha.
author: Leana L.

description:
loveee the mojito iced coffeee,
its like sweet but not too sweet, just perfect with the mint leaves :)
stafff always friendly!
author: Miffy L.

description:
I don't think Philz Coffee needs anymore great reviews but this coffee was an absolute best!! It literally brough joy to my mouth and the service was outstanding! 
Wished I lived close by to be a regular! :( Try the bagel with tomatoes and boiled egg! Every cup of coffee is a guaranteed love at first cup.
author: Jackie S.

description: Loyal. Brand freaking loyal. This city is expensive and time is constantly at a premium. Speaking of, I got rid of the car and totally manipulate friends to take me here. Coffee is *awesome* - why? - cuz hard working freaking real people care if I want it a tad bit more "sweet and creamy". Thanks to people like Kelia and Dane.
author: Elizabeth C.

description:
FOLLOW DIRECTIONS (EXACTLY):

1) Go to Philz Coffee.
2) Stand in line.
3) Choose Mint Mojito Iced Coffee, maybe get a bagel.
4) Pay your friendly cashier, smile.
5) With drink in hand, bring to lips, open mouth, tilt head back. Let the refreshing stream of mint ice coffee goodness excite your mouth.
6) Walk to Saigon Sandwich (estimated walking time 8 minutes) [see review].
7) Order Banh Mi (chicken, tofu, pork, or combination).
8) Eat, Drink and be happy.
9) Repeat steps 1-8.
author: Vivian S.

description:
Absolutely love this place. My first time and it won't be the last. Service was great the coffee was even better. I have plenty of coffee to try. 

Would like some more food selections however, I love the fact that they had sambusas. I'm in love.
author: Omar J.

description:
I didn't quite receive the attention I was hoping for at this Philz. The barista wasn't terribly smiley on the morning I went in and hardly spoke a word, and I was never asked to sample my drink and approve or disapprove of it before purchasing. 

Kind of minute details, but it felt like this location was less-independent and more-chain, something I prefer to avoid when getting my coffee. Maybe it's because everyone has hyped up this location as the Crème de la Crème of Philz locations, but I was a bit disappointed. 

The coffee was still good (and my pal loved her Iced Mint Mojito coffee), but it didn't have that excellent customer service to kick it up to four, or even five, stars. Maybe next time?
author: Natalye R.

description:
Walked a mile for coffee this morning. Wasn't disappointed--Jacob's wonderbar was amazing!

A required stop for coffee lovers visiting SF. Soak it in!
author: Drake L.

description:
Walking around in 80-degree San Francisco. Sweaty. Hills. Uncomfortable.

~ order a mint mojito at Philz ~

Day instantly better.
author: Sheng W.

description:
Really. good. coffee.
That's pretty much all I have to say.

I like how this coffee shop is a local joint. On the wall, there are mugs with names above them for all their local customers. Always like to try places that's popular with the locals.
author: Dayae K.

description:
Mint mojitos! Nothing more and nothing less. Okay actually I just had the Tesora which is just the way coffee should taste. 

The mint mojito is my go to drink here. They only make it iced and I wish they had a hot option...

I had the Tesora with non fat milk and one packet of stevia sweetener. Two small drinks for $7. The baristas are great at suggesting new drinks.
author: Angeline H.

description: Friendly service as always.  These folks really know how to make you feel like it's still a small operation and all they want to do is to make sure you have a great experience.  A close friend who no longer lives in SF actually asked me to buy philharmonic blend whole beans to take to her because she misses Philz so much!  One note: the whole beans don't have added cardamom whereas the ground beans can.
author: Vivian W.

description: Best coffee and customer service! Close to the bridge and affordable!! They will have my continued support
author: Huda S.

description: Philz Coffee, will you please come to the east coast? I miss your Mint Mojito Iced Coffee :(
author: Vhalerie L.

description:
You go in and you order from the barista, you then walk over to the cashier and tell them what you ordered and pay. Interesting style. Took less than 10 minutes to get my drink, I don't know what people are complaining about. 

Of course I had to get the Iced Mint Mojito Coffee, it was delicious. Now if you don't like mint... or coffee.. or mojitos.. maybe you shouldnt order this. The next day it was cold in SF so I got Ambrosia with sugar and cream. I'm not normally a coffee person, I like to order my girly latte but this was amazing! My bf regrets not buying any to bring home. Don't make the same mistake he did!
author: Tammy Q.

description: i found this place a few months back and today I must write this review because they are KILLING it at this location.  Everybody is so friendly and kind.  The service is swift and the coffee is delicious.  The style is pour and drip coffee.... that was new for me and MAN, the difference is completely astounding.   I LOVE THIS PLACE.  Try it, you won't be sorry.
author: George B.

description:
Quite simply, the best coffee in the city. 

My personal faves include the Philtered Soul (hints of hazelnut, cocoa, and syrup), cream and medium sweet. I also adore the iced coffee (doesn't have to be the mint mojito, the plain one is good, too) on a warm day.

Insider's tip: Bring your own mug, and get a large coffee for the price of a small.
author: Nina B.

description:
If you like mocha their mocha tesora is amazing!!!!!

My first experience with mint mojito was not so great (I didn't add any sugar or milk and for a non- regular coffee drinker like me it just tasted bitter!) Add to mint mojito sugar & milk it becomes a heavenly fragrant iced coffee...will get you addicted

My FAVOURITE coffee in the bay area = PHILZ!
author: Sujan H.

description:
No doubt mojito coffee is a must since so many know the wonderful mojito and sophisticated coffee at Philz I will comment on the location. Parking is difficult on the busy Van Ness street with 35 miles per hr traffic. Surrounding neighborhood is known to be less ideal to walk around when getting late. Be sure to walk your female friends to their car/ bus stop if getting late. 

Few table places for work though free wifi is available. Seats are often occupied at first but table changes hands relatively often (like hourly). There are about 4-5 two person tables in te middle and a couple of bench, mini sofa spaces. Accommodate ~10-15 people
author: Dilys S.

description:
Does this place actually need a review? We all know we love it! But for those that are unsure let me put it to you this way.

I went from a heavy cream/sugar girl, to a milk/honey girl, to an almond milk only girl, to a straight black coffee girl. It's so good it doesn't need anything else.
author: Jeannie D.

description: Yumm. Tried the iced coffee and black tea. Perfect! First time in a Philz, definitely will be back. It's cozy and welcoming, very cute interior. We sat outside, where there was plenty of seating! It is a great concept and I love that every cup is made to order. So tasty!!
author: Amy H.

description:
It's changed a lot since the first time I'd been here! What used to be one whole cafe has split up! If you're not paying attention you'll get distracted and wonder why the heck they got rid of all the seating! The main room is now just the usual area where the baristas do their magic and a cashier counter with a small pastry glass box (I like the sambusas!), the middle of the room is where people ordering/waiting get to stand and there's even a bathroom in here. By the way there's an app you can use to order from if you don't want to wait in line! 

So question is where do I get to sit and study/hang out/read a book/or use the wifi after I buy my coffee? Walk out the door and into the door across from it. It's the philz lounge that's also shared with a deli! It's pretty quiet with light music playing in the background. Though small, there's plenty of seating and you can sit by the window and people watch if that's what you like to do! There's also a bathroom in here and plenty of outlets to plug your computer into. 

Philz is still my favorite coffee stop!
author: Mercy D.

description: like many other philz in the city, the coffee is consistently great. and they also have "order ahead" service. so it cuts down on the time of having to wait in line for the one cup at a time experience (don't get me wrong, i love the fresh brewing, but at busy hours this could take a while!) , across from the order section is a big space for people who wants to chill and work on their laptops. location is easily accessible with buses ( in fact, bus stops right outside of philz on van ness), just be aware of the surrounding in and out of the shop because there are sometimes some "interesting" homeless pals outside who will surprise you!
author: Joyce C.

description:
Dear Philz,

You are so good to me. Too good, in fact. Each sip of your rich coffee is pure bliss. Each sip of your extremely strong and not bitter at all coffee makes me more and more jittery, it's amazing. I love how every drink I had of yours has never ever disappointed me. The Philharmonic is my to-go drink, with it's nutty cardamom flavor and smooth complexion. The tescora is bold in flavor, and the mint mojito is a perfect drink on one of those rare beautiful San Francisco days. 

I also appreciate how your workers ask me after making me my drink to try it to make sure it's the perfect drink for me. Can you be any nicer to me?? You're making me blush.

I yearn for you all the time, so can you do me a favor and please open a location closer to FiDi/Soma so I can have you accompany during those long Mondays at the office?

Forever yours,
Me.
author: Evelyn S.

description:
Ever since I was introduced to the Chemex drip coffee method by a classmate recently, I've found myself preferring that drip over machine drips.  So of course, when I come to San Francisco for a short visit, Philz is on the top of my list.  And it did not disappoint!

I got the Philtered Soul and my friend got  a Mint Tea (which came with real mint leaves!  Both were absolutely heavenly and delicious!  The baristas that were helping us were the sweetest people, and they were very concerned about making sure that everything was made to order.  They were also able to juggle multiple drips at the same time, so despite it being a busy afternoon, the wait time was not long at all.  Also, the coffee was fairly reasonably priced (hint: Intelligentsia Coffee anyone?) II also bought a pound of the Tesora, so I can't wait to go home and try it!
author: Alex R.

description:
Amazing coffee (need I say more?). 

Philz is simply the only coffee that will actually make me shiver and make me so jittery that I think i may experience a cardiac arrest. That is the power of an out-of-this-world caffeine kick.

I've tried the following and enjoy them all -

- Tesora (a good medium roast blend if you're trying Philz for the 1st time)
- Mint Mojito (iced. excellent on a hot day)
- Jacob's Wonderbar (a super strong dark roast blend. made me so jittery)
- Sooo Good (another good one to start your relationship with Philz)
- Anesthesia to the Upside (had it so long ago but recall i liked it)

More to try, though I'll probably stick with more of the medium roast blends.
author: Jing D.

description: I love using Yelp when I'm out of town and research the best Restuarant and coffee spots wherever I'm at. However, we stumble upon this coffee shop as we were waiting for a restaurant with a 1 hour wait. We saw a few people carrying the cup and asked where it was. It was the best find without using Yelp. If you love dark bold coffee and this place definitely had it. I also loved they way they do your made-to-order coffee. It was an ingenious way to order/make coffee. It was quick and full of flavor. We came back the next day even though our hotel was in South San Francisco.
author: Myrene M.

description:
Ambrosia + lightly sweetened + light milk= AMAZING.

I love this location because there's plenty of meter parking near the store and there's a separate room for customers who'd like to get some work done while they're WIRED on their delicious cups of Philz. 

I've also tried the SOOOO good, tesora, and mint mojito iced coffee. All were super aromatic and delicious EXCEPT for the SOOO good....kinda deceiving. But I'll let it pass.

They do NOT charge extra for soy! Extra star for taking care of the lactose-intolerants like myself! :D They also accept credit cards WITHOUT a minimum purchase. Extra high-five!
author: Patricia K.

description:
No clue which location we went to but YUM!  COME TO LA!  Actually its probably better that there is nothing like this near me because the last thing I need is a bad addiction.  I'm not a regular coffee drinker at all, do like it occasionally.  

Anyways we got the Mint Mojito Iced, yummy w/half sweetness.  YUM!  I loved everything about it.  Now I know  a Philz Coffee stop has to be part of my future SF visits!
author: Ami S.

description: Mint mojito iced coffee is delish but I still prefer Blue Bottle's Chicory iced coffee. They are a little heavy handed with the ice too so I got mostly ice in my small. Really want to go back and try some other items on their menu but for now I'm making a "not impressed" face :/
author: Semuteh F.

description: I love philz coffee, they use manufacturers cream in their coffee.  Manufacturers cream is like 40% butter milk fat. If you normally use sugar in your coffee you don't need it at philz because the cream has so much fat content. Butter milk fat makes everything taste so good.
author: James F.

description:
Just like the other Yelp'ers have noted, Philz has some bomb @ss coffee!!!

this review is just an fyi...

To get a bag of coffee shipped to your door (if you live in SoCal), it's about 15 bucks.  Not a bad deal at all, considering how good it is!
author: Niño M.

description:
First time I came here, Hubby and I ordered the coveted iced mint mojito and some iced gingerbread-something-or-other. Truthfully, I was not a fan of either, and I happen to enjoy mint and ginger flavored drinks. To me, the mint mojito tasted like I was drinking coffee after having brushed my teeth and gargling with mouthwash (which is not a good thing). Maybe it was on off night.

Today, Hubby happened to be near a philz coffee and got me an iced mocha tesora. Holy hell this drink was good. I do appreciate that they used real cocoa to make the drink, and that the baristas ask their customers to taste their drink before leaving in case it needs tweaking. 

Hubby also ordered an iced Jamaican blue mountain, which I thought was nice as well,  but not $120/lb nice. 

If coffee wasn't so damn expensive, I would probably go out of my way more often to get another iced mocha tesora. Otherwise, it's a nice every-once-in-awhile treat.
author: Isabel D.

description:
The baristas at Philz go to great lengths to customize drinks to your liking, paying attention to your sweetness, creaminess, and temperature preferences.  They also never charge extra for soy instead of dairy milk.  Also, have you seen their standard-issue insulated paper cups?  These fancy yet understated cups keep drinks extra hot or cold.  

As for drinks, as a mocha lover I find the mocha tesora (with a little cream and sugar)  unparalleled.  The mint mojito iced coffee -- a souped up iced mocha with fresh mint leaves -- is also worthy of all of the hype.  These chocolatey beverages are flavored with cocoa powder, rather than the more commonly-used chocolate syrup.  The difference, though subtle, is noticeable if you prefer your drinks moderately sweet.  

Philz's version of a chai latte is also uniquely made with chai brewed from tea bags, not processed chai-flavored syrup, which gives it a rare freshness and spiciness.  

The only drawback about this Philz location is the lack of convenient parking.
author: Chris T.

description:
Mint Mojito Iced Coffee = yum!

I heard a lot about this place from friends and with hours of work ahead of me, I knew I needed to try it out. I went with the iced coffee to be adventurous and loved it. I was surprised when the barista actually reached into a pot of fresh mint leaves and ground it into my cup. The coffee itself had a lot of flavor and I was overall very happy the drink.

The only cons are the coffee packs quite a punch. Normally, during the week, I would love that boost, but there was so much caffeine that I actually got a little twitchy and it was hardy to get work done. Also, it was really hard to find a seat. I had to wait a bit and I ended up with a seat right against the wall, crawling over people to get to it, only to hear every single word of the conversation going on at one table over. Go for the coffee, not the lounge.
author: Ben W.

description:
Philz is like crack. Mint mojito is my go-to, but this time I tried Philtered Soul. Love

Parking is really difficult around this area. I paid $3 for an hour of parking at a meter. 25 cents for 5 minutes? No thanks, won't be paying for meter here anymore. But I did spend my hour wisely in the Philz seating area next door studying and people watching. Kudos to their chairs which really supported my usual poor, stooped posture when I study. Philz needs to come to the boonies of SF (aka Sunset district) where there is better parking.
author: Andrea F.

description: Only thing I am mad about is now every other coffee I have feels like a disappointment. If you want the the nectar of the gods known as Phil coffee be weary and understand that everything else after will taste like coffee for peasants.
author: Mike M.

description:
Not counting only a few desperate situations, I will only drink Philz Coffee. Nothing tastes so good, nothing makes me feel as good, and the staff is always so friendly!

4th x Berry is my Philz. Philharmonic (no cardamum, no mint, lowfat version, medium sweet) is my drink. (Ice coffee is also good- but will give you a caffeine jolt!- and I also love their chai.) It's rare I can resist a vegan donut, muffin, bean and cheese burrito, or yogurt. Also love the comfy seating and the free wifi!!!

Once you go Philz, you never go back!!!!
author: Rebecca L.

description:
First time here and I came in for some early java this morning and had the Sooo Good blend . the mint was an interesting touch for coffee, glad the Barista recommended it. In hindsight, I would have foregone sugar as the mint added a sweet touch already.

The staff was super friendly and the fresh grind & pour made for a fresh flavorful cup. I'll definitely be back.
author: Madison C.

description:
Only stopped by here once, so I can't say much for their drinks.

My boyfriend orders the Mocha Tesora, so that's pretty much all I've ever had and pretty much will be my go-to drink if I ever stop by again. It was rich and sweet, but not overly sweet.(If it weren't for this inconvenient location with lack of parking --double whammy-- I'd stop by more often)

Service seemed friendly. The only thing I noticed was they had a weird flow path when it came to ordering drinks. It was like you walk in and order at the coffee bar, but then walked down to the other side of the bar to pay, and then double back to pick up your drink. It was fine when I went because there wasn't anyone in line when I ordered, but I could see how people could be bumping into each other back and forth when it got busy. Plus with people standing in front of the bar waiting for their drinks and placing orders, I could see how confusion could arise if people standing have ordered or waiting to order.
author: Jenna H.

description: My order came out pretty well. It wasn't my first time at Philz, but my first time in a while. The employee I gave my order to was less than welcoming and felt very condescending when I stumbled through my order. It made me think about if this was how they treated all customers, even their brand new ones who are not familiar with the process of ordering. I also spilled some of my drink onto the counter, cleaning it up with no assistance from the woman who took my order, even though she was standing right in front of me. Aside from that, the lounge area adjacent to the store is nice and cozy with wifi! Overall, I wasn't having the best morning and the service here made it worse
author: Carmela Y.

description: Now I see what the hype is about.  This is a very good cup of coffee.  The barista made suggestions (since it was my first time.)  Added just the right amount of cream and sugar.  I appreciated that they cool down the coffee a bit so that I don't burn my tongue when I take that first sip.
author: David O.

description:
I wish I could give it a 5 star - and I almost think I'm rounding up from a 3.5 to be giving it a 4 star... the Mint Mojito Iced Coffee was pretty good, but it wasn't all that.

Maybe it was the hype.  I was expecting this life-altering drink that would forever convert me to Philz and make me have restless nights until I was able to fly 400 miles just to indulge in a cup.  I wasn't.

It's good, but I actually don't think I would drive out of my way, even if I was already in the city, to grab a cup.

With that said, it's definitely good.  The minty portion really added a new twist to what you would expect a coffee to taste like. On a hot summer day this would definitely hit the spot.  The coffee itself is VERY smooth and full of flavor.  Definitely quality coffee but I'm one of those fake coffee lovers that enjoys Ice Blendeds from Coffee Bean and Fraps at Starbucks.
author: Grace L.

description: Crazy long lines, somewhat rude and rushed baristas but the coffee has never ever disappointed.  I prefer the smooth nutty flavor of the ambrosia.  Every time we come to SF, Philz is a must do!
author: Megan B.

description: What is the best gourmet coffee places in San Francisco. They brew a cup at every time and that is our motto. The coffee is made from light to dark is rose depending what you like and you can choose which one you like. They will grind the beans pre order and make the coffee one cup at a time. Always fresh the best coffee around. I travel 30 minutes just to get a cup of coffee. Definitely a must try. Bon Appetit
author: Ty G.

description:
The coffee was awesome but, my customer experience was terrible. This was my first time at Philz and I was super excited. The person helping me didn't feel the same way though. He was making another coffee and we weren't sure if we were suppose to order with him or with someone else. Most places do this in an orderly fashion. 

After asking an employee where to order he proceeded to stare blankly at us and point to himself like he was annoyed to be asked something. So we started our order, I asked him for his recommendation and he mumbled something out like he was terribly upset to be helping me out. I asked him to repeat himself and I still had no idea what he said.  To get past the awkwardness I just said, "I'll have that". In hopes it would be good. 

My coffee ended up being excellent, I loved it and the pastry we purchased. I'd recommend Philz coffee but would also recommend a different location for a better experience. I want to go back and get the same thing but I still have no idea what I got. :)
author: Bryan L.

description:
I knew it was only a matter of time before I had to try the mint-mojito iced coffee. My reasoning for never trying it was that it didn't sound appetizing to me, and it didn't actually have alcohol in it (which is whole other issue).

So I took a chance and ordered a mint mojito iced coffee instead of my usual philtered soul (also a great choice). I took a skeptical sip- HOLY #&%$ that is fressshhh! It was a perfect blend of creamy, minty, and coffee-y.

So yes, I'm now a believer and one of those people who won't shut up about that mint-mojito iced coffee at Philz.
author: Justin T.

description:
Yes, the ordering process is a little confusing at first, but it's definitely worth it. I've been fortunate enough to pop in during the afternoon lull and have never caught the large crowds. :)

The staff are great! Super friendly and helpful. I've never had a bad experience here. And the coffee -- it is simply amazing. My favorite is the Ginger Snap. 

Hope to stop by more often and try more of their delicious coffee!
author: Nicole I.

description:
Refreshing is the word! It was my second visit to this place. For the first time I had ordered mint mojito and yes it's awesome. No wonder why it's everyone's fav.
For the second time I had light roast coffee called it's sooo good and boy! It was so much like its name. It has an earthy taste and it is as smooth as it can get.
