The lady made sure that I liked the coffee. 8 thought they keep creamer outside the counter like Starbucks. But no philz has its own style. They do it for you. So the lady was happy to make it creamy for me. 
The place also has a nice ambience and there shop near market street also has a sitout. There is always a big queue for placing the order. I heard their order ahead app is quite good. Would love to try that before my next visit!
author: Akshay M.

description:
Great coffee, friendly service. Iced mint mojito coffee!! 

Bought the travel mug because you get discounts on refills....but logo mostly washed away after a month. I'm sure they'll still honor it, but, sad face!
author: Rachel L.

description:
best coffee, best atmosphere, best owners, excellent staff, comfortable environ.  free wifi and power.  I am really going to miss Philz when I move to New York in May.  I will need to have them teach me to make my cup of Jacobs or Julie's Philz Way so I can order it online and try to make it myself.  

Philz Killz :)
author: dave b.

description:
-The friendliest staff! 
(i mean these people are TOO chipper in the morning, its odd!)

-Good coffee. i like the medium roast flavors. usually packed full of flavor + lots of caffeine

-Local. 'nuff said. isnt like a starbucks which is on every corner downtown. 

lastly, did i say its not like starbucks? Feels local and SF-ish.
author: Cicely T.

description:
I came here with my friend and girlfriend as we waited for a table to become available at Brenda's around the corner. This micro-brew coffee shop is inviting with the friendly staff and aroma of coffee. 

I ordered the Ambrosia Coffee of God. This particular cup was good, but a little more bitter than I like. I was able to try the Tesora which I here is their most popular flavor. I have to say the Tesora is the best tasting coffee I have ever had! When I return to San Francisco and want some coffee, I'll skip Starbucks and head over to Philz

My girlfriend got a LARGE piece of pumpkin spice bread. I enjoyed this very moist, chocolate and nut filled bread!!! One of the best pastry breads I have had in a long while.

Final Thoughts: Can wait to return! I wish we had a Philz Coffee in Monterey!
author: Anthony P.

description: Not much of a coffee drinker anymore, after the accident, but this coffee is superb! It's one of my favorite places to go. Plus, there's a panaderia right in front where you can get all of your pan dulce to go with your coffee!
author: Javier P.

description:
Whenever I have a coffee from a different place, I find myself comparing it with Philz Coffee. I'm no coffee connoisseur but to me it's so creamy ,bold, and it's got that crispy aroma. I've had the light, fruity and the more acidic ones which I like it sometimes, but I don't really feel like I drank coffee. ...but on the otherhand, Philz makes me feel like I drank a hot cup of "STFU and savor the best coffee ever!"

I had a pound of beans from another place but I ditched it and headed over to Philz. I love you Phil!
author: Yuki A.

description:
I am not a coffee snob but this is by far my favorite coffee shop of all time! My favorite drink is the mint mojito iced coffee. I have a sweet tooth so it's perfect for my taste buds!

I no longer live in San Francisco, but EVERY time I come back, I find myself back here. 

If I'm ever craving a warm coffee, I usually order myself a philtered soul.

If you like your coffee slightly sweet, ask to get your coffee "philz way".

I brought a friend from NY here. He is basically the ultimate coffee snob. He likes his coffee really bitter. One sip, and he was sold. His exact words were "This coffee makes me want to move to San Francisco."

The baristas know what they're doing. If you don't know what to order, tell them what you're feeling like and they'll throw out plenty of suggestions. After your order is made, try it and if you want them to add more cream or sugar, they'll gladly do so. 

It is slightly more expensive but you get what you pay for. 

BEST COFFEE EVER!
author: Jessica Y.

description: The mint mojito iced coffee (got mine with soy milk) is fucking amazing. Fast, free WiFi, decent amount of tables with a variety of chairs/benches in the joined cafe.
author: Matt D.

description: As a coffee lover, this is my favorite place. Tried about 6 or 7 blends and none have disappointed. Smooth, low acidity and fully flavored.
author: Zaid A.

description: I dont even drink coffee and this place is amazing. I love how you order with the barista and they make you try your drink before paying for it so you wont be disappointed.  I ordered the mint mojito ice coffee and it was amazing.
author: Donna C.

description:
The first time I came to Philz, I didn't know that I had to pick a specific blend, and so, with a giant line forming behind me, the barista asked me what I wanted. I panicked and just said the first thing I saw, the Philz Harmonic. 

I'm glad I did, because even after having gone back and tried other flavors, the Philz Harmonic is still my favorite to order, as well as to say aloud. I love taking it black, because it's got this spicy, almost chai-like quality to it that makes it super flavorful without being bitter.
author: Anna H.

description: I LOOOOVE Philz Coffee! I drink it almost everyday at work! The workers are nice and they try to be as quick as possible. At first i was like "EHHH its so over rated" but more and more I started drinking the more and more I was hooked!  Philz is one of my favorite places to go in SF.
author: Tiffany C.

description:
This place is the bees knees, for real.

How refreshing to not have some lame dress code. Why some companies think all black or everyone with a certain color hat/apron on is somehow more appealing I do not know. "How can we go about erasing any sense of individuality from our employees? We'd really like them to all look like replicated drones, lets start by making them all dress the same." WHACK. Employees here seem to be able to wear what they please, so chill.

On to the drinks I'm not usually one for fancy pants options. When I get booze, it's whiskey or gin/tonic. When I get coffee, I get coffee. Yet here I am at Philz eying up the Mint Mojito Iced Coffee. I give it a whirl and my god man, I've been missing out! Mint for my coffee going forward, no exceptions.

Niceness level of the staff is off the charts. Generally I find two options for baristas: pretentious or completely uninvolved and vacant. Here though I was greeted right after walking in and the guy was so happy to chat about the Mint Mojito Iced Coffee I almost wanted to order three. Lots of mint? He'd be happy to do it! Prefer only a little sugar? No problem, he's all over it! Just so damn cheery and helpful.

I had no idea this little gem was just a block away from my pad, right on Van Ness near Civic Center. If you're in the hood come get your mint iced coffee on.
author: Justin N.

description:
MINT MOJITO ICED COFFEE.. thats all you need to know.

i have never tasted anything like it and im still thinking about it..
author: Jenny F.

description:
Philz coffe speaks for itself. Amazing. 

I've been going daily to this location for about 6 months and love the baristas here. They don't kiss your a** and bow to you the second you walk in so if you're used to being treated like the royalty you aren't, then you might be offended. Each barista is super kind and really interesting if you speak with them and even more importantly, they know their coffee!
author: Sean H.

description:
I like me some large anesthesia or ambrosia (no sugar, no cream)  on a weekday and a mint mojito or mocha tesora (light sugar, light cream) on the weekends.

I swear, you are not going to buy another Starbucks coffee once you taste a Philz coffee extraordinaire.
author: J M.

description:
Big fan of Philz! Love how they make every cup fresh. The people here are incredible and their service is great!

I come here every time I visit SF!
author: Jen M.

description:
Philz Coffee is an amazing place! The staff is very professional and the greetings are warm and friendly! The atmosphere is excellent. I love this place!
My new morning coffee shop!
author: Darnell H.

description: Best way to start the morning is at Philz! I lovvvvve the iced Arabic - iced soo good and green tea. I usually switch between those three. I've been coming to Philz for about seven months each morning unless I'm running late. After I've had my Philz I'm ready to take on the day. I love that they actually brew the tea instead of just putting a tea bag in the cup like every other place does -- that's not how you make a proper cup of tea.
author: Allie M.

description:
After having been to Philz in the Southbay, I was excited to try the one in SF. I am no coffee connoisseur and consider myself  to be a noob level coffee drinker. What I liked about Philz was the abundant selection of coffees - light, medium roasted, dark. Each category had its own unique blends and flavor notes. I was particularly impressed by the Mocha Tesoro - the rich chocolate flavor is the first note you get upon tasting. While it's listed under the dark roast category, the coffee itself is smooth and rich tasting and very much for the chocolate lover in anyone. I couldn't recommend that one more!

The ambiance inside Philz was warm and relaxed. The staff behind the counter were really nice and personable. They def know their coffee there! Highly, highly recommended.
author: Jennifer N.

description: Masha rocks - she's nice, fun, timely and always makes the coffee perfect. She also is on point with the OrderAhead too!
author: Ryan M.

description:
Once we reached Van Ness Ave, we knew the long line out the door had to be Philz Coffee. 

The coffee was a much needed pick-me-up! Thanks Yelpers for helping me select the mint mojito iced coffee and mocha tesora! I would love to come back and check out the rest of the coffee selection! 

I wish we had a Philz Coffee in Southern California!
author: Judy H.

description: Coffee is not that great and a had the worst experience with a barista. I'm going back to Starbucks! Not worth my time and money!
author: Maritza B.

description: Honestly if you're having a crappy day, come in, get greeted or a laid back batista who cares. Order your coffee , just pick one, it doesn't matter , they all are simply amazing .light cream light sugar ... or light plus on both for a smidge more... leave, consume coffee, be  in a much better mood to conquer the world ahead of u.
author: Miss J.

description:
Definitely some of the best coffee out there!

This location is a lot more mellow compared to the Berkeley location. Staff is still super friendly. Drinks are delicious as well. Location is closer to the end of Van Ness, which might explain the quietness. Parking is doable, especially if you circle a couple of times or park a block away.

Soooo Good and Tesora are my favorites so far. There are so many choices! Also can't go wrong with a Mint Mojito.
author: Elaine H.

description: I was so excited to try the mint coffee but was so disappointed it wasn't minty enough :( The coffee tasted fantastic though. The line moved fast and service was good. The gingerbread coffee was so good.
author: Catalina V.

description:
Friendly,  great service,  good system.  Quality,  strong coffee. Usually I drink my coffee dark and the medium is good enough. I had a buttery nut combination (forgot the name) and my husband had the turkish dark roast.  We both had it without sugar. It was both very good,  but the downside if this place is it does take quite awhile to get your drink and the food selection is mediocre.  The pastries are all served cold too. 

I would recommend it.
author: Katherine F.

description:
I will keep it short and sweet with a friendly warning: do not come here unless you are prepared to be hooked on Philtered coffee - really.  

POISON/PROBLEM/WHAT THEY DO:

(1) carry (almost) all of my favorite beans including: Sumatra, Ethiopian, Brazilian Dark and that liquid gold: Jamaican Blue Mountain.  This means that they probably have your favorites too. 

(2) let you watch your cup slow drip  - it's really not that slow though.  Ok, there is only one table and two chairs in there - so you actually have to stand and watch, or move to the lounge.

(3) put cream in it - real cream and ask you if you like it slightly, medium or real sweet.  it's sweet enough with a drop of cream.  Cream + coffee...

(4) ice anything you want even though not everything should be iced ie Turkish [just get the Ecstatic]

(5) Ecstatic iced coffee - I could drink this all day.  It's a blend of like gazillion coffees - seriously the most complex cup to cross my palate -  it was like revisiting every country I've ever traveled to and drinking my favorite beans all over again.  Apparently, it will never taste the same on a different day, because they blend it differently - daily.  When I finished, I just wanted more - super glad this place is pretty far from me.

(6) Separate Study Lounge from the coffee bar - so you don't obsess over the constant dripping.   It's like they know a few doors between you and the bar won't stop you from drinking as much caffeine as your body will tolerate.

TIP: if you like bold flavors that leave your mouth feeling like smooth chocolate - get Jacob's Wonderbar! Or, the Mocha Tesor.

Sorry not so short after-all - maybe it's the caffeine?
author: Rayna A.

description:
I appreciate a good cup of coffee .... ever since i tried Philz in Berkeley off Shattuck, nothing compares anymore, LOL .. 

Out of everything, my favorite is the Mint Mojito -- iced or hot, but iced is definitely better.

I enjoy the ambiance, the employees, the style of coffee brewing -- i love Philz so much i buy the beans and brew em up at home myself since i'm located too far from one! :(

Philz is one of those guilty pleasures that i never really and honestly ever feel guilty about .... ;) So worth the drive to Berkeley!
author: Rachael D.

description:
I don't like the hipster way that they make you order your drink and pay, or vice versa. I thought I was the only idiot that was confused, but thankfully there was a whole line behind me that was confused as well. 

Anyway, you guys are lucky that your mint mojito is so darn good because I wouldn't give this place any less than 5 stars for it. Thank you for making every other coffee that isn't yours taste... Meh.

(If you're reading mom, your coffee is still the best.)
author: Charmaine A.

description: Taking off a star because the set up is a bit confusing and the place looked a little dirty.  I walked here from my hotel in Marina/Cow Hollow (a 5 mile round-trip) as I'd read that the coffee is great. I ordered an Aztec Mocha (coffee with Bittersweet Cocoa Powder) and asked them to add a little almond milk. The coffee was awesome. Like, "mmm" inducing awesome every single sip. It was a little cooler than I prefer but I consider myself a newbie and had I known the almond milk would cool the coffee so much I would have ordered it "extra hot". Well, now I know. I really hope I get to return to Philz someday. The Mint Mojito Coffee looks amazing as well. My husband also got the Aztec Mocha no milk and really enjoyed it. We agreed there's definitely some sugar in the cocoa powder as the drink was moderately sweet.
author: Amanda Z.

description:
Consistency is key for coffee shop chains. When I go to Starbucks and I order a coffee, it should taste like the same coffee I ordered 5 months ago at a Starbucks 3,000 miles away. So tell me why I ordered mint mojito iced coffees from this same location in the same week (made by 2 different baristas) and they tasted so different? 

The guy barista makes it exactly how I like it. Strong coffee flavor, sweet and he crushes the mint so that the whole drink has the minty flavor incorporated into every sip. Now they have this chick back there, who made it and it tasted like watery garbage. Not sweet at all, minty to the point of herbal medicine, and watery to boot. I asked her to remake my drink since it didn't taste right and although she was sweet about it, the second time was just as bad! I wanted to say, "Excuse me, can you get your other coworker to make it? Because whenever you make it, it tastes like I paid $5 for a cup of brown herbal water." 

Worst part was that I was bragging about how good their mint mojito iced coffees were and my two friends with me were definitely not impressed. Retrain your female barista. In fact, get the tall Caucasian urban dressed guy barista to retrain her before you lose customers. I wish I had bigger cojones and refused to accept the 3 drinks she made.
author: Vanessa T.

description: After hearing many good reviews from my friends regarding this place, we decided to give it a try. It was close to our hotel and it looked like all of them needed some awakening coffee. I ordered the hot cacao and it was great! It didn't taste like hot chocolate. It wasn't sweet or creamy. Rather, it was rich and dark. My boyfriend ordered an espresso and man, it was strong. Not my taste, but that's because I am not a coffee drinker. My friend ordered the mint mojito and it was refreshing!!! They actually put a mint in it. The only draw back was that it was iced. It was already cold in SF, I didn't need a cold drink to warm me up. In all, I liked all of the drinks we ordered at Philz.
author: Jenifer L.

description:
I'll be completely honest, I don't necessarily know that the service is any better or worse than any other coffee shop - then again maybe I just didn't notice because I'm more of a "get in, get out" kinda girl especially during busy mornings where it seems like the whole world wants to get coffee at the same time - but I do know that this is some incredibly good coffee, and well deserving of all the high rating it's been getting, which piqued my curiosity in the first place. 

That said, the service I got today was quick, efficient and to the point. Just the way I like it. 

"Who needs to order?" 
I do. 
I'd like a small Mint Mojito iced coffee please.
 "Cream and sugar okay?" 
Yeah. 

Fantastic, and so was the mocha my other girlfriend got. This is really good coffee and I'm not gonna lie, I'm glad there isn't one within reasonable distance of either my residence or my job because I'm sure I'd be back trying something different at least once a week. 

But if I happen to be near one, it's definitely a must-have in the future! ;)
author: Aivy C.

description:
I swear they put crack in your coffee, it is THAT good.  Philz is my go-to spot for a work day pick-me up. The coffee here is brewed by the cup to your liking.

You can't really go wrong with any of the medium roast coffees.  If you are a Philz newbie and looking for a good cup o' joe, try the Tesora, Itz the Best, Philz Harmonic, New Manhattan.  I'll be honest, I can't really tell one from the other, but have enjoyed all of these!

If you aren't big on coffee or want to change things up, try the iced mojito.  They  add fresh mint leaves to your cup, making it a refreshing and delicious beverage.

Tip #1: Once you know what you want, order from a barista first, THEN pay at the cash register.

Tip #2: Bring your own cup and they will charge you for a small.

Tip #3: You can request "low fat" versions of your coffee and they will use less sugar and low fat milk in lieu of cream.

The baristas are always friendly and will always ask you to try out your coffee to make sure it is to your liking.

In my book, Philz coffee is giving Blue Bottle a run for their money!
author: Matt S.

description:
Food: 3/5- The coffee here is good, but if you're an espresso person, I recommend going to Blue Bottle.  Also, the place seem to be suited more towards folks who enjoy their coffee flavored (mint, sugar, etc.).

Service: 4/5- Friendly and relatively quick.

Environment: 3/5- The brewing and pick up area is small, it's a bit awkward and clumsy to wait for your brew.

Value: 3/5- Average price for your cup of joe. 

Return again?: No.  I'm a Blue Bottle fanboy.
author: Jin L.

description:
Hello Mr. Philz,

Thank you for having one of the best darn coffees ever.  
You got me obsessed with mint everything due to your mint mojito coffee.  It never fails me on a cold day.  I will order the hot mint mojito coffee.  On a hot day, I will order the iced mint mojito coffee.  On a warm day, I will order both!  

The cup itself makes me happy because I know what glorious coffee it can store.  
I hope you expand further and take over Starbucks.  It would be great to see Philz in every block, internationally.  Oh, can you please?  I wouldn't mind part owning it either. Call me.  

Truly yours,
Philz Phan Phorever
author: Grace P.

description:
I was skeptical of Philz because I had already tried Blue Bottle and we all know about Blue Bottle.

I needed a place to work on a project as well as feed my caffeine fix. A friend recommended Philz. They have this small to medium sized room separate from where you get your coffee that had just tables and chairs for people to read, go online, be productive, etc. I had no idea what to order so I "settle" with their Iced Coffee. The baristas (is that what they're called?) were very friendly and seemed to take their time making each beverage. I take a sip of mine and the first thought that popped into my head was, "I have never...ever...had an iced coffee...this good in my life."

My only gripe is that parking isn't the best and I ended up paying $9 to park for 3 hours right in front.

I am a fan and can't wait to come back to try other items on their menu!
author: David P.

description:
I'll be honest--I drink espresso more often than I drink drip coffee.  If I had to pick a coffee myself, I'd be completely lost.  Thankfully, I can rely on the wonderful staff of Philz to choose for me.  The whole team is great.  They know their stuff, they're willing to share info and they genuinely want you to get a cup of coffee you'll enjoy.  If you speak up and explain what you like and what you're in the mood for, they'll find something to suit you. 

You won't find espresso, syrups, or oddly fancy coffee concoctions at Philz, but you will find a huge variety of quality honest brews that are crafted one cup at a time, just for you!
author: Helene O.

description:
Not only does Philz have the best coffee around, Philz also has the best customer service -- as good as it gets!

A ton of high quality roasts -- and the baristas are super knowledgeable but still so down-to-earth. I told the barista that I wanted a medium-dark roast with little acidity or fruitiness, and he recommended Jacob's Wonderbar to me -- an excellent choice. Smooth, bold and dark. Freshly ground with just a little bit of soy milk. Perfect.

Long lines are the only downside but a place so good is never going to be able to avoid that.

This is THE quintessential coffee shop. This is how good coffee should be served and enjoyed - by and with friendly people, with little snobbery or pretentiousness.
author: Natalie S.

description:
I love this location! I come all the time. Kel (the girl with the funky fro) is almost always working when I come in and always hooks up the best Jacobs ever. I get so excited when I see her behind the counter because I know she will hook it up right! 

The other employees are great too! Of course the coffee is the best as well. 

Go see Kel (the only and best fro at philz) and tell her what up!
author: Joshua J.

description: Mint! Different and Yum!  Although very good I couldn't give five stars since it's not the best above the rest but definitely on the list of good coffees. They either need to expand locations or I need to visit SF more so I can keep going and trying more drinks and give that next star.
author: Chelle P.

description: Meh. I'm not sure why, but Philz wasn't doing it for me. I suppose the disorganized layout played a hand. A mint coffee drink where the mint was barely noticeable didn't help. Nor did serving an iced drink in a paper cup. That feels weird. There is so much good coffee in SF, Philz seems to be the "better than Starbucks" option that's readily available in a lot of parts of the city if you can't get to your favorite crafty place.
author: Joe A.

description:
First time trying Philz last week. Great customer service, delicious coffee.

Would recommend trying the iced mint mojito!
author: Kimberly H.

description:
How long as Philz Coffee been around and how is it that I have not heard about it?  My BF and I wandered into the one at this location a couple of weeks ago, after hearing other people raving about it, and decided to get a cup of the stuff.  

I couldn't make up my mind, so the nice young lady behind the counter made a suggestion (after I told her I liked hazelnut & vanilla) to go with the Philtered Soul blend.  

Did it live up to the hype?  Hells yes it did!  Other people like their Blue Bottle or even Starbucks or whatever.  And yes, there are plenty of great coffee shops in SF, but my heart now belongs to Philz.

I immediately bought a 1 pound bag for $16.95. I'm almost out, so I guess it's a good thing I'm going back to SF in a couple of weeks.  It doesn't taste as good when I make it on my own...so that's kind of disappointing.  Maybe next time, they will teach me how to make a decent cup of coffee myself.
author: Grace C.

description: I am a Philz fan from the very first time I had a cuppa down in San Jose. This branch is one of the better ones ( but there are really no bad ones). I like how theres enough chairs to sit, and the availability of wifi and sockets for people who need to do work, as well as sofas for people who want to chill and talk and work tables for people who want to study.
author: Sara N.

description:
I wish I could remember the day that I went to Philz to order a panini...it was an awful and awkward experience.  My boyfriend and I decided to order coffee and sit on the other side of this location and order a panini.  The guy that made our panini was soooo miserable.  He looked, and acted, as if he hated his job and his life.  He was in the middle of cleaning something and when we were ready to order he looked really annoyed that we were interrupting his cleaning.  He didn't speak much, looked lifeless, and didn't respond to my "thank you."  I thought maybe it was the day - maybe this guy had a really bad day...maybe he bought an ice cream cone earlier and his solo scoop of ice cream fell off onto the pavement after he licked it.  I dunno...wanted to give him the benefit of the doubt....but...I went on another day to Philz to have coffee and another panini and that SAME GUY was there to take my order...and I got the same terrible treatment.  He makes me dislike paninis. 

If I were to put this incident aside...and rate this place purely on coffee, and not customer service, is a definite 5 stars!  I love Philz coffee and it makes me really happy.  The mint mojito is a favorite and a special treat (creamy and sweet).  I do enjoy Philtered Soul, Tesora, and the Blue Mountain (super buttery and oily - yum!) when it comes to hot coffee.  The Estatic Iced Coffee is also delicious on a hot day.

I miss the old Philz crew that worked there from 2010 - 2012.  To the Van Ness Philz workers from 2010-2012: you are missed!  If you still work there...I haven't seen you in a while and look forward to one of you making my coffee!  Hope all is well!
author: Tara K.

description: Mint mojito! That's the only item you need to try it's very unique with the fresh mint they add to your cup. So creamy and delicious can cure and needed caffeine needed for the day. I wish I lived closer it would be my local coffee shop I would probably visit every day. Every time I'm in the city I have to stop by!
author: Ryan L.

description: ICED MINT MOJITO! Enough said. I've never had such a thing and it was amazing! I love coffee, and this gave me that and the refreshment of a mint mojito. Crazy right! The cafe is pretty small with maybe 4 seats if I recall and staff was friendly :)
author: Sarah R.

description:
You kind of can't beat the selection at Philz. I just wish the enlisted Portlandia cast would figure out how to toast my dang chicken provence! #arabica #cacáo 

P.S. Mocha Tesora est Wunderbar!

Sincerely,

Chef Cannon
author: Billy C.

description:
I'm not a coffee drinker, but their iced coffee made me feel as ecstatic as it claimed.  Some of the customers think they must put crack or something that makes it so addictive and good.  Whatever it is, it does a great job of picking you and your day up.

Service is fast, friendly, and helpful.  They ask you to try each drink before you pay to ensure satisfaction.  The decor is that of a simple, clean coffee shop with a few seats to lounge around.  Parking can be tough on the street, but it's a great place to stop to and from the movies or places to eat.
author: Jenny L.

description:
It doesn't get any better than a large Jacobs, sweet and creamy. I'll sometimes get an Iced Ecstatic or Mint Mijito (sweet and creamy, of course)... but my obsession always brings me back to my true love: Jacobs. 

Also, it doesn't hurt that the baristas are SUPER nice and always make sure you're in love with your drink. 

Drink it. 
Often. 
It's a party-in-your-mouth!
author: Lezlee C.

description:
This is coffee preciousness taken too far. Here's what a large coffee will cost you. 

1. A confusing trip between multiple counter stations. If you haven't ordered here before, there's no way of figuring it out on your own.

2. A lecture from the barista about handcrafted, individually poured coffee. 

3. A ten-minute wait while your coffee is hand crafted. 

4. No fixin's. Sugar and cream are applied behind the counter by the barista. They apply. You try. Setting up a nice back and forth as they try to get your level of cream and sugar right. 

5. Oh yeah, then there's the tab. $3.75. Almost double Peets. 

Decent coffee. But not worth the 2x price, the time and the overall, over-artisanation of a morning staple.
author: Chris H.

description:
I have been waiting to come here for some time, especially after hearing so many rave reviews over there coffee. So after an amazing breakfast at Brenda's, Daniel and I headed on over to Philz for a cup of Joe.

This place is small but cute. I was immediately impressed with the selection of coffee and how they freshly brew there coffee. There was a vast selection to choose from. I'm a dark French roast type of girl, so the super friendly barista suggested a special dark roast type called the jacob, I ordered a small soy cafe au late with x tra foam and 2 splenda, Daniel ordered some sort of iced coffee with soy.

Before making my drink, the barista gave me a selection of soy to choose from (I chose Vanilla) he even added my special truvia sweetener in it before making! When the barista finished my drink he made sure it was exactly how I prefer, he even asked if I would prefer to have more soy of foam! They really go out of there way to make sure you are satisfied! Man I wish they had one close by where I live! Super Impressive!!

My drink was great! Coffee was strong and had a good flavor. I really appreciate how they go out of there way to satisfy you and are so upbeat and friendly, it really creates a positive atmosphere that keeps you coming back. The one complaint I would say is that there was not a counter space to put your coffee and add condiments and the place is a little small. Other than that the coffee was solid with good flavor  the service was top notch, I will definitely be back when I'm in the area!!
author: Shannon H.

description:
Boy after writing so many 3 star reviews I feel almost bitter!

Fortunately I did have some fantastic experience! Here we go.

I am a complete coffee snob and on average have 6 different kinds of coffee beans at my work desk, and another 10 at home.

And then-- I met my match!

People at Philz pride themselves on their beans, their passion and no comparison of their uniqueness with every other commercialized coffee shops, not even BB.

You walk in seeing other snobs with their laptops/netbooks or other invisible-wire devices, and a couple with a real book (no "feminine" iPad!!)

Then you walk up, not to the registrar to get a coffee, but to get lost on the phenomenal chalkboard of coffee making styles. You look down, you will get even more lost because this is not a coffee shop, it is a mini-coffee bean world, my beloved bean world, but not a bean counter.

I am almost in shock jaw-dropping when they said they have 33 different kind of beans!!!!! Their beans are uniquely crafted. I was so snobbish I could not pick up my iPhone to take a picture of it, because I had a distinct feeling the server would hate it. He probably would even be upset now that I am writing so much about it.

So the sharp server looked at me intently, asking what kind of flavors I like after positively pointing out I have never been to a Philz, in which I replied dark roast, flavorful, non-earthy, full bodied. He gave me a much more approving look upon knowing I know my beans. He distinctly knew and picked Jacob's Wonderbar.

Yes, he scooped the BEANS, grind-ed just for 1 cup, and dripped it individually. Since I like it darker, he put in more beans.

The heaven-sent drink had the proper tiny foam bubbles at the top, in which I closed my eyes and enjoyed it in divine. The server then asked whether it was EXACTLY what and the way I wanted, whether I needed it stronger, a different flavor or any other improvement. In which I replied, it's a perfect Saturday afternoon drink. If you don't like the drink, they will make another one.

Then I paid. The person, as I just looked at the website just now, I think is Phil?

I was not in a coffee shop, I was in coffee heaven! Now we are really talking about coffee. And I am worshiping!

I feel much better now with this 5 rock star review!
author: T L.

description:
Have them brew you a cup of coffee here and it will not disappoint, in fact its one of the best cups in town... if you really want a wow, take some whole beans to go. Learn to brew yourself at home and you'll get a better more consistent cup of coffee then any coffee house can make.

"Jacob's wonderbrew" is a great choice is you are looking for a rich full body brew.
"Soooo good" is you are looking for something lighter but be warned, this one has a caffein kick that will keep you up.

Friendly and knowledgable staff that will answer all your coffee related questions. 

Be sure you order your coffee first and pay second or you could be waiting much longer.
author: Brian T.

description: If a tree Philz in the forest, and nobody is there to hear it, does it make a ground?
author: Sabrina M.

description: I recently went in to get coffee here with a  friend. It was early morning and I had never been in this place before so I was unaware of where you order and where you pay.  It took a while to get my order for just coffee but when I asked for my coffee the woman behind the counter said sort of rudely "Are you going to pay for it first?"  I was quote shocked by the attitude I was given.  Not a place I want to go to anymore.
author: Russ L.

description:
Okay, can we please start building these everywhere instead of Starbucks?!

Philz is, simply put, fantastic. Their slogan is "one cup at a time" and it couldn't be more true; each cup of coffee is made by hand using individual pours and crafted exactly how you like. Every time. The baristas are always friendly and happy to help you find the best fit for what you're in the mood for that day. If you're not a coffee drinker, no fear! They have tons of teas and other drinks to choose from. One day I came in looking for something hot and un-caffeinated, and one of the baristas somehow convinced me to try their chamomile tea. A pretty boring choice I thought (and she really had to twist my arm to order it), but It was absolutely AMAZING. Creamy, fresh and full of tea flavor with all the richness of a latte. Their mint mojito iced coffee is outrageous, too! It's also garnished with fresh mint - yum. 

This is a great spot with a great vibe (they even have a little room alongside with wifi, plugs and tables), and some of the most unique and well-crafted coffee drinks I've ever seen. Love this place!
author: Sarah S.

description:
Heard the rave reviews and tried their coffee twice at two different locations. I got the ambrosia the first time and the iced coffee (number 6 I think) the second time. I wasn't too impressed by the coffee...maybe my expectations were too high when they told me "each cup is personally made to each customer's preferences." I was expecting to have my taste buds blown away...and they weren't.

The baristas were friendly in all, but then again I didn't meet any mean people in SF.
author: Judy H.

description: Turkish coffee here blew my mind.   Between Philz and Blue Bottle, SF has got some great coffee spots worth checking out.   Baristas were quite helpful too, considering my nub status.  Absolutely loved the coffee here.
author: Dave C.

description:
I don't know how you did it, Philz, but you did.  I HATE coffee.  It's bitter and gross and gives people terrible breath.  But holy crap, the Mint Mojito was DELICIOUS.  I was in the city for my engagement photo shoot and my makeup artist recommended this place to me after I said my fiance has a love affair with coffee.  I know nothing about coffee but I like the whole concept of the place and how they brew it.  My fiance had the Philtered Soul and he said it was equally delicious.  

OMG Mint Mojito.  I'm going to need to get one everytime I come to the Bay Area.
author: Stephanie M.

description:
A few things....

(1) Customer service is DA BOMB! Like, I don't even know how to describe how awesome they are (but I will try). After giving my two cents about the taste of my "latte" in my previous review, the wonderful people at Philz contacted me and apologized. They didn't have to, but they did. Not only were they very apologetic, they even offered to send me a gift card so I can give them another chance. I was like, "Sure, why not?" and they suggested I try the Iceed mint mojito since it's more of a latte drinker's palate.

Today, I went in with my gift card, ordered two iced mint mojito lattes and something called a chicken provane (probably really off on the name) and I was WOWED. Which comes to...

(2) The drink was fantastic. It was unique. It had a nice blend of the latte that I'm very much used to drinking with a kick of mint. The chicken provane was delightful. It's like a french puffy pastry with chicken, cheese, and some other sauce. It's pretty much like a pita pocket. REALLY DELISCIOUS. Yeah, I'm still thinking about it after eating it an hr or two later.

and lastly,

(3) again, the customer service was A++. The guys here are really unbelievable. I bet, if they could give every customer a hug, they probably would. They go way beyond; really making sure you are happy with your drink. Even the last time I was here and had that awful "latte", they were super nice. 

Anyway, to sum everything up...YES, I WOULD COME BACK AGAIN (mainly for that chicken provane that really got me falling in love with this place).
author: Lily W.

description:
Walked in & was just a LIL confused with the menu :)

Me: Ummm...just give me the strongest you got.
Him: Get the Ecstatic, stronger than anything you've had.
Friend: Oooo, give me one too!
Me: Yea, sounds good! It sounds crazy! I like it..

The barista was super nice, asked exactly how sweet we wanted it, and how much milk to add, then waited to see if it was perfect or not.  When I got my coffee it was delicious! Very smooth, strong, and just a lil sweet.  My new coffee spot! $3.25 for a Large, makes me think....Starbucks? Who? Yea, I don't know that place anymore.  Now I just need to make my way down here more often.  The coffee shop is a bit small, but the unique coffee makes up for it all.

Definitely can't wait to try a Mint Mojito!
author: Christina O.

description:
- Had some Great Chai Tea @ Philz
- They have a separate sitting room which is nice and mellow
-  Service was friendly and speedy

2 thumbs up for Philz
author: Joey F.

description: The hype about Philz is real. Gingersnap iced coffee, where have you been my whole life? Not too coffee-y and not too gingersnap-y. And the girl working was the one who suggested it when we asked what kind of iced coffees they have -- you da real MVP, gurl.
author: Jonny A.

description: Good coffee shop if you want to chose from a wide selection of coffee and take it to go. Less than average quality speciality drinks and not the type of place to sit and enjoy your drink. They don't offer your drink in a glass or mug and limited sitting with aweful ambiance.
author: Greg W.

description: Friendly Service - Nice Menu - a bit pricey but different feel & nice atmosphere.  Ordered an Istanbul Cream Tea with Mint Leaves! Their menu was quite extensive & their coffee's looked really lovely. I'd like to try them sometime. What I liked about Philz Coffee was how happy every customer seemed with their Drinks. Everyone seemed pleasantly surprised and left with a bit of spark in their eye which a nice change of pace from the likes of Starbucks & Peet's. Philz seems more like a place you want to have coffee and sit down with someone and have a nice conversation or read a book or do some writing. It feels more about taking time out to enjoy every sip and not rush in and out. Their pastries are self serve and in a case of their own which was great too! I love that they have fresh mints and herbs and ingredients and I can't wait to try more beverages from their menu!
author: Julian I.

description:
Finally got to try the Iced Mojito Coffee drink. Delicious. I will definitely be back for more of that stuff. 

Boy liked his coffee. That's all.
author: Nina Y.

description: The mojito iced coffee is probably the best drink I've ever had... I'd even chose it over a real mojito.  Yes, it's THAT good.
author: Audrey K.

description: Just got treated to the Jamaican Blue Mountain coffee.  So money but so tasty!  Wish it could be part of my daily morning routine.  You can taste the different layers and notes!  No joke!
author: Dorothy L.

description:
Turkish coffee.

Amazing. 

Coming back for easily acquired, no hassle, superior coffee. Can't beat fresh brewed.
author: Steven H.

description:
#Mint #Mojito #Iced #Coffee.

Lines out the door for this location.  I usually get the mint mojito ice coffee and the rest is history.  They also have a sizable lounge area on the other side of Philz which is great!  I see people work and chill there.  I feel such a hipster drinking Philz coffee.  #Philz  #hipster #coffee
author: Elliot Y.

description: Loved the Mint Mojito Iced coffee! I'm definitely coming back to try the rest of their menu!
author: Lauren H.

description:
Thanks a lot Philz, you've got me hooked on coffee. Now I'm dependent, and if I don't have an iced coffee to start my day, I'm gonna be a groggy grinch. I will even drive the longer route to work so I can stop by and get some. 

This is the Philz I frequent most. I'm not a serious coffee connoisseur, and before this I rarely drank coffee. So drinking iced coffee all the time is a big step for me. Everyone recommends the Mint Mojito Iced Coffee, but I consider that the gateway drink to get you hooked. Once you can move past that, try the Ecstatic Iced Coffee and you'll see why I'm back here at least twice a week. You can also make any of the other roasts into the iced version.

The staff here are super rad and they're all very laid-back and knowledgeable about the coffees.
author: Helen Z.

description: Mint mojito iced coffee was fantastic! Service was awesome also! Loved the atmosphere and all the coffee
author: Sharon P.

description: Good coffee to warm your bones on a chilly SF day.  We went to the Castro district shop with my brother in law, it was some of the best coffee I've ever had. The beans were roasted nicely and the slow drip method is worth the wait!
author: Jess C.

description:
Philz is my favorite coffee branch in San Francisco. Fact uncontested. 

Always get your coffee with a little bit of cream (and sugar). They use manufacturing cream, which has a high fat content and makes the coffee delightfully buttery. 

My absolute favorite is the mocha tesora. Imagine a hot fudge-brownie sundae in liquid form. If you have a low tolerance for sugar, ask the barista to use less cocoa powder. If you like mint-flavored anything, definitely try the Mint Mojito iced coffee. They overload it with ice cubes so you want to ask for easy ice.

Almost everything I have had here has been amazing, with the exception of Anesthesia. Philz also has some of my favorite bagel sandwiches in the neighborhood. I do not, however, recommend the overpriced (vegan) cookies. 

Recommended blends: Philtered Soul, Sooo Good, Jacob's
author: Shan F.

description:
I love this place....

Love love love...

Philtered soul & everything bagel / twice toasted with cream cheese!
author: Teena Marie T.

description:
Yes, the mint mojito is fresh and yummy!
I don't think any other coffee drinks are much better than anywhere else though. Stick to their exciting creation. You will have a good time with that.
author: Genevieve G.

description:
Why have I not heard of Philz before? I mean even living in the East Bay I'm familiar with many SF addictions and hot spots, or I guess I thought I was.

Yes, I'm a coffee addict
Yes, this is my first time at Philz
Yes, I wish Philz was near me
Yes, I will be back at every chance I get...that means this weekend: SCORE!

So Philz , I do believe that your coffee is amazing, and I think each one of your coffee pushers deserves a medal for how they are so meticulous, and quick might I add, with each person's order. Thank you for that! Definitely made my first time experience an AHmazing one.

Not a big fan of mint, okay I lie, I don't like mint really, so I didn't get the much anticipated Mint Mojito. However, I heard it's top notch. I did get the Mocha Tesora (iced) and let me tell you that I did not just love it, I devoured it! True story. My friend looked over at me and she said "you're done already?" The funny part is, I didn't even realize it until I was getting just air. Yes, it was that wonderful! 

You better believe this will be a regular stop!
author: Tyree G.

description:
When we moved to San Francisco I decided to stop wearing a watch. I had worn a watch for 40 years but why did I need a watch? People in San Francisco don't wear watches. I carried an iPhone wherever I went. I didn't need a watch to tell the time. I would just look at my iPhone.
  
Yesterday Anna wanted to get up at 6:30 so she had time for a shower before school. I usually set the alarm in my iPhone. But my power was low and I had to charge the iPhone. Fortunately I had downloaded an alarm app on my iPad that could do the same thing.  I was so iConnected. I set the alarm in my iPad and put it next to my iBed. iSlept.

I awoke with the clock flashing 6:00 AM. It was dark outside and the deep rumble of the foghorn made my bones vibrate. I went to the kitchen. I made a pot of strong coffee - I was drinking something menacingly deep from Philz's called "Ether" - and drank a cup. I read the morning news on my iPad.

At 6:30 I went up and tried to wake Anna but she begged for another 15 minutes. I went back to the kitchen. I had another cup of Ether. At 6:45 I started back upstairs. Odd that it was so dark. The foghorn was still moaning so we must be really socked in today. I got to Anna's room and sat on the edge of her bed. She hadn't moved - Wow, she was really sleeping hard. I hated to wake her. I put my hand on her shoulder and gave her a shake. But then I noticed her clock - it said 3:45. 

I went back to the other room and grabbed my iPad. It said 6:45. I went upstairs and found my iPhone, now fully charged. It agreed with Anna's clock. I realized what had happened. I hadn't moved the time forward on the iPad; it was still East Coast time. Here it was 3:45 in the morning and now I had drunk 2 cups of Ether. 

Sure got a jump on the day.
author: Jay D.

description: The worst service ever. I waited for a simple mint tea for 15 min!!! 15 min for a tea!!! They saw me waiting, they even didn't try to tell me how long will it take. About 10 people got their coffee while I was waiting for a tea. I asked three times where is my tea. Got an answer: it's coming. When sked second time, the guy was already rude. After asking third time, he told me he'll call me in a very rude manner. And after two more minutes my baby woke up and I had to run immediately. But then the guy called. He even didn't try to help me give a cup (he wasn't busy at this moment). I grabbed the cup. It was hot! And without a lid. The cup was so hot, I couldn't hold it. My baby cried and I had to run out and just threw it. Thank you very much:(! I'm never coming back.
author: Anna K.

description: Very unfriendly barista - by Philz standards! I'm used to the great customer service at the Philz in the financial district. There they usually ask how much cream or sugar you would like and ask you if it's made to your liking. This one didn't. The barista was moody. They were not even busy. Maybe she was having an off day.
author: Zara Y.

description: Totally average- definitely some quality control is required in this location. I've always gone to the original location and regret having the coffee at this more conveniently located Philz. This is certainly not the same product.
author: Muna T.

description: Dependably delicious!  Personal service, and its perfect every time!
author: D G.

description:
Used to love Philz, but they just raised their prices...  Regular $3, Large $4, LB $16.  Yeah it's nice and simple now with the uniform pricing, but the brews I drink all went up in price, especially by the LB.  Kind of disappointing.

May have to try Peete's...
author: Scottie P.

description: Philz was my first experience in having a whole cup of coffee made up for me and I loved it! The flavors here are great, the coffee is delicious and I always feel so waited on. Philz has a special place in my heart.
author: Kaitlin T.

description: Mint Mojito Iced Coffee....  DIVINE
author: Page F.

description: Philz coffee is the best. Amazing taste and quality, friendly stuff.
author: Hugo L.

description: One of my favorite coffee shops. I love light and medium roasts. Beans are a little pricey but worth it. Friendly staff at every philz. Pastries are also a little pricey. I've only tried the baclava which is great with coffee.
author: Alex S.

description:
Every time I am in SF I come to Philz. I prioritize coming to Philz over anything else, ANYTHING else. There is no coffee place in California or otherwise that is quite as good. That includes Blue Bottle.

I would replace every bodily fluid I have with this coffee if I could. I'd crack open my eyeballs, drain the aqueous and vitreous humors, and pour Tesora in if meant I could see in some cool "coffee vision."

Philz could easily be the douchiest coffee bar on the planet. I was scared that I would be met with a smug hippie attitude when I first came. The worker was wearing a freaking afghan and had facial hair that screamed "bongo lover." Suddenly I felt very metropolitan and out of place. I didn't know how to order their coffee, was I to be mocked? SF can create dens of smuggery at times, and I feared I had entered one.

But everyone here, hippie or otherwise is nice as can be. They don't judge, they know that flavor is subjective and everyone has their preferences. Reading up on the philosophy of the place really shows that they are PROUD of everything they serve, so whatever you order is fine by them.

Do you want lots of cream and lots of sugar? No problem. My lady orders it like that all the time and they've never raised an eyebrow. In fact just about every order is met the same way. "No problem, coming right up." Or maybe, "Right on bro."

Oh right, so the coffee. It's fantastic. Every blend is unique and you should experiment to find your favorite. The flavors in these coffee will show you what coffee is capable of if you were like me and had only frequented a Starbucks prior to this. My favorite is Anesthesia To the Upside. I have NO clue where they get these names from ...

They actually have recently added a bagel bar in the corner and it's REALLY good. I like the Mediterranean bagel the best. It might seem pricey ($4-5 I think) but you actually get a BIG bagel sandwich that's enough for lunch.

Swing by here if you're stopping in SF for any reason and see what they can do.
author: Ethan N.

description:
I love Philz and that this location is larger and more spread out, so there is actually room to sit or hang back while you try to decide what to order. This location takes cards too! :) 

The staff at Philz is great and if you are overwhelmed just tell them what you like generally and they will whip up something awesome for you based on your preference! 

I love the variety of spiced and  flavorful coffees here! As everyone says the iced mint mojito is great, but I would only order it on a really warm day. I just love the aroma and cozy essence of hot coffee. The mojito is perfectly refreshing on a warm day though. 

Pumpkin cookie with cream cheese frosting! The pastries in general here look fresher and better than those at the one in the Castro. OMG definitely an upgrade from red velvet! I love anything pumpkin, but paired with cream cheese, this is just too good!
author: Angela K.

description:
Admittedly, I was skeptical about Philz Coffee, especially given how much I love Blue Bottle. However, after hearing rave reviews from friends and about the opening of this new location (much closer to my apartment), I finally succumbed to peer pressure and gave Philz Coffee a try!

I was pleasantly surprised by my experience at Philz and have to admit that this is a great addition to this side of town! The baristas are friendly and knowledgeable, the coffee is amazing and even the pastries are delicious!! For a Philz coffee virgin, the first visit can be intimidating because Philz offers an extensive selection. However, the baristas are more than happy to answer questions and/or make recommendations. Not only is each cup brewed fresh to order, but the baristas will also add cream/sugar for you! I had a cup of Philtered Soul, which was rich and buttery and amazing!

TIP: Philz prides itself on being a GREEN company. Bring your own mug and only pay for the price of a "small" no matter what size you order! Hooray for saving $$$ and the environment!!
author: Alice W.

description: Mint Mojito Iced Coffee with soy and less sugar is my go to drink. My friend suggested that I tried the Tessora, which I will next time. The coffee is soooo smoooooothhhh. Please open more in So Cal!
author: Canaan K.

description:
A big fan.  Yes indeedy.

When I'm usually on the run and seeking a quick fix to liven up my verbal capacities, any old cup of coffee will do.  Starbucks.  Peets.  Royal Ground.  Martha.

But when I'm out in the nitty gritty spots of the city and looking for something smooth and strong (please, no bitter coffee face) I'll stop in this joint any time.  Prior to doing a little manipulation within the house (just purchased a nice large black leather club chair) my tall Italian requested a little caffeine prior to the big event.  We stepped in, I ordered my usual breve latte and he had a large cup of their standard.

We spent the next moments sitting at a table and consuming the hot drinks prior to mentally preparing ourselves for the onslaught of labor afterward.  He wanted to know what was going on in my dating life.  I basically told him that some people never learn about the intricacies of online boundaries, despite the age difference.  He said that stupidity has no restrictions on age.  

"Do you trust him?"

Honestly, after his several blunders due in part to poor judgement, I was just about to dump his sorry ass.  As I've mentioned before, I'm not entering a relationship just to teach someone the 101 steps to maturity.  F*** that.  Go waste the time with someone else. Shooooooooot!

The caffeine kicked in after a few minutes and what usually may have taken half a day was finished within a span of an hour or so.

Cheers to Philz for making it happen and knocking some sense into me!
author: Miika M.

description:
I'm definitely a fan of Philz coffee now. I was near Chinatown and I was craving for some Philz so my friend and I decided to head over - the bus was not coming anytime soon so we walked all the way there! A good exercise and you get an awesome treat at the end!

I've tried Jacob's Mocha Tesora, aromatic arabic, and Jacobs Wonderbar brews. My favorite is the mocha tesora since it resembles an espresso mixed with chocolate flavor and almond milk. The Jacobs Wonderbar brew is definitely a dark roast and has more bitter flavor to it compared to the mocha tesora and aromatic arabic.
author: Donna C.

description:
I am so stunned by this unpretentious this little coffee house is. The people who come to the Blue Bottle always seem kind of stuffy and reek of that South Park episode with the Prius (you know what I'm talking about). The coffee here is just as good if not better than having espresso at Blue Bottle. I know it's like comparing apples and oranges but there's only so many elite classes of coffee places out there and I'm grouping them together. 

This coffee seriously gets me pumped up and loving every single drop down to the little tiny rim on the bottom of my cup. I had a New Manhattan and loved it so much I bought my first pound of coffee ever. They certainly take their coffee seriously and watching the barista do his business is excellent use of 3 minutes. 

This is a great place to people watch and have a sit down on the comfy couch with a friend. The staff here is so relaxed and chill they don't even bother taking your money right now. They let me drink my coffee and talk with a friend before taking my order for ground coffee and paying. There's something nice about a coffee place downtown that has the cozy niche feel.
author: Jessica K.

description: Best cup of decaf I've ever had. We need Philz in LA!
author: Gino G.

description: Iced mojito .. Was unique. I wouldnt have imagined it could have been any better than what was served so rating it well for a job well done! Well crafted gourmet coffee. Cheers guys.
author: The M.

description: Since my last review, the owner contacted me with a sincere apology and offered to make it up to my roommie. I've been back and have seen the change.
author: Quan N.

description:
the best coffee in north america.  price aside, there is nothing that beats a nice light roast with baklava when you got a bad case of the mundaes.  i enjoy the fact that philz' default cream is whole cream (commercial cream), as no other coffee shop i have been to carries this item.  once you go full fat cream, alternatives such as half and half or whole milk just won't do.  in fact, i couldn't even find this commercial cream at the grocery store (it is berkely farms so you would think safeway carries it)!  as far as where this mythical dairy product belongs in the cream spectrum, i would surmise it resides somewhere in between heavy whipping cream and half and half.

a philz addiction is no joke, it is much like nicotine or crack addiction.  i consciously know its overpriced coffee, and is terrible for my wallet, and i tell myself this is the last cup, i swear, but somehow i always find myself in line every morning.  the $200 monthly coffee bill on my credit card makes me cringe and enter a state of self loathing.  i like to think of myself as a savvy consumer and i know better than to pay 4 dollars plus 1.75 for baklava every morning, but the subconscious draw of physical addiction overpowers all.  pray for my weak soul.  next week i swear, i am done, i am just going to drink the free tea at work...
author: Dan S.

description: Mint mojito iced coffee was good, but the baristas were really rude and unwelcoming. Cashier was friendly though!
author: Lana L.

description:
I have a confession to make...for the longest time I refused to succumb to the Philz Coffee hype. A rogue cup made by a disinterested barista a few years ago pretty much turned me off completely. Since a new outlet of Philz opened up a few blocks from my office I figured it was about time that I gave them another shot. The verdict? Wow, was I ever wrong!

This time, my barista was awesome. I told him that I was a Philz virgin and he walked me through my options. We decided on a Tesora with cream and sugar, medium sweet and it was pretty fantastic. 

I'm a card carrying member of the cult of Blue Bottle and don't think that will ever change but after my experience today, you can definitely chalk me up as a Philz fan.
author: phil h.

description:
The OG Philz in the Mission is good, but the Van Ness Philz is great!

For those that don't live deep in the Mish, can live without crawling over fixies and want a shorter wait time to grab a cup o' joe... this location is for you.

Plus, it's way cleaner and they take credit cards! As far as I'm concerned, this is the greatest coffee in the entire city.
author: Ruggy J.

description:
A great place to go to if you want to get out of your house to work / study.
Not too loud and free wi-fi is pretty rare these days.

Only downside is that the actual selection of food in the place is very limited. But still recommended
author: Assaf B.

description: Every cup of coffee is brewed from fresh beans, whichever bean you pick.  I had the house blend and I'm quite sure it was the best cup of coffee I've ever had.  Wish I didn't live 1500 miles away.
author: Jeff S.

description: Have to update this one. I went in to this philz this morning and the service was WAY better. The people working there were cheerful and friendly and of course the coffee was amazing. Also very easy to find (free) street parking and they have an app where you can pre-order and pay if you're in a rush!
author: Emma B.

description: Pretty delicious coffee! Beware the caffeine is outrageous! I am a normal coffee drinker meaning at least 1-2 cups a day. But one small cup of filtered soul coffee from Philz gives me a boost that compares to no other cup. Not only is it tasty but it does give you the energy you may need to get you through the day
author: Serina T.

description:
The 'one cup at a time coffee' was great but the service was even better!

Perhaps on a Saturday mid morning, the extremely friendly coffee expert guy was a bit more patient with two 'deer in the headlight', how do you order, where do you stand, what coffee lingo to use people who wanted a cup of coffee while waiting for a table at Brenda's around the corner.

The coffee maker dude could not have been more gentle and instructional asking us how strong, what size, and what we wanted in our cup of joe..that's right...he said look around, do you see any messy, crowded 'condiment' stand?  We do it all for you here for a perfect cup of coffee...yes, 'one cup at a time'.  

They really do grind your single portion beans on the spot and by the time you pay, your steamy and tasty cup is ready for you.

You pay a little more but the quality and taste is worth it.

Four locations in San Francisco...I hope they expand!
author: Randall F.

description:
OMG, Philz on Van Ness?!?! This means trouble! No longer will I have to wait til the weekend for a little indulgence.

Small Mocha Tesora. Soy Milk. Pack of Splenda. Mmmm!  Makes me sing!

Thank you Philz, for aiding my addiction. My coworkers will probably hate me since I'll be buzzing around nonstop and bouncing off walls! =D
author: Marti L.

description:
I came to Philz because of an offer from Groupon. I originally regretted it because the locations were not that convenient for me. But after I bought it I looked around and this was the best location for me.  

So I came here and seen their Turkish coffee sign and had to have one. When I ordered, they grinded the beans right then and there, poured on cup of boiling hot water and slowly let it drip out like the Vietnamese coffees, ask how much cream and sugar you like in there and topped it off with a bit of mint leaves. 

First time I had coffee in awhile without sugar, but that cup of coffee was great. And the eye candy that was getting 2 cups to go wasn't bad too. Just as most people had said, it's a bit pricey for a cup of coffee, $3.50 for my large.
author: M C.

description: Came in to let my girlfriend try their coffee. They had a huge selection of coffee, with arabic beans to the columbian coffee beans. I ordered one of their specialities was really sweet and delicious. My girlfriend got one of their black coffees. Overall good coffee, my girl didnt like their customer service, but I thought they were friendly.
author: Tuan T.

description: I love the Mint Mojito Iced Coffee with soy milk. This location is separated into two sections. Plenty of seating. There are also bike racks in front if you bike here.
author: Susana T.

description:
Absolutely love me some Philz.  Actually this is a requirement on weekends.  I love the Van Ness one because I get to see Phil himself most of the time. 

Since I'm a die hard ice coffee kinda girl, the mint mojito and ice coffee are fantastic. But when I'm feeling for a hot coffee, Philz really hit the spot because of all the different choices.
author: Nho C.

description: I am so glad my first Philz Coffee experience was in SF! Honestly, I could not find anything wrong with my morning coffee. The coffee was so rich and perfectly sweet and creamy. Ack, I can't wait to go over to the one in Santa Monica!
author: Meagan T.

description:
The mint mocha iced coffee is REALLY good.  I'd go back just for this drink alone.  The beef samosa and the Mexican mocha cookie was so-so.

I really like this place.  It seemed very cozy and the smell of coffee lingering outside was amazing.  Friendly staff.  Limited parking.  Great coffee.
author: Mary B.

description:
whenever I go to any other coffee shop I always compare it to Philz...

Philz holds the standard of what coffee should taste like..

Philz is amazing...
author: phillip w.

description: Great coffee shop, located right on van ness. As an avid coffee drinker, this is some of the best coffee I've ever had. Not sure how they do it, the texture (full fat cream) and the taste from the individual brew per cup seems to be why. I've heard they add special spices and blend beans from around the world to make there coffee. Tasty  brew for sure!
author: Phillip F.

description:
I wish I lived in SF so I can try all the different types of coffee this place offers. I tried the mint iced coffee. Loved it! I like how it's not too sweet and it's different from the usual coffee establishments. The barista was very informative. I appreciate how each cup of coffee is made one cup at a time. 

The next item on my list to try is the Turkish coffee.
author: Andrea C.

description: the best  express/casual coffee ever!! omgoodness I thought this would be another hype like blue bottle or something, but i assure you if you don't like blue bottle coffee (because of the ridiculously sour taste that cannot be consumed like I think it to be) than Philz is totally a mediation between super sour hyped up coffee like Blue Bottle and super diluted and weak coffee like Starbucks. Although I think VERY highly of Nespresso coffee and would prefer Nespresso, (even though I've only had one taste of it in the downtown location in SF), Philz coffee is BY FAR the best tasty retail/chain coffee ever that doesn't go sour in two seconds. The workers are super chill and nice. While the service may not be the fastest or most efficient (like Starbucks), it is definitely worth the extra 30 second-wait for extra delicious coffee. TRY IT IF YOU HAVE 5 MINS TO SPARE
author: Hannah K.

description:
I was very skeptical but their coffee really is a significant step above Starbucks, Peets, etc.  It's almost twice the money but a definite treat.  Only gave it 4 stars because it is $4 for a medium size cup (12 oz maybe).  So good though that I'll get over that.  Plus, they have a wide variety of different beans you can try and the staff is extremely knowledgeable.
If you really like coffee, I can't imagine a better spot.
The lounge area is pretty utilitarian and hooked up with a decent sandwich shop (Delish).  Free Internet and room for work but no cushiness.
author: Ric S.

description:
I'm not a big coffee drinker and if I do drink coffee I have to stick to decaf ... 

My sister took me to Philz to try this place out.  I ordered the Decaf French Roast and it was absolutely the BEST coffee that I've ever had.  I get mine with light cream and medium sweet which is the best combination.  

My sister even tried my decaf and was impressed saying that it tasted like real coffee to her. 

I bought a bag of beans to take home with me and now I'm savoring it since I don't want it to run out!  This is seriously some good coffee and now I have to stop by whenever I'm up in SF!
author: Stephanie H.

description: Iced gingersnap has a whole lotta nutmeg and cinnamon. They'll make it to suit your taste too - less sweet, etc. But after having a sampled some of their coffee drinks I think I will stick to the SooGood. Their roasts are so amaze, it really doesn't need the extra stuff!
author: Aubrey O.

description: Very cute tiny place, I went when it was kind of packed so it was a little confusing figuring out where I was supposed to pay and wait for my drunk. Mint mojito iced coffee was amazing though!!
author: Brianna C.

description: Jamaican Blue Mountain worth all 10 dollars for a large! But for just 4 dollars I suggest the Phil Harmonic it's awesome if you like cardamom as much as I do! Service is always spot on! Don't go here in a rush as all drinks are made by hand a single cup at a time but worth the wait!
author: Joshua O.

description: Very friendly atmosphere, delicious drinks and snacks, and fantastic costumer service.
author: Aubree G.

description:
Dropped by for a Sunday morning pick-me-up while waiting in line for Brenda's Soul Food not too far away.  Of course, there was a line for Philz too, but luckily the wait was only 15 minutes.

I wanted something with a caffeinated kick to it and was steered towards "The Anesthesia" roast.  I was told it was a medium roast coffee with a smooth, yet strong finish.  It was definitely a medium roast.  It smelled wonderful, but was a little too light-bodied for me.  You must tell the barista how you like your coffee (sugar?  milk?) and they will add everything for you.  I found it difficult to get everything "just right" for myself, as they were so busy that I felt I was being a nuisance to keep asking for my drink to be adjusted.

For our non-coffee drinker we ordered a mint hot tea.  They actually put real fresh mint in the tea!

I didn't have it, but my friend loves their mocha and the grasshopper coffee beverages.  

Loved the fresh bagel stand at the side of the coffee bar/counter, but they didn't have anything we wanted to eat.  We tried their potato samosa, which they kindly toasted up for us.  It was a bit greasy for my taste, but very flavorful.

Wish we could fix our coffees the way we wanted, but the coffees themselves were pretty good.  The baristas were knowledgeable, but they were so busy they couldn't really talk us through all their different roasts.  Definitely am going to come back to try some other kinds.
author: Jacklyn H.

description: I love philz coffee but this location is just ok to me. I'd rather walk 2 more blocks down to the bigger philz coffee which I feel is less of a wait and I like the way the baristas are consistent with my order.
author: Christine W.

description: I can't stay away from Philz, even though I do think their coffee can be a bit pricey. Expect a longer wait because they actually take the time to brew the drinks by hand, if you are in a rush then order through OrderAhead (app). I use OrderAhead in the mornings and it saves me at least 10 minutes. Their mint mojito keeps me awake and fulfill my weekday mornings.
author: Kawai N.

description:
Mint iced coffee mojito!! Never had anything better. Even the non-fat one is to die for.

Sadly, the baristas are such mega snobs! :( Did not appreciate them at all, but thankfully, they're nasty attitudes did not find their ways into my coffee.
author: Hana J.

description:
DRINK:
Jacob's something sweetened w cream - mm strong smooth


SERVICE:
Nice. Free wifi.


ATMOSPHERE:
This one is nice. Has seperate rooms, one side for ordering and bathrooms, the other is a nice quiet studying atmosphere with somewhat decent number of tables n seats. Has artwork of locals up on the walls, cozy environment :}

1.2
author: Angela L.

description: Probably the best pour over coffee I've had.  Friendly staff, helpful and attentive!  Found my go to beans for home brew via aero press Tesora!
author: Jeff L.

description: I am not much of a coffee drinker AT ALL, but Philz Tesora coffee was really good. I will definitely be back next time I'm up north!
author: Tamara M.

description:
I fell in love with Philz coffee at least 2 years ago, and my loves grows stronger every visit.  Some times I wonder if I moved to San Francisco just to enjoy your coffee nearly every day.  
- Turkish- love the cardamon
- philharmoic- love the cardamon
- philtered soul- love the chocolate undertones
- mint mojito- refreshing, but not always needed since it's usually freezing in SF
- Ginger Snap- reminds me of my childhood!
Thank you Phil and crew for making my coffee amazing every visit...
- drink and make of choice at this moment:  Philharmoic, low fat version (fat free milk with a splash of cream and regular sugar)!
author: Bridget H.

description:
3 words: mint mojito coffee. I heard a lot about Philz before actually going so I was afraid it would be hyped up for me. But after I ordered the mint mojito coffee, I always crave it now. It's different from anything I've ever had and is very refreshing. It's sweet, but not too sweet, and the mint is fresh but not overpowering. Coming from Seattle, I've had just about every type of coffee. Starbucks is laughable in comparison.

I wish they sold the mint mojito coffee in cartons that I can bring home...wait do they?
author: Amy N.

description:
The clouds broke and a ray of sunlight shot downward from the sky illuminating a path towards a strange building. A deep voice said unto me, "Go forth and taste the glory and rapture found within!"

Ted has a really deep voice and can be kind of a nut sometimes.

I had never partaken in Philz SF before and Ted had decided to pop my cherry on this special day. "My treat," he said, and when someone is buying, I'm always drinking! I went with a little Philharmonic and was verily impressed. Not the best coffee I have ever had but this made the top 10. The delicious scone that I snagged was an excellent compliment.

Quick and friendly service with a nice clean establishment really topped the visit off. The fact that Ted paid for it all was just a little whip cream on top. Good choice Ted, good choice.
author: Nick B.

description:
Dear Philz,

Please open a location in LA so that I can get coffee wasted with you everyday of the week.  Your iced mint mojito coffee is the single greatest contribution to world since the thong bikini. 2 words. Life. Changing.  Or maybe thats one word with a hyphen, whatever it is I just want you to know that you kick ass!  Oh and I'm pretty sure you ruined my life because after tasting your coffee I simply cannot go back to drinking that crap from Starbucks.

Love,
Mike
author: Michael C.

description:
Best coffee in the city, no question.

The staff here really love their job, are extremely friendly and know that they have the best brewed cup of coffee in the city. They are not trying to be cool and hip and there are no dirty tight pant wearing kids only great coffee and friendly people.
author: Justin S.

description: Mint mojito iced coffee is the most delicious coffee I ever had. The coffee is packed with fresh mint and refreshing flavor, slightly sweeten, would trick your taste buds into thinking you are having a chocolate mint desserts. If you are craving hot drinks, their mocha is on point as well. Not too sweet, taste like dark chocolate melt in your mouth. If you happen to be in the Bay Area, Philz coffee is definitely one of the must go spots.
author: Jens L.

description:
Philz has to be my absolute favorite coffee shop in the Bay. I will drive across town just to get coffee here because it's just THAT AMAZE! If you're a chocolate or dark roast lover, get the Mocha Tesora (I would recommend getting it with little or no sugar). It's simply the best!

I like this location in particular because the staff is friendly, and they've opened up the other side of the building so there's plenty of seating room.
author: Meesh N.

description: Like many other yelpers have already mentioned, the mint mojito iced coffee is awesome. Awesomely delicious. It is just right: not too sweet or creamy. Wish there was more seating though. And the line's a little hard to navigate during peak times (since the line to order & to pay are separate, and can congest/block one another in the small space).
author: Lee L.

description:
If I had to rank coffee shops in the area, I would rank Philz #1, Peets #2, and Starbucks #3. 
 I love the Philtered Soul and mocha tesora. I'm addicted!The quality of Philz coffee is so much better than the others. It costs a little bit more, but you can tell that the quality is there. The coffee makers are extremely nice and willings to help you with a coffee making decision.
author: Nick N.

description:
To this day, 3 months later since my first trip to Philz Coffee, I can still remember the vivid aroma that quenched my lackadaisical mind of caffeine which rejuvenated my senses stronger than a mentos mint could. All in my very first encounter and sip of the MINT MOJITO ICED COFFFFAAAY! 

I can still remember this very day. It was a warm day. Perhaps 70 degrees where the sun was shining as if it were singing and radiating beams of rays in the air as it anticipated my first encounter with Philz. Having heard so much about this coffee shop, I was enthralled by this so called "Philz," that seemed to sound too cool for itself. Leap leap leap, I happily skipped into the store and behold! A fresh, breathtaking whiff of air that screamed of angels that were high on coffee caught my sinuses. Whoa. That was Whoa like Usher would say. 

As I curiously approached the counter, not sure what to order due to my asymmetrical tastes that are opposite of a hardcore coffee addict. I prefer the taste of sweeter and creamier coffee that still carries the aroma of the freshly ground coffee beans, but is not equivalent of a 40% milk, 40% sugar and 20% coffee concoction. I still want to feel and pretend to be somewhat like a suave and sophisticated coffee go-er ya know... 

The barista kindly suggests that I try the Mint Mojito Iced Coffee. In my head I'm thinking "mint in coffee? Pish posh- you must be loco." 

Of course, having seen a customer that just received their freshly brewed mint mojito iced coffee who drank with such glee and delight, I had no choice. I opted for the seemingly pretentious and unusual beverage. 

HOLY MOLY. I drank the coffee as if it were melted Godiva dark chocolate.
