Chilled ice coffee that was a perfect blend of cream, coffee and sugar, mixed in with the mint that surprisingly complimented the sweetness of the sugar perfectly (this taste & sensation can be comparable to a lighter version of mint chocolate chip ice cream) to the point where I was smiling bigger than my already big mouth and smile could accommodate. My only disappointment was that I wished I had ordered the largest size they carried since I later found myself jamming my straw in between the cubes of ice at the end struggling and trying to suck every last droplet of happiness. 

I love you MMIC. I shall be back! With my 44oz Super Big Gulp cup from 7-eleven too!
author: Tiffany K.

description: my first time having ginger coffee. and it won't be the last now!
author: Payal L.

description:
I've had a love affair with Philz ever since I first had a cup at Outside Lands in 2009. I remember watching in amazement, as the Philzistine poured hot water into a a single coffee filter hovering over a cup. I had never seen coffee prepared in such a way. Granted, I wasn't a big coffee drinker at the time, but I couldn't get over how much different the coffee tasted when it was a single brew. 

This experience is probably why I don't care so much for Four Barrel or Ritual. I also don't feel like dealing with the snobbery when I shell out for my once a week treat for a $4 cup of coffee. While Philz may not be the cool kid on the coffee block, they serve a great cup of coffee without the fuss.
author: Lael A.

description: Wow game changer for coffee.  You'll pay a decent price but it is for quality. The mojito coffee is amazing. You think mint and coffee ummmm that's strange but no that isn't strange it is amazing. Next time I visit I'll be back for some more coffee.  Wish they had it in SoCal
author: Hunter P.

description:
Philz is the best. 
I work two blocks away from this location and it's safe to say my coworkers and I are obsessed wit this delicious Coffee. This rich, smooth, flavorful coffee.

New Manhattan and Mint Mojito are my all time favorites. They have good food too if you want a quick bite in the morning. The pumpkin cookies are awesome and they have great breakfast burritos. 

And of course the owners and employees are great. Seems like a fun place to work.

Enjoy.
author: Denise S.

description: I tried mint Mojito coffee which is highly recommended by yelpers. Only thing I can say is I wish Orange County has Phil'z!!!! They put real mint leaves in not just purely syrup. $5 for large. I'm glad I ordered large. Def go back again when I visit SF!!!
author: Yunnie L.

description:
I FINALLY was able to try Philz Coffee just a few hours ago!

I'd heard about Philz a long time ago and have always wanted to check it out for their famous Mint Mojito coffee. I'm normally not a fan of mojito or mint-flavored anything, but because I'd heard so much about Philz and this specialty coffee, I figured I'd give it a try.

I was not left disappointed. I was honestly thinking it would be overly sweet but the flavors are really light. The coffee itself is strong and you can definitely taste the mint mojito in it. I loved every gulp of it. 

I also tried the Gingersnap iced coffee and it was really good, too! The gingersnap flavor wasn't overpowering or sweet... I guess I am just used to the holiday drinks at Starbucks and Coffee Bean, so I was used to more diabetic-tasting drinks. 

I love Philz! Definitely a must try, even just once. I'm hooked.
author: Kristina K.

description:
I really wanted to like this place, especially with all of the positive reviews.  However, my experience was a bit of a disappointment.  The menu is pretty vast--with clever names for the blends instead of locations of origin--and the staff was very helpful, but I found their coffee to be flat out watered down.

First of all, I was surprised to know that they don't make espresso (at least they didn't for me), so when I ordered a latte for the wifesky I was told that they could make a latte-styled drink.  OK, I thought.  She'll have the Turkish.  For myself, I asked for a recommendation and was immediately led to Tesoro.  Excellent, I thought.  This will be an experience...

All of their coffee is drip, so there is a bit of a wait, but so it is when it comes to quality food and drink.  So I waited.

When my coffee was served, the barrista told me to take a sip.  I did.  
Then I lied.  
I said, "Mmm...nice."  
It wasn't nice.  It tasted like a very watered down cross between a more robust Tim Hortons and a Fair Trade McDonalds.  Now, what got me was that Tesoro is supposed to be their intro to the world of Philz Coffee; this is the brew that is supposed to lure you in to a quality cup.  Who exactly is their target audience?  Even someone who lived under a rock next to Starbucks would find this underwhelming.

My sidekick had the Turkish and she liked it, so that's a plus.  They were also playing Queen's Flash Gordon which deserves 5 stars in and of itself, yet upon further thought, perhaps it was a sign.  "Just a man, with a man's courage.  Nothing but a man..."  Indeed.  Perhaps the Divine was warning me of the coffee.

With all the rave reviews, it is tempting to go back.  However, with Ritual and other quality shops in the same city, why not go for the sure thing?
author: Nicolas W.

description:
The good - Everything
The bad - Usually there's a lack of seating
The yelp - Try the chai tea if you're not in the mood for coffee cause it's DELICIOUS!
author: Allen T.

description: Man, the ecstatic ice coffee was sooooo good! I like coffee, but I'm not a connoisseur by any means. But I like that each coffee is hand brewed, and the style of iced coffee they made was unlike anything I've had before. If I lived in the Bay, I'd be coming here everyday.
author: Patrick F.

description: I first tasted Philz as a student at SJSU because there's one CONVENIENTLY located a block from campus. As a student I was thrilled because the coffee here DOES WONDERS. but my wallet? not so happy... anyways, this new location has always been a hit or miss. Now I drink coffee not to stay awake but because of it's taste. So i usually get the Mint Mojito because I like the sweetness and creaminess of the drink. Sometimes it's made perfectly, other times... not so much. Customer service there is always great - and the wait allows me to see WHAT ELSE is on the menu lol besides the mojito.
author: Kristina L.

description: Mint mojito deserves rewards.  Got more minty the slower i drank.  Finished only to realize that it's full of fresh mint leaves.  That's an a plus for fresh in my book.
author: Rena A.

description:
I love Philz! I don't know what it is, but their coffee is amazing! I tried it for the first time few months ago at the Berry St. location and I have been addicted ever since! There are 3 locations in SF that I know of, but neither one are really close to my home but whenever I'm in the neighborhood, I always pick up a cup of Ecstatic Iced Coffee, Yum! I used to drink coffee everyday but I haven't been to Starbucks or Peet's ever since. 

5 stars for delicious coffee & friendly staff!
author: Cara N.

description:
Philz coffee, oh how I love thee!
The baristas are so nice and chock-full of smiles. If the coffee menu seems overwhelming and full of strange names, do not hesitate to ask for a recommendation. You will get a damn good cup of joe either way. Each cup of coffee is made to order, the price is totally reasonable (considering other single-cup brew coffees can easily run $4-5 in other coffee joints). I get all my coffee black, but if you want cream and sugar, the baristas will put in the right proportions themselves to really make your coffee perfect.

My favorites:
Ambrosia: "food of the gods". However, in this context, a nice bold, smooth cup of coffee fit for the gods.

Mocha Tesora: Take their original blend and add in the mocha powder. You've got what appears to be a hot chocolate...coffee. It is as wonderful as it sounds!

The Philharmonic: One sip and you will hear beautiful music for the rest of the day. 

Mint Mojito Iced coffee: Hot day getting you down? Shut up, it never gets that hot in San Francisco. But the sun's out, and you're totally burning up in 70 degree weather (it's happened to me). Get the mint mojito and feel the heat dissipate from your nasty, sweaty body. Complete with cream, sugar, and a sprig of mint to freshen you up.

Go.
author: Dan K.

description: Philz has helped me to become a slight coffee snob.  I more success making my own coffee at home with their beans (Tesora) than even my other favorite, Blue Bottle's.  Once in a while, when I want a real treat, I stop by and let their fabulous  (and helpful and friendly) baristas make my cup of coffee for me.  Always perfect. Always.
author: Karen R.

description: Philz Coffee are among the best in 2 things: coffee and service, both of which are achieved hand in hand. Every cup of coffee is made to order, like it would be if you ordered a steak. You get to decide your sweetness or your choice of milk. Not only is that great coffee, but great service. The staff here are crazy friendly too, from the person who takes your order to the person who rings you up. Amazingly, the lounge also remains dead quiet for those who are actually doing work. The best thing is, all of these great things are at every Philz location.
author: Jennifer W.

description: I've been to this location a couple times and each time I did not have to wait long at all.  Service is just as good as any other location.  I like how they have a separate coffee lounge area.  As always, great coffee..  My faves, you ask?  Mint Mojito Iced Coffee and Mocha Tesora.
author: Rose A.

description:
I COME HERE ALL. THE. DAMN. TIME.

I like how there is an extra room.

So I can get some work done.

"Studying"

Except really, I'm reading celebrity gossip blogs.

Wait, what?

Coffee's always on point. Large black Ambrosia, please.

but

Sometimes it takes me like, all of ten whole minutes before I can connect to their wi-fi network. What's up with that?

And sometimes the chick next to me will be cackling at something she just read. Or she'll be on the phone. Hella loud. What. Gurl bye.
author: Lalitha K.

description: Philz, philz, philz, What can I say about one of bay area's most popular coffee shops. I like you, I really do. Even though I'm not a huge coffee fan, I had to come and try it and see what the hype is about. Though it was a hot day, I decided to go with the more familiar mocha tesora (vs the iced mint mojito coffee). They brew it right in front of you, individually. I didn't ask for any special requests (sugar or cream or what not) and they didn't ask. Normal? However my friend also got a mocha with like half the sugar and 30% cream or something customized like that. But when it came time to pick up our orders, we asked which is which and the girl making the drinks replied very nonchalantly (ie like she could care less) that they were the same. I highly doubt they were the same because I bet she forgot my friends special requests and just made it normally. That kind of irked me. But we were like whatever and just paid. The drink was pretty good and it got rid of the headache I had been suffering for the past couple hours. Very chocolately, which is how I like my coffee anyways. Haha. So maybe next time I will try the mint mojito but probably at a different location.
author: Alison W.

description:
JUST SOOO GOOD! 

anytime I am in the area (SINCE I LIVE IN North Beach), I make sure to stop by. 

When friends from NYC visit....we DEF stop here. 

Thank you!
author: Rebecca M.

description:
checked it out because a friend recommended it.  Tried it for 3 days.  

I liked the matte tea a lot.  The Tesora was a good balanced medium roast.  I liked it a lot, would probably frequent the place if I lived up in SF.
author: Daniel K.

description: I go to coffee chain regularly just because of convenient locations.  However I come here time and time again for their mint infused coffee. Like mojito on caffeine!!! Try it and you'll know what I mean.
author: Nessa M.

description: My all time favorite coffee spot!!! The employees are always extremely nice and helpful for recommendations.  Although... I was get my signature mint mojito with soy milk & honey. Anytime I'm in the neighborhood... Philz is a must stop!
author: Lynda N.

description:
Dropped by here on Sunday to get a start to my day.  It was my second time here with a long enough gap that I didnt know what to expect.  I was surprised that Philz lived up to the Yelp! hype.

Pros
+Service - from the young lady taking food orders to the amazingly friendly cashier, I got the sense that the folks working here knew their stuff and were genuine.  

+Coffee - I got the Tesoro (or the most popular blend) , I was knocked off my feet.  It had great flavor and had lasting power throughout the rest of my day.  

Meh!
-Location - I live around here and I have my own gripes about it - loud, impersonal - but they seem to make due.  I wouldn't come here to read or chat - more of a pick-up and go kinda joint.
author: Aasim K.

description:
ABSOLUTELY NO JOKE.... MINT ICED MOHITO!!!

I listened to the reviews... YELPaLICIOUS!

O
author: Chris O.

description:
I love the customer service here, I love how the coffee taste here. I just love everything about here. 

My favorite coffee to get is the Iced Mint Mojito, it tastes just right not too sweet nor bitter. I think i might be addicted. Another reason why I love Philz is because their coffee doesn't make you feel sick.. I used to drink starbucks coffee alot and I always get that empty sick feeling after, maybe it's the milk they use i don't know. But I can drink Philz coffee at any time of the day and I will feel refreshed after. Isn't that the whole point of drinking coffee? & They make it just that much more enjoyable. 

five stars to you Philz! :)
author: Allie S.

description:
Okay, what the eff. Philz, you need to open up a location in Los Angeles immediately. I honestly didn't have much expectation for this coffee shop and only drove through the hilly and unfamiliar streets of SF to get here because my sister desperately wanted to come.

Lo and behold, I discovered the best iced coffee of my life. 

At Philz, they brew each order separately. Yes, separately. So your coffee will be freshly brewed right before your eyes.

My iced coffee (forget the name) was brewed to perfection. It was naturally sweet and caramel-like in flavor, just like how good coffee is supposed to be. Just lightly creamed and sugared how I like it, I was quickly regretting not getting the large. 

If you are a coffee fanatic in the SF area, definitely try it out!
author: Joanna S.

description: Philz!  I can't get enough of you!  You're so addictive and it was like love at first sight! AND I'm not regular coffee drinker.  The doctors say caffeine is bad for you....but you....you I can't resist!  I think out of all your locations I frequent the Van Ness one the most.  Every time I visit everyone working has always been so nice and patient.  Why do I say patient?  Cuz I'm a woman...and sometimes women are indecisive and I can stare at their coffee menu for a good 5 - 10 minutes deciding which coffee I want.  Technically it's Philz fault because I've never gotten a bad cup from them and there is just way too many options to just go with my regular "I don't feel like thinking" drink which is the ever so popular iced mint mojito.  Other than the iced mint mojito my other favorites is the Tesora, Greater Alarm, and Dancing Water.
author: Christine D.

description:
Oh Philz...during my first visit to you, your workers wouldn't have known it, but I was having a sad day because of a sad errand I had to run in that area. The upside was I finally got a chance to try Philz!

Your mint mojito iced coffee picked up my spirits considerably.  When it was time to take the bus home again, it even distracted me from the random man that was half naked and looked like he might take it all the way.  So, take it from me, a person who was having a bad day at first until love at first sip...Philz will make your day all better!
author: Alice C.

description: Best coffee I have ever had. I normally drink black, but as my brother told me "you let them make it how they want". My favorite is Jacob's wunderbrew but they are all good. A little mint and a little cream is perfect. Their hummus/falafel bagel is terrific too.
author: Danny B.

description:
Who wants to open a Philz in Long Beach??? Who's with me!?!?  Seriously the best cup o coffee I have had in a long freaking time.  

We were in line @ Brenda's and needing a coffee/sugar/caffeine fix for the wait.  OMG I am bummed I only got a sip of my friends Mint Mojito coffee.  Because that was serious crack.  They could charge $10 for that thing.  Amazing.  Take thee around the corner from Brenda's and have yourself the best handmade each freaking cup at a time perfect cup o coffee.  Now.  Do it.
author: Lisa V.

description:
I'm a newbie.  Went to Philz for the first time this past weekend, and I am certain it wasn't my first and only visit.  What an awesome idea- One cup at a time- LOVE IT.  When they say that, they mean it literally.  

When the barista heard it was my first time, he recommended the House Tesora blend.  I got a hot medium roast and not too sweet cup of Tesora with milk.  When he handed me my cup, he said, "Are you ready to taste the best cup of coffee of your life?"  My internal response, "HA."  Nonetheless, I took a sip and according to the barista, I made a really weird facial expression.  My expression wasn't because the coffee tasted bad, but because I was in shock of how good it tasted!!!

Barista was extra nice as well.  he made sure I liked my cup of coffee before I left.  When we did leave, although he was extremely busy, he stopped what he was doing to say bye to us.  Can't wait to try the Mint Mojito...

Too bad Philz is only in SF with a few locations in the Bay.  I want to write a note to them to consider opening one in Sac... bahaha.  I can't wait to go back when I'm in the city again!
author: Mindy D.

description:
Best coffee ever! Highly recommended for those with high standards.

I've had some excellent coffee, but nothing compares to Philz.  They brew each cup individually which provides excellent flavor and temperature. Just how I like it!

In addition to the great product, they have great service. For my first visit, I asked for a recommendation and the gentleman inquired about my coffee preferences. Based on his recommendation, I tried something called "Ether."  It was amazing!

If I have any complaint, I would like to see a larger option. Philz large size is equivalent to a medium at other shops. I'm sure it's a large by global standards, but here in America, food portions are super-sized!

I look forward to trying the other locations in the Bay Area.
author: Nathan E.

description: Loved the Turkish and the Mocha Tesoro!  First time here and we will be back. It was a short walk from our hotel. The area is a bit sketchy to walk to, but well worth it!
author: Lori O.

description: Woohoo love Philz, I always get Philz everywhere i go.  This place has a nextdoor lounge area where you can sit down and chat or do some work.  The guys working here are nice and they make a really good mint mojito!  My favorite spot because there is never a line on the weekends unlike some other Philz.
author: Terence N.

description:
Ever since I've been here, I can never go back to Starbucks or Peet's. This is the only place I will go for coffee break at work. I've tried most of their medium roast coffee and my favorite is the Philtered Soul. The famous Mint Mojito is not bad either, very unique and great for a summer refreshment, but a little expensive for what it is. I think the drip coffee is really their strongest item. 

For this location, there's a wifi lounge across the door. It can get crowded in the afternoon. Beware of body odor lingering in the lounge when it's a hot day......
author: Jamie L.

description:
Pretty cool place.  Parking was a bit hard but these are the reason I adore this place:

Pet Friendly.
All coffee/expresso orders and individually filtered..separately.
No expresso machine other than the person standing behind the bar. :)
Fresh mint is use...no syrup sweetener..but brown sugar was offered and gladly accepted.
Reasonable prices...and oh yea: GREAT tasting coffee. 

I ordered 3 shots of expresso, with brown sugar...a dash of h&h
the sister order Ice mint coffee.  She loved it.  

PHilz coffee: Please migrate to sac.  Thank you...Love a loyal FAN!
author: Trang K.

description:
This is my new go to place for coffee if I'm ever near a Philz store. Chains like Starbucks and Peet's are not even competition when it comes to the quality and service of Philz's.

This location is a little weird. It's located on the bottom floor of an apartment complex. Enter to the right to order and pick up. Enter to the left to sit and relax. 

Anyways, today was my first time and I ordered a Mocha Tesora and a Tesora coffee. The mocha was incredibly rich, creamy, and flavorful. The coffee was full-flavored and smooth. The total for the two came to about $7. Each cup is brewed individually when ordered, unlike other places that brew "coffee" and simply dispense it when ordered. You can tell the attention and passion that is brewed in every cup. There is also a separate counter for bagels and one worker there specifically in charge of making the bagels. The counter also features a baked goods case.
author: Steven L.

description:
I must admit Philz Coffee tried to make me a happy customer. I wrote a review for another location and they private messaged me saying that they will offer me a gift card to give Philz another try. I must admit the second time was good...but it still isn't AMAZING, I'm still a starbucks fan and I think its steaming the soy milk which makes the difference. 

3 stars for being good..
1 more star for excellent customer service.
author: Brendan L.

description:
Coffee. A stimuli for many. Be it the conventional Slow Drip, French Press, Cappuccino or Espresso. The black sludge that so many people dearly love, cheerish, and NEED every waking morning to get through the day is needed like a shot of reality.

With SO many chain coffee shops such as Starbucks, Peet's, and your scattered  mom & pops. Who really reigns King of The Roast? Well my dear YELP-sters. I could honestly say that Philz Coffee will have that Starbucks Mermaid on her knees ready to bow down to be his bitch.

You have coffee makers and baristas. Well Philz got Coffee Roast Masters. You might feel a bit intimidated upon ordering. But the Good Roast Masters could take one good look at you and KNOW what you need.

Mia recommended the Mint Mojito Iced Coffee. She feverishly muddled the fresh mint leaves and carefully poured coffee into the cup. What happened next was PURE caffeine intoxication. I awoke  from my standing state of slumber and saved a lady that was about to be run over by a MUNI bus. OK..that didn't really happen. BUT The Mint Mojito Iced Coffee http://static3.px.yelp.com/bphoto/B90TD4l3w-Aa_KV1F4RJuQ/l  would be capable of doing JUST that! 

Good People. Do yourself, your Body, your Mind some good. Hit up Philz Coffee. Ask Mia..matter fact..let Mia recommend something for you. I'm sure she'll brew something that'll be ass-kicking good and bring out the Super-Hero in you!

-----------------
Rye's Notes:
- GET THE MINT MOJITO ICED COFFEE NOW!
author: Rye N.

description:
I'm hovering over 2 and 3 stars because really this review is for the customer service and not the coffee, although I will mention that I think the coffee at this location is not as good as the one in SOMA and the people working there are so friendly, the contrast is stark. I've given a great review on the coffee before and since this one is for my last experience regarding customer service...2 stars it is...

I'm don't know all the details about why this was happening, but I hate, absolutely HATE, when I overhear workers at establishments talking bad about the patrons. (yes, that's you mr. tatoo, fixing my coffee) I don't know what the particular patron you were talking about did to you, but it always makes me worry that you're lips are quick to blab negative remarks and wrongfully judge the people coming in your coffee shop. please stop.

there are plenty of other coffee shops i'll be trying out in the area now...maybe they'll be nice.
author: Rachel W.

description: My family was in the coffee trade since the mid 1800s, so loving good coffee is in my blood.  I like quality coffee, and I also like to have control over how much sugar is in it and what kind of sugar and what kind of non-dairy cream, etc, so I often feel it's easier to just make the damn drink myself at home to accomplish the flavor I want, than to be that one pain in the ass customer in line.  But Philz service is so top notch, they ENCOURAGE you to specify any request you may have.  In any other coffee shop, you might feel rude saying, "I'd like a small coffee, lightly sweet, half stevia with a pinch of sugar and 1/3 vanilla almond milk with two fresh mint leaves please."  But at Philz they'll make your irritatingly specific beverage wishes come true without judgment AND ask you to taste it before you buy, just in case your delicate little tastebuds have any more requests they can fulfill for you!  They'll make you feel actually good about your food allergies, lactose intolerance, diabetes, or discriminating taste.  And when you taste it, you'll feel you got your money's worth.  Over the years, I have decided that Philz is my favorite cup of coffee, better even than Blue Bottle, because every cup is so customizable to your specific desires, which is what sets it apart from the competition.  They have a great business model, and I always leave happy!
author: Pho Q.

description: I ordered the mojito iced coffee since it was a suggestion from a friend.  Meh, I'd give it another try... it was alright.  Their line system is a little awkward as well.
author: Kimthy D.

description:
If you read my other review for Philz: http://www.yelp.com/user_details_review_search?userid=pmKnNkGVgzhMkwJaTU5apA&q=Philz

Then I do not need to reiterate how addicting this place is! 

Difference in this location: two sides of the store, right side is were you order, left side is where you can sit, study, and mingle over coffee.
author: Katrina T.

description: Here lies the strongest coffee in all the land! My favorite is the Silken Splendor. One of these babies and my physical and cognitive function go through the roof. I wish they had one in my neighborhood.
author: Laura F.

description: I've ordered 3 small coffees; 2 small Mint mojitos, and a hot chocolate today. My friend and I encountered a rude Asian barista who gave us that "really?" look because we wanted our mint mojitos in different sweetness levels. We brushed it off at first but when we got our coffees, she said in a cold flat manner, "make sure you enjoy your drinks okay?"
author: Claire S.

description: I've had my first Philz in San Jose and absolutley fell in love with it, both the drinks and the service every time was perfect! However, when I moved to SF and found Philz close to my fiance's office, we were both disappointed. First time here, we ordered our favorite, the Mint Mojito. It was so bland and the service there was just horrible. All the workers looked like they did not want to be there. We figured it was probably an off day for them, so today we gave it another shot. Same thing. The barista never smiled, and when I said thank you with a smile, he didn't smile or say anything back. Mint Mojito was bland and tasted watered down AGAIN. Disappointed. We will have to make a trip back to San Jose for a perfect cup of Philz Mint Mojito.. Sighhh..
author: Kim N.

description:
The more I drink, the more obsessed I am with this amazing coffeeshop. One taste of the Iced Mint Mojito and I was officially at their mercy. They make such amazing, tasty coffees that I can't go anywhere else now (I noticed that the coffees I used to drink at bagel shops were the nastiest coffee drinks I had ever tasted after my palate adjusted to Philz!) My husband and I are also in love with their dark roast Jacob's Wonderbar Brew. And the manager, Sammy, is the best!!! Super friendly and fast service with a smile! 

The other day, I struck up a conversation with someone else who also made a detour to come here for their amazing coffee before heading to the brunch place we both ended up at.  Yep, I'm so addicted, I go out of my way to come here, even before brunch. Sigh.
author: Tina T.

description: I love the coffee and ordered the mocha tesora. Only thing is for my first time trying it out, there was one girl making coffee there that gave me an IDGAF attitude and acted like she didn't care about anything. RUDE. I understand you're hipster cool and all but customer service is essential for business. I would go to another Philz for better customer service but their coffee is flavorful and rich.
author: Jessica A.

description: The coffee was amazing but the employees were rude and the music was terrible and frankly annoying.
author: Andreas C.

description: Great beverages as with any Philz Coffee.  The place is a bit small/crowded, and I don't think I saw any seating.  However, if you're coming from/going toward the Golden Gate Bridge/Palace of Fine Arts Theatre, this would be the closest Philz Coffee location.
author: Dennis C.

description:
like the coffee. 
But the music here on Sunday is so loud and not good for people who are studying or just wanna chill. 
( Who will play Metal hard rock music in coffee shop???!! With singer screaming all the time?? )
author: Steve D.

description: After seeing many pictures on Instagram and reading reviews, finally decided to give this place a try. During my visit, every other guest seemed to get the mint mojito. It looked good but I'm not a big fan of mint. I decided to just get a ecstatic iced coffee. I have never had a cup of iced coffee that tasted so good in my life. It was perfect. I wish we had one of these here in Sacramento. Most definitely will come back the next time I take a trip to sf.
author: Ryan M.

description:
What an absolute treat! The best tasting coffee I've had anywhere.

When Philz was recommended by a friend whose taste I completely trust, I knew I had to try it. And my friend, it did not disappoint. This friend, who accompanied me on this first visit ordered the Ethiopian Yirgacheffe which was not even listed on the menu. Now, I'm a dark roast drinker and this coffee, the Yirgacheffe, is considered a medium roast, but this was the smoothest, and most satisfying brew ever. My understanding is that it is the fine grind that makes this coffee so good. I admit, I've only been here twice (twice in two days) so I have a lot more tasting to do but I don't think I will be disappointed. 

Great knowledgeable, friendly, helpful staff with no attitude whatsoever.

And check out the bagel guy - a great adjunct to the overall scene.
author: Steve R.

description: Not a coffee drinker so I got black tea with cream & sugar. I am not a sweet tooth person so I was slightly afraid when I said yes to sugar (compliments of being continually over-sweetened at Starbucks) but it was just the perfect amount of sugar. And it was also the perfect temperature. The line moved very quickly as well. It's a bit pricey but worth it if you're in need of a caffeine fix.
author: Vanessa H.

description: As much as I love the coffee at Philz, I can honestly say that this was the worst store for customer service. My friend and I heard the barista speak with a lot of attitude where there were many customers waiting in line. Customer service is definitely a significant part of success! I will NEVER go to this location again, even if I have my craving!
author: Jennifer M.

description: Needed a pick me up for a wedding reception later that evening. wow! get some! the mint mojito iced coffee hit the spot.
author: will b.

description: The mint tea was good but tgis location is cramped, the wifi was not working and the bathroom was dirty, messy.  I don't understand the enthusiasm for Phillz!
author: Michael H.

description: One mint mojito iced coffee, please.  Actually, make that ten.
author: Marcin M.

description:
READ THIS FIRST! 

#1 - Order your drink with the barista. 
#2 - Pay at the cashier. 
#3 - Wait for your drink, patiently. 

If you don't follow these directions, you'll look like a noob.  But if you just follow the signage, that works too. 

I looked like fool by doing #2, #3, #1 and then #3... in that order. 

I love this place. I wish I lived closer - It's like liquid crack. 

::must drink more caffeine::
author: Lisa L.

description:
Good enough. Friendly staff, plenty of places to sit. Coffee was excellent, as always.

The one bummer was that my cousin, who I met here for coffee & catching-up while I visited SF, had his bike stolen from literally right outside the door during the half-hour we were there (yes, it was locked). Eesh. Not their fault, of course, but a good reminder to be super cautious, I guess?
author: Amelia N.

description:
So, philz does make the absolute, incomparably best cup of coffee you'll ever have. - when they get it right. 

That being said, they tend to forget whether or not you want sugar so you end up with a cup of sugar coffee when you ask for no sugar. Also, the line outside is Always up the street so you can expect to stand in like for at least 15 minutes. 

That being said however, when you what you order and you accompany it with a lox bagel from the sandwich stand, it's Sunday morning heaven. I didn't believe it at first, but
It really is amazing.
author: Adam O.

description:
DOPE DOPE DOPE service.

Oh you thought they just served coffee? 

This place has coffee down to an art. Everyone was very helpful when we blankly stared at the menu like a deer in the headlights. A little confusing at first but once they break it down for you and figure out what kind of coffee suits those taste buds you'll be on a good one.

Perfect spot for that caffeine fix or to have some conversation with a friend.
author: Keith O.

description:
I've been a lover of Philz coffee ever since they opened up next to the SJSU campus. 

My favs: Mocha Tesora, Greater Alarm. 

They def keep the consistency up there and The service has always been great. and if you've never been to Philz, you just go up there to order, or tell them if you like light, medium or dark roast, and they usually have a good suggestion for you.

I like the fact that they brew the coffee right then and there after grinding the beans after you have picked your drink. thats what you call FRESH.
author: Kenny L.

description: Even though this location is super busy, the baristas are EXTREMELY friendly and they'll take the time to make your drip coffee just the way you want it. With an endless selection, your coffee-fiend can never get enough!
author: Ann N.

description: Tesora all the way ! Actually I haven't been very experimental at Philz since I know what I want.
author: Priyanka P.

description:
Philz Mint Mojito Iced Coffee is LiQUiD CRACK!! So ADDiCTiNG!!

Sweet, minty, coffee goodness.

What? You haven't tried one yet? WELL GET ON iT!!

One star off only because there's so much caffeine in the large that I always get a headache after sucking one down, which has forced me to order decaf whenever I'm here. I never order decaf as a general rule, cuz I think it defeats the purpose of drinking coffee. Though I love the taste of coffee, I'm in it for the caffeine BUZZ! But not when the buzz warps into a mind-splitting headache o.O;; LoLx
author: Dee W.

description:
03.12.11

Coffee, just the way you like it.  You want it sweet?  You got it.  Not so sweet?  You can have that, too.

I like my mocha tesora with non-fat milk, extra hot, and not so sweet.

Mm mmm good.
author: Jenny L.

description:
As soon as I moved to San Francisco, I was introduced to Philz right away. First it was the branch in Castro ... Leanne made the best cup. When she left, it was good that we had to move too.

On Berry St, there WAS Charlie. My friend constantly complains about having to deal with inconsistency whenever our favorite baristas are not around. Well... she's now gone too ... and i dont think my Philz addict friend's taste buds have been satisfied since. 

Today was my first time to go to Van Ness location ... and LILIAN (who ironically only drinks hot water), ...  youre cool!  :) I will tell my friends to ask for you when they are in the area. 

I was seriously embarrassed having to order DECAF (cut down caffeine, doc said - PFFT!). I asked Lilian what is close to what I normally order and without batting an eyelash suggested a decaf alternative to my craving and went on to describe the taste. SOLD! You had me at hello! :)

I am not giving up on Philz anymore ... will definitely drop by this location whenever I go to City Hall.
author: RED C.

description: Fan of Philz and was desperate for coffee when I was out in the city. I'm glad we found this one. We came here right before closing so it was more quiet than anything, and the employees aren't as friendly and chippery as the other employees at the Philz in Palo Alto or San Jose. Oh well. I guess it's closing and they just want to go home. But, coffee is great as always and they did another perfect job adding cream and sugar (lightly sweetened) in my coffee!
author: Louisa T.

description:
I'm so happy to finally try philz coffee! 

My boyfriend and I were debating what to get and the barista and cashier were so patient with us. They asked us what we liked and gave us some suggestions. I remember reading that the mocha tesora was really good here, so my boyfriend ordered that iced. I ended up ordering the mint mojito (asked for less suger and it came out perfect). My drink also came with some fresh mint on top. So yummy and refreshing! 

If I was a student...I would come here to study. The coffee shop has a whole different room across the actual shop for studying.  I like that they keep the study area seperate from the cafe. 

This is going to be my go-to coffee shop in SF!
author: Eileen C.

description:
Yes, I'm a fan!!! Let me breakdown the coffee hierarchy for you:
(From the top to the bottom)

Philz Coffee (especially the Philtered Soul)!!!
Seattle's Best
Blue Bottle
Dunkin Donuts 
McDonald's
Coffee Bean
Starbucks

Philz Coffee on Van Ness is hands down the best coffee & best staff!! I want to try all of the flavors on the menu. If they ask whether or not you want cream and sugar - just trust them. Somehow, I don't know how, but somehow they always put exactly the right amount! Philtered Soul nom nom in my tom!

This place is great for studying, unlimited WiFi access and a large room with many tables. Not a great place to eat - they need to expand their menu selection - though i'm sure most people are here just for the coffee.

I love you, Phil!
author: Emily L.

description:
Best. Coffee. Ever.

Seriously.  I'm not even going to explain why.  Just go there.

You see all these long-ass reviews above and below me on Yelp?  It's because they're all jacked up on Philz Coffee.

Now go!  Quickly!
author: Alex S.

description:
Store #1:

We heard about Philz through my boyfriend's brother. The first thing that occurred upon entering Philz was the aroma. Split into two, Philz has a dedicated area for coffee and even a mini stand for bagels; the other area is for their tables. Our barista, even though busy, was still very helpful for us newbies. 

My boyfriend ordered a large Tesora and I tried a large Tantalizing Turkish. I never fully appreciated coffee until I came here. With just a touch of cream to both cups, I was instantly awaken to what coffee should taste like. Their Tantalizing Turkish was bold but that smell of Turkish coffee was affirmative and it was very different to have it in such a large portion. Their Tesora lived up to its description and was a great beginner Philz drink for anyone new to their franchise. Plus with the extra dose of hyper-activeness I experienced afterwards, I was quite pleased with our curiosity of trying out their coffee.
author: Jamie L.

description: Awesome!!! Go!!! I went with tantalizing Turkish here in the Mission. Such a friendly staff - even asked me to give it a sip to make sure it was to my liking. Never heard that at a coffee shop before!
author: James N.

description: No trip to sf is complete without a mint mojito iced coffee!!
author: Sarrah F.

description: Besides the fact that their coffee is the best coffee anywhere in the city, they also have really yummy sweet treats! I recently bought the Mexican Chocolate Cookie - from Karri's Kreations - and it was amazing! Truly 1 of the best cookies I've had a in long time. Chocolate chunks interspersed with a slightly spicy Mexican spice & some grittiness involved. It's not your normal cookie and I liked it! I'll definitely get it again...warmed up with some hot chocolate...oh la la!
author: Marissa H.

description:
I love me some coffee. Philz has one of the best iced coffees around IMO. It's super smooth, creamy, and has a nice lingering coffee flavor. It's not too bitter, too acidic, or too sweet & sugary.

I've had some great coffee in San Diego, New York, and here in San Francisco. While all these great flavors have been good in a different way, the most important thing to me has been a coffee shop's consistency and their attention to detail.

Other things that are important IMO about a good coffee shop: How well thought out is each individual drink served, how knowledgeable is the staff behind the counter, how is their coffee when it finally hits your palette? Does it take a while for you to like it? Or is it perfect from the first sip?

Philz is perfect from the first sip to the last. Hot, iced, or black, the coffee is a super smooth elixir. If you get it black, they aerate your drink to make sure it's slightly cooled down and also not as acidic on the tongue. If you get it with milk, they make sure to add the perfect amount to your blend. If you get it iced, they serve it from a special cold brew they have on the side. If you ask them about your coffee, they'll make sure they give you a good talking to... just to make sure you know what you're getting into.

I'm not from SF or even visit that often. But next time I'm here in the city, I will make a trip to Philz.
author: Lynn C.

description:
I love, love, love the mochas here, they're the best in the city I've found so far. 
You can taste the love and effort put into each cup of coffee. 
I like that you tell them your specifications, little sugar, little milk and they always get it perfect. I've never not been satisfied with anything I've ordered here. 
The only thing I wish was that this place was bigger. I've tried to work here but it always just feels too cramped.
author: Tasha A.

description:
Hook at the first sip!
Since I don't live near a Philz, I have resorted to buying roasted beans at a local Whole Foods, which I was so surprised to find and brewing my own cup at home!
author: Tess Y.

description: Great coffee, too bad there is not an option to have an espresso (no espresso, minus one star)...coffee is excellent, though.  My wife had green tea that was good; make sure you don't leave the mint in for too long (take out after a couple of minutes).
author: Justin D.

description:
In my opinion...
This really is the best cup of coffee in San Francisco.
You need to try this place.
I am currently stuck on the Turkish.
It is absolutely amazing.
author: Barry A.

description:
Discovered Philz recently while wandering the streets of SF.  Tried Jacob's Wonderbar and loved the dark roast with hints of chocolate.  Each cup is brewed to order and packs just enough caffeine for a bright eyed look.  

Didn't realize Philz had more than one location until my second trip to SF this month.  Tried Tesoro the second time around.  Fell in love again.  

Most memorable thing at Philz was their Pumpkin Drop Cookie. MMmmm.  Thick chewy cookie with cream cheese frosting.  Yes, please! 

While the coffee line continued to grow, I felt bad for the employee working at the bagel station.  He looked bored.
author: Min L.

description:
My friend took me here telling me its the best coffee he has ever had. He doesn't even like coffee but he is now addicted to this place. He calls it heaven. 

I had a friend who was visiting me this weekend. All three of us walked in and they guys welcomed us and told us to head over to the back. My friend and I don't really drink coffee so we didn't know what to order. The guy asked some questions and he ended him making me a "soo good" and it was soooo gooood! haha. My friend got a chai tea. She says its the best chai tea she has ever had. 

My drink was 25 cents cheaper than starbucks but 100x better.
author: Sarah C.

description:
iced mint mojito!!!!!!  After Philz I've been wanting to add mint into all my drinks! LOVE LOVE LOVE it.  

It's nice to have the person who takes your order make it right in front of you and ask how you like it...then asks you to try it so they can redo it if it's not the BEST you've had....so good.
author: Janet L.

description:
dropped by this place before work to see what all the hype was about.  it was my frist time and i am not much of a coffee drinker but the baristas definetely helped me out on picking a coffee.   ended up getting ambrosia coffee.  it was a smooth medium roast with a caramel tasting undertone.  they added cream and sugar to the coffee which lightened the taste.   service was very friendly.   if it's your first time here, go into the right side section of this establishment and order directly from the baristas, and you pay the cashier after you get your coffee.  on the left side they have places to sit with wifi.   this place is not as lightning fast as a starbucks, but it makes up with the home-ish vibe.

the caffeine in my small ambrosia coffee certainly kept me going all the way thru my busy 8 hour shift .  stronger than starbucks in my opinion

i would certainly come back just because of their friendly service, wifi, and abundant seating.
author: Tina A.

description:
First time here.... 

Tantalizing Turkish - Has some extra added spices in it.  The barista recommended it, because i like my coffee black...  I was not a fan of the spice at all.

Definitely need to go back and try another flavor because this place has enough hype to give it another couple chances.
author: Steven F.

description: Amazing coffee, especially the mint mojito and mocha tesora. However, the mint mojito is iced and thus comes with very little actual coffee. Skip the hot chocolate, it's nothing too special.
author: George L.

description:
I am a super skeptic, but hands downtown philz for having one of the best coffee shops. The Mint Mojito Iced Coffee is a must!
**but at this Philz location... it wasn't all that
author: Nan L.

description: Crack coffee. Their secret is the large quantity of sugar and manufacturing cream dumped in - and I don't care. When I don't have time to get over to a Philz and am feeling edgy, I pour heavy cream and sugar into my home-brewed coffee and it is good - but simply not the same.
author: Lauren D.

description: I'm not a coffee connoisseur. I can wake up and function without a cuppa joe but every now and then I really crave a GOOD cup of coffee. Philz is the best I've ever had. It actually makes me love coffee more. I tend to steer towards the house blend decaf, which is sooo damn good. Love that they also carry Califia almond milk now. The Philz bagel (with cream cheese or hummus) is a filling and somewhat healthy breakfast (well compared to the other baked goods there).
author: Priscilla M.

description:
I grew up with great coffee. My mom never went to Starbucks or Petes or any of those crummy chain joints. She always went to the nicest little cafes and bought the best beans to make at home; she didn't use drip, only french press.

Let me tell you, if you have been to a lot of coffee shops and been disappointed, I don't think you will be at Philz. This is not a place for European coffee-drink snobs; they do not have mochas, "non-fat-latte" this or any of that other crap you might find in a Starbucks or Seattles Best. No, this is a true coffee shop. True to the name at least.

Philz has over 40 different types of coffee I believe (for those who don't drink coffee regularly, that means they are sourced, grown and roasted differently; ALL OF THEM. If you like wine, you know what I'm talking about) and most of them are excellent. They literally have something for everyone here, so don't dismiss this place just because you can't get a cappuccino (you can, but I wouldn't recommend it). Get a nice cup of traditionally brewed "cafe" as they would say in "San Francisco"; San Francisco is a spanish town, with spanish roots. People get serious about their coffee here!

If you've ever been to Seattle, then Philz probably won't be that blow-your-mind coffee shop. But considering most coffee in San Francisco (and the bay area in general) sucks, Philz is a refreshing departure from the trend.
author: Angel M.

description:
Love this place! While visiting from NYC, a friend suggested we meet at Philz to catch up with some other people. I felt bad that we took up 3 tables and stayed so long, but the workers were not bothered at all by us staying for so long. I had no idea what to order and told the guy behind the bar that I'd like something bold and milky.  He nodded and whipped up a Jacobs Wonderbar and it was AMAZING! It had a very distinct taste but felt incredibly smooth and rich going down. I like how they hand you a cup and make absolute certain that you like the drink, and that they would remake your drink if you weren't satisfied.

After a couple hours, I decided to try another cup and got the Ambrosia and it was equally delicious and COMPLETELY different from my first drink! It was very rich and delicious as well. My friends got all different drinks and I loved them ALL! A Mint Mojito Coffee.... what??? It was amazing. Great job on the creativity and imagination department, Mr. Philz!

On my 4th or 5th hour there at the coffee shop, a worker signaled me to come over to him. I thought I was in trouble for being too loud or for staying too long, but he just poured some coffee into a few cups and asked us to try it out. So nice!!! The vibe is hipster-ish, but not annoying hipster-ish, if you know what I mean. They're very down to earth and chill.

I bought a bag of Anesthesia to the Upside and it was fantastic for a french press. How come I love them all?

I'm sad that Philz does not exist in New York, but I encourage them to do so!
author: Carol S.

description:
I wish this location Phil Coffee shop was open when I was in college. I will definitely go there for studying. There is a separate room next to where the coffee drinks are made/ordered. It perfect place for  people enjoy their coffee with the extra noise. 

I love this new location because it's easier to find parking on the weekend compares to in the Mission. The staffs there are really friendly and helpful.

My all time favorite ice mint mojito coffee. However, their medium roast coffee selections coffees are good too
author: Stacy L.

description: This place never disappoints.  Made to order drip coffee that is rich and unique in flavor.  The Mint Mojitos are a must try.
author: Mary V.

description:
Philz is very interesting. First of all you have a large variety to choose from, 2ndily every coffee here is very unique. The way they blend and make is creative. I kinda think it as cocktails of coffee. This morning I tried sooogood. It has an intense sense of favors: fresh mint, fruit, and coffee, all mixed well, a shocking experience to your taste.

In the past, I also tried silken slender and mint mojito (just the name is like cocktail, irght?). All very different from usual coffee shops.
author: Emmy P.

description:
I had to try the Mint Mojito Iced Coffee.

The refreshing blast of mint was surprising and immediately transported me back to summer.  A bonus for me: the mint stalks kept me occupied - they were incredibly fun to pick out and eat.  Weird habit.

There is one downside.  This jingle will help you out: "if you hate the price, ask for less ice!"  Four dollars for a 12 oz cup full of ice is pricey!  Even with mint stalks and all.
author: Fei L.

description:
Great cup served with a smile.

They have a bagel station and a large lounge on the other side at this location.

It can be pricey, but what do you expect when you want quality.
author: Po L.

description:
uh....i don't really like sugar and creme, soooooo yeah thats why a low ranking. too much sugar in a drink for me. I like my coffee black and bitter. so when i read the description of the bold coffee i thought it was hints of cocoa, not an actual mocha type drink...um, honestly it was good but not my taste. So don't take the 3 star too personally, just not my cup of tea..in this case coffee..

People do say you can get it black, but the whole layout was a little confusing, and the menu was confusing..but next time i go (yes i will give them another try) i want to try the black...straight black coffee.

So i will update because i hear so many good things, i won't let my hatred for sugar drank be the deciding factor.

but the prices were really fair to be honest.
author: Barnabas L.

description:
The things I would do to someone who brought me a Mint Mojito Iced Coffee RIGHT NOW.


(BTW, I'm in Italy. But I do awesome things.)
author: Liz T.

description: Philz coffee is good, but why do I feel like I have to be a hipster to walk into this specific establishment? I've been to other Philz and it was great. This place has an air of pretension and the staff wasn't that friendly. My friend visiting from the east bay noticed it too. I like the lighter roasts and it seemed like the Barrista was not enthused by my selection. Just a weird vibe. I'll try it again to see if it was just an off day.
author: Heather H.

description: Mint mojito iced coffee, best coffee ever! It was far from where I was staying but worth the walk!
author: Laura N.

description: I love Philz. Greater Alarm is my favorite! Great place to go in SF when you want coffee without attitude. They have a huge variety of options and so far, I've enjoyed everything I've gotten.
author: Leila-Anne C.

description:
Good coffee but socially irresponsible and harmful to the environment.

Goes something like this.

I walk in. 
Barista: "What can I get you?"
Customer: Asks about some coffee. 
Barista asks what size.
Customer: Small.
Barista whips out a disposable cup.
Customer: Whoa! I'm having this here. 
Barista: OK. 
Customer: I care about the environment and those were once trees. 
Barista: So do we. That's why we compost our cups.
Customer: What's the difference between a composted cup and a fully grown tree? 
Barista: Our customers don't have coffee here; they just go. 
Customer: What about these people, drinking out of disposable cups at the window? What about all of the people sitting down in the other room?
Barista: We don't have enough cups. 
Customer: Who's fault is that?
Barista: We ask that our customers bring their own cup.
Customer: Uh. Just like you asked me, right?
Customer: Just trying to get you to think.
[Customer gives barista a reusable container to put coffee in]
Barista: Here's your coffee.

Coffee was quite good, got a good buzz and another killer training session with Bunkerd.
author: Garrett S.

description: Philz has amazing coffee- especially the Tesoro Moca and Iced Mojito.  However, the tast is definitely  imporved because they use cream in all their drinks as a standard compared to the other cafes.  If you had Pete's coffee with cream it would tast much better also.  Service is always helpful and quick. parking is easier at this location
author: Amit P.

description:
Best goddamned cup of coffee in SF.  It's not even particularly easy to get to and I still manage to commute here once a week.  Turkish is my go-to, but the iced coffees on the menu now are AMAZING on a hot day.

The decor is ho hum, and they've expanded seating into the space next door.  They should really pump music into that room too.  It's library quiet and a little (read, a lot) strange to sit and have a conversation.

As noted in other reviews, minimal scruff factor at this location versus 24th Street, but not as cozy.
author: Ryan P.

description: Philz is amazing.  Mint Mojito Latte that's all you need to know
author: Jay H.

description: Okay for a change. Smells more like candy than coffee. Costly. Loud.
author: Mr G.

description:
I love PH_ LZ! (Do you want to buy a vowel?)  
I love the location.
I love their bagel sandwiches.
I love the Mocha Tesora. 
I love the first sip of coffee because of the perfect temperature. 
I love every single staff who works here. 

What more can I say?

I love Philz. :)
author: Deborah C.

description:
I love coffee, in all shapes and forms. I've heard about Philz a while back but never had the chance to try it. My friend suggested we go and on we went.  I was amazed by the selection of the different beans and was lost on what to order. The barista  that helped me guided me thru the different beans and offered her suggestions.  I was in the mood for something cold so she recommended their beans made for ice coffee. It was full of rich coffee flavor and just the right amt of sweetness. 

Cant wait for my next cup of joe from here. Next time I'll try one of the warm varieties or one of the specialties.
author: Peter L.

description: Parking is tough since its right on Van Ness. However, staff is friendly and efficient and there is plenty of seating allowed for Philz customers at the deli next door. Definitely a pit stop for out of towners.
author: Lisa H.

description: Recently moved to San Francisco and was in need of a spot that I could zone out with a nice roast and do some work. Philz is PERFECT! Free wifi, great coffee, and a separate room to hang out, study, or eat in. I'M SOLD.
author: Samantha G.

description: delicious delicious and fresh coffee!!!! This place is booming because there are lots of hungry and anxious people nearby waiting in the hour-two hour line at Brenda's soul food down the street! This coffee is pure amazing!
author: Amanda C.

description: An amazing selection of great coffees, and you can buy grounds of anything to take home.  Your coffee is always ground and dripped on the spot, when you order it.  It doesn't get much fresher than that!  The people are always friendly and helpful if you have any questions.  I can get very packed and very hot it here though!  But the room next door is theirs also and air conditioned, so you can wait in there as well.
author: N. Danny S.

description: Already wrote a review for another Philz location, but I really love this particular one because of how convenient and fast it is! It's clean, has a decent number of tables/chairs, not too crowded, and there's plenty of metered parking in the area on weekdays. People here are incredibly friendly; not surprising, though, since all the workers that I've encountered at Philz locations are great! Less wait time than I've experienced at other Philz locations, and definitely not as cramped as the one in the Castro.
author: Angela K.

description:
Not only do I love this coffee place, BUT I do prefer this location above the rest.
The staff here are ALWAYS so friendly and helpful.

I've been to the other locations and maybe had bad luck with new staff. They couldn't handle my boyfriend's order of light cream and sugar. They ended up messing my order up twice. And I honestly would have taken the coffee however he made it.

This place is SO great that we buy the $100 gift cards for $80 for ourselves.
We take home bags to brew at home and I actually give out bags of Philz Coffee beans as gifts for my friends in San Diego and Chicago.

The best part about getting your coffee here is they brew each cup individually.
They also add cardamom to the Philharmonic, which we started doing at home.

I highly recommend the Phil Harmonic, Ambrosia, Philtered Soul and Tesora.
author: Lora J.

description:
OK. You got me there, San Francisco. I am onto you now. Happy workers shaking your coffee beans to perfection with the milks and foaming and sprig of mint. Delicious I tell you! 

Many choices to enjoy. Dark, light, medium dark, etcetera. You are In the Big City now and manhood is upon you. Embrace to it. Feel the juice in your veins! 

Coffe was made by the Inca. My people. They older than sphinx and pray to the sun. Philz are the sun. It's people are my people. Pastry to go, my people, godbless to you.
author: Esteban F.

description:
After reading so many check -ins from a bunch of my friends on FB, I decided to see what the hype was about Philz.

I am not ashamed to say - I am a PHILZ addict! Philz is out of the way, and I would find my way to get a cup of this coffee on crack before work, after work, to bring with me to my son's football game, etc...

My husband had to do an intervention and cut me off....he even was doing the coffee run for me and my co-worker for awhile because I needed my Philz fix.

I usually get the Mocha Tesora as a treat or just the tesora for regular coffee.

My husband usually gets the Code 33

It takes awhile for your order - especially if there is a line - but that's the beauty of it...you're not getting coffee made in big batches that either is watered down or too much...it's not the cruddy drops for the bottom of the pot - it's a fresh manually brewed cup just for you!
author: JJAMZ C.

description: Pretty good stuff.  My gal and I got the iced mint mojito coffee.  They also have a nice selection of pour over coffees.
author: Anthony R.

description: The dark roast drip coffee is out of this world. They have almond milk for us vegans besides just soy as an option.
author: Brandon L.

description: I don't get the manufactured "cult" status of this place at all. There are about 899 places in the city that make better espresso drinks
author: Troy B.

description:
Philz is the best!!  Maybe the best cup of coffee in town.  The Mint Mojito Iced is awesome and the Mocha Tesora is so naughty but so delicious..  the people who work here are awesome and super-efficient.  the place is usually packed but each employee has like 3 drinks going at a time and get you served quickly..
there is no milk/creamer/sugar section, they do it all for you.  just tell them how you want it and they make it perfect for you, sugar, splenda, whatever.  also, if you bring in your own mug it's a $3 fillup, no matter how big your cup is..  seriously....
author: Clarke D.

description:
Oh yeah, this is the bees knees.

Ecstatic iced coffee, medium sweet = perfection.  Their coffee is so delicious you really don't need to add anything.  

And the service here is AMAZING!  When you walk in early morning or later in the afternoon  for something to open your eyes and get the blood flowing, even if you're not a morning person, you will feel good coming in here.  They are so friendly, so personable and they know their coffee!  Definite deal breakers on determining whether or not I'll be a regular.  

Philz definitely has a loyal customer in me.  How can I not be when they've made me an addict?
author: Juv C.

description:
Entirely worth the 10 block hike from my place.

The New Manhattan is my new morning crush.  It's delicious and makes me forget about the hangover inducers consumed the night before.

Great service; the baristas are generally nice, all over making sure you get your drink and the line probably moves the fastest of any of the great coffee places in SF.

Next time I might have to get two; one for the walk back and one for when i get home.
author: Steven R.

description:
Greatly enjoyed my Turkish coffee, though I was hoping for it to be done the traditional way, in a mini cappuccino cup with the dregs left to settle at the bottom of the cup. Still delicious, nonetheless!

One downside - wifi is horrendously slow. Or perhaps it was just being fickle on this one day. Will return to find out :)
author: Jade C.

description:
Everyone knows I love my iced coffee.

Even when it's cold outside, I'd rather have my dose of addiction, ICED.

So when one of the attorneys in my office noticed I have an iced coffee in my hand from *ahem* (starbucks) literally every morning, she urged me to try Philz.

Hands down, BEST ICED COFFEE EVER.

You don't even really get a choice of flavor, you just literally say, iced coffee and they whip it up. 

One of their associates actually told me it's a mixture of all the coffees they brew throughout the day.  While that might sound absolutely disgusting to drink a mixture of a bunch of stuff, fear not, it's absolutely delicious!!
author: Vince S.

description: By far my favorite coffee place in the bay area. Their different blends make it a different experience each time I go to Philz. A couple of my favorites are the Silken Splendor and the Tesora. The coffee tastes freshly brewed and you can tell it's just a good cup of coffee when you drink it.
author: Spencer E.

description:
I'm just slightly, maybe a little bit, in love.

What do I do?  Should I confess my love?  Or just be a stalker and profess my love online?  :D  Hm.  Oh, the dilemma.

Luckily, there is plenty of love here.  The baristas are super friendly (hello!), and it's a great spot to study-- there's WIFI and a new lounge area, where I often see my classmates studiously crying--err, reading-- over their notes (ha, I WILL fight you for Philz' love.. outta my way! just kidding.  sort of.)

Heart Philz.  Heart heart heart.
author: Jeanne Y.

description:
Love Philz...I not a coffee drinker, but when in the mood I go to Philz..why 

1. close to my job
2. I like all that extra shit they do with the coffee- it's makes you feel as though that cup of coffee was made especially for you
3. diverse groups of folks that frequent this place-suits and jeans alike
4. Love the bagel bar- that one guy who works there with the ponytail cracks me up

I only get decaf coffee here, cause it's pretty strong caffeine their serving up. One time just for shits and giggles I ordered the $11 cup of coffee- hey i felt like a baller- it was a fun time in a cup.
author: Janay W.

description:
Absolutely the best coffee shop in San Francisco. They also make a mean Chai Tea if you're not a coffee person. 

Definitely worth it to stop by Philz when you get a chance
author: Kev M.

description: Now why doesn't LA have this sort of joint? Oh, right, they are busy spraying on mystic tan. Anyway, when I visit home (SF) I make sure to hit up Philz Coffee for their Mojito Ice Coffee, only thing better? Add some rum in that sucker and call me happy.
author: Phuong T.

description:
I can't believe I just wrote this review!!! Philz, your coffee is the best in town!! You definitely beat blue bottle... 
I am a ice coffee fan and I highly recommend the ecstatic ice coffee... no other place could compare its specially taste. 
Philz! I love U!!!
author: Tammy V.

description:
Best coffee in the city, hands down!! I started with the Castro, but this is now my favorite location. 

Jacob's Wonderbar Brew and Philzharmonic!! Both with milk and light sugar....so yummy!!

Strong, never bitter, made when you order. You can't go wrong with a cup of Joe from Philz.
author: Maria M.

description:
Philz is ALWAYS busy, but you can't blame them.  They offer some of the best coffee ever!  Even though it was crowded, service was quick and the women who made my drink made sure I liked it before running off.  Even the cashier took the time out to ask me how I was doing and how my weekend was going.  I thought that was nice of him.

I ordered a decaf mocha tesora, medium sweetened.  It is by far the best mocha that has ever touched these lips.  If I had known how amazing it was, I would've ordered a larger size.  Next time for sure!  

I wish there was a Philz in the East Bay.
author: Rosemarie P.

description: This place was so great I had one of the best coffee's I've had in my entire life I could not believe how good this coffee was I have to give this a five star
author: Richard R.

description: Addicted to PhilZ came back and was recommended another coffee yesterday, I wanted to try something different besides my Jacobs wonderbar. The suggestion was good but I forgot the name Damn. The staff at the vanness location is super friendly also. Thanks for making amazing coffee!!
author: Karen T.

description: I got the mojito coffee with soy, and it was DELICIOUS! They are not skimpy on the mint AT ALL. I also bought the Tereso coffee bean home for my dad, and it smells amazing! I wish there was a Philz in Southern California :(
author: Trinity N.

description:
I hate coffee... but, Philz showed me the light! 

Waaaaaaaaaay better than Starbucks!
author: Juliette R.

description: I CAN SEE CLEARLY NOW. errrr Philz coffee actually gets me excited like coffee never has done before. I'm such a huge fan of the turkish with just a touch of soy that I've willingly added time to my currently rather long commute for it.
author: Misha T.

description: Well brewed coffee made fresh before your eyes. Couldn't fault the coffee. As a first time visitor however, I would have appreciated a little bit more assistance in directing my way around the menu e.g explanation of how to order/recommendations etc.
author: Tegan S.

description:
Today was my third visit to Philz coffee on VanNess between Eddy and Turk. I decided to wait until I found something to write about because I felt my first two visits left something to be desired. I talked to my good friend Mark about Philz, Mark is a fan, he said if I wasn't happy with my coffee perhaps I hadn't found the right coffee. I usually order a double espresso but Philz makes drip coffee only. I found the coffee at Philz to taste almost like hot water, didn't have any body or flavor to it at all. Mark suggested I try their Turkish coffee, wow, what a difference that made, nice a strong, felt like I was drinking something other than hot water and there's a spice in Philz brew that I think was cardomon, it certainly enhanced my drink without overwhelming it.

The staff are always nice and friendly and want to make sure they get your drink order to your liking and for $3.75 for a large coffe that's a good thing!

 Would I go back again? Absolutely now that I found a drink that I like!

Saturday, 3/24/12
Rainy day, Philz is doing a good business, the other room where you eat, use the free wifi is packed. Went back for another large Turkish, I asked what's the spice they use in the Turkish coffee, it's Cardamom! Since I have not had brekkie and it is going on 430p I ordered one of their burrito's, the Black Bean Breakfast Burrito. They are made in Sonoma, kept in a fridge (always a good sign) and reheated in the micro. Made with Flour Tortilla, potatoes, eggs, black beans, jack and chedder and seasonings. It was fillling and for $4 it needs to be however, I'm a spice nut, I like my spicy salsa or maybe  sri racha on my burritos. Maybe some individual salsa packets to take with the burrito would be perfect? Are you listening Philz?
author: David P.

description:
Still a HUGE fan of Philz.  They never disappoint.  Only gripe is the darn locations!! Tough to get to but oh so worth it. 
Like crack in a cup (in a good way).
If you need to be super charged for something grab a cup of Philz.
It's pricey but you get what you pay for!
author: Alisa M.

description:
Amazing coffee!!!

There might be some confusion as orders are placed first and paid upon completion. 

This location is a good place to study, because there are two separate rooms; one for ordering/paying + restrooms, and another one for sitting down with tables.

Mint Mojito Ice Coffee is my kind of drink, even when there were big chunks of mint in my drink.  

The ginger snap ice coffee had a nice spice taste that I hope becomes a regular on the menu. 

Baristas are very friendly and patient with customers and do their best to remember the regulars and their drink orders that help give this store a more personal place.
author: Casey L.

description:
I like their coffee but dislike this particular store.

The interior is uninteresting and customer service is the worst
among the other shops.
author: Yoshiko M.

description:
Good God. I've lived in San Francisco for almost a year. I've been drinking Starbucks coffee for longer than that. I'm disappointed in myself. Why did I not give Philz a chance until just now? Because I'm an idiot.

My friend was driving me to the airport the other day, and before we left she told me I HAD to try Philz Coffee. She's been talking about it for a while now. Now I know why.

I walk in around 9:45am on a Saturday, and the place is packed with happy people. The line was decent, but literally 2 minutes after I walked in, the line was out the door. I had no idea what I wanted to order, all I knew was I was getting a large (I went out the night before, I needed to wake up). I wanted something light, and smooth, with no yucky coffee aftertaste. I asked the baristo (I don't know, can I call I guy barista that?) what his favorite light coffee blend was. He recommended the "Soooo Good" (I'm a little unsure as to how many o's there actually were in the word "so". Please note that this is just an estimate). I got cream and sugar as well.

It took a little while to get my coffee as it was so slammed. I loved the way they had all the beans in different containers behind them, all labeled with their fun coffee names. Each barista/baristo had 4 coffee filtering cups in front as to make 4 orders at a time. It was such a fun thing to watch, maybe because I'm easily amused, or maybe it's just actually that cool to watch people make my coffee.

I paid my $3.50 for a large, took a nice large sip (PERFECT temp), and exhaled a sigh of contentment. I also exhaled my want for Starbucks ever again.

As a side note, I heard a TON of people ordering "the Jacobs." It must be their most popular blend. I might have to get a cup of that during my next Philz trip, which probably would have been right now, but I'm in North Carolina this week (hence the airport trip mentioned earlier). 

Phil, you're my new boyfriend. You're not arrogant, you're just hot enough, and you're very smooth. ;)
author: Ashley D.

description:
Truly a 4.5 out of 5 stars, but I rounded down for my reason at the end of my review.

Not a huge coffee drinker, but my very good friend recommended I try the Gingersnap Ice Coffee, so I decided to stop by and get the decaf version with almond milk. I'd never been to the Van Ness location before (I frequent the Berkeley one way more often to get work done) and was a bit confused about the set-up. There are two different entrances within the same building--the one on the right is where you order/pick-up and the one on the left is the seating area shared with a sandwich shop.

Fortunately, there was one empty table right next to an outlet that I was able to snag. I dropped my stuff off and went to order. There was only one person ahead of me and the barista was really helpful and friendly in terms of answering my questions and telling me what was in it. I then looked to see what pastries they had to offer and didn't see any vegan ones other than the ABC cookies that seem to be the vegan option at every vegan-friendly cafe in the universe. I passed. After ordering and paying, I waited only thirty seconds for my drink and the barista apologized for the wait. I was surprised because I thought it was very fast and told her so. She didn't ask me what I thought of my drink (as is customary with the other Philz), but I told her I enjoyed it anyway. It basically tasted like what autumn would taste like and figured that's why my friend recommended it--he knows how much I love pumpkin flavors.

If you're able to find a table, this is a great place to work for a couple hours or so. Everyone's busy doing their own thing and it's not too loud of an environment that you can't listen to music on your headphones.

My only complaint is how long it's taken for any employee to realize the compost/recycle bins are overflowing. I've been sitting down for an hour and they're still looking pretty gnarly.
author: Abraham D.

description:
Had the Mint Mojito medium sweet. I also tried my friend's who ordered it regular sweet. I think if I had ordered his, it would have been much more enjoyable. I don't usually add sugar to my coffee, but maybe a minty coffee needs that extra glucose factor. Anyways, solid service and solid coffee. 4.50 for an iced drink seems a little steep but what isn't these days.

Coffee is not as strong as I would like, but it may have been the drink that I tried. I will give it another try and update it soon.
author: Minerva l.

description: I might be just a little bit obsessed with Philz because I haven't had coffee for 2 weeks before trying this place OR because it's just that good. Unfortunately, I couldn't try the iced mojito because the one weekend I was up in SF, it was butt stinking cold! My friend advised that I get the Jacobs Wonderbar, and I definitely was not disappointed! It's a lot lighter and smoother than Starbucks. I'm wishing Philz would move down to LA and make a chain too. I'd be SO SO SO HAPPY! My next stop will be Blue Bottle Coffee, so that I can compare the two! And I'm hoping next time I come up to SF, it's not too cold so that I can try the mojito iced coffee!
author: Jackie K.

description: Sorry to say that i'm not a fan of the mint mojito! The coffee itself was smooth and creamy like i've never had before .. but the MINTS!! ahh.. get out of my drink! Although I do have to say that i've gotten another iced coffee from Philz and that instantly made me a fan! It just had the right balance of caffeine for me and it wasn't too sweet! Even when the ice melted, the coffee was still there! Which is very different from starbucks where your coffee just gets melted down when the ice melts!
author: Jennifer W.

description: Parking can be an issue, unless you live/work nearby.  Otherwise Philz is the best and no one can beat'em!  DELICIOUS coffees!!!  And now they've added a lounge area which was sorely needed.  You must go.  Now!  Finished?  Good.  Go again!
author: Jonathan G.

description:
What can I say, I love Philz!!!  I'm glad that Philz is making his mark in the SF Market, just don't turn into a virus like starF**ks.

Anyhow these are my favs I highly recommend, listed from most fav:

1) Ambrosia (my usual) now this is how coffee was meant to taste like.

2) Dancing Water (hmmmm, it's definitely dancing) LOL

3) Mocha Tesora

4) Turkish

5) Jacob's

This location also took over the real estate next door for your seating convenience!  ENJOY!
author: Edrian D.

description:
Great, great, great coffee. Very jealous of my sister who is able to grab a cup of Philz on her way to work everyday.

I've only had the Turkish coffee, but am so in love. 

The service is very friendly and quick, they were very conversational and walked me through their interesting way they create their drip coffee.
