As one who typically orders fancy coffee drinks, I was a bit hesitant at first of ordering just plain coffee but they add in the perfect amounts of sugar and milk for you! How sweet of them. 

It was the first time I realized what I had been missing out on with my fancy coffee drinks - I could actually taste the aromas and flavors of the coffee grinds, which doesn't immediately overwhelm your palate at all. 

Lovin' it and can't wait to try out other favs from my fellow Yelpers!
author: Shephalie L.

description: Not a huge coffee lover but their Mint mojito iced coffee is quite tasty!
author: Brian N.

description:
Philz Coffee, I'm upset. 


Your Mint Mojito Ice Coffee is too good that I can't try the rest of the drinks. You need a coffee drink flight :D
author: Jess H.

description: Hmmm, so I tried Philtered Soul this morning, and it wasn't that amazing.  I could see why people like it so much though -- it has a very distinct, nutty, hazelnut taste in the background, but it doesn't overpower the taste of coffee.
author: Christine A.

description: Best coffee in SF. Hands down. I like the 24th St. location best, but this one is closer to home. There are two sides to this place -- one side is coffee, the other bagels. My favorite blend is the Ether, made medium sweet with light cream.
author: Teryll H.

description: Delicious coffee. Got the mint mojito one and it wasn't overly sweetened. It let  the yummy flavor of the coffee shine through. Next time I want to try one of the unflavored variety.
author: Megan H.

description:
Philharmonic. 
mint leaf.
heaven in a cup.
wonderful coffee-one of my top two in the city. 
I will be back :)
Great customer service too.
author: Stefani K.

description:
Wonderful coffee (in particular the Dancing Water, which is what I ordered this last visit).  I had a rare opportunity to visit one of their shops while running tasks out of the office.  This is my second time to a Philz Coffee (the first time was at their Mission Bay location).  I wish there were more locations for me to hit and try more of their many brews on the menu board.

Philz Coffee is interested in it being a full service coffee bar.  They even add the creme and sugar for you upon request.  There's no creme containers or sugar packs away from the coffee bar.  Also, you order first and then go pay at the cash register.  This does have some potential for confusion because the cashier is not the one you ordered with.

This location is unique in that there's one entrance for ordering the coffee, and then a separate entrance for the "dining room".
author: H K.

description:
Don't think I can go back to places like Starbucks now that I can have my fresh cup of coffee made to order. Philz is the best! Everyone was really helpful and answered my questions about the different brew when I first started going. 

Now I like a new flavor coffee each time and rotate, it's addicting! 

Must try their mint mojito iced coffee:-)
author: Mandy T.

description:
This is the coffee shops of all coffee shops during my trip up to SF (And there are literally a million cafes in Little Italy that all serve coffee in the mornings, you can take your pick). It's unique, flavorful, creative, and really sets itself apart from all the other places.

First off, this place has over 30 different roasts to choose from. The best part is that they have very detailed descriptions of each roast and the drinks that are made, so that you can find the best drink suited to your own taste buds (this is especially important to me even though it's a pretty small detail, and I must have spent a good 5-10 minutes reading the descriptions to pick out what I liked)

The other thing that really caught my attention is the level of detail and care they put into their drinks. This isn't your typical coffee joint - each barista custom makes each drink, filtering a fresh batch of finely ground roast. I was pretty impressed; even as the barista that was taking my order was making several drinks, he still took the time to talk about various roasts with me.

Ended up trying the mint mojito iced coffee; the honest truth? It wasn't my favorite thing. I'm used to drinking coffee black, no sugar and cream, and I'll admit that it was a definite step in the other direction and the drink wasn't exactly for me. What I will say was that it was very flavorful and creamy, with a nice hint of mint that you could definitely taste, but not overbearing (I'm here for the coffee really, so I'm glad that it wasn't super strong)

Even though the drink I ordered didn't suit my tastes, I am absolutely certain that with the amount of knowledge and care taken for each drink, that there is something on the menu for me, and I am certain that drink is going to be pretty much perfect. If you're in SF and you love coffee, this is a definite must.
author: Anthony L.

description:
Totally love this spot. I came across this spot while I was walking my dog. I love these guys. They are friendly and even chipper in the early am. But they understand those of us (like me) who can't function properly until caffeine has been mainlined. But they walked me through the process and I ended up with a yummy cup-a-joe.  And the Ginger Snap iced coffee is incredible. It really does taste like a ginger snap cookie. WOW!  And I love that they have gluten free snacks. A brownie and a coffee - what more can you want or need. 

P.S. And I totally love the guy who rolls his tongue while working. I am not sure if he knows that is a big turn on for a lot of folks. Definitely makes for nice eye candy.
author: Melita R.

description:
Love this place.  If you like hand crafted coffee this is the place to go.  

They have a new location on Golden Gate at Larkin.

The only other place i know of thats this good in the Flora Grubb nursary coffee bar.  But phiaz has the best selection of these nhand crafted coffeess
author: Bruce B.

description:
This is my first time writing a review on Yelp because I really love Philz coffee.  I was a little overwhelmed, at first, because of all the different choices of coffee they have.  The staff was very friendly and helped me choose the perfect coffee.  I told him what kind of coffee I normally drink and he selected the tesora.  He added the perfect amount of sugar and cream.  He did a better job of making coffee than i do at home.  The bf and I shared a cup of coffee because we weren't sure how good it would be, but i wished we would've gotten our own cup.  We couldn't stop talking about how good the coffee was.  

I wish there was a Philz in LA.  I guess I will have to wait til my next trip to SF.
author: sophie s.

description: this place is awful for those that want coffee alternative.  I walk in and nearly stumble back by the extreme smell of coffee as if this place was never cleaned.  Secondly I order tea, only to find out that they do not separate tea and coffee, and therefor, my tea tasted like stale coffee. and thirdly they were not friendly or accommodating to me when I expressed to them that I am allergic to coffee.  I took 2 sips, of the somewhat hot tea, and ended up giving it to a homeless guy cause I was ready to puke.  Dont even waste your time thinking about going to this place.
author: Rachel A.

description:
Pretty cool place. Very busy, small lounge area-no place to sit.  Coffee is fresh and pretty good. You won't get an specialty coffee here, like mocha, latte or macchiato. But they can put some milk and sugar :)
I wish they had more tables, students occupied everything there because Wi-Fi is free :)
author: Xenia K.

description: Best. Coffee. Ever.  Yes it does live up to the hype.  Consistently good coffee at every location.  This location just happens to be closest to my house.  Try the silken splendor for medium roast or Jacobs Wonderbar for a dark roast.
author: Kirsten M.

description:
HOLY S#!T!! So, last year a girl friend of mine brought me a bag of the most yummiest Turkish coffee beans from this place. I thought I'd died and gone to Heaven!

Here I am a year later, living out in Annapolis and dying for some of that Turkish coffee blend to help make the new move not so depressing.. I call up Philz to have someone give me a better verbal description of what it is/how it was roasted, etc to see if I could find something comparable out here and the guy who answers the phone, frustratingly reminds me of the Hispanic house keeper on Family Guy... OMG! I tried being really patient, speaking slowly and clearly, but... It was getting to the point where I needed to politely thank him and gracefully say good bye or I was seriously going to end up snapping ....aaannd, I don't like to do that. He probably thought he spoke really good English.
author: Tanis G.

description: BEST coffee. I'm from LA and I miss this coffee everyday. Their selection is a bit confusing for me but their employees explain it all. I didn't know there was so much to types and brewing methods but they will hook it up with the best cup of joe you'll ever have.
author: Keiandra B.

description:
Where has Philz been all these years?!? I took 2 sips of their iced mint mojito and was already addicted!

 After hearing people raving about how good Philz coffees are I had to try it for myself. There isn't a lot of locations in the city so for me to get to one is rather challenging. Since I work in downtown and the nearest Philz is still rather far away. I finally took advantage of my day off and made a drive to their Van Ness location.  Parking was super easy on a weekday afternoon and the line wasn't bad. 

I of course, ordered the iced mint mojito =) the 1st sip was definitely very minty and it was something I wasn't used to in my coffee.  But the 2nd was what made me fall madly in love with this drink! The coffee is rich and creamy, the mint flavor leaves a cooling and waking feeling in my mouth and it's super refreshing. 

I wish they will open up a location in the heart of downtown! Until then, I cant wait to meet with Philz and their addicting iced mini mojito coffee.
author: Jenny G.

description:
If you read my previous review, you'll note I had a sub-par experience a little while ago.  

Management noticed too, and Jacob (Phil's son) went out of his way to make things right with me.  It meant a lot, and I'm happy to say I'm back on the Philz bandwagon.  It just tastes too darn good to stay away for very long.
author: Andy C.

description:
This is seriously the best coffee in SF.

I thought I was in a fancy bar or 5 star restaurant when the guy was spending time asking me about what I like in my coffee :)

Nice and clean shop, super friendly staff. My new fave!
author: Aphrodite L.

description: As always, great hand crafted drinks @ PHILZ!  The ginger snapn is my favorite! BUZZ!!!
author: Bernel H.

description:
When I need a coffee, I try to avoid Starbucks. I was happy to find a Peets a block from my new apartment. Until I saw Philz across the street.

Not only do they have excellent coffee, they also have comfy chairs and sofas so you can chill sipping one of their unique roasts.

Speaking of which, what a selection.
When I entered, I probably looked confused by all the choices and the guys behind the counter probably saw it; I'm pretty sure they are used to it.
And that's what sold me on intending to become a regular there: the staff.
First, they are super friendly.
Second, they take the time to ask you what you like so they can tell you which roast would be best.
Third, after  sitting in there for some time and see it interact with customers, especially the picky & annoying ones, I can tell you they are pretty awesome.

Finally, they brew one cup at a time, so coffee is always fresh.
What's not to like?
author: Vithiet L.

description: Came here earlier today and was amazing. The baristas were friendly and helpful. Will come again when I am in San Francisco
author: Catriona A.

description: This is my fav coffee in the city and maybe the whole wide world.  I think I've been to most of their locations.  If I'm out and about and need a cup of coffee I look for a Philz first, then Peets, then Starbucks if I'm absolutely desperate.  Most times I just get a cup of coffee (Philharmonic, Jacob's Wonderbar, and Turkish).  I've also tried the Mint Mojito which I thought was an odd drink offering but actually is great as well as the Mocha... outstanding Mocha.  Depending on the time of day you can be waiting 15 minutes for coffee.
author: Angelique B.

description:
Their Tantalizing Turkish is a full-bodied dark roast, aromatic and topped with three mint leaves designed to extract the special notes in this mysterious individually brewed blend.

The knowledgeable Baristas aka "Mixologists" steadily inquire about your caffeine preferences and perceptively concocts a unique blend while skillfully fusing your coffee, cream and sugar.

Verdict = Equivalent to Blue Bottle sans the haughtiness.

Philz, I look forward to a eternally everlasting relationship with you...meaning, prepare to be stalked!
author: Lisa W.

description: I officially have a coffee shop when I'm in the city. This place is phenomenal! I really suggest the almond milk ginger snap iced coffee. Definitely the best flavored iced coffee I've ever had. And it's not full of that syrupy garbage. Philz is phenomenal!
author: Nicole L.

description:
It's not your average cup of coffee. Philz brew their coffee right in front of you and ensures that it is to your liking. I always ask for cream and medium sweetness. Depending on the person brewing your drink, 9/10 times will be to your liking.

I was first introduced to Philz in San Jose while attending college and needed a mid afternoon refresher or something to get me ready for that 8am class. I have been to the one in Palo Alto, the two on 24th in the city. They all have had excellent service and sometimes that helps even more to uplift my energy. They usually have ample seating if you need a place to study or do some work.

My favorites are their Ambrosia of the Gods, Mocha Tesora and Philtered Soul. The Philtered Soul has a delicious hint of hazelnut that enhances the flavor of the coffee and is currently the one I get. I have had their famed Mint Mojito. I thought there was too much mint in the Mint Mojito, but still enjoyed it. They even have Blue Bottle Coffee there.
author: David M.

description:
As we were walking to the Giant's celebratory parade, those 6 Bloody Mary's kicked in so I had to go...

So we popped into Philz and by the time all that vodka had left my system, I literally think I tasted the-very-best-iced-coffee-of-my-entire-life. That medium sized cold coffee was of dessert quality. It was so creamy and the taste of mocha and coffee beans just lingered. I don't know a thing about Philz, but before we could even order the lady behind the counter simply declared "One Iced Coffee", and I'm so happy she did because it was insanely memorable and overwhelmingly satisfactory.

I haven't read any of the reviews on Philz yet because I want to make sure others agree before I start thinking that I was just on the verge of too-drunk, if such a thing even exists. I mean, the reason I remember the name of the place is because I'm from Philly and found it quite ironic that I was holding a coffee cup that said "Philz" after the Giant's just beat my home team.
author: Michelle L.

description:
"You've been 'phil'd',"  as what Tina T. would say. And indeed I have. Not too long ago, many of my coffee loving fiends insisted I tried out Philz. Initially, I thought there's really nothing special about this place from the exterior. I'm ashamed to say, I would often confuse them with a chain like Java City. I'll wait a bit. After more insisting, I finally decided to go check it out with Tina T as we were in the area. I may have just came across one of the best specialty coffee places in my life. I'm swooned, Philz. I am swooned and you have opened my floodgates to a new addiction: your mint mojito iced coffee. 

Who thought of this? Ingenious! When I usually drink specialty coffees, I get this heavy bloated feeling in what I thought was lactose intolerance (if I am, I'm in denial). The mint mojito iced coffee is sweet but it was sooo light and refreshing! First time, I didn't have the bloated feeling after coffee. 

The baristas working the front are very sweet, personable as well as Sammy, who was working up at the register. Thank you Philz, you've got all the elements I'm looking for. I wish you weren't so far away from me, or I could easily have become a regular here.  4 stars for now because I feel like there is more I need to try here! Anticipating until my next visit!
author: Wendy L.

description:
Story time: Philz has been in my life for years now. Back when I lived in palo alto they were the new fancy coffee shop that took over La Creme and became a hangout spot where my friends (several have worked there at one point) would all meet up and drink coffee/draw/smokecigarettes/spend hours doing nothing and now that I've grown up a bit and moved to the city this location has become my daily coffee spot before work due to it being literally 2 feet from my bus stop.

A large black cup of greater alarm is my drink of choice or a large black light iced ecstatic when it's nice out. The sambusas I've recently gotten into getting daily as well, they're all good. And today I tried their Philz bagel for the first time and it's so good I may start getting that daily as well. You get what you pay for here in quality, service, and atmosphere. 
So here you go Philz, another 5 star yelp to add to your giant stack of perfect reviews from another regular customer that feels like you've made some positive impact on their life.
author: Fishy S.

description: I'm usually not a coffee drinker, but this place was a MUST try for me when I visited SF over the weekend. I got the popular mint mojito ice coffee. For someone who is not a coffee lover, this was pretty damn good. I even came back for a second visit before I left. Great and quick service, I plan to come back to try the other drinks on the menu when I'm in town.
author: Elaine T.

description: Mint mojito is my favorite coffee drink in SF. Had it hot and it was amazing.
author: Xteethx B.

description: I had a super bad experience on mojito iced coffee this morning , I am a fan of Philz coffee , but she the Asian lady brought me in a super bad coffee which I asked for creamy and sweet on it , it turned out taste dark ,her attitude really turn me down. :(
author: koko c.

description:
If I leave for work early enough, I hop off the bus and stop here for some coffee before going in to work.  There is so much to choose from, I don't know where to begin.  I have gone up and down the menu and can't decide which blend I like best.  I do have some Red Sea all set for my French Press, since the coffee at work is pretty bad.

I normally just drink black coffee, but something in that thick cream and sugar just works.

Smaller and not as hip at the original location on 24th, but I will gladly leave home even earlier if I can have enough time to make a stop here before my graveyard shift.

Now maybe I'll try that $10 per cup of Jamaica Blue Mountain and see if it is REALLY all that.
author: Michael M.

description:
Great chai tea, delish coffee. 

Bring your own travel mug and pay the cost of a small even when you get a larger size.
author: Cory D.

description: Istanbul tea w/ honey & mint please! Something about this tea has me hooked! It's delicious!
author: Jeanette Y.

description:
Directions to reading this review:  When reading the first half of the review...please read slowly and do not stop midway.  At the end of the dots it trails on to the next dots.  Thank you..come again. 

This place makes Starbucks look like a dumb hooker whose been around the block that night to pay for her...

...shit... aint even tight anymore...Gotta stick it up her...

..But hold... on don't you even fret, Philz to the rescue to get you....

..Off... to a good start.  Haha i know I'm a tease, don't worry I put...

..Out...of this tiny hole...in the wall place comes a mean cup of joe's...

..Cream...please! With 2 Splendas :)  I'm stopping now...lol

This place makes me wanna slap other coffee shops in the face.  Don't make me go Madea on yo ass.  Seriously this place puts out an amazing cup of coffee.  Each cup made to order, our barrista Austin was beyond awesome.  Friendly and entertaining with a spunky personality.  He was so accommodating even when one of our party changed her order twice.  

Austin asked us what we liked and had a recommendation for all of us.  Mine was absolutely what I was looking for.  Nutty and smooth with a hint of something extra in the background.  It wasn't overpowering, the flavor was subtle and delightful.  It felt like heaven was trying to call me home.  

Friendly service, interesting coffees, free wifi, each coffee made to your specifics.  I don't know why this isn't in LA yet?  I'm jealous of this shit.  I wish this was closer to me so I could be a regular like the cast of "Friends".  I think i would be Phoebe, just because she makes me giggle.
author: Anthony N.

description:
This place is great.  

As referenced in the other reviews, the coffee truly stands out.  As I get more and more into coffee, I'm finding good coffee is all about the blend and Philz has got it down.  However, at least at this location, the thing that makes Philz so great is how friendly the staff is.  They're super accommodating and help guide you through your selection, which is great considering all your options.
author: Jeff B.

description:
I'm a beginner at coffee BUT I HELLA LIKE the iced mint mojito coffee!

The staff are great too!

Place is a little small but most people are on the go anyway.

YAY!
author: Jay C.

description: I have to agree with Jenny K. The staff very impressionable with meeting your taste for coffee. Very well pleased, thank you very much. Light roast is what I asked for, and the first sip of "soooo goood" is soooo great!Normally I add a sweetener (which I forgot to mention to the barista) but the flavor of coffee with soy milk was not bitter at all.
author: Jay B.

description: First time at Philz. My friends suggested the Lime Mojito Iced Coffee. It was really good! I'm usually just a straight coffee type of guy, but it was really good! And they do drip coffee, which I personally prefer over machine.
author: Nathan T.

description:
I adore this place. OK for coffee, it is expensive...and it is a bit of a cult. But I joined! I am not big on cutesy names. So I dislike "the z" at the end of Philz, and I am not big on the names of the coffees which are all too precious. But the crowd is fun, ranging from fashionistas, military people, cops, EMTs, and a gazillion white collar workers. 
The bagels are a good and fresh....try the chai sometime...it is freshly brewed and not from a mix.
author: Adam R.

description:
philz is soooo good. I drink strong black coffee, and if you like that too, try Ether! Some of the best coffee I've ever had. The mint mojito is also perfect for a sunny hot day (which luckily we've been having a lot of lately!) I also find the staff nice and really friendly and always willing to recommend a new kind of coffee. I love that they ask you to try it before giving it to you to make sure it's perfect.

Why isn't this five stars?
Their muffins are really hard which isn't my style, last weekend when I desperately wanted a coffee the line was out the door and like 20 people long (wtf?!) and it's a kinda expensive.

Besides that, it's pure awesomeness.
author: Ashley H.

description:
I really really count on that delicious Philz flavor as the sun comes through my window. 
I picked this location because it's near my workplace and the people there are VERY friendly and helpful, but I'm mostly reviewing the coffee in general.  
I live in Oakland right in between Peerless, an old-school institution that I am glad still survives, and Blue Bottle, a very very well-known coffee joint and part of the whole new coffee movement deal.  But I choose to buy me some Philz beans. It's a love affair, mainly between the bean, and me.
author: Lila G.

description: I always look forward to coming to Philz "err" time I am in the city!  There is always a wait on the location in Vaness, but well worth it! The coffee is strong and tastes amazing! I have had the iced coffee at both time and it has been delicious and strong! Highly recommend!
author: Abra S.

description:
This place is excellent! Wonderful baristas who's really helpful and friendly. They make coffee for you on the spot. Bring your own mug/tumbler, coz no matter how big your mug is, they'll charge you a small coffee price. 

Extensive coffee menu (from light, medium to dark roast), interesting and fun names for each beans. You can even mix and match beans. My favorite combination would be Philtered Soul + Mocha Tesora. It's great coz the Philtered Soul is hazel-nutty thus really pairs well with the chocolate in the mocha. 

Quality is often consistent, as you can even control how sweet or creamy you want your coffee to be. 

The cafe is quite small, has free wifi, baklava and breakfast burritos!
author: Rika P.

description: While visiting San Francisco a friend took me to Philz Coffee and I enjoyed the experience as well as the coffee so much I went back two more times during one long weekend visit!
author: C. M.

description:
Philz has great coffee, definitely among the best in SF. I usually get coffee drinks, not just plain coffee, so I realize I'm not a real coffee authority. But the coffee at Philz is good that it doesn't overwhelm your palate with bitterness. Here's what I've tried (and loved): 

-mint mojito iced coffee
-Tesora (recommended for first timers)
-Philtered Soul (really does have a hint of chocolate)
author: Shreya O.

description: There's no question the mint mojito is the must-order here. I also go here to stock up on fresh coffee beans to bring back for my friends in Calgary. If you're a fan of dark roast blends, get the Tantalizing Turkish blend.
author: Asim S.

description: Love the Tesora, right amount of sweet n nutty. Milk and sugar is added to your liking, love that too :) Service is friendly and if you don't quite know what you'd like (there are a LOT of options), they are great with recommendations.
author: Cindy L.

description:
Take any aspect you dislike about coffee: the acidity, the bitterness, etc. and throw it out the door.

Brewed one cup at a time, after 25 years I can honestly and wholeheartedly say that this place roasts the BEST cup of coffee I have ever had. 

After years of hype I finally did it..I went in. I was fully ready to tear this place apart because of all the good press but it's honestly hard for me to say one bad thing about this place.
author: Mafia M.

description:
HOW COULD YOU GO WRONG?!?!

PHILZ COFFEE IS THE ABSOLUTE BEST COFFEE IN SAN FRAN!!
I love coming here to study for my finals. Although it's busy at times and crowded, I think it's def. worth the wait and the line goes by fast. I've been to many Philz and this one is the cleaniest and most friendlist!
author: Serena S.

description:
They have the best staffs at Philz on Van Ness. They are so kind, so helpful and so witty!

Don't know what to get? They will recommend something great and if you're not happy with their recommendation they will make you a new one til you're satisfied! (thats what my barista told me!) They have not yet failed on me when it comes to their recommendations.

My favorite is their "It's the best" and their daily iced coffee with a mint leaf.

Their coffee is personally brew, just for you so each cup really is freshly made!

Can't go wrong with Philz. Ever.
author: Jenny K.

description:
I fell in love with Philz at their 18th and Sanchez location. Reviewers called it a life-changing experience and I rolled my eyes....then I went there and had a cup and told everyone and their mom, "Oh my GOD, this coffee changed my life!" Believe the hype. Believe in the power of mint leaves.

So I work graveyard shifts for a news wire at Market and Polk several days a week, and I decided that since it's logistically closer to my work I would make the Van Ness Philz my new guilty pleasure stop. And as much as I love the Castro, this location puts that one to shame. Well, as ashamed as a place as awesome as Philz can be.

This location (I'm here right now) is so clean, you seriously forget that you're a half block from the heart of the TL. The bathroom is super big and clean, and I always appreciate places that can even make a pee a pleasant experience. There's plenty of seating (tables and couches), and, obviously, FREE WI-FI!

But that's not what makes this Philz more than the best Philz, but one of the best singular coffee shops in the entire city. It's the people who work here. I swear these are the most happy, light-hearted little joy spreaders I've ever met. They greet everyone with the biggest, most sincere smile and really care about making you a drink you'll really enjoy; they're not pushing an agenda with no regard to whether you like it or not. They'll make your coffee extra sweet and creamy or totally black, just like you like it. And they'll remember you when you come back.

I came in here one morning around 7:30 a.m. after a long, grueling overnight shift. To paint a picture for you, let it be known that phrases like "I honestly hope someone tries to start a fight with me on the street after my night shift just so I have an outlet for the aggression it causes" get thrown around by my colleagues, so when I dragged my tired self into Philz that morning I wasn't exactly chipper. But the brew master behind the bar was so full of smiles and energy that by the time we had decided on the coffee I was going to try that day (I like to mix it up) I was already at least three times as energetic as when I walked in. Then he clapped his hands and said, "Alright! Let's bring you back!" And he did: as I walked out with that treasured brown cup in my hands I was smiling from ear to ear and practically skipping down the street.

Big kahuna bonus life points to the VN Philz folks on this one: if you drive here and park your car out front, they make announcements warning people with cars when meter maids are rolling through to help you avoid those dreaded love notes on your windshield! Let the good Karma flow, and...

Viva la Philz!!
author: Kyveli S.

description:
Oh... Philz. You helped me realize that law school without caffeine is just a well-meaning yet futile endeavor. Thanks for making me face the truth.

(And also for the most delicious addictive coffee too, I guess.)
author: Ash V.

description:
Philz is an extremely homey, friendly coffee shop with damn good coffee.  I don't know what they do to that coffee, but it makes you feel good.  I've never had such great coffee.  Spendy at 3 to 3.50 a cup, but worth it.

Great place to both study on your laptop and have random interactions with strangers.
author: Kyle P.

description: Best coffee on the West Coast! Phil is also the nicest, and friendliest guy ever. If you are looking for quality coffee, this is the spot.-LA or Norcal. A must!!!! Keep expanding Phil! We need Philz in Oregon, especially Bend, Oregon!
author: Nicole B.

description:
Friendly but tad expensive.  And I do like my simple large ice coffee with 1 cream and sugar.  

When your ice coffee doesn't taste sour, has a full body and an aroma and taste that is fully rich with coffee flavor that lingers for however long, with just a fair amount of kick, its great.  Winner for Philz.  

I don't have to wait for the blue bottle at this point.  Philz across the street from work works just fine.  And this place has a nice environment but limited seating for studying.  If I pass my test, I'll proudly attribute some of the efforts to Philz with its coffee and convenient location.
author: Vincent K.

description: Best iced coffee EVER. I have yet to have a comparable iced coffee anywhere... not at Blue Bottle, Starbucks, Intelligentsia, Lamill, etc. Have yet to have Stumptown coffee but I'm still dreaming of Philz! When r u coming to LA?!
author: Ellen C.

description: Finally, I got to try this place! At first I was a little disappointed because I expected my mint mojito coffee to be VERY good (like crack fries).... Idk... after sipping it a little more and actually savoring it.. it slowly grew on me! It's rich and creamy with a hint of mint... it's quite refreshing! OH and i love how it's STRONG, it doesnt taste strong, but woah.. it's nothing like starbucks :) Love it!
author: linda L.

description:
Never been a big fan of Blue Bottle.

But I LOVE Philz. 
Options, and options and lots of creations....
They have a wide variety of coffee - just tell them how u like your coffee
 ( what type of flavor ) and they will make it for you. Everyone that I have introduced Philz to, Loves them.  So what I like might not be your cup of Philz. Go In and actually tell them what u like. 
I actually crave Philz at least 3x's a week and will go out of my way to get their coffee.

Please go get yourself a Philz!!
author: ThuZ W.

description:
My friend, who is NOT a coffee drinker, suggested this place, so I figured it was going to be one of those spots where there is mediocre real coffee and a bunch of those whipped cream laden, overly sweet belly busters in a clear cup, rather than a true coffee lovers' spot.

I am glad i was wrong.

Philz is like toys r us for coffee lovers!  The menu is a bit confusing at first, so I ordered a "plain black coffee."  Hahaha.  Luckily, the guy behind the counter explained everything to me, and then asked me what I like.  "Something bold" was my response, and his recommendation was Jacob's Wonderbar.  It was amazing and definitely hit the spot on this cold, rainy day.

I wish there were locations closer to where I lived in the east bay, but this is definitely a new stop for me anytime I need a quick, tasty pick me up.  Highly recommended.
author: JP T.

description:
East coast coffee sucks.
Silken Splendor, medium:
I miss you so much.
author: Jared S.

description:
Great place! nice and cozy ......great work break. They put cream and sugar for you. Yummy desserts as well.   

Also good place to work.
author: Dishar R.

description:
By now, I've been to this location enough times that I can no longer count them without taking off my shoes.

Anyhoo... I generally receive better than average service here... except my last time.  This last time, my friends weren't treated the best.  They seemed frantic and very much in a rush.  For what reason and to what end?  Hell if I know!

Space is limited, so going to this Philz expecting to sit and enjoy the coffee is somewhat of a pipe dream.  

Oh well, no matter what little complaints I have, they are usually pretty consistent with their service and coffee.  

Recommendation: Philtered Soul... 3 mint leaves.  

4 Stars.  Polo, you rock.
author: Johnson N.

description:
you will regret coming here. because after you've tried it, everything else will suck

love the mojito, mocha, and dancing water!
author: Long C.

description: This Philz location is smaller but friendly nonetheless.  My mint mojito was made a little too sweet but the barista tried to fix it.  Parking here isn't ideal but I love the other room to study/do work in.
author: Carli F.

description: Mint mojito. Love the creative iced coffee options served here.
author: Kelly T.

description: Philz, you never let me down.  That iced coffee. is. so. good.  I particularly really like this location because there is a coffee lounge across the way from where you actually buy your coffee, and maybe it isn't always like this, but it was TOTALLY quiet.  Really great environment to study/get some work done while indulging in a delicious cup of Philz.  I wish there was one closer to Nob Hill . . .
author: Mel G.

description: Love the coffee here . Every time I go to San Francisco I try and make it to this place.
author: Chris W.

description: I'm not a coffee drinker but I had a sip of my friend's coffee here and it was damn good. They have a really good selection to choose from. They also have a bigger sitting area so there's a lot more room if you want to sit and chat with a pal. I only ended up buying a bottle of water but maybe next time I'll get a hot beverage. I will be back.
author: Amy J.

description:
Iced Mint Mojito Coffee... uh, nirvana? Is that you?!!
YEAH. Philz is amazing. Best coffee in SF! Everything on the menu is fabulous.  Please expand to Seattle... pleeeeaaasseeeeeeeeeee!!
author: Robyn B.

description:
This is my favorite Philz location in the city!

Service: As with all Philz, customer service is friendly and delightful, not to mention very helpful when suggesting a cup of coffee.

Vibe/Location: Clean. Neat. Not a bad neighborhood (referring to Mission location which is kinda shady/scary - not my cup of tea..er joe?)
There's also a lounge right across the way which is filled with tables and even a couch. Great spot to study or read some books.

The chocolate croissant we got on a Saturday morning wasn't very fresh and pretty dry, so Philz, if you're reading this .. make sure to get more frequent deliveries!

Recommendations: Sooo Good. Iced Mint Mojito.
author: Mia N.

description:
Seriously, my favorite coffee place in town.

We first had Philz by the ATT park when a bored worker invited us to our first cup which he promised would be the best I've ever had in my life. He was hilarious and full of confidence and we couldn't believe that he wouldn't back off. Definitely good their coffee is generally very smooth and almost cocoa-y and always a little bit frothy and creamy in a good way, if you get cream.

Ever since I've been a fan. Their employees are nice without being overbearing and seem to genuinely enjoy being there. I stay in the medium roasts as their lights can come off as a bit watery to me but their darks definitely have a punch. Iced coffee is refreshing and the mint mojito version sounds a little weird for coffee but it works.

A great coffee shop without the pretentious feel. Love it.
author: Sam H.

description: The mint mojito is a little creamy, but magic layers. the Istanbul treat highly recommended. Be aware of low customer service
author: Edison L.

description: Hands down the BEST COFFEE on the entire planet!!
author: Xiu L.

description:
I give Philz 4 stars because "Yay! I'm a fan." 

Last week the store on Van Ness had funny handwritten signs...alarming you to beware of more handwritten signs. There's also a lounge right next door for those Philz customers who want to sit down and enjoy their coffee. 

The customer service was awesome! My friend and I didn't know what exactly we wanted so the girl helping us asked us a series of questions and then brewed up exactly what we wanted, without us even knowing. The temperature was exactly perfect for right-away drinking, unlike other chain coffee shops they give you scalding hot coffee that will kill your tastebuds so you can't actually tell their coffee is bad. 

I got a Philz Harmonic (love the name) and it was a light roast packed with flavor. I've also tried their hot chocolate at other locations and for chocolate lovers, I'd call it heaven.
author: Christine A.

description: Best coffee place ever. Huge comfortable couches, laid back and clean environment, and incredible coffee. This place is going to take off. Big time.
author: Robert S.

description:
Previously, on the Philz review I stated that I only drink mochas, and the pastries aren't that great.  Well...

Thanks to Philz I have started drinking a cappuccino here and there, and I really like their Philtered Soul.  Also, they added a bagel bar, and the Philz Bagel is a really tasty bagel at a good price.

They also bought the retail space across the way and made it into a seating area, so the entrance to the coffee bar isn't packed full all the time.  It just keeps getting better!
author: Diana W.

description:
As a recent law school graduate and bar exam survivor, I think it is safe to say that I am coffee addict. Coffee has been my lifeline for years and it was all I drank for 10 weeks straight while studying for the bar exam. I made it my mission to visit as many coffee shops in one of the most caffeinated cities in the U.S. This was the last stop of my coffee mission and I definitely saved the best for last. Starbucks who? I had the Philtered Soul, a hazelnut cup of magical deliciousness. This coffee is a little more on the sweeter side but did not compromise the taste of the rich coffee. When I have a coffee, I want to taste the COFFEE, not all the milk and sugar. Philtered Soul had a great balance of coffee and hazelnut that made me question how I can even continue living without a Philz coffee shop. 

Philz we need more you. Please share your amazing coffee with the rest of the U.S.
author: Anna M.

description:
Addicted. Oh so addicted.

Newsflash - They now have a bagel bar, and where you used to sit, that's all gone. They bought the space next to them and there is much more room over there. Out.
author: Ken L.

description:
The Turkish Coffee at Philz is better than coffee in Turkey! I love this place.

Oh and the music in the lounge is awesome!
author: Elie K.

description: By far the best coffee (concept) in San Francisco. The Tesora is great and the staff is always very friendly and helpful.
author: Vincent V.

description: Gets crowded around Sunday brunch time. Delicious coffee, same as every other location.
author: Rob R.

description:
I don't care that you're convenient or that you know know how to keep me happy through the rough days..or even that you remember my name..................

but Peet, not only have I been cheating on you....I'm leaving you cause I found someone who does it better.

Philz has a wide selection of coffees, catered to your needs for the mood that you're in at that very moment.  I couldn't really ask for more, other than for them to pour it down my throat with a sexy Greek god fanning me.  Really.  The Mint Mojito Iced Coffee is simply amazing.  It lives up to the hype and is definitely not a pretentious coffee shop like the other ones in the city that people rave about and are willing to waste a fraction of their lives waiting in line for.  There's never been a long line, they're well versed in their product knowledge, combined with their personable attitudes.  They ask you what you want, what you're in the mood for, and how it was after you tasted it.  Exactly, like the perfect lover indeed.

Philz, I'll never leave you.  I'm absolutely smitten.
author: Betty W.

description: I ordered the infamous mint Mojito iced coffee and it was good, however when I reached the bottom it was hard to drink because of the numerous mint leaves they put in there. The mint Mojito is perfect for those who are not heavy coffee drinkers because it doesn't have a strong coffee taste.
author: Kristian W.

description:
I will never be the same again. How can a 12oz cup deliver such delight? Forget Starbucks, It's a Grind, Peet's, even Blue Bottle. No one compares, NO ONE.

I died and went to coffee heaven when I entered Philz for the first time. What's kind of cool about this place is that the cups are already insulated. My mom loved this so much she saved our cups so she can use em again when she brews at home. Gotta love fobby moms!

I got four words for you: Mint Mojito Iced Coffee.

Word.
author: Anita W.

description: I enjoyed the Canopy of Heaven. Who woulda thunk that light roasts have more caffeine? It definitely got me through the day.
author: Earlene C.

description:
My friend Diana has opened me to a new coffee spot.  Peets coffee can move over.  Dark roast coffee: Jacob.  Just only one sip and you'll find a deep appreciation for coffee beans and making the coffee.  The medium roast mocha was pretty good.
You have to find a Philz nearby.  You won't be dissapointed.
author: Eric N.

description:
If you like mint tea, minty stuff, this is a great place for you to try some MINT MOHITO COFFEE! it is absolutely refreshing! it is definitely different from traditional coffee. it's a hot coffee with mint, add ice to chill it in a hot coffee cup. a bit interesting, eh?
The staff is friendly and helpful, they explain what's in it even though the written sign below the counter is pretty self-explanatory lol.
author: Mindy C.

description: Philz is my favorite coffee place of all time....The iced mint mojito coffee has completely won me over! Love love love!
author: Sheryl P.

description: FYI, drip coffee only. If you want an espresso fix, you will have to go somewhere else.
author: Matt S.

description:
So good. SO GOOD! holy crap this coffee is good.  Better than Blue Bottle, Ritual, and all the other places in the city.  Trust me, I know my coffee and Philz is amazing. Well roasted, well blended, well brewed, balanced sweetness and acidity, smooth flavor. They make it for you exactly as you like it.  Friendly service, they dont make you wait ridiculously long and they do not have snobby attitudes. 
Smiles all around as you take your "test" sip of the cup they just made especially for you...and you will always smile and say its perfect, because it is.

We bought some for home too and as I write this review, I am contemplating making another cup since the first one was so insanely enjoyable. I love being addicted to coffee if this is the coffee that I get to drink every day. Life is good.
author: Nilu r.

description: This is a Philz Coffee shop located on Van Ness diagonally across the street from my beloved Peet's. Philz started in the Mission District in 2003 and they are famous for their Mint Mojito Iced Coffee. Trust me it exceeds all the hype! The iced coffee itself is creamy, but not too sweet, while the mint provides a very refreshing flavor. Also, you can barely taste the coffee's bitterness as you gulp it down. The service here is very friendly and efficient. Walk in, order your drink, and pay for it in a separate line off to the right. I haven't had a chance to try anything else here, except the Tesora blend coffee. The Tesora fit my ideal characteristics in a cup of coffee (full-bodied and smooth), but didn't really stand out in any way; maybe I'm just too partial to my Peet's Sumatra and Arabian Mocha Java beans. As a bonus, all Philz locations have free Wi-Fi and there are plenty of tables next door for catching up or studying. Just keep in mind it may get pretty loud for a coffee shop, especially in the afternoons, so bring some headphones if you don't want distractions. This place receives 4 stars purely for their Mint Mojito Iced Coffee. Maybe once I try some of their other coffee blends/drinks I will increase it, but for now I will be back for the perfect summer drink!
author: Andy C.

description:
11.09.12   yy/mm/dd


I crown Philz as the new king for brewing the best coffee
I give it 5         stars for the Blue Mountain $7 for small $10 for large
             4 1/2   stars for the other blends


Back in past ...  it was different cafes in North Beach ...

Then it was Blue Bottle and Ritual depending on which drink

Now ...  it's Philz Coffee. 

I was curious when I keep hearing it was highly ranked on SF Weekly. Finally I was in the neighborhood in the mission this year and had to try it. I was impressed. I wasn't used to the full service protocol. Sadly I noticed they also served Jamacian Blue Mountain coffee by the cup. Sadly, I enjoyed the great cup of "Terosa". I couldn't stop thinking how it would great to finally sip a cup of the elusive Jamacian Blue Mountain coffee...

Finally. One at Van Ness ave, reasonably within my reach! The first thing I order was a large Jamacian Blue Mountain, $10/cup! It was the best smoothest cup of coffee I ever had!

I was so hooked that I visited it 3 times in a row!
So I tried the Jamacian for the first visit.
The second visit I had the Jamacian and "Terosa"
The Third time ... mocha

I noticed on the third visit that the drinks didn't give gas and was very smooth ...

Each order is handled by each barista.
The beans are grind per order.
Grinded beans are placed in a filter with a special round collar.
       Assuming used to keep the grind from floating all over the place
The milk and cream are done by them also.

I will not tell you how it taste ...
     because there are so many blends with different profile
            just come and try it for yourself
                    aren't you curious about how a Jamacian Blue Mountain
                             taste???

I am glad I tried this place.
Didn't care for the split store @ Van Ness.
One side closes half hour earlier.

I hope they will have an outpost in the Richmond district in the future.
author: S.K. Y.

description: I was brought to Philz by some locals, aka my boyfriend's brother.  The place is small and disorganized and has a bathroom key that I did not want to touch.  But damn that was a good coffee.  I got an iced coffee, I think it was called the ecstasy blend.  It was really good.  Tastes fresh like they just ground the beans... because they did.  A+
author: Rachel R.

description: I love love love this Philz. Of course, their coffee is just as good as it has ever been at every other Philz I've been at, but what really stands out for me is their separate "study room". It's a peaceful, quiet detached room which free fast wi-fi and plenty of outlets. I'm in love.
author: Melody L.

description: When I need that cup of coffee in the am to really get me going I hit PhIlZ! I like the Jacobs blend or the tasoro. Not a fan of mint in my coffee so I always tell them not to put it in. It is pricey for a cup but worth it once in awhile.
author: Michael W.

description:
Love Love Love. I have been going gaga over Four Barrel and with my late discovery of Philz Coffee, realize I have been missing out. The coffee selection and service is hands down awesome. The baristas are cool and though I hate to play favorites, the intense blonde guy behind the counter is far and away number one in my book. 
They take the time to help you figure out what you'd like if they notice you standing like a deer in headlights, the decaf is bold and so full of flavor one wouldn't guess its decaf and one sip of the Istanbul Treat was enough to make me consider switching to tea. 
Open one downtown ASAP!
author: Stacy T.

description: Philz offers free WIFI to go with the awesome coffee.  Someone here also realized that electrical outlets would be helpful.  There are power strips all over the place.  The staff is comprised of a motley crew of friendly, efficient folks who seem to actually like their jobs.  It'd be perfect if the space was larger.
author: Victoria T.

description:
First I ordered a Philtered Soul coffee, it smelled terrible and tasted weird.

Then they were nice enough to replace it with a Mint Mojito Iced Coffee. That was so much better.

If you want a bold new experience beyond the traditional Latte, Cappucino, Mocha, come here.

About a 3 star coffee place, and 1 star bump for being nice about making me something else :-)
author: John N.

description: Really good coffee each cup separately filtered. Friendly staff that give good suggestions on what to get when you are stumped. Tesora is super strong and yummy. A special treat is the mint mojito with soy, so creamy and sweet like ice cream :)
author: Natalie E.

description:
I am going to present an opposing view.  First, I have been grinding beans and making espresso at home for longer than the staff at van ness have been alive. I've grown in appreciation of good coffee from my first experience with Peet's French roast at cedar store when I was in grad school over 30 years ago.  And have passed through a few boutique coffees before finding blue bottle and most recently Philz.  And Philz "It's the Best" will remain our bean of choice for home espresso.

BUT.... This past Sunday We had stayed in sf for a one night staycation and wanted a morning latte.... Used yelp to find Philz and just assumed they made lattes...seeing espresso on the chalk board.  So I ordered one for me and one for my wife.  I was excited as I'd never had a latte at philz, just bought beans for home use.  I was only half paying attention but I saw the Barista pour brewed coffee through the grounds... Never had seen that... Didn't even occur to me that this was a Philz espresso.  So I said I'd never seen that before.  When she said 'that's your latte,' I was stunned.   When I registered confusion she acted like I was some kind of coffee neanderthal, clueless about the nuances of philzdom... I objected and said that when I ordered a latte she should have said that they dont make lattes or they make 'turkish' lattes....(which is also a misnomer as Turkish coffee is not twice brewed but who is counting...). Bottom line pouring coffee through grounds twice doesn't create espresso, it creates Luke warm coffee.  I would have been ok with all of this, but Barista was so unapologetic and rude that I decided to brave the wave of 5's on yelp and offer a countering view.

Having said all this, we will continue to get Philz it's the best beans, cuz they are the best,
author: Paul G.

description:
They need to add 6 stars for Philz. 

Best coffee in SF? Yes. Best in the world? Maybe. Blue Bottle is good, but I think it's too bitter. Peet's is phenomenal and I love their mocha, but Philz is just on another level. I don't remember all of the different blends that I have tried, but I do know that every blend has created a circus in my mouth. I think I'd have to go with Philtered Soul as my phavorite. 

There aren't too many places that brew your cup of coffee individually, to guarantee it is as fresh as you can get. All of the baristas are super friendly and will help you to find the exact type of coffee you are looking for. They are also dog friendly, my pup loves visits to Philz.

If you are a chocoholic like me, then you have to try the chocolate croissant! It is seriously like a dessert, lots of delicious choco chips. The breakfast burritos are also good, any of their snacks are better than you find at typical coffee shops.

Thank you Philz for amazing coffee, it's like I'm addicted.
author: Gregg K.

description:
I make my own espressos or get quad espresso from Peet's (with Peet's, it's sometimes difficult to tell if I am going to have minor stroke or an awesome day). 
I don't appreciate whipped cream&corn syrup in my coffee so caramel lattes/mochaccinos/frappuccinos, etc. are lost on me. 

That said,  Mocha Tesora &Jacob's Wonderbrew are my favorite, so far. 
They offer a more sustained&jitter-free caffeine-induced high. 
Rich, flavorful&smooth. I can sip them all day long. 
Their baristas are very friendly& will help you choose (since there are no descriptions of the brews) the right coffee, according to your taste. 
I look forward to exploring all the different brews.
author: LatteGir L.

description:
I REALLY wanted to like this place. After seeing multiple photos of their mint mojito iced coffee all over my Facebook newsfeed, I decided to try it for myself.

After finishing a meal at Turtle Tower, we had about 24 minutes left on the meter, so we decided to walk around the corner for some coffee and be back at our car with time to spare. Once I walked into Philz, it was pretty empty, and I was excited to get to try my first mint mojito iced coffee. I placed my order promptly with a woman near the espresso machine, and was told that I would pay after getting my drink. Fair enough, I thought. About a minute later, 3 people walked in. Then 2 more. All of them ordered some kind of hot drink, and 10 minutes later, I was curious as to where my drink was. 3 of the people that came in after me already got their drinks - and I thought OKAY, maybe this iced coffee concoction takes some sort of special prep... I've worked at a coffee shop before, and I KNOW that hot drinks take longer to make than iced drinks just because of the extra step of having to steam the milk. It still seemed a little ridiculous of a wait to me, considering that I was there before any of the other patrons, and the fact that I ordered a cold drink. Five more minutes pass by, and at this point, I am STARING DOWN THE BARISTA because this was such a ridiculous wait for coffee! If I knew it would take so long, I wouldn't have come. FINALLY, she calls out "MINT MOJITO ICED COFFEE" and puts two on the counter. One was mine, and the other belonged to a customer that was there for probably about 2 minutes. WHAT THE HELL. I angrily paid at the register and rushed back to the car, hoping that the meter didn't expire. 

Firstly, my coffee was not presented in the way that all the pictures of the mint mojitos were depicted. Mine just looked like regular coffee.
Secondly, the drink was INCREDIBLY watered down. I've had my fair share of different coffees, but this drink was similar to a McDonald's iced coffee (think a crap ton of milk and little to no espresso). While I enjoyed the minty cool flavor of the drink, this was in no way worth the wait or the ~$4. 

I am hoping that the Berkeley location of Philz won't disappoint, but the kind of customer service and lack of quality control here was unacceptable.
author: Janice W.

description:
(Just reviewing the coffee here -- never really been to the cafe.)

At our office we decided to get all scientific-like and do a true blind tasting of 8 different coffees. This included some big names, some esoteric fru-fru stuff, and some no-brand supermarket stuff. In each case we tried each producer's most "typical" house blend.

8 brews, 10 participants. We drank them all straight, brewed through an Aeropress in an identical manner.

Bottom line - Philz "Tesoro" coffee won convincingly. In fact it garnered 5 first-place votes and the best overall score. 

I always thought Philz's popularity was all about the hipster ambience, the local ownership family thing, and the counter staff who spend 10 minutes slaving over your little perfect drink.

But screw all that -- You can't argue with science!

Philz is truly the best-tasting coffee and I am now a convert. Philz rocks.
author: Al M.

description:
It's been such a long time since I've had a really good cup of coffee that I think I forgot what a good cup of coffee actually is.

This was a mondo good cup of coffee. 

Evidently this place has a following...over four hundred reviews? Geezo. I'd never been here before yesterday, and went to sit next door to wait for friends. They'd never been before too, so when came over with their coffees, said "sorry it took so long - we didn't know what to do!" (So much to order from and a bustling holiday weekend.) Luckily, I was with someone who had been there before and just said "I'll have what she's having." 

It is hard to call this a coffee shop; it is more like a coffee sommelier boutique. "What do you like? Are you in the mood for something light?" Then BAM there is your coffee.
author: Kristen O.

description: How is it that I have never written a review for Philz? I absolutely adore this place. The greater alarm is my brew, and this pure heavenly caffeinated bliss. the service is always friendly and fantastic, and the coffee is smooth and tasty. If only there was a philz closer to home or my office... then again, i'd be broke if i spent $4/day on coffee... oh and that heavy cream they use, would permanently destroy my diet... lol
author: tina p.

description:
When my step-sister told me about Philz and claimed that it was amazing, I figured it was just hype. Coffee pretty much tastes the same anywhere, right?

Wrong.

Amazing, single-cup brewed coffee. It tastes unlike coffee that I've had elsewhere. It's just distinct, and I'm no coffee snob.

I'm not a SF-dweller, so I tend to drive everywhere. However, I cared enough on this to walk a mile to grab a cup, passing up a Starbucks and Peets on the way. It's that good.

Believe the hype.
author: Sam B.

description: Today I tried the famous Mint mojito iced coffee and boy,  why have I been buying Starbucks ice coffee this wholetime? This is in no way of a comparison because this drink is out of this world. The mint mojito is freaking delish!  Only regret is that I didn't buy an XL! Can't wait to try all the different types of coffee Philz offer.
author: Dee T.

description:
Awesome mocha.  Mint mojito is too sweet for me, but others seem to love it.  

Price is right, too.
author: Erika C.

description: I'm not much of a coffee drinker but every time I come to SF, I look forward to their coffe. Philtered Soul all the way!
author: Anselmo G.

description: Best Mocha (Mocha Tesora, bittersweet) I've ever had! Their list of coffee beans is impressive. I wish I was in San Francisco longer, just so I could try more varieties!orBut we did go every day for the three days we were here.  I tried the mocha and two of their dark roasts - simply amazing.
author: Caitlin C.

description: Ok I would have given the Van Ness store 0 stars had it not been for Philz coffee being such GOOD coffee! So today I go into the store on Van Ness and get my usual cup of Joe I then proceed to the check out and pay for a pound of coffee and explained that I ordered a small cup of coffee---which usually is free when you buy a pound of coffee.  The woman behind the counter (with all kinds of sh*t in her face---piercings) charges me for both the pound of coffee and the small cup of coffee, which would have been fine had there been some sort of effort on her part to be nice and friendly, customer service is lacking at this location for sure.
author: James E.

description:
Now this IS what coffee should be. I normally stick to espresso drinks, but I was anxious for some java after a long flight. The guy at the car rental place recommended Philz. 

It was awesome. The "bartender" asked questions about what I normally drink and enjoy. She then proceeded to make me my own cup. She even mixed in the sugar to an oh-just-right amount of sweetness. Her recommendation was spot on. I miss it already. 

How about a Philz in Manhattan? ... please.
author: Ariel J.

description: This place is easily the best coffee in the city. Not only that but all my favorite people work here... Not that we're really on a first name basis. But they're all wonderful and friendly and I look forward to being weird for just a moment every day with them. The coffee is great and always consistently great!  It's honestly hard to go wrong here.
author: Alexander G.

description: The best cup of coffee I've had in 20 years if coffee drinking.  It started with the Tesora pour over.    The Greater alarm is my workday saviour.  One large cup has more than enough caffeine to fuel the day.  I usually take my coffee black.  But, with Philz, I usually order medium cream and medium sugar for improve the flavor balance.
author: Lark A.

description:
Great coffee, great atmosphere, great music.

There is a wide array of blends to try, with the board and all their descriptions, there is a coffee for anyone.
 
Handmade coffee that is made in their magic coffee machines in front of you and they ask you how sweet you want it to be or if you want cream.
The first time went I didn't know what scale to use for sweetness, turns out you tell them 'kinda sweet', 'sweet', 'really sweet'. 
Soy is also available.

The new seating area across is a great addition.
author: Steven L.

description:
Goodbye Starbucks. I have lived in the city for 2 yrs., and I have finally discovered Philz Coffee. I would jump in front of a MUNI bus for this coffee. The menu of the different types of beans available is huge. It would take at least a month of hardcore coffee drinking to get through the whole menu.
I really don't know how to explain it, but the coffee is well made kinda like your Grandma baking you a cake with love. There are no frapps or double whipped just straight coffee with cream or sugar of course making it the drink that has lasted for thousands of years.

Out of the stores I have visited this one is by far the most enjoyable. I visited it in the morning, and closing, and both times the employees (same people) were extremely friendly. There was no rush for me to pay, and the coffee came out extremely fast. They both had a smile on there face, and were just plain happy...maybe it was the caffeine! If only I could just stand behind the counter, and watch them make the coffee that would be awesome. 

If your looking for a cool local coffee shop that's not a cliché this is the place to be.
author: Nathan M.

description: Hmm.. the first time i went to philz coffee, my coffee had a weird taste in it.. perhaps it was something else. Anyways, that time was remedied by the next cup of dark roast coffee at Philz, the wonderbrew. They put the cream and sugar in for you, and i must say its pretty suite.. not too sweet, not too bitter. I thought it was tasty
author: simon k.

description: Love love love the iced mint mojitos at Philz! The customer service is good here as well (I've been to the other one near the Caltrain station). My friend and I came here because we were waiting to get seated at Brenda's French Soul Food a block away. We noticed someone walk out the door with Philz and we decided to take a walk. If you look in the trash can at Brenda's, there are a lot of coffee cups haha. The only thing with this place when we came here was that it didn't seem like there is much ventilation; it was warm. Same with the side room where there's space to sit and get work done (quite a few people were sitting and reading or doing work on laptops.
author: Katherine S.

description: Do not come here for an espresso drink.  Change your yelp category to not include something you don't cater to.
author: Michael S.

description: Seriously, how can you go wrong when you have so many different kinds of beans? If it's overwhelming, just ask the friendly barista to help you pick one. The Tesora, Ambrosia, and Philharmonic are usually pretty solid ones that you can't go wrong with. And of course, if it's a hot day (which we don't get many of in SF) then definitely go with the Mint Mojito Iced Coffee.
author: Lynn C.

description: this place rocks! I love the coffee, and the staff is very friendly also accomodating .we tried the "best" coffee,and the handsome barista Brian was kind enough to "doctor it up" for us-DeIicious(and the coffee too!)LOL!the pastries looked sinfully good, and they also have a bagel bar.cute!I will definately return..
author: Brian M.

description:
My first & last time at Philz. 

I walk in, go to the register & order a medium iced coffee. He tells me small or large, i say large. He asks medium or dark roast, I say dark. He asks milk or sugar, I say half n half no sugar.

I proceed to the coffee station which is right next to the register. When my order arrives she brings me a hot coffee and asks me how it tastes. I said I ordered an iced coffee, which the guy who took my order said "Oh." Which is no big deal anyway, I wasn't bothered by it.

She then says something about next time when you order tell us. I said I don't know what you mean? She said when you come in and order tell us not the register. Sorry I didn't mean to sound condescending. I said well you did. She then told me to try it, how does it taste? It's fine, thanks. Great, you have a nice day now. (ever so sweet, as she could tell by my demeanor that I was annoyed)

If I walk into a cafe and the first thing I see is a register, I"m going to place my order. He didn't tell me otherwise. Why would I tell the person making the order? There was no sign saying "Place orders here," from what I noticed.

Plus, they only had small and large. The large is a medium anywhere else, plus is was more that double the price I usually pay. I don't mind paying extra cause it's organic, I eat organic all the time!

I felt like I was cheating on Peet's anyway, which didn't make me feel good. 

That was my first and last time at Philz!!!  UGH!
author: John S.

description:
I came into this Philz and was shocked at how un-scruffy the customers are and how there weren't any flies at all. I'd only ever been to the Philz on 24th. This one is very different in many ways but the same the way that counts.

I was feeling like a rock star and went for a small Blue Mountain at $7. I rarely have coffee and felt like I deserve the best. I told the barista that I wanted "very little milk" and "just enough to change the color", he handed it back a very light tan color. I not only couldn't appreciate the Blue Mountain but it had so much milk in it I could barely drink it at all. I know this is my fault; I've never been able to successfully express to anyone at Philz on 24th how little milk I want in my coffee either. I would do my own milk but I don't want to hold up the line; I'll have to figure something out.
author: Manny F.

description:
I had a dream about Philz Coffee last night. Having heard so many amazing things about it for so long, it was now crossing over in to my sleep; I knew it was time to check it out. 

In my dream I walked up to the counter and told them it was my first time. The barista told me that I should try their "cheese-it" drink. It seemed odd but in my dream I was willing to try it. It tasted nothing like cheese-its and was sweet, smooth and amazing. 

In reality there was no such thing, of course, but it very much was smooth, sweet and amazing. And by far the best cup of coffee I've ever had. They are incredibly friendly and helpful here. You can tell that they make every cup of coffee with pride and care. This is a true gem and I'm pretty sure my new favorite weekend coffee shop.
author: Julia N.

description:
I started coming here a couple weeks ago with some co-workers who said Philz has the BEST coffee in town, but I find their customer service to just be "okay."  I order the Tesora (the first time), which they recommended, and it was alright.  They have much more other choices, which I planned on trying, but not sure if I'll come back because of the rudeness of some people.  

Since the past few times I've been here, I'd say my favorite one is their mint mojito.
author: Melissa T.

description:
Anything Iced, anything hot, its gonna be good.

My personal favorite is a large Mint Mojito Iced coffee. I get a big one cuz I suck it down too fast. Yeah, blue bottle is good, but Id be hard pressed to say its better than Philz.
author: Steve S.

description:
Its like...liquid cocaine.
1.  its expensive
2.  its addictive
3.  it'll have you grinning like a mongoloid and exhibiting ADHD-like behavior after about 3 sips.
author: SF R.

description: Wow ... I'm somewhat addicted to coffee, but Philz Coffee was able to pour a large cup of its dark roast that packs a jitter-buzz like I've not experienced anywhere else.  You'll wait a little longer as they prepare the coffee in their unique way, and the cup is good, if not the best.  Don't hesitate to go next door and take advantage of wifi and ample seating, and order a delicious bagel for breakfast (it helped cut the jitters too!).
author: Vince V.

description: You cannot get wrong with Starbucks, Coffee is good, hot, with spices or without, people working at Starbucks always the same wherever you go, same training, this makes it kinda flat with no personality, I would like to see different Starbucks with different personalities, but for now it's impossible.
author: Mathew S.

description:
This coffee is simply amazing. I actually said "wow" when I tried it. And this is a place that really KNOWS coffee and puts love into the craft of brewing. Each coffee ordered is ground and brewed per order. So your getting a fresh brew! And the service is awesome and the girl I ordered from was super nice.

I would give more stars if I could :)
If your anywhere within 5 miles or if you just want an amazing coffee. Go here. And fully enjoy.

25/365
Yelp365
author: Andy M.

description:
Even though I simply love & adore coffee, I've never been really particular about which kind as long as it's better than 711's brown sludge. Even a McDonalds cup of joe will do in a pinch. 

Coffee @ Philz is a life-changing experience. I ordered the aptly named "Ambrosia"--the food of the gods! Perfect for me because I am a goddess! But even if you're not sure what to order, the baristas that work behind the bar are coffee shrinks in disguise. They have a knack for asking a few choice questions and pair you with a great brew.

I am swooning at the thought of my next cup from Philz.
author: Vivian L.

description:
Pretty much looked like an idiot when we went in and immediately got in line for the cash register without ordering our drinks...as an FYI, you order at the three coffee stations to the left before paying on the right. Seems a little weird, but hey I'm not here to judge.

We tried a cup of the mint mojito iced coffee and canopy of heaven, which were pretty much amazing. I loved how they had their mint leaves in mini garbage cans on the counter..so adorable. The mint mojito was definitely different and really refreshing, but I've gotta say I really loved the canopy of heaven. The flavors reminded me a little of a coffee flavored chocolate or something...(clearly I am one with words).

It was awesome seeing the baristas working right in front of you, and I'm really impressed by the amount of work they put into each drink. I'd love to come here before work but shelling out $4 for a cup of small coffee is definitely tough. Will definitely come back for a weekend pick me up though!
author: Stefi C.

description:
Sorry, but does the music have to be SO loud?  My seat is vibrating.  It also gets louder closer to closing time when there are fewer people in here.  The bass is literally shaking my seat.  The coffee is usually awesome (but more expensive than other places in the Mission).  

They paper filter the coffee which in my opinion takes away much of the taste/oil/goodness. WIsh they wouldn't (or have an option not to).

What about a loyalty card Phil?  That would be nice.
author: John A.

description: I must update this. Everyone knows their coffee is hands down AMAZING but their team (especially the ones working on Saturday 4/7) has to be the most exceptional, friendliest I've ever seen. They are ALL upbeat and SO KIND to every customer that walks in. My favorite location!
author: Helen L.

description:
Philz Coffee has the best coffee in the bay area! I love it so much. Their coffees have a rich favor and very smooth; they are definitely unlike the usual coffees. 

Their coffee names are super creative, and they do have explanation for each coffee on the counter, which is very helpful. Their price could be a little expensive compare to other coffee shops, but it is well worth every single penny. 

Try Philz Coffee, you wont regret it!
author: Benny K.

description:
I resent Starbucks and Petes. For every two cups of their coffee, I could have had one of Philz, and they all would have been worth it. 

I'm almost anxious when I get through the door: "HI, WELCOME!" someone would shout. I've rarely seen such excellent service.  The baristas don't bother to pretend they don't recognize on your second day. 

The bakery goods are tasty.  You know how some people say that at some point they've had the best sex ever? Well, I know for sure I'm not even close to knowing what that's about.  I still hope it's true that there is better.  BUT, Philz's baklava is the best I've ever had. 

I recommend the Anesthesia to the upside with half and half and sugar (they mix it all in there for you).  I also love Jacob's Wonderbar- THAT'S WHAT SHE SAID.  I'm trying the Turkish coffee tomorrow. What fun :)
author: Catherine L.

description: Delicious coffee, awesome staff. The only thing that would make this place better is if they delivered to my bed every morning.
author: Shawn B.

description:
Do yourself a favor and skip the Starbucks, that is if you're ready to try some REAL COFFEE. Each coffee is made individually, and they carry a wide variety of blends that each have their own super catchy name. My go to is the "philtered soul" :)

TIP: service is great, but be prepared to spend a little more than usual for your cup of joe!
author: Kristen C.

description: Went yesterday for the first time so I can't give a testimony to consistency but I had they're speciality drinks... Went in for the mint mojito (they were out) but got the ginger snap ice coffee instead...it was great! And service was hilarious and thoughtful.
author: Mimi D.

description:
I hate being impatient. 

Correction, I'm not really impatient but I tend to live my life on a too tight schedule. I overbook, try to do everything in too little time, get distracted, you name it. So sadly, I avoided stopping by Philz for much too long. It's not because I don't love good coffee. No it's because I usually have about 45 seconds to jump into a place, order and jump back out on to the street, dribbling scalding coffee down the side of my hand or risk missing my MUNI bus. However, I think I may have a legit reason to move faster in the morning. 

The last time I stopped by was with John on New Years (i.e. a rare, no set schedule day). We were waiting for food from Brenda's (located a block away, hint for all of you waiting in line) and since time was not a factor we popped in. I pointed out to John that while the names and prices are posted above, descriptions of coffee and drinks is below on the front of the counter. For those of you not in the know each cup is individually brewed. Think of it in terms of a cocktail you should pay a little extra when your drink is customized to your taste and when the talented soul creating your mood enhancing beverage actually gives a hoo ha about what will meet your lips. Worth the extra buck or so, no?

The location is pretty tiny, so yeah there is an unintentional grab and go feel. But ladies, ladies, ladies, here's a tip. If you like your men a little scruffy (think Max's 540 Club, Hemlock, Zeitgeist) stop by and look behind the counter. Yeah if the coffee doesn't perk you up, the view might. Consider this your morning makeup warning. You're welcome.
author: Veronica G.

description:
The best coffee I've had so far. Oh my goodness. It's amazing how I didn't discover this place until recently! All thanks to my coworker and my sister+her bf! lol. Anyway!
It's located in a building that looks rather new and...modern. The shop itself is pretty cozy. :) The service there is really good, everyone's really nice and asks if you need anything explained or what not. I got myself a Mocha tesora and it was so chocolatey and amazing good. Stronger than most of the coffee I drink. :) I'm definitely going to come back here sometime. I gotta try their Canopy of Heaven.. It sounds amazing. :)
author: Susan Y.

description:
This is the 2nd time i've been at Philz and although it is good, it is nothing amazing...

It seems like everyone keeps on saying "Best coffee EVER!!" but... it's aiite. The do have free wi-fi though and I'm here on a Friday.... pretending to work. So not bad. But I'm trying to manage your expectations and maybe your experience will be better than mine.
author: Stephen N.

description:
When I first heard that Philz coffee rivaled blue bottle, I had my doubts to say the least. but finally on my way to class one day, in desperate need of a good cup of joe, I decided to give it a shot. after all, the one on Van Ness is on my way. 

When I walked in the door I was surprised to see the almost endless options. the menu is great, well organized with explanations of everything.
