I started to sort through the menu items when the barista asked if i would like any help finding my perfect cup of coffee. I said yes, of course, letting him know about my blue bottle love. 

He started asking me a multitude of questions, sweet or smoky? dark or light? etc... after we narrowed it down to 2 or 3, he let me smell each of the coffee beans and explained what was different between the two. finally, a decision. Filtered Soul. 
he asked if i wanted cream or sugar (they add for you), just cream for me and a large size plz.

he brewed the individual cup just for me, mixing in perfectly frothy milk. handing me the coffee he asked me to taste and make sure it is to perfection. one sip....and utopia! Wow, hands down the BEST coffee I have ever had.  

I think because they help you choose your coffee bean type and then the way they brew it, its a recipe for perfection. 

HIGHLY, HIGHLY, recommend!!! theres another location at king and 4th by the ballpark, havent been there yet, but im sure its the same excellent quality.

also, they tend to play good chill jams and offer free wi-fi. comfortable chairs and couches. this location is pretty small, but I've never not been able to get a seat.
author: Carlynn A.

description:
WHOA. Did I just spend $4 on a cup of coffee? I didn't mean to! oops!

My boyfriend and I stopped by our first Philz this weekend and it was kind of a fail. 

I didn't expect so many options and the menu overwhelmed me. So I just picked one randomly, Seven Stars.  My boyfriend got the Ethopian something or another... and the total was $6.75... I didn't question it... just paid the man. But wow. $4 for a cup of coffee? (his was $2.75) holy moly. I thought paying $2.50 for a drip at Blue Bottle was rough... I mean, it was good. I did like it, and the fact that she put cream and sugar in made it taste kind of like a latte... so I guess it's a little more acceptable to buy a $4 latte. 

Also, my boyfriend's cap didn't fit completely on the cup... causing spillage in the car. If anyone else has experienced this coffee curse, they know how much it sucks. I'm not really blaming Philz for this... I'm just saying, it puts a damper on your coffee drinking ability.

Overall. I'd go back, if I was in the mood to spend that much on coffee. It was good... I guess I'm just a loyal blue bottle junkie though.
author: Abbey S.

description:
Say what? Mint mojito iced coffee.

My friend took me here for the very first time. She was raving about Philz Mint mojito iced coffee. They have several spots in the city and this was the spot she choose because it was close to restaurant we wanted to eat at. We walked in and the cashier greeted us. We placed two small orders of the Mint mojito iced coffee with cream and sugar. It wasn't busy at all, got our coffee within three minutes. The barista asked if our coffee was sweet enough. It was perfect. The coffee itself was strong and the mint complimented it well. I loved how you get a mint leaf surprise every time you sip. Some may not like that, but its worth a try!
author: Aileen F.

description: Philtered Soul.  My knees are weak just thinking about it.  Luther Vandross' knees are weak just thinking about it.
author: Michael D.

description:
BEST coffee EVER!

Philz is so good .. that if i had to move from LA to the bay I'd go with it so that I could have Philz everyday.  Honestly folks, I LOVE coffee and so far, Philz has been the BEST I've had yet.  The next time I'm up in the SF.. I'm hitting Philz everyday.

My favorite is Philtered Soul... medium roast with nutty flavors.
author: Cindy C.

description: I get fresh ground coffee at work for free-- and I still choose to walk 5 blocks out of my way every day to Philz. The Jacob's blend is to die for!
author: Preston B.

description: Mint mojito! Awesome. Got some decently priced awesome bagels as well. Love this place. They have a comfy lounge for studying and reading as well. Super friendly staff and atmosphere. Best coffee joint in town.
author: Carrie T.

description: Wicked yummy coffee. They grind and steep it right there. A little pricey, but worth the extra for the effort and taste.
author: Wendi B.

description: Great service..small cozy coffee shop. Nice sit down with tables & couch. No outdoor sitting thou :(  The coffee here is good. It's a bit darker on the latte that i had. There's a huge selection of fresh coffee bean to grind and serve. It rangea from dark, medium, light, and decaf roast. All in all, will definitely come back again to try other variety.
author: Ernie P.

description: Nice! Each cup is hand dripped to order and things aren't overly sweetened to cover up the low coffee quality. It's pretty legit. Mint mojito is subtly addictive. Fresh mint, slightly sweet, totally delish!
author: Jane K.

description: I LOVE Philz COFFEE. Hands down it is my favorite coffee ever.  I can't believe I ever liked Starbucks...ugh. Philz has ruined my ability to enjoy other coffee places and I have tried many in the city. It's simply amazing. I love the blend called Ether. My only reason for not giving 5 stars is the price. $4 for a cup of coffee is hard to swallow. So I only go when I happen to be driving by one of the locations (which I have to admit I have found myself driving way out of my way to happen upon a Philz). It makes my day!
author: Kristin K.

description: Amazing coffee! Dancing water is the coffee to try! Tastes so light with a hint of sweet goodness. The baristas are so friendly and helpful. I want to live here with all the other cool kids.
author: Jina C.

description: I was not impressed. I ordered an iced mojito coffee, it took at least 15 minutes for the drink to be ready. Once it was, the coffee had so much ice in it, the cup was good for 4 or 5 sips. All of this for $4. Don't think I'll be coming back anytime soon.
author: Bridget O.

description:
On the way to pick up a girlfriend for dinner and needed my Philz fix!  Ordered my Mint Mojito Iced Coffee...what else would I want?  During my wait a lovely gentleman came in with a bag and told the barista "Oh don't worry he doesn't eat much" while looking at his bag.   

Excellent service: CHECK
Amazing coffee aka Mint Mojito Iced Coffee: CHECK
Entertainment: CHECK!

I adore this place!!!!
author: Michelle Y.

description:
Oh Philz,  you just...get me. All the right kinds of brews to warm my heart. The New Manhattan is my match though, it can never go wrong and feeds my addiction :) 
Glad there's a location now that is is *somewhat* closer to me now! 

And the coffee addiction saga continues...
author: Lauren S.

description:
My bf and I alternate between this Philz and the one in the mission.  I recently gave the one in the mission 1 star because the guy who made my soy chai was a little on the incompetent side.  

Sadly. I stopped drinking black coffee a couple weeks back and moved to Peet's soy lattes.  This morning I went to Philz and got the tesora with soy and it was just like a soy latte without the foam.  The coffee guy even asked if the amount of soy was enough for me. How sweet.  Awww I heart you Philz.
author: Skye W.

description: Pretty much I am addicted to this coffee. Their blends are awesome, the atmosphere is great, and their food is beyond delicious. I want there to be more Philz in SF. I would go there 6 times a day.
author: Andie B.

description: Finally tried something new today, a nice hot cup of tesora. Great smooth taste and a nice finish. Thanks to the barista for the recomendation. Loved that they were playing the Beatles as well :) All you need is love ... and coffee!
author: Sarah L.

description: I'm all about unique sf coffee shops! $4.50 for a large mojito I was erecting cocktail like coffee not the case! Minty for sure and creamy could not taste the coffee and i felt like my drink needed so,e sugar. Will be trying something else next time. I love the Philz lounge next door do awesome and the drop coffee for every cup!
author: Diane S.

description:
If you have a non-discriminate, low-maintenance palette like me, trust my opinion: the coffee here truly IS amazing!

I'm not a picky eater and honestly, it takes a lot for me to be really, truly impressed by the same food or drinks other people might claim as amazing. I would have been happy with Starbucks but my world changed when I tried Philz. 

I got the Ambrosia Coffee of the Gods and it was like no coffee I have ever tasted. Very mild but full-bodied and nutty (if that makes sense). I like my coffee black but it was a tad too bitter so I asked for some sugar and the barista added just the right amount. I have been doing coffee wrong this whole time! And trust, this coffee still tasted good an hour later after I finished binging on pho.

I like that the baristas ask you to try the coffee after the brew it. Then THEY add the amount of cream and sugar THEY think you need. No room for imperfections!
author: liz c.

description:
I love going to Philz and am so glad that there is a Philz on my side of town. That is what this review is about, to let you know that there is a Philz within walking distance of Nob Hill. 

I'm not a coffee connoisseur (don't tell anybody but I drink starbucks) but I do enjoy Philz the best. 

Great guys working here who are very knowledgeable about coffee. Something I learned from them: Typically light roast has more caffeine than dark.
author: John B.

description:
Amy:  *Walks in with Roomie*  Ooooh.  Preeeeeetty.
Roomie:  Just look at those tiny cupcakes.
Amy:  OMG, they're so cute!  *bats eyelashes at cute barista*
Roomie:  They piss me off.  Um, I'll have the Anesthesia.
Amy:  *looks at cute boy talking to owner*
Roomie:  Makes sultry glance at Amy that says, "aren't you going to order stupidhead?"
Amy:  Why do they piss you off?  Uh, I'll have a large coffee.  Thanks.
Roomie:  They're too small.  You have to tell him what kind of coffee.
Amy:  Size queen.  What?  Kind??
Barista:  You haven't been here before?  Do you want light, medium or dark roast?
Amy:  *looks at cute brown boy*  I like dark.
Barista:  I'd recommend the Ether.  Would you like to try that?
Amy:  *kind of scared about ether*  Yes, I'll try that.

...and then!  And then and then and then and then and then!  He brews our coffee individually in the proud Turkish tradition.

Barista:  Do you take cream or sugar?
Amy:  Only if it sucks.

It did not suck.  It's like a wine bar for coffee...or like a jelly belly store with different kinds of coffee instead of artificially flavored corn syrup goobers.

Amy:  *tips barista*  I've never tipped a barista before.
Roomie:  Those cupcakes piss me off.
author: PrincessPeac H.

description: Talk about designer coffee!  I had the mint mojito ice coffee (Large, 16 oz, $4.50).  A bit confusing for a newbee, which line do I get into?  One line is for order and another line to pay.  Which is first?  Order.  There are so many choices that my friend had to read the board.  First sip?  Oooo, it's like a dessert!  Smooth!  Whatever cream they use must be from the cow in the back.  They will ask you how sweet you want it.  Yum!  One order means no yawning for the rest of the day. The real test is whether I'm going to sleep tonight or would this last 48 hours?
author: Helen L.

description: Fast service.  Great coffee.  I want to try all the flavors.  Can't wait to come back this small place.
author: Dan K.

description:
I thought I had tasted the elixir of the gods with the Turkish blend, black, and 1 tbs of sugar...

That is, until I discovered their...

SUPEREFFINGAWESOMELIQUIDDIAMOND!!!!

aka their iced coffee

some cream, a tablespoon of sugar...this is what it must feel like to be Tom Cruise
author: Tadd L.

description:
Hands down to great drip coffee served at Philz. I have heard about this place, but finally had a chance to experience it myself.

First off, I was impressed with the variety of their selections. It was a tough decision to pick one out of the list, so the guy behind the counter stepped in and gave some pointers. I had a dark roast Jacob and it was such a soothing treat, fresh, smooth, not very sweet, and not overwhelmingly creamy. No dispute, this is definitely a place to go for a good drip coffee.

Though it is relatively pricey for just a coffee, I have to admit. However, if you bring your own coffee mug and you can get it filled up at the cost of a small cup.
author: Edmund L.

description: I'm giving this Philz 3.5 stars (and rounding up) since they didn't have the mint mojito ice coffee.  Ginger snaps was decent though.
author: Joshua L.

description:
Bangin Joe! Their coffee blends are superb!. I like Blue Bottle but i only have been to the Kiosk location in Hayes Valley. Great coffee but little selection. 

Friend of mine told me about Philz  and I went to check them out. On their wall is an extensive blend list  and fun names they have on their menu. LIttle overwhelming but at least I had choices. I couldn't make up my mind, so Lillian the barista,  helped  me and we got down to the nitty gritty. Bold...  strong but not too strong in flavor, light on the caffeine, and chocolaty and the winner is....Mocha Tesora!

 Lillian asked me about the milk and sugar ratio. I told her "I'd just do it i have all that stuff at my work". But she in insisted that she does it. I trusted her. Was it her experience? The LOOK in her eye of determination? Her confident smile? Dont know, but I let her do her thang anyway.  One small sip too the lips and BAAAANNNGGG!!!! Magically Delicious! It made me smile. Literally! Even Lillian was laughing cause she knew i didnt sip that much but enjoyed it. It was PERFECT! Like beating your opponent in Street Fighter perfect! Matter in fact I'm going back again now. PEACE!
author: Brent W.

description:
I love Philz. God, how I love Philz.

I'm pretty sure if Jesus came back and converted water into another darker liquid, it would be Philz coffee. Turkish or Philtered Soul, black like my heart. The only thing that can make this place better is if it were closer to me.

Enter, the new Van Ness location...

Five caffeinated, jittery, going-back-in-effing-time stars.
author: Keane L.

description:
Excellent coffee, up in the same echelon as blue bottle, and with a shorter line. Philz prepares their drip coffee individually to order (I LOVE that trend here!) and has many options to choose from. I've sampled the two that they recommended first when I asked for a dark roast: "Jacob's Wonderbar" and "Tantalizing Turkish." They were both excellent, but I preferred the latter.

The Turkish blend includes a subtle hint of cardamom, and all of their coffees offer an optional mint leaf. Now, I've steered clear of flavored coffees ever since I graduated from french vanilla "coffee" at Dunkin Donuts to real black coffee about two weeks after I started drinking the stuff, but the cardamom and mint are subtle enough to be a nice touch. The mint adds a freshness that you don't get with pure black coffee. 

Anyway, if you appreciate great coffee, flip a coin. Heads is Philz, tails is Blue Bottle. You win either way.
author: Adam B.

description:
I *love* this place ... truly amazing coffee. Wish I knew what they do to make it so good because making it at home is never the same.

Think I've had everything on the menu and these are my favs: New Manhattan, Greater Alarm, Four Horses, Dancing Water ... and the iced is great on those rare hot days.
author: David N.

description: I love that each cup is made individually. Its a busy coffee shop but there is a sense of peace among the employees. Everyone is happy and seem to love what they do. The passion comes through in their coffee.
author: Seena A.

description:
Review Summary: 
Crack in a cup. 
Get some. 

Extended Review:
I love the taste of Philz. It has a distinct flavor unlike any other coffee out there, and there is a combination for everyone. My favorite is the Mocha Tesora, lightly sweetened, light cream. If you get the OrderAhead app, it is always waiting for you on the edge of the corner by the time you arrive. 

-1 star = addiction + $broke$
author: J. L.

description:
I normally like Philz coffee, but I've now had too many bad experiences at this location. I'm seriously thinking about never going again:

1. This morning, there's a long line for bagels and the bagel (although he seemed like a very nice person) was seriously chatting it up instead of focusing on making the food. He asked me for my order, on top of like 3 other peoples' order and I specifically said I want the bagel extra extra toasted. That was one of only 2 modifications (the other was just no capers). The bagel was barely toasted at all. If I'm going to pay $7 for a sandwich I want it to be the way I ordered it. 

2. I am completely disgusted by one of the male baristas. He asked me if I wanted cream or sugar in my coffee, I said cream but not shaken because I don't like the foam. He slighly, but so everyone could hear, told a coworker, "she's another one that doesn't like my cream shaken." That's just GROSS.

3. It just always seems disorganized and like most of the people there are not on top of things. It takes too long. I'm over it.
author: Sarah G.

description:
Wake up people! There's something new to get addicted to when hanging out in the Tenderloin/Western Addition!

I drink coffee, but I don't particularly enjoy it. I do it out of necessity. But then there was Philz, who introduced me to coffee that I actually craved. So when they opened one that was close enough for me to walk to I was ecstatic!

Every trip to Philz is yet another battle in the epic war between delight and wallet capacity, but it's worth it. The baristas are quite nice at this specific location, and as at all Philz there's a strong trust that you'll pay. Because they don't really care, there's more pressure to give a nice tip. Darn they're good at consumer psychology!

I still haven't tried everything, but I'll likely continue with my perfectly sweetened 'Greater Alarm' with soy milk and no mint. Most people like the Philtered Soul though, so if you're new give that a try.

I'm not even going to mention the free wifi and warm workspace. Just get your coffee and go!
author: Ryan V.

description:
coffee coffee coffee
crack crack crack
great blends
one cup at a time
lovely staff
relaxed atmosphere
and the best iced coffee in the city: the mint mojito.  yes please!
author: Tomas V.

description: I could never say anything bad about Philz. They have some of the best coffee I have ever tasted in my life. My taste buds are always happy there and the customer service is great. The employees are very friendly and welcoming. If you like medium roast then I recommend the Ambrosia Coffee of God. Purchase a lb of Tesora, it's cheaper to just make at home or can also be used as a great gift (especially for out-of-towners whom have never had Philz)!!
author: Ashley C.

description:
There are 3 major types of coffee drinkers in San Francisco. 

1) As long as it has caffeine, I'll drink it type
2) Starbucks, Peets or any other joint serving machine served coffee type
3) Aficionados

If you're not type 3, I wouldn't suggest it. If you're brainwashed into thinking Starbucks, Peets, Tullys is the shiznitz and not willing to expand your horizons and really taste the bean, go somewhere else. If you're full of drama like this lad http://bit.ly/cSmx84 go somewhere else.

The only real "chain" competition Philz has in SF is Blue Bottle. However, Blue Bottle coffee isn't really close and they have a yuppy/snobby thing going on.

If you know your coffee, look no further than Philz.
author: John T.

description:
BEST cup of coffee I've had. I usually get the Ambrosia, it has a good nutty flavor. My only concern with the goodness of this coffee is the ever decreasing state of my checking account (around $3.50 for a cup).

Did you know that lighter roasts have higher caffeine levels than darker roasts? Thanks for the tidbit Philz coffee guy!
author: E-dough R.

description: Consistently perfect cups of coffee.  I go for the Turkish, iced or hot depending on weather.  If you want something a little less bold, go for the Tesora.  If you want a sweet treat on a hot day, it's alllll about the Iced Mint Mojito.
author: Nikki A.

description: Another Philz I'm a big fan of. The coffee is great, trying to park just blows around this location. I always go with the Jacob's Wonderbar. The bagel counter looks awfully tasty, too, though I've never tried it. 4 stars, I'll add one if they add a parking lot! ;)
author: Amy C.

description: Philz is like a little slice of Portland mixed with Humbolt county right here in SF. There are 19 different blends of coffee, each with a missive of a description suitable for a travel magazine. Your coffee is brewed as you wait, which will be a minute or two, but the cup of brew you receive is otherworldly. There is also a bagel station which comes with witty repartee at no extra charge.
author: Matt L.

description: Their coffee is always crazy good. But today it came with the added benefit of some excellent eye candy.  Yum
author: mike t.

description: Don't get me wrong - I have a deep and powerful love for the perfect cup of black coffee. But the iced mint mojito brought me over to the not-so-dark side. It seemed like the wait would take a while but it went pretty quickly. Even if the line is slow, this is gonna be worth the wait. Before I left SF at the end of my vacation, I grabbed a bag of their Silken Splendor beans. Just the smell leaking through the bag is heavenly! But even better, I am loving every cup I make.
author: Ashley D.

description:
Interesting twist on coffee service--that is, they individually "drip" (literally) one cup at a time. Similar to a coffee press, but without the forced pressure.... It is also unique because they do not offer espresso, cappuccino type beverages--rather everything is based on a basic-drip-process. You are still able to receive all flavored coffee varietals just as long as it is stemmed from a drip style coffee. 

The coffee itself is very specialized and categorized by region, intensity of flavor.... I required some assistance from the staff in choosing and am happy to report everything worked out well.
author: Alex A.

description:
A few Sundays ago, my mom & I were out & about on Van Ness, eating sushi, running errands & gallivanting & such. 

As much as I love my traditional baked desserts, I am a huge believer in coffee being (one of) the best after-meal treats. We walk into Philz & grab a table amidst a handful of people taking advantage of the free wi-fi.

Our barista, this wonderfully joyful, charming man, recommends "Jacob's wonderbar brew" for my mom's first cup of Philz. She really enjoyed the chocolaty notes. I order my usual: "ecstatic iced coffee" (extra sweet.)  We share a strawberry scone & catch up on family gossip. 

Philz has not let me down yet; every cup of coffee I've had tastes (pleasantly) unlike any other coffee I've had before.

Total: $8.45
author: Fancypants X.

description:
OOOooooOOOhh... Blue Bottle or Philz.  What a dilemma.  Both on the scale of awesomeness, are perfect 10s.  I must say though, the menu at Philz is much more intimidating with 20 different blends to choose from.  They are very good at recommendations though and will take a moment to ask you if you like your choice and if there is anything they can do to it to make it even better.  That's amazing customer service if you ask me, and I'm a fan of any business that takes the extra effort.  

Philz, I think you just tipped the scale for me.  Hooray for Philz!
author: Maria L.

description:
Starbucks never tasted the same after trying Philz.  

Coffee taste so pure and delicious.. and its cheap too! We like the fact that they ask you if its how you want it before taking your drink.. It just makes it even more personal.  So far I like all the drinks I got except for the iced Mint Mojito Coffee (not a big fan of big mint leaves in my mouth).  The breakfast burritos are great too! 

We like the Philz at Van Ness street because the staff and people are friendlier and they always make my coffee/mocha the way I like it.  The only problem is the parking -- you have to find street parking, but its not all that bad.  

Download the app for iphone/itouch to see the different kinds of coffee they have.  

**Thanks to those who recommended Philz to us**
author: Ellaine P.

description:
Wow! This is the FIRST five star review I'm giving out. I guess I can be pretty critical because the chances of an establishment getting a five star review from me is one in twenty! That's saying this is some seriously good coffee. I love the single cup personalized brewing style, how good and strong each cup is, how nice and friendly the customer service is despite any crowded situation. 
This deserves a five star rating bc not only do they make the best damn coffee I've ever had, they've got some of the most patient guys working behind the counter with quick and efficient service. A huge bonus for a very clean bathroom and excellent ambiance with comfy seating!!! Pretty well rounded; I guess they've got everything covered when it comes to pleasing picky people.
author: Tu L.

description:
I did it! I did it! I actually took the plunge and decided to order something other than "Philtered Soul!" 

It was a scary notion- having something other than the hazelnutty cup-o-heaven I've become addicted to over the last month. But then again, its Philz Coffee! So making that move was well supported by super friendly and knowledgeable baristas who were able to guide me to a new flavor while calming my anxiety. 

Thus, Philz continues to amaze me and Ambrosia- with its smooth, medium  is  sure to be this month's
author: Raquel C.

description:
Same great coffee that you get at every Philz. Beginners should just trust me and get the Tesora.

The one drawback about this Philz is that it's small. The one in the Mission is way more homey. I feel like I can hang out in that one all day. 

Having said that, this location is very clean and the staff's friendly.
author: Huey K.

description:
I read about Philz cos I wanted an early Sunday morning coffee near the Hotel Kabuki,  I walked and found the location via yelp and believe me - it was totally worth it!  The barristas are knowledgeable and patient and while I had a "regular" cup of coffee (tesoro) it was friggin' amazing!!!
I wish we had something like this in Encinitas!!  The cream is so good I didn't even need the usual bit of sweetener I like.....Bought 3 one half pound varieties and will always go back!!  LOVE IT!!!
author: C M.

description:
Wow.I haven't had a great cup of coffee until now.what an awesome place with an awesome staff.staff is great,very informative and knowledgeable about their coffee.I took the baristas advice and got the ever so popular terosa(sp?)and expected to have just an average roast but man was I completely wrong.coffee was rich,fresh,nutty,delicious.not your average coffee shop where they have coffee in a pot left for an hour or so waiting for people to buy it.one cup at a time really does mean one cup at a time.they grind your coffee seeds fresh and add the perfect amount of cream and sugar or however you like it.got my grandma a hazelnut like coffee and she loves it.I will be stopping by here more often to try all their other roast.price scared me a bit but after a cup I came back and got a second.price is worth the cup of coffee.

Oh and ambiance is very very nice.comfy looking chairs(I just stopped by to grab a cup)lighting is dark but not too dark.
author: Gerard P.

description:
What can I say....6 S.F. Cops loitering outside with their coffees...Not a donut in sight! Either the coffee is off the hooking chain, someone's been murdered, or they're waiting to shake down someone...

And the winner is: The Coffee.

I routinely refuse to give out 5 stars for any kind of food or beverage. I've said in the past that 5 stars means you'd rather have it whatever you are giving five stars then sex. 

Philz is damn close: I'd rather have a cup of Philz than Bad sex.

4.55 stars rounded up.
author: John J.

description: Just ran into philz in rush, I needed a super quick breakfast before my bus came. I had 5 minutes. Immediately the girl at the counter dives for the burritos, and in that same majestic motion the burrito flies into the microwave. Within two minutes I was out of there, burrito in hand I dashed towards the bus stop.  To my surprise, I was left with time on the clock. Enough time in fact to sink my teeth into the mighty sausage breakfast burrito. All thanks to the mystical girl behind the counter at philz coffee.
author: Joe P.

description: I don't normally drink coffee but living right by Philz gave me the urge to try it out and see what the hype is all about. Mind you going to work every morning and smelling the fresh brewed coffee is invigorating. I gotta try it! Boy oh boy! Did it stimulate my taste buds! Haha If you haven't had a cup of coffee from Philz, you must try it! I had an... Iced Mint Mojito! Yummm... And I'm sure there's plenty more for me to try! Definitely recommend!
author: Megan S.

description: Just doesn't get any better - seriously good coffee (ALL OF THEM!!) - the process is so much apart of the allure...would compare it to old school barbershop for men with a straight razor shave and hot towel - Philz is that kinda shave!! :-)
author: Richard D.

description:
I agree with the person writing a review earlier in the year.  This place appears to be full of pretentious people and show offs.

The weird thing was how the baristas talked to me... I have foreign looks and heavy accent, true. But c'mon! ... Yes, it was a nice gesture of them when they saw/talked to me.  All cancels out .  That was what it was weird.

PS: Any coffee is great with cardamon, duh. 
Cons: place is small and NPR plays as loud as it could be.  Yes, they care about letting u know how trendy the place is.
author: Emir A.

description:
When I told my co-worker I was going to get hot coffee on a very hot day today, he didn't say it out loud but he had that look on his face, "YOU CRAZEE, GURL!"

Well, call me Super Loca but I badly wanted to try Philz coffee.

So, I walked under the hot sun and found a small, clean place with straight leather-back chairs with people on the internet.

The friendly staff gave me a little lesson on coffee. She said that: Light-roast=most caffeine and Dark roast=strongest taste.

She asked me if I wanted my coffee nutty or sweet. I told her I wanted my coffee medium-roast and sweet.

Voila!  She brewed my coffee in turkish style coffee-maker "One Cup At  A Time." (Philz's slogan).   She handed me the "AMBROSIA."  A drink for the Gods, indeed!  Well-balanced, no bitter taste, a little spicy kick with a hint of vanilla.

I also grabbed a "potato empanada" that looked more like a samosa. Surprisingly very good and super-spicy!

Philz was worth the .8 mi trip from my office and the $5.25 I paid for my large coffee and empanada.  Probably one of the best medium roast coffees I've had so far.

Who's La Loca, now?!!!!

(Special thanks to Melinda C. whose review inspired me to check out Philz!)
author: Leah E.

description:
Excellent. I don't really have any other comments. The staff is soooo welcoming and knowledgeable, and the coffee is amazing. 

Bravo.
author: Ramon E.

description:
I'm going to have a "coffee off."  Blue Bottle versus Philz.  We'll see who wins the battle.  Today, one of my beloved co-workers (well, two of them) brought me a cup of Philz, since they know I love coffee.  Alas, they doctored it up with cream and sugar.  Cream, I can deal with.  Sugar, not so much... Even still, I could tell that was one good cup o' joe!

So, I'll need to make a trip back to figure out if Philz can rival my love of BB.  Or for that matter, a cup of Peet's coffee -- brewed in a french press with the timer set for four minutes.

Ah, what bliss!

.... stay tuned for the Coffee Off!
author: Patty W.

description: I really wanted to jump on the raving review band wagon, yet the coffee isn't that great nor horrible. I just re-learned that putting vanilla soy into your own fresh batch of beans with ice is a great way for $3 to be spent. Although its a trendy and up and coming chain, I still say Coffee Bean and Tea Leaf Rules!  I have SBX via brew at home and so I just keep to that. I don't really go out to coffee shops as many mom and pops tend to have the same stuff I have. (From Costco or what not.)
author: R C.

description:
Almost everyone I know have told me at least once how awesome Philz Coffee is.  Even this one random guy who was waiting in line with us for breakfast at Brenda's French Soul Food was preaching about it after asking us if we enjoy good coffee.

We made it over to the Philz over on Van Ness - luckily on a weekday mid-morning, so it wasn't crowded - and got our first taste of what everyone's been talking about, and let me say, they are not overhyping it -- it REALLY is that good!

The baristas there are such coffee geeks, it was awesome.  Since I was one of few customers there at the time, I got a quick run-down of what they're all about and a walk-through in choosing what blend I'd like (since they've got like, 20!), as well as how much cream and sugar I like in my coffee - great customer service!  I didn't have to do a thing and I was handed what seemed to be the perfect cup of coffee.

Dare I say..  I think I choose Philz over Blue Bottle .. gasp!
author: Crys L.

description:
This is a professional coffee house.  I usually trust the judgment of the employees...I just tell them what I am looking for (i.e a BOLD cup of coffee, or a smooth mellow sweet blend) and they know exactly what to make me.

Each cup is individually ground and brewed for a perfect flavor every time.  

This is where serious coffee drinkers go
author: Matt V.

description:
This is my favorite coffee in San Francisco. Blue Bottle, Ritual, Four Barrel are all really good, but Philz takes the cake. I never knew that coffee could taste so good. Whether it's ambrosia, turkish, phils harmonic, it is all made with love and you can taste so many extraordinary flavors. Highly recommended by a coffee fanatic and lover. 

p.s. try their vegan donuts!!
author: Saskia S.

description:
I finally know what real coffee taste like after I have Philz! I usually get my $1.5 coffee from starbuck but almost once a week, I will treat myself to Philz ($3.25 for a large medium roasted coffee).  

They customize your coffee and their service is excellent! I felt so welcome there and their coffee menu is one of a kind in SF! Even if you have no idea what kind of coffee you want, the staff is happy to create one that fits your taste.  Their coffee is a great way to start off the day.  What is better than indulgent yourself before a long day of work!? Definitely recommend it!

P.S.  If you bring your own coffee mug, they charge you a large drink for the price of a small one! Environmentally friendly and you save money for being green!
author: Yau L.

description:
The coffee is insanely good.  I would wager it's even got a leg up on Blue Bottle.  My first time there I was nervous about the baristas adding cream and sugar.  But man, they do it up perfect!  I'm also getting addicted to the sambusas they sell.  The potato ones are awesome.  If there was anything negative I could say it would only be that they're somewhat lacking in the pastry dept.  But hey!  When the coffee's this good they get a pass.  :)

It's a small place but very nicely furnished and there's always a nice neighborly vibe.
author: J K.

description:
Staring at the pre-packaged single serving package of coffee in my hotel room, I knew I didn't want to blow a chance to sip on a great cup of coffee while on biz in San Fran.  I mean, this is the Bay Area! Northern Californians have perfected the art of the cafe....its the home of Peet's and Cafe Strada!!  

I queried my fellow Yelpers to find that a place called Philz served up the mother of all cups of coffee only 1 block from my hotel (Phoenix Hotel). 

Half awake, I found Philz at 645 AM.  Quite busy, to be expected for a midweek cafe in San Fran.  

I was greeted with "what can I get started for ya boss?"  Which is cool -- I'm down w/ friendly baristas, especially ones who know that John O is the boss.......

Anyways, the choice of coffees was overwhelming - a bit too overwhelming for my brain so early in the morning.  I'm not supposed to think before 8 am.......

I went with the standard cup -- per the suggestion of the guy behind the counter.  

$3 for a standard coffee -- probably the most expensive cup of coffee I've purchased for a long time.   Coffee at ski resorts even cost less than Philz.....

My cup of joe -- or should I say Philz -- was really, really good.   I also think Peet's across the street serves up a great cup of coffee at probably about 65% of the price.  

The taste was quite good -- but I could see this as being an expensive habit if enjoyed daily!  

All in all a great cup of coffee -- definitely original and worth checking out if you're in San Fran.
author: John O.

description: Amazing drip coffee. Stopped at Philz in the wee hours of the morning on my way to the airport and was blown away by the delicious
author: Kathryn R.

description:
This is my favorite Philz!  The staff is so awesome; whoever is recruiting does a great job. The best thing going for this place is its staff: Zach, Terrell, Brian , John and Tom are very sweet. Zach and Terrell are always making bagels super fast and well. If you are a regular the coffee staff remembers your orders! Everyone is friendly and efficient. 

The only negative thing which prevents me from going in there on some afternoons is the heat !!!!! It's really hot; AC is needed!
author: Sara S.

description: Love the mojito iced coffee and classic chocolate chip cookie.
author: Diner S.

description:
I freely admit to drinking mochas from Starbucks.  I'm that much of a coffee wuss.  Peet's is just a little too strong for me.  But Philz coffee has converted me away from drinking Starbucks.  It is the best coffee I've ever tasted.  The best mochas!!  

Plus you never have to worry about crime when visiting this location in the morning because there are usually 5-8 cops hanging out in front drinking coffee.
author: Gordon A.

description:
I LOVE Philz and was stoked to find one in my neighborhood(Van Ness@Turk) .The whole staff is very friendly and knowledgeable, especially Sammy the manager. There coffee may seem a little expensive, but it is the best coffee that i have ever had both in flavor and caffeine. I drive 10 or 20 blocks just for a cup frequently. If your not a coffee addict like i am you will be after the first cup.

A word of warning tho , once you have Philz you wont be able to drink Starbuck's any more.
author: Richard P.

description: i go to philz every other day.  This philz is consistently off.  I'm not sure it's the barista or what but it's never as good as the other locations.  I now steer clear of this one.
author: Ezra K.

description:
Phil...YOU DA MAN.

I walked in the door with a line of 6 people deep, so I was able to take my time browsing through the menu. With the heatwave hitting the city hard and the scorching sun burning the back of my neck, I was leaning more toward the iced coffee drinks...when suddenly my attention wandered down to the bottom of the chalkboard and I felt my eyeballs jump out of their sockets. MINT MOJITO ICED COFFEE. Oh no you did-int!

Got to the front of the register, threw down my $4, grabbed my drink, and frolicked away like a giddy child who just bought a barrel of chocolate from the candy store.

One sip...and I was floored. I'm not even sure how to describe this moment of bliss, but it's become my new favorite coffee drink. I'll definitely be back to try their other brews. Thanks to Philz, I was wired enough for the next hour or so to finish up some work.

I said it once, and I'll say it again. Phil, YOU DA FREAKIN MAN!!
author: Michelle W.

description:
YE-EEESSS!!!! I have no idea how long this Philz has been here, but literally crawled in here midway through a brutal rain-trodden run last week.

I can now allocate a portion of my paycheck to my daily Philz- love, love, love... I don't even have to schlep clear across town to score some!
author: Gabrielle J.

description:
I had heard about this place  for a  while, and was in the neighborhood yesterday, so decided to try it.    The coffee  WAS  delectable.  I  had looked it up on Yelp before  I went, so knew what to order for my  palette.  The coffee was smooth and  silky, but  not bitter at all.   So that was cool.  However, it  seemed a bit pretentious.  Also,  I  felt  like  I was an imposition to them.    I  know that  you get what you pay for and the coffee was really good. I just cannot   justify paying that much on  coffee that often,  

Who was really nice though was this fellow customer  and  CPA  student  named Ted.:)  He really helped me out  and  even gave me mint when I realized I had lost my gum.:)  Due to my speech speech disability, he 
didn't get my name, lol.
Anyway, back to Philz, in this area is  either this, McDonalds or  Peet;s (too bitter)      so  this is  the best choice and I would come again.   Also there is a nice lounge area  , though not great for large groups.
author: Sascha B.

description: I really liked the Mocha Tessora but then I tried the Mint Mojito Iced Coffee.  Pretty sure that is what I was meant to drink all along:)  Yum!
author: Karen K.

description:
I am very sensitive to caffeine, and have had to give up coffee years ago because of it. This place delivered the first cup of coffee I've had in over a decade that has not given me a headache, and instead delivered a pleasant buzz.

I informed the barista of my sensitivity and he brewed up a cup with a specific combination of blends to address my specific concerns.  It was great.  I was not disappointed.

The mint mojito iced coffee is not to be missed.

I've tried Four Barrel Coffee and Blue Bottle in the last few days, but this is definitely tops.  I shall return.
author: Stephanie T.

description:
This place definitely know how to serve coffee!!!  Only a place like this is worth walking 5 blocks, in heels, on an infamously chilly SF night, for.  

I was first introduced to this place by a trusted friend and she did not fail with her Philz coffee suggestion.  The mocha tesora is rich, creamy and tantalizingly addicting.  I like to make mine a bit sweeter and creamier, but that's just a personal preference.  I have also tried their iced coffee, and once again, I was not disappointed.  

Added plus, the staff is super friendly and chill!  Two thumbs up for Philz Coffee.  KIM APPROVED!
author: Kim C.

description: Was at Philz last week.  They still make great customized coffee, but they dont serve vegan doughnuts anymore.
author: Cris C.

description:
Always great coffee! This time I had the Turkish with soy. I would say that if you are spending 3 dollars on coffee, just get the cream and sugar, because it makes the flavor really come out- Turkish tastes like cardamom.

Didnt like this location that much- kinda squished and not that much seating for studying.
author: Sirina K.

description:
I'm not big on coffee hype- I'm perfectly satisfied bringing my mug of instant black coffee into work/school every day.  However, every now and then I'm looking for a treat, something to make a gloomy day brighter, and for this I want Philz.  Today I had the Istanbul Treat because, well, I wanted a treat, and the soft balance of honey and mint with a spiced tea- I just sighed in appreciation of the memory of that drink.  And really, the price wasn't so bad.  Sure, I could get a too-sweet-too-much-whipped-cream-make-me-feel-sick-double-carmel-blah-blah-blah for $4.50 at Starbucks, or I could get any of Philz's large coffee or tea creations for $3.50 and feel refreshed and satisfied.  

My only wish, and I've never really said this about a business before, is that I wish it weren't so customer service-y.  Most of the drinks have a special code name that isn't very telling about what the drink is and in this environment I'd rather make my decision on my own than have to buddy up to the barrista.  However, if you need to ask questions (I'll just opt for blindly trying things but still being satisfied every time), everyone was very helpful and friendly.
author: Luthien N.

description:
Philz ain't no Starbucks...actually, it's even better than Blue Bottle Coffee. Not only are the barista's friendly and attentive, Philz' brews each coffee one cup at a time. Philz' handcrafted brew is complimented by how sweet and creamy you want it. 

The darker roast the better and my recommendations are: 
* Jacob's Wonderbar (always a standard fave) 
* Tantalizing Turkish (if you're feeling spicy and want a kick of cardamon) 
* Julie's Ultimate (smooth and mellow)
author: Aya O.

description: Ohhh Philz - how I love thee. So amazing - the only coffee that may change your life - or turn you into an addict. I love this location the most - the staff is almost always friendly, upbeat and they do very sweet and creamy (blasphemy - I know) the right way. They don't make me ask for more suger 5 times like other locations. Parking is a headache - but the sweet silkiness of the coffee will chase it away. Highly recommended.  There's occasionally a grumpy guy at the register (who doesn't seem to fit with the rest of the perky staff) so I'm thinking about licking him next time or gifting him a sticker - something to remind him - you have access to the best coffee in the world at least 5 hours a day. Life is good my friend, drink on.
author: Shannon O.

description:
I'm addicted to coffee again! After a few years of Starbucks and Peet's, Philz blows them out of the water! I've even biked from my place in Fillmore and back with the coffee in hand just for a cup.

The coffee blends are rich and tasty, not watered down. They do make 1 cup at a time and they custom make it with cream and sugar to your satisfaction. If you don't like it, they'll make you another cup. That only happened once when I ordered the Mocha Tesora; it's way too sweet for my taste. The few sips I had of it was tasty though. They happily made me a different coffee, no drama.

I've ordered the Tesora, Jacob's Blend, New Manhattan, Code 33, and Turkish coffee. All good! Just depends what I'm in the mood for.

Do yourself a favor and have cup of Philz, you won't regret it.
author: Alex A.

description:
Mind splitting, intense, lush, savory, satisfying....philz coffee I am now having an affair with you. 

So many places make stronger coffee taste like absolute bitter crap...Starbucks you fail, Peets don't even try to hide. Not here. I want to call them bartenders because it feels like a bar for coffee. They can make a mean Turkish cup and leave it not too overly hot but just the right temperature so that you can actually start drinking the coffee straight away without catching your damn tongue on fire. Was I in a dreamstate when they asked me to sip the coffee and make sure I liked it *pinches arm* nope wide awake, tasted it and LOVED this coffee. I am not one for cream or sugar but the guy threw in a sprig of mint at the very end and it added so much more depth to the coffee. 

Oh Philz, you blew my mind and I will be a morning regular ; )
author: Morgan M.

description: Nice coffee individually made.  Very nice and perfect for those cold, early mornings.  What better way to warm yourself up and wake up.
author: Nicholas L.

description:
People, do not blame Phil for your bad choices! 
This place is awesome. I really enjoy the Philtered Soul and Mocha Tesora but seeing as how you CAN'T GO WRONG with any flavor on the menu I usually just ask the baristas to surprise me. The baristas are also really friendly and helpful, even though their hipster vibes may throw you at first. I'll admit it's a unique payment system at Phil'z. You order first then get in another line to pay, using the honor system. 
The other room in the back is also awesome, it really sets the tone for the chill vibe that Phil'z upholds. 
Fair warning: Phil'z coffee is STRONG. The first time I went here I downed my coffee in 10 minutes and by the time I got to school my math teacher said I was chattering away and bouncing off the walls like a chipmunk and my heart was racing like the Indy 500. 
Final verdict for the awesome delicious, affordable fair trade coffee they serve here? 4 FOR YOU PHIL'Z, you go Phil'z!!!!
author: Lia R.

description:
I think they make each savory cup with more love than is found in most relationships!

Philz coffee rocks! 
Each cup is brewed one at a time & steeps in single filter until is is perfect. Today I had the french roast while my friends opted for the New Manhatten blend. After the funky serious coffee connoisseur staff prepares each cup, you are summoned to the counter & asked exactly how much milk & sugar should be added for the primo coffee experience. My friend insists we bring our own mug so the coffee is not sullied by a paper cup & Philz supports this with a discount.
Divine & well worth the wait for the perect cup of coffee!
author: heather s.

description:
There's finally a reason to get up (early) in the morning!  I say early because I'm one of those people who usually gets up in the morning with just enough time to get to work on time.  I have been inspired to get up a little early to take a detour to the amazing mecca that is PHILZ COFFEE.  

Upon the very nice and informative barista's (barist-o?) recommendation, my first taste of Philz Coffee was Jacob's Wonderbar Brew.  "Wow"...yes.  WOW!  This epic moment was followed up with "Wow's" after each sip.  I couldn't help it.  

Since my first experience, four days ago, I've gone back four times.  Sad?  Maybe.  But to think of going back to regular coffee would be dreadful.  I thought about going through the menu and trying each blend.  So far, Jacob's Wonderbar is the best...First timer?  Go with Jacob's.  

With the exception of the cashier, service is excellent!  The baristas are super friendly and PATIENT...which is what I love.  They actually take the time to find out what you like and explain the various blends to help you find the perfect match and without a doubt, you'll find a winner.  If only dating was this easy...
author: Jennifer L.

description: Love love love love Philz. I have my "drink" and order Philtered Soul if it's chilly out (typical SF mornings) or Iced Mint Mojito if the temp is high. I have to say having the different stations is super confusing if you haven't been there before. I didn't understand how it worked the first time and had a veteran have to explain it to me. You order from one of the baristas and make sure to get your drink from that same barista. The bagels are pretty bomb too, Philz style is my favorite. The bagel guy also makes me laugh (probably not intentionally) and always remembers my bagel order even if it's been a while! Go here for your next caffeine fix!
author: Melinda S.

description: No espresso here. Just really good drip coffee made one cup at a time. I walked in thinking it was just another coffee shop and ordered a Latte. The nice woman behind the counter explained "We don't pull shots here but I can make you something very similar. It was very good. I wish I would have bought some beans to go. Next time I will.
author: Bill B.

description:
I like Philz for the coffee. I also like Philz for the uniqueness of the way they run their shop. It's the kind of model I can imagine will one day be starbucks-ified... maybe... if people every start making enough money again that $3+ coffee becomes a fiscally acceptable indulgence. 

As for me, I felt guilty after day 4 of picking up their coffee in the morning before hopping on the cal-train. 

Ok- a quick commentary on the coffee: it is smooth but strong. I can drink a whole "large" cup (not your starbucks venti-sized monstrosity, but bigger than your standard coffee mug size) and get a nice clean buzz without that feeling in the back of my throat that I had been licking old grounds out of an ashtray like I sometimes get at other coffee places.  I also like the fact that they have blends of coffee that actually taste different! It wasn't just a: let's give it a different name and have our baristas pretend that there is a difference between this and the rest of the stuff on tap. 

And now, to end with an apology: I don't know how Philz does the voodoo that they do, but it is not as simple as just grabbing a filter and a cup and trying to brew your own cup-sized coffee. So: to all the coffee places out there that I just insulted, I will admit that, in your defense, I have been trying to save money and copy Philz, and it has not gone over well... so I guess I feel your pain. 

In summary: Philz- is a pricey treat. But one that delivers delicious coffee with a side of frustration that you can't do it yourself anywhere as good as they do.
author: Chris Y.

description:
Mint Mojito Iced Coffee....
I saw nature at this coffee...Grass,sky and tree...
author: bonnie k.

description:
I saw their mint mojito coffee and just had to try it. It was totally worth the hype!  I got a large and finished it in about 2 large gulps because I just couldn't stop :]

They also have a nice seating area on the second floor. I like how its not too close to campus (UCB) but close enough. 
I went to Philz during Dead Week (Finals) and spend all day studying with a bunch of other people. If I wasn't busy I probably would have talked to the people next to me since everyone was friendly and they were having a public conversation anyway.

Besides the mojito coffee, I asked the worker what other coffee she would suggest and she said Ambrosia. Its a mild coffee and I got it sweet with sugar and creme. It was delicious as well!
I was very happy studying and drinking there. :] Can't wait to go again.

The only thing I didn't like about the place was that it was always packed! haha. Hard to find a place to sit sometimes, but their quality is good. 
They also like your instagram pics if you tag them :p

oh and parking kind of sucks, I always park residental because I don't like paying the coin machine thing
author: Dominque D.

description: Efficient and knowledgeable baristas, consistently delicious everything. Super fast WiFi and a few laptop accessible outlets. Win win win win.
author: M R.

description: I've stopped drinking coffee from other places because they just can't compete with Philz. I think this place can even turn coffee haters into coffee lovers. That's how much I believe in the power of Philz. I assume everything is good even though I only ever get the Soooo Good. I don't think their drinks are expensive either because if you're ready to shell out $3 or 4 for a flavored latte or frap at Starbucks, why not just go to Philz for a drink that's a million times better for the same price?
author: Kathryn C.

description: Hands down, one of the best coffees in the whole bay area!
author: Amir A.

description:
Others have raved about the coffee and I do too, but Philz is truly unique in many respects.  First you get to pick your roast - dark, medium or light (say bye-bye to burnt beans).  Then there's the cream.  Philz uses a really high quality cream in your coffee - it is truly spectacular.  Finally, they ask you to take a sip of your custom brew and if it's not how you like it they'll fix it for you so it's how you want it.  The folks that brew your brew are friendly and will help you pick from among the many roasts.  

It's a bit pricey, but there must be more overhead if you brewing each cup indvidually.  It's worth it!  If you want an inexpensive cup, brew it at home.  The mint mojito is truly magic.
author: Kat M.

description:
yes to the mint mojitooooo!

the first time i visited i was so confused because they have a line and differrent barista tables where they specifically take your order.  once ur done there's a whole separate area where you pay and you sorta just stand around until your barista is done with your order.  fantastic service, great coffee, fun environment.  go go go go go go!
author: Sandy L.

description: Very nice place, cozy atmosphere and amazing refreshing drinks! My fave is Philz Fresh Chai. Also, ask for a fresh mint leave in your coffee, it's so good!
author: Elena M.

description: Out of all the Philz I've been to, the one on Van Ness keeps me coming back because of their non-hipster, down to earth, polite & friendly baristas. The usual guy that makes my coffee says "Why, thank you!" everytime I order. I always walk out of this Philz with good customer service & a hella good cup of coffee (Large Philtered Soul, Medium Sweet with Cream)
author: Valerie F.

description:
The string of disappointments was growing:

Fri PM: A trip to the East Bay for family time was great, but what's with the biting cold in Dublin in July during an outdoor concert? Brrrr.

Sat very early AM: The streak of amazing talent ends as DJ Bobina fails to tell a captivating story at 1015.

Sat AM: Our breakfast destination, Cafe Ramind and it's exceptional looking French toast, was unexpectedly closed. Did I miss something about not being open Saturdays?

Sat early PM: Harry Potter 6 sucked.

Then a streak breaker - the new Philz. I was very happy to see it's just like all the others, which means friendly service, reasonable prices and more caffeine choices than you can imagine. All served one delicious cup at a time.
author: Jason B.

description:
CASING THE JOINT:

Pretty damn good coffee. One of the smoothest, most flavorful coffee in the city. Multiple locations in the city - this is the smallest, but perfect for get-in, get-out, walk to Civic Center or walk around Polk.

THE SCORE: 

With Tesora blend and a sprig of mint mashed in, it can't be beat. This was the first cup I've ever gotten, and the best. Small for $2.75, and ~$3.5 for a large cup.

Around $12.95/lb for any coffee to take home.

Since that first day, I've tried many other blends - it's hard not to be curious. 

"So-Good", "Ambrosia Coffee of God", "Silken Splendor", "Jacob's Wonder"-something are also some favorites to try. 

THE GETAWAY: 

Usually pick up a cup of coffee here on Sunday on the way to the Civic Center Farmer's Market. It's a good Sunday when this happens.
author: Eric C.

description:
Once every two months or so, I call Sami (the store manager) on the phone, and place a huge coffee order for my company to go pick up. This has been the "arrangement" for the past year or so and I've had nothing but flawless transactions *every* time. Not only do I get awesome service, but Sami sends me home with a cup of mocha tesora (my fave!), always asks how my little boy is doing, and inquires about how life is treating me.  

Local Offices/Businesses: These guys are more than able to handle commercial orders, so you should give them your business, not the middle men companies who don't know you and sell you old coffee! Sami and his crew are why I don't use a third party to buy my coffee from anymore. The beans are super fresh and they are able to fill my large orders within an hour after I place my order over the phone. 

Honestly: I'd rather give Sami's store the business and feel like I'm a part of the community-cause he & his crew are sure doing a rockstar job of doing it.
author: B W.

description: Love this place.  The staff is always nice.  No attitude.  The clientele couldn't get more diverse.  And I can get really great tasting coffee, even though I have to have decaf now (pregnant).  The Swiss Water Peru decaf is amazing.  I don't even know i'm drinking decaf.  Plus the Philz Bagel is tasty, too.
author: Cami B.

description:
This is their new Civic Center location - big Yay!  The Civic Center is looking up these days with neighbors like Philz Coffee and Brenda's on Polk (around the corner), and Ananda Fuara's.  I hope other reviewers write about the other choices on the board, because there be lots to try.  This time around, I did the Turkish coffee (recommended by the friendly barista) and she let me try it before I paid for it.  I got to add 2 packets of fake sugar (Splenda) when she made it (very accommodating).  It was pure Turkish hedonism, a dark concoction, but oh so smooth.  It felt like I was experiencing some sort of ritual with the mesmerizing chants of the muezzin resonating from my coffee cup.  Does that mean I get to do this 5 times a day?  I asked to be rung up because I was set to go with a content smile on my face.  Plus, the buzz was just right.

A 5-star treat.  I will be back.
author: Roger R.

description:
Quite Simply one of the test coffee's I've ever had.

Individually brewed coffee that tastes amazing. Philtered Soul was a big hit with me. If i go back to San Fran... this is a definite.
author: J B.

description: You're first visit might be a bit tricky as I don't think they have any "regular" or "standard" coffee, but every cup is made on the spot and the staff is super friendly.  If you need a kick, go with one of the light roasts like the Greater Alarm!
author: Fred L.

description: My latte was so-so - the coffee tasted a little watered down, honestly - but the cheerfulness of the staff earns Philz an extra star.
author: Jess L.

description:
I hate you Philz....you've turned me into a coffee snob!!

Tesora on most days. The baristas are so awesome here ... sometimes I'll just ask em to whip up something yummy or their own personal favorite.

But yeah, I don't go to Starbucks anymore b/c of Philz.
author: Ames L.

description: If you come to Philz "Turkish" Coffee actually expecting Turkish style coffee, you'll waste 4 bucks like I did. Philz "Turkish" is just drip coffee with some spices, not the strong, thick artfully boiled demitasse of middle eastern style coffee that usually goes by that name.
author: Anthony B.

description:
Philz is definitely my favorite spot to get coffee! They always get it just the way I like it. . The people who work at Philz also go above and beyond to ensure that you are completely satisfied with your coffee.  

The only downfall is the wait, but that's just the nature of the beast. If you want fresh, customized coffee that has its own unique distinct flavor, it takes time...but it's well worth it.
author: Kim H.

description:
Beware of getting addicted to this coffee and this is coming from someone who used to only drink coffee when working overnight shifts. How can i resist when the frothy, smooth, heavenly cup of liquid energy is only a block away from my work.  
Now don't get me wrong, working at a non-profit makes me think everything in the place is overpriced but the coffee keeps me coming back... 
Must fight Philz addiction.... 
but as they say in AA, relapse is a part of recovery and I foresee a lot of relapses as long as Philz is there. You have been warned. 
Be ready to be awakened to the delights of fresh ground, one cup at a time, perfect every time elixir of life. 
The coffee at Philz helps to explain the changes that happened during the age of enlightenment when coffee first became popular in Europe.
Signs of addiction: constant movement, talkative, euphoria, and espousing reviews about Philz that cannot be believed by those who have not tried it... I weep for the day that Philz is not around even if that day is 100yrs in the future.  
ps- this review has been written two days after the last cup of Philz coffee while suffering from withdraw. I mean who looks forward to mondays just for a cup of coffee to start the day?
author: tomohisa w.

description:
This is the #1 place to buy beans.  I've purchased the Tesoro blend, which is smooth and fabulous and not at all bitter or acidic.  Today I bought the Ambrosia blend, and card hardly wait to have my moring BOWL of latte.  Sorry Pete's but Philz has you beat.  Philz far surpasses any Starbucks product.  

The first time I went here to buy a cup, the barista was very helpful.  They will ask you about your preferences, if you do not know which blend you'd like.  

The service is friendly.
author: Gigi M.

description: First time here,first time the Mint Mojito Iced Coffee was so so.  Came back a second time and the Mint Mojito Iced Coffee is now my favorite coffee in the city.  It's conveniently located on Van Ness and the lines are crazy like other places.  The staff is friendly and give great recommendations.  Place is tidy and clean.  Ever since my first time, this is a stop for me whenver I am in SF.  Mint Mojito Iced Coffee is highly recommended.
author: Ronald L.

description:
Philz, you make my heart happy.  Yes, in the super caffeinated way, but also in the "I want to take you behind the schoolyard and get you pregnant" way.  

My favorite is the Philharmonic, but I also adore the Tesora (isn't this Phil's lovechild?) as well as the Arabica and Turkish blends.  One of my most favorite things to do is get Philz at the Castro location with a donut and sit in Dolores Park and watch the hipsters go by.

You also make me look like the coolest person ever when I introduce you to someone new.  Bonus points if they're from the suburbs.  One sip of your Ambrosia and you make my married and settled-down friends want to move to SF, ride a fixie and drink Philz coffee.
author: Michelle P.

description:
I don't think there's very much to add, other than I got turned onto Philz Coffee by Phil himself when he was giving a demonstration at my workplace.  He made me a cup of coffee, I drank it, and thought "wow, this is pretty good."  I drink a lot of coffee, and generally the stuff we have at work is excellent quality, and at the time I rated it a solid notch above what we were drinking.

Then I had some of the work coffee again, and it tasted like water.

That's how good it is: it makes my normal, quite good coffee taste bland and lifeless in comparison.

Sure, it's a litle pricey, but the staff are extremely friendly, the atmosphere is nice, and the coffee is staggeringly good.
author: Nils J.

description: The mint mojito coffee was hands down but most unique and wonderful tasting coffee every. The wait line was quite long, but the service was pretty quick and you knew you were getting great coffee, so it was worth the wait. I like the fact that there is a separate seating area/study/chill area across the ordering place, so it's not too loud, but you can grab your coffee and then have a seat with your friends or take care of any business you need to. The only reason I give 4 stars is because the cashier lady definitely gave me an attitude. If you know you are going to have lots of customers, know how to treat them well, or you will lose them. ....Rather than that everyone else was very sweeeet
author: Sooshi K.

description:
First time here and I received the best help. 
The barista could tell right away it was my first time and he told me to just reply to some of his questions which i did.
After his 3-4 questions survey I ended up with the Mint Mojito Cold Coffee... and it's a great and flavorful blend!
I'm coming back for sure. The environment is chill a lot of people come to pick up a drink few stay and immerse themselves in their computer.
WIFI IS FREE SO WHY NOT!
The chili breakfast burrito is okay.
author: Christian P.

description: I am addicted to Philz Coffee. Seriously, I could leave it at that . . . but I will proceed. Sammy "makes" the place feel like home. He is always welcoming, generous, has a smile on his face . . . and makes the best effen coffee I've EVER had. I live and die for a cup of Dancing Water on the daily, and sometimes have to go back for more. Yes, it is really is that good! It's effects are long-lasting:) Really, I walk my dog, hit the gym, run errands, cook . . . you name it, after having a cup of Philz!I I will be a fan for life, and would follow Sammy and Dancing Water to the ends of the earth:)
author: Gabriela W.

description:
Thanks to Groupon I've been hitting up Philz a lot, and I'm definitely on the Philz bandwagon.  The coffee is outstanding and the service is, to say the least, a cut above any typical chain or local coffeeshop.  They grind and brew one cup at a time, and they prepare it to your liking (cream, sugar etc) instead of leaving it up to you.  At first this seemed odd, like I would have to keep giving it back to them to get it right, but they know what they're doing and can easily accommodate your preferences.

So far my favorites are the Turkish and Julie's Ultimate, both dark roasts.  I've had some of the pastries too, which are decent.  The plain croissant was great, the mini cupcakes were ok, and the scone I had was pretty good.

The only downside really is the price.  I think the cheapest cup is $2.75, and they go up to I think $3.25 for a small.  The price is fair when you consider the quality, but it keeps this from being an everyday kind of place for me.  It would be nice if they had a cheaper bulk-brewed option, but I understand why they keep it strictly 1-cup-at-a-time.
author: Joseph N.

description:
I guess at this point I'm just reiterating what mostly everyone else said...

This place is fabulous!  I work right by the Van Ness location and Peet's is the existing hot spot for coffee related business.  Never again.  I saw this little place and popped in instead of Peets, now I will never go back.  The astonishment when i realized they brew on the spot, all the time!  The total enthusiasm with which the barist....er? answered all of my questions bordered on annoying, but managed to stay in the realm of charming.  fine line.  

this place manages to be gourmet without pretention.  fine coffee, fine selections, fine lines respected, all over this place is a winner.  my new favorite.
author: Beckie M.

description:
AMAZING!! I am not a coffee drinker (at least that's what I tell myself) because I'm terrified of becoming a mandatory cup in the morning, cup in the afternoon type of person. Hence, I don't have a whole lot of experience in coffee drinking. 

But everyone at Philz is not only super nice and accommodating, but they are more than happy to help you out with recommendations. They have given me several good recs, including Mocha Tesora which I'm a big fan of with vanilla soy milk, and a few others as well. Once I asked a guy which he liked more, the maple scone or the lemon, and he gave me a free maple scone so I could try both!! That's service for you! They really stand behind their products and are really genuine, nice people.

Only negative is it is a little pricey for the pastries and there are no prices up.. it's kind of misleading. I got one and it ended up being 5 dollars for a tiny pastry. Oh well.

I really recommend this for everyone- even "non-coffee drinkers"!
author: Cathy S.

description: Best coffee in the Bay, hands down. The mocha and mint are my favorite flavors if you're looking for something fancy, but even their basic coffee is heavenly. Plus watching them brew it by hand for you adds an extra personal touch.
author: Abby G.

description: Although I've only tried the Sooo Good coffee at Philz, it is super delicious, undoubtedly strong and quickly addicting. It could be the Arabic beans. It could be the cream and sugar. Each order freshly ground and brewed super hot! I love that the coffee continues to stay hot, even if I'm nursing half the cup an hour after I started drinking it. All the employees are friendly and chill but work efficiently to get everyone's order in. I line up to order my choice, mention my preference for cream or sugar (or none), the barista then starts making it as I move down the line to pay at the cashier. Wait a few minutes, he/she calls out my order and I go back to pick my cup of caffeine. Take a sip to see if any extra cream or sugar needs to be added but most of the time it's brewed perfectly. This coffee is seriously good.
author: Sarah N.

description:
I can't say enough good things about Philz Coffee.  Great coffee brewed one cup at a time, friendly and knowledgeable baristas, free wi-fi, and great atmosphere.  

When you order your coffee the barista consults you on what you should get based on your own personal preference.  Today, for example, I was suffering from a pretty legit hangover and needed to get my butt in gear to work.  The barista suggested a cup of "Great Alarm" which was money.  He suggested another type (name escapes me now) and said the difference in the two was, "Fireman strong versus Police Officer strong."  The way he explained it made sense and I went with Fireman strong.  

Philz can get a little noisy so I wouldn't suggest posting up here if you need to talk on the phone or can't concentrate around noise when you study.  Otherwise this is a great place to hang out and people watch all the characters in the Tenderloin, read a book, study, or chat with friends.  

And I cannot stress enough......The coffee is amazing!  Sometimes that gets lost when rating coffee places because everyone is so worried about convenience.
author: Tanner M.

description: My first time at Philz was very pleasant. I was immediately helped by Nick who was extremely warm and helpful. He introduced me to one of their specialty coffees, silken splendor. Great coffee. Friendly baristas. Thanks Nick.
author: Dunn D.

description: 2nd best coffee shop I've ever tried (after Intelligentsia). I usually take my coffee black, but my friend told me that I should try it with cream and sugar, as they even make that a different way. They brew each individual cup and have very knowledgeable baristas. I had no idea which coffee to try. My first visit I tried tesora and 2nd visit had Jacob's wonderbar brew. These guys know how to make a great cup of coffee. I wish NJ/NY had more places like this.
author: Rich K.

description: The coffee here is ridiculously good. The lounge area is entirely separate from where you order. Huge bonus. The crowd is a mixture of students studying and people all about getting work done. The wifi is free and super fast. The staff is really friendly and have great musical taste. Just come to hang out, buy or not buy coffee/bagels, eat your own food, surf the internet, whatever. No pressure anywhere, and yet people don't abuse the system. Mom and Pop's are you listening? I can't believe this is a chain coffee shop. My only complaint is that the pastry/food stuff is a little on the expensive side for what it is ($3 for a cookie?) Other than that - awesome.
author: Ramon S.

description: If you want some coffee that will put some pep in your step, Philz is the place for you!  Spectacular coffee is not enough praise.  I work 1 block from Philz and I wish I worked farther, their coffee is so good.  I've become addicted to their coffee in a way I am unsure how it exactly happened.  I usually get the Mocha Tesora and I say to myself every time, "Philz, I wish I could quit you!"  I also frequent the Jacobs which is perfect for a morning or midday coffee.  The more you go, the more you know because the baristas are pretty knowledgeable and talkative about the coffee biz.  I've never left their establishment with anything less than a goofy smile on my face...kind of like a giddy kid on Christmas Eve waiting to open their presents or something.  Ohhhh Philz, why are you so delish?!?!?
author: Victoria R.

description:
You would think that paying close to $10 for two cups of coffee will get you something really tasty and maybe out of this world.  That's not the case in my world.

Came here on a weekend morning in a rush for a cup of joe for the ride.  Got parking right in front which was not expected, long line started to form and the wait isn't long.

The thing the bothers me most is that once we got our coffee and in the car ready to go, the coffee is not even hot.

My gf ordered the a small tesora and I ordered a large Jacobs Wonderbar.  When we both got into the car, took a sip before driving off, it was luke warm.   

This is a place where I've visited before and never had a problem with.  I'm just looking for some consistency from a coffee place that specialize in coffee.
author: C Y.

description:
Philz is probably my favorite place to get coffee in San Francisco.  It's so good.  The people at Philz are generally super friendly.  The Mocha Tesora is phenomenal.  I actually haven't ventured very far beyond it, but I have also tried the Sooo Good and it is exactly that.  

The Philz on Van Ness is a pretty good study spot as well assuming you're able to find a spot to sit to down.  I kind of like the Mission location more overall, but I do love my Philz.
author: Alea G.

description: Caffeinated nectar of the Gods.  Best coffee in SF, period.
author: Ottis M.

description:
Going on my way to a Job faire today i passed by this aromatic coffee shop, seeing that it was early morning, i needed my cup of joe. Once i walked in i was greeted by the employee and it smelled SO GOOD, like i said, i smelled it from outside. He asked if i've been there before, i said no, and he asked what my preference was, so he gave me options.

I went with the Canopy of Heaven, and OMG best cup of coffee i've had in a while! It was light and at first it wasn't sweet enough to my liking, but he had asked me to taste it first so he can adjust the taste for me. After one more dab of sweetness, my coffee was PERFECT. A small cup of Canopy of Heaven was only $2.75 =) It really made my day all the more great.
author: Elisa T.

description: What a great coffee bar experience. Super cool and friendly staff. They have so many types of coffee beans and brew styles to choose from. Just tell them what you like and they listen and tailor the perfect cup of coffee you want. If something is not quite right, they will make it right like adding that little bit extra of sugar. Great seating area and wifi to hang out and surf. Try this place out and you will not be disappointed. I can't wait to try out the original location.
author: Don J.

description: I'm giving Philz Coffee five stars, because I don't know of any other coffee in existence that has had the power to get me truly amped! This full body rich coffee is supercilious! Its made by hand so the wait for your poison is a bit longer than usual. I had "Four Great Horses" and it made my little mustache hairs stick up. :) if you're a coffee snob like I am and your looking for some rocket fuel for a long night of studying or just want to stay up late, Philz is definitely your brand! Mmmmm Mmmmm Mmmmm!
author: Venus R.

description:
Best coffee hands down! Move over blue bottle, ritual, even peets. These guys are always friendly, efficient and they sure know how to make it perfect every time.

Only (slightly odd) thing is the set up is slightly weird but when you've got little space to deal with, what're you gonna do?

Philz is a MUST in SF.
author: Adam N.

description: The BEST coffee !!!! I order the mojito coffee with 1 sweet in low and it is fabulous!
author: V b.

description: Going to Philz is the usually the highlight of my work day.  After commuting up to 2 hours in the morning, I really enjoy taking the short walk to get coffee from such a warm and inviting place.   If I have anything negative to ever say about the place, it is only about the other cranky customers.   Frankly, I really enjoy the Batistas personalities and Zachariah (the awesome guy who makes the bagels) are the reason why I go to Philz. It is always busy when I go in but the staff there is always smiling and Zachariah especially makes me laugh and if it weren't for him, i don't think I would even buy a bagel.
