They make me smile and who doesn't want to start their day like that??  Thanks Zachariah and Sammy and the rest of the staff!  Keep smiling and thanks for making my workday bearable!
author: Gina J.

description:
I more or less thought coffee shops were all the same until I came here. Truly different tasting coffee. I'm not super into caffeine in general and usually get hot chocolate. Everything on their menu is pretty clutch, which is rare for a coffee place.

Recommend the chai, mocha tesora, and I've heard good things about the mint mojito iced coffee.

Expected bill: $3
author: Tushar K.

description:
No need to say anything more about the coffee - absolutely delicious.

However I would like to drop a remark about the folks working here. 
With everybody I have interacted here on several occasions, I had a wonderful experience. They really try to get you the best bang for your buck and make sure you will enjoy your pricey cup of coffee!
author: Sonja S.

description:
LOVE THE COFFEE, HATE THE SYSTEM!!!  85% of the time, people look confused and are unable to determine where to order, when/where to pay, and where to stand!  I usually hear "where's the line?" "Are you in line?" I mean the signs are loud and clear but the ordering line and the waiting line are in the same small space and it seems really inefficient.  My co-worker said to me the other day "I don't even want to go in there because it looks so confusing."  

The coffee is great and the bagels are a nice addition, but the set-up is all wrong.  I think the people should pay, the order handed over to the coffee makers, and then the coffee makers call out the orders once its ready.  It would probably increase the revenue because it will get people in and out so quickly.  Hope your reading this Mr. Phil...
author: Duchess G.

description: Slow.  Lots of choices but I am not sure how to make a decision and not just a guess. Said i liked French Roast so asked what to get and she suggested a Tesoro.  Meh.
author: George S.

description: Great coffee as every other Philz, warm and down-to-earth staff, but one star off for the ambience... something about the counters being too high and making me feel small and the separation of the seating area from the coffee
author: Amy M.

description:
Wow. I thought I knew what good coffee tasted like, but Philz opened up vast new vistas of coffee nirvana. I'm not sure how I'll ever settle for Peet's; nevermind *bucks ever again.

If you're the sort who thinks coffee should have flavoring and whipped cream on top, you'll be lost at Philz. But if you're looking for hot, strong, black and amazing rich and flavorful, look no further.
author: Richard P.

description: I wish we had Philz Coffee in Chicago.  They have the best coffee(S) that I've ever had.  They are right when they say, "one cup at a time."  They truly DO brew one coffee at a time.  And they have so many roasts its ridiculous.  On vacation, my friend and I visited this place several times just to try as many roasts as we could.  I love the dark roasts, but the light roasts are good as well.  The employees are really nice too, and if you have any questions they are more than happy to talk to you about their coffee.  I recommend trying the coffee without a ton of sugar, just so you can taste the roast, its something to behold....
author: Kevin W.

description: My 1st time here.....now I know what all the hype is about....I like how it's split. You order one one side and then enter the other side to sip and chill or get your study on. The coffee's good I needa figure out what my friend ordered. YUM!
author: Diane L.

description: Excellent coffee. Was pretty overwhelmed by the choices and took awhile to order but the baristas and other customers were patient and kind. Finally decided on the Tesora blend and bf got the Turkish. We were very satisfied with the coffees, very smooth and delicious. I'd love to go back and try a bunch of different blends. It would probably take awhile to find my favorite. Good coffee Yum
author: Brandi H.

description: Philz does not fail to disappoint. As much as I love the mint mojito, mocha tesora, and Turkish (ABSOLUTELY FAV--who can say no to cardamom and mint?), I've finally ventured out to explore others. It takes me a while to go through them, because I get hooked, but dancing water, anesthesia, and the arabic are just as awesome! Can't wait for the new location in PA to open!!!
author: mar m.

description:
I went here while on vacation off the recommendation of a local and was like really...you're sending me to the TL....for a cup of coffee?  Skeptical would certainly cover it, but through the TL and into Philz I went.

I ordered an iced coffee and when the woman asked me if I wanted cream and sugar in I panicked a little that I would not be able to add it in myself.  Having someone else add sugar and creamer to your coffee is kind of like going to a new hair dresser--you say you only want a little of the ends but you're neeeever quite sure what that means to someone else.  Well, Philz can be my new hair dresser any day.  My iced coffee was delicious and I'd go back any time.  Definitely stop by and let them make you a cup, or 5!
author: Samantha S.

description:
What do they put in this stuff? Its like liquid magic! Seriously people, best coffee and tea in the city. The coffees are really good in the morning but I've switched over to the Mint Black Iced Tea (medium sweet) in the afternoon because the coffee will keep me up all night. Its super refreshing and just enough of a kick to help me plow through the remainder of my work day.

I love you Philz coffee...I will never cheat on you with mediocre coffee chains that shall remain nameless.
author: Kimberly B.

description: Went to Philz during my lunch break and was craving their Mint Mojito...yeah, I know, I shouldn't be drinking on the job, but I couldn't resist this treat, since my first try of this drink was such a hit!.  However, on my second try of this iced drink from a DIFFERENT location, it was a dud.  I noticed that they skimped on the mint, the essence of the drink!   The drink maintained it's coffee flavor, but there wasn't much of the mint infused in it...it was more watery than anything else.  Philz you let me down this time. *SIGH*
author: Lisa W.

description:
Talk about awesome, friendly service!  Not only does this place have great coffee, but their staff is patient, helpful, and super cool.

Philz coffee is worth the $$ if you want a good cup of joe but I don't think I would be able to swing it on a daily basis.
author: Yeelo N.

description:
Very friendly baristas.
Good coffee. They will customize it for you and will remember your order if they see more then 2-x  :)
My favorite is "Sooooo Good" with cardamon.
author: BO P.

description:
There are two robots working at my service; making my drink however my heart desires. Hehehe...

But yeah, I've joined the Philz Coffee hype. How could you not? It's too amazing for me (and my taste buds!) MINT MOJITO ICED COFFEE FTW!! Though, the only thing that bothered me was that I kept eating the mint leaves... but who could complain when they're not using mint flavored syrup but the real thing? Yeah, that's what I thought. Btw, it didn't tickle my taste buds at first, but the guy was more than willing to make my drink a tad bit sweeter. I drunk the coffee to the last drop. Though pretty expensive for my standards, it's worth every penny.
author: Lindsey M.

description: All I can say about this place is whoa and where has this been all of my life.  Probably one of the best espressos I have ever had.  This place really did live up to what everyone I talked to was hyping it up to be.
author: Francisco R.

description: Long overdue review: Philz on Van Ness is the best! Not only is the coffee fantastic (literally my favorite coffee in the city, hands down), but the people working here rock. The afternoon crew, especially Kris, Stephanie, Brian and John, are probably the friendliest baristas on the planet, they can always brighten my day :)
author: Danielle B.

description:
Move over Starbucks and welcome Philz coffee!!!!  I was introduced to Philz through a friend of mine and I'm glad she told me about it.  

I've been to the Van Ness Avenue and the 24th street location.  Both places have great customer service and coffee.  This is not your average Starbucks type of coffee shop, so don't think you'll get a frappucino style type of drink here.  

Great coffee and I will be back for more :-)
author: Shana W.

description:
Never had a more delicious cup.

Try the Tantalizing Turkish if you like a good strong coffee with hints of cardamom.    

I want to try the others but I love the turkish so much that it's hard to break the habit.
author: Sanjiv P.

description:
Heavenly, just heavenly! If I'm a little bit more emotional, I would totally tear up after the first taste of Philz Coffee.
Aside from the coffee (personal fave- Philtered Soul), the staff is just scarily friendly, sincere and knowledgeable. Promise me you would give it a try and fall in love with Philz like I did!
author: Candy C.

description: A bit expensive!  However, the cold coffee is worth the money! You would realize that you PAY FOR QUALITY with each sip.
author: Tanya W.

description:
my favorite coffee place in the city. love, love, LOVE their ecstatic iced coffee (although for the life of me i can never remember the adjective...is it dynamic? fantabulous? awesometacular? why yes, all of the above!)

this is a must-stop for me and for bf whenever he's visiting for the weekend. in fact, i was so addicted for a while that on my way back from the airport, i would have my cab make a stop at a Philz (usually in the Mission) for my iced coffee fix, even at night when i knew i would be paying for the caffeine kick later. but hey, it's totally worth it. 

i'm sure i'll eventually review all the Philz locations, starting with the one that popped my coffee cherry (Castro), but for now i will give this one 5 stars. all are extremely consistent, with knowledgeable and super friendly baristas who are willing to go the extra mile to make your coffee JUST how you like it. no goldilocks dilemma here!
author: Suana W.

description: Decent coffee but their side of snotty attitude really makes it an unpleasant experience. I told the guy I wanted an iced coffee, apparently he didn't hear me say that I wanted it iced and he got snippy with me. What's even ruder was as I stood there he made all sorts of underhanded comments to his coworker about how I didn't ask for it iced in the first place. So passive aggressive!
author: Sharon L.

description: I have quickly become addicted to Philz coffee.  Anytime I'm on Van Ness, I'll pretty much dash out of my way for this tasty urban treat.   So far I have tried the Mint Mojito, Turkish, and Iced Gingersnap.  The iced gingersnap really does it for me - not too sweet and full of ginger flavor.  The mint mojito was good, but pretty sweet, so I'll be sticking with the Gingersnap.  Goodbye Starbucks and seasonal Gingerbread lattes.  You have been replaced with Philz year round deliciousness!  Their bagel was also quality - I would eat that again.  But I'm definitely coming back because of the Coffee.
author: Julie I.

description: nice place though I wonder how it would operate if there was a rush.  Service seemed kind of slow and relaxed which was nice because there was no one in line.  Great creative drinks
author: Christine K.

description:
Worth a special stop.  As a coffee lover and frequenter of Caribou, Starbucks and Peets, this place is special.  Has a more subversive vibe, with great coffee.  If you are under 40, no worries.  If you are over 40, the coffee may blow you away -- like Pepperoni pizza after 40.  So be sure they cut it with cream or soy if you are older. 

But this is a special place with very original coffees.  You think the coffee shop could not be reinvented; this is a bona fide re-invention.  Very different than Starbucks, and very good.
author: Mark G.

description: Went here on a recommendation from a friend. Bad wifi, bad seats to sit on. The mojito coffee was good, and the only saving grace. I intended to work here but the disconnecting wifi made us leave and the chairs gave me a backache! Avoid if you want to sit and work!
author: Abhay S.

description: Ordered the mint mojito iced coffee. Very nice. I was a little confused on how to order because your order on one side and then pay on the other side. The staff was friendly though. I like how pastries are cheap after 5.  The room where you sit, was about 1/4 full at 5:30 pm on a Wednesday. But it was strange no background music was playing on the side where you sit. I got used to it after a while though. I am surprised there aren't bums camping out in there. Check this place out if you want an alternative to SBUX.
author: K S.

description:
My favorite coffee in S.F.  It's a treat to enjoy a perfect cup of coffee with a touch of sweet cream.  I'd recommend the "Canopy of Heaven" if you don't already have a favorite bean picked out.
The store decor is simple and not terribly inspiring, but it's far more cohesive than the Mission location, which could use a new look. All the employees are very knowledgeable and super friendly.  By far the best service of any of the coffee shops I've been to in S.F. The barristas always ask you to try the coffee to make sure that you love it, and they're always ready to tweak or re-make your coffee if it's not perfect.
My favorite Philz location thus far.
author: christopher w.

description:
The king of coffees! Their coffee isn't just tasty, it changes your entire outlook on life for several hours after! And yes, it really is just coffee, but it tastes very similar to espresso based drinks.

I would actually prefer Philz over Blue Bottle now. If I'm in the mood for an espresso drink, BB is the way to go, but I'll go for a Mocha Tesora over a Soy Latte at BB any day.
author: Matt W.

description:
Did you know this place has a secret menu? Neither did I. I'm here today because of a meeting in the city, but usually I come here on Sundays after watching football. I'm almost done with Sunday football for the year, so I need to enjoy this at every opportunity.

What I've been doing is working my way down the list of coffees, ordering them in order, until I've had them all. I've suggested a punch card program to encourage people to do this, with the hopes that I can earn a free mug. I hope to be grandfathered in.

But what about the coffee?  The coffee is delicious: there's a coffee for everyone. There's wifi here and good seating and power strips!  What a concept: power for everyone!  I really like Philz.
author: Gordon E.

description: Worst service I have ever received. In particular from a girl named Aidene. Every time she makes my drink in fast pace it tastes horrible. She doesn't take my order seriously nor correctly. Her customer service skills are non existent. This location for philz coffee doesn't believe in the slogan that they have plastered on their walls and sign: quote "one cup at a time". The manager and the owner including Aidene believe that rushing through orders and giving customers attitude is the right way to run a business. If I wanted a cup of coffee that is cheaply made I would go to seven 11. I love philz coffee however in other locations then this one. The environment is dirty the attitude is rude and the quality of drinks is pure trash. Don't go to this location!!!
author: Alex D.

description: My weekend coffee treat. Ask for a mint leaf with your coffee. Mocha Tesora very rich and chocolate-y - ask for less chocolate. Jacob dark roast coffee tasted normal. Canopy of Heavy is light and reasonable. A little on the pricy end but definitely worth the money.
author: Jenny Z.

description:
Freshly brewed coffee!

The mint mojito is bomb!!
author: Tim N.

description: My favorite thing at Philz is their drink that has no coffee or caffeine.  Try the iced mint tea (with no green tea in it).  This herbal concoction is made with fresh mint leaves, cardamom, and some other herbs in it.  It's so refreshing and delicious. Yum!!!  I also love the variety of funky Philz locations (they all seem very different architecturally, at least in SF and Berkeley), all with free WIFI.
author: Jason L.

description: Oh I come here and get a cup of coffee and I really like. I not know how they stay around when coffee take so long to make and people in rush all time.
author: Elizaveta C.

description: Need I say? Purchase the minto mojito. It's a philz classic. It's one of the only coffees, other than the coffee I get back at Berkeley (FSM branch coffee stores), that effectively wake me up. I enjoyed the mocha, but I usually only get a mojito. For a chain store, the best wifi at a coffee shop I've had (Starbucks's is super crappy) and I like the accessibility of seats depending on the time of day you go.
author: Emmanuel C.

description: Ordered the Tesora today while waiting for a table at Brenda's. This Philz is conveniently located just around the block from Brenda's, and they have a cool lounge area where customers can do their studying or just chitchat while enjoying their cup of brew.
author: Julia K.

description:
Being from Seattle I thought I knew about good coffee--Philz completely matrixed my coffee world! 
    I sat for over an hour on a stormy Sunday and watched the stream of people come through to get their cup of liquid ecstasy! 
    I tried the tantalizing turkish and had the iced coffee at the Mission location a few days prior. My niece and myself splurged the next day on 2 small cups of the Jamaican Blue Mtn. in honor of her Mom's love for coffee!
    The barista's are coffee geeks ( a good thing) and their attention to detail is unmatched at any coffee house i have frequented, always making sure you have the perfect amount of cream, sugar or honey. 
     I will be using their mail order service as soon as my 1 Lb is gone, which won't be long!
author: Mike P.

description: This is the BEST place to get coffee. Everyting is good, EVERYTHING! It's not your standard coffee but try it the first time and you'll be hooked, I want to travel back to SF from Seattle just for the experience. if they were located in Seattle I would be broke from ordering coffee three times a day.
author: Amanda H.

description:
Philz may beat out my beloved SF coffee treat, Blue Bottle.  The mocha tesora was so rich and delish!  

I was a little confused on where to order.  I went straight to the (unfriendly) cashier and after watching a few others I realized I needed to go to the baristas first THEN the cashier.    

The barista was very friendly and apologetic about the wait (aka my mistake).  I will come back fo sho and get the ordering right.

It's a bit cheaper than BB too!
author: Emily W.

description:
Philz Coffee is DELICIOUS! Jenny K. brought me here one and raved about their coffee. I think its awesome that each and every cup of coffee that is made is made when ordered and that includes grinding the coffee beans AFTER you order! Something that was different for me was the fact that the barista adds sugar and cream to your coffee for you! I was only worried that they would not have added enough.

Anyway, I ordered the Mocha Tesora and the barista asked if it was my first time. I told him it was and that I can't drink black coffee that mochas are typically what I go for. While he was making it, he asked if I wanted some extra sugar in it. I wasn't sure but he assured me that I would probably want more sugar so I trusted him. He finishes making my mocha and its time for me to try it. 

I sip it and think "wow! I didn't just burn my tongue!" The temperature was JUST RIGHT. Not too hot, not too cold. Perfect to start drinking immediately. After a second sip, I noticed an after taste that was distinct and different from other coffee I've had.... and I fell in love. This has got to be one of the best mochas I've ever had! 

I also realized I've been walking by the one located by AT&T park for the entire last season the Giants were playing!! OMG!!! Well, now I have something else to look forward to in the future! Giants game AND philz coffee! AWESOME!
author: Eugenia G.

description: Damn you, Phil! You've ruined me for all other coffees, and I don't live in San Francisco!  And your staff is knowledgeable and delightful. How dare you.
author: John E.

description: I have only been once, but since then I have craved it. I had something with the word "alarm" in it? It was delicious. Supposedly is the most caffeinated of all the drinks..but mind of matter and you'll be fine. I can't wait to go back to try something new!
author: Bree G.

description:
DISGUSTING!!!  is the word to describe all other coffees I have tried prior to happening upon Philz Coffee.  

I attempted to order a latte but was informed that they did things differently here.  Always willing to try new things I let the barista chose something for me (Jacobs blend I think),  something dark is what I was looking for.  I of course accepted the cream and sugar that was offered and took my first sip.

I can honestly say that it was the best cup of coffee I have ever tasted.  It reminded me why I drink coffee to begin with, the taste.  There was a nice foam on top with no bitter, acidic or burnt taste that plagues so many coffee shops.  I am usually one to order lattes, mostly because regular coffee is not that good, just better than nothing. For too long I have been ordering something caffeinated and hot that resembles coffee to start my day.  This is a completely different product.  This is what coffee is supposed to taste like.  Although it seems a bit pricey, your next cup of coffee should be from Philz.

p.s.

I have been using a French press for some time now but today decided to use a makeshift method of brewing, resembling Philz' method.  Using a metal tea strainer and a coffee filter with freshly ground coffee I poured the boiling water over the grounds.  The resulting cup of coffee was very good, much better than the regular French press method, and similar to Philz.  With the right type of cream and sugar I think this is a very acceptable substitution.
author: Ben D.

description:
This was my first trip to Philz and -- since it was in the evening -- I was sadly resigned to getting a decaf cup o' Joe.  Unsurprisingly, there weren't nearly as many decaf as regular choices, but that's okay -- the vast array of other choices were a bit overwhelming anyway.

I requested a Swiss Water Peru Whatever large decaf with just a touch of sugar and cream and...

HOLY MOTHER O' JAVA... that was an awesome cup of coffee!

This was also the first Philz time of one of my buddies with me, and he, too, loved his coffee.

What made me so happy with this coffee was that it was simultaneously strong 'n' flavorful without being harsh or bitter.  Totally smooth.  This is drinking coffee because you love the taste, not because you need a jolt (though I understand Philz regular coffee offers quite a fine jolt :p).

You know what else made me happy?  The barista was genuinely friendly.  Not fake-friendly, not sales-friendly... seemingly just a hell of a nice guy.  And the somewhat-scarily-tattoo'd woman at the counter... a bit quieter, but also quite pleasant.

So why not five stars?  Well, this is a pretty tiny place in a not-so-picturesque spot.  The sort of place you get your coffee to go and -- having been to some amazingly-ambiance'd cafes in my life -- that's a mild bummer.  Also, as others have noted, this is some pricey coffee; I don't think I'd be up for buying a cup every morning.

Still, though, I am now tempted to make a special journey tomorrow morning to the Philz nearest me (in Palo Alto) just for a happy jolt to the day.

Now if only Philz was a more full-service, full-menu sit-down cafe where I could hang with friends on lazy Sunday near a park... amazing coffee, tasty food, friendly service... wow, now THAT would be awesome!  But I digress.
author: Adam L.

description:
i'm a brat... i'm not just a fan of any Philz coffee... i'm a fan of Philz Coffee on van ness... and ONLY when Thomas is working... because he makes my Tesora just perfect!! PERFECT! 

Philz coffee is awesome... and my favorite is the Tesora... and ultimate favorite is Tesora made by Thomas... it's so smooth and sweetened just perfect!! 

Thomas only works in the mornings... so your lucky if you work in the area and can get a cup of his creation!
author: Kelly H.

description: Great little coffee shop. Highest quality service and the best ingredients. If its cold, try the Mocha Tesoro, you won't be disappointed. And if it's cold the Mint Mojito Iced Coffee is fantastic. I hear their bagels are delicious as well!
author: Sam O.

description: The coffee here is great. I am also beginning to think the main ingredient in their coffee is crack because it's ADDICTING! It's really JUST coffee, so if you're looking for one of those hotsy totsy drinks, philz isn't the place. It is honest to goodness coffee. The BEST. It'd say the atmosphere is friendly, service is good, the cookies and coffee can't be beat, but it kind of clashes with the ambiance. It's not always so comfortable to sit and have a cup with all of the people there...it kind of clashes with what the business seems that it should be. SO if you don't want to be gypped out of coffee that is actually good *coughcoughstarbucks* go here, you get what you pay for! And get the sooo goood!
author: Desiree B.

description:
This place serves the best coffee I've ever had in my life. I never knew that coffee could have such subtle flavors and varieties while packing a huge punch.  The staff are very friendly and remember their customers by name and even the type of coffee they like. I wish there was more for food but I still got to give them 5 stars. You'll never look at a cup of coffee the same way.

Coffee is 3-4 dollars a cup but its made with a heaping scoop of beans to order. Better than any latte or espresso drink you might have.
author: Jonathan W.

description:
Wow!!! Now that is coffee! I can't ever go back to a regular cup of coffee. I started out drinking the Greater Alarm and now go back and forth between Canopy of Heaven, So Good, and New Manhattan. Love them all! 
The employees at the 18th St. location are the nicest people ever. Don't worry if it is your first time and overwhelming when you first walk in the door. The staff will help you W/a smile. Paolo walked me through my first order and it's been a great experience ever since. I drive there everyday for a cup of Philz!!
author: Lynnet S.

description: I drink a lot of coffee, therefore, I appreciate a good cup of coffee, & philz coffee is by far, thee best, ever. EVERYBODY should try this place out, even if your not a coffee person, you'll find a reason to fall in love with Philz coffee. two words. LOVE IT
author: KEN S.

description: I love this place!! I take my aromatic Arabic large with just a splash of cream. I love their pumpkin drop cookies and yes I even splurge on a Feta-stick bagel which has feta cheese and hard-boiled egg. It can get pricey if I do it 5 days a week but what the heck, good is good but this place is da bomb.
author: Mira L.

description:
I recently took a trip to SF and stayed with a friend.  She's not a coffee drinker, but I am an avid coffee drinker so I knew I would have to procure coffee by myself.  I used to live in SF, so I knew that I could go to Peet's down the block from her.  However, lo and behold, there was a new coffee shop that was much closer!

I stopped by and it happened to be their first day open.  It was quiet so I was able to chat with the owner Phil for a while.  I was surprised to learn that they had several coffee shops and they were rated best coffee for 5 years in a row in SF.  How is it that I did not know about this coffee?

Since it was slow, I got to taste several different blends.  I love the unique way that they make their coffee.  They grind the beans then put it in a coffee filter hanging over a carafe and pour the hot water onto the coffee.  What comes out on the other side into the carafe is pure coffee heaven!

The drinks are based on light,medium, or dark roasts and there are descriptions of what it tastes like (kind of like wine descriptions, but for coffee).  I tried several medium and dark roasts and really liked their coffee.

I visited the cafe every day and progressed to the turkish delight, a very strong brew that was delicious!  I fell in love with the coffee (and a little bit with the personable owner) and on my return to Philadelphia, I took 2lbs of beans with me.  I will have to have them ship beans to me when I'm out.

I've tried Blue Bottle and Ritual and thought they were OK, I LOVE philz!
author: Jean C.

description: Really San Francisco?!?? This is your favorite coffee? It tastes like *nothing* - and I got the dark roast, I can't imagine how flavorless the light roast must be. This is the absolute worst coffee I've ever had at a coffee shop. It reminds me of the crap that you get at diners... Didn't take more than two sips and threw it out. Not worth drinking!
author: Tim S.

description:
The easiest rating I've had to do. The barristas are extremely knowledgeable and have a useful way of providing recommendations. After a brief foray into the spectrum of roasts: "tell me something you like about coffee".  My response: "I like strong coffee, not necessarily packed with caffeine."   I ended up picking Jacob's Wonderbar Brew, which is bold with a hint of chocolate (in the bean and roast -- NOT added to the coffee).  

Free wireless, nice clean bathrooms, and comfortable lounging atmosphere to boot. 

Take advantage of the knowledgeable barristas --  I recommend you get a recommendation.
author: Sierra M.

description: Turkish coffee was amazing!  This place is so unique and interesting.  Bagel was good too.  Wish I lived in San Francisco just so I could visit this place all the time.
author: Sarah T.

description: The Turkish coffee has a wonderfully unique flavor & the peppermint tea come with whole mint leaves inside. Awesome!
author: Sarah D.

description: I'm SO UPSET that I've hit the bottom of the cup already. I want more Philz!
author: Sarah Z.

description:
I frequent the 18th St. location, but my first visit to this one was the best yet. Phil was drinking coffee with another man at a table, but got up to personally make me a cup. Taking his recommendation, I had the most amazing cup of coffee. I know it was part "New Manhattan" roast, but the rest was left to magic. 

If you love coffee, you will love Philz.

Atmosphere: Quaint, but comfortable seating, long windows for people watching. Local artwork on the walls, likable staff.

Cost: $3.00

Order: Phil's recommendation

Try: A different coffee on each visit, New Manhattan is wonderful though.

Skip: All other coffee shops. Just go to Philz.
author: Taylor S.

description: This is definitely one of my favorite coffee brewers in the city. I would have given 5 stars but parking can be a hassle at times around there. I usually go the philz on Folsom as its easier to find parking. Favorite thing to order here: Iced Mint Mojito with a philz bagel(bagel, olive oil, cucumber, tomato, salt & pepper, and of course, cream cheese)
author: Rich L.

description: Loved their mint mojito iced coffee, the friendly server who made it, and the hang out room next door that you can enjoy your coffee in. yay, i'm a fan!
author: Janet Z.

description:
Friendly and knowledgeable staff. Delicious iced coffee mojito. Mmmminty! 

Seems like their secret is more about the cream and sugar than the coffee itself, but I may be ignorant to the truth. 

My favorite part about Philz is that it is right next to.... Kaleidoscope Free Speech Zone where I do The SEWing Show the second Tuesday of every month at 8pm! 

Oh, and they have great donuts!
author: Candace Y.

description: I am not a big fan of coffee, but their coffees were pretty good. I will definitely try other flavors next time.
author: Nori K.

description:
My first experience with Philz was at this location.  I am told that this one of the newer locales in the City.  More importantly "itz the best".

For consistancy, service and location there is no other Philz that can even come close.  As Saturday morning regulars we look forward to seeing the same baristas (reads: Austin) each week.  They are friendly, helpful and funny.  Most importantly they know their product.

The other Philz locations are great, don't get me wrong.  I have been to all of the stores in the City multiple times since first finding this addiction to the "one cup at a time" philosophy.  Civic Center Philz will always be #1!
author: Karsten R.

description: I've had the ecstatic and the mocha tesora, both of which tasted great and gave me the caffeine boost I needed.
author: Mike L.

description:
All I gotta say is:

MINT MOJITO ICED COFFEE


Soooo good! I have to say that it is the best coffee I have ever had! I wish I lived closer to a Philz coffee so I can get it everyday! It would have gotten 5 stars if the staff wasn't so bland.  No smiles =(
author: Mel G.

description: Tried this place for the first time.... ordered a mocha, Surprise !!!!! they only have coffee. The gal recommended phils mocha special which is coffee milk and chocolate. Now I make sure I get it every afternoon before I go home.
author: Sue K.

description: One of the best local coffee shops I'd been in in the States. They blend their own coffee from all over the world and I love the fact their menu is eclectic. Their mint mojito iced coffee is refreshing and a must try, muddles with fresh mint. mmmmmm.....
author: flygirl f.

description:
My gf and I were in town visiting some friends and decided to stop by for a cup of coffee at Philz based on a friend's recommendation. At the expense of a fight between my gf and I, we drove 30 minutes out of the way to stop by here. Philz did not let me down!

I ordered the Turkish Coffee and was surprised that they actually grind the beans for each cup. With the hint of the mint leaves and the steamed milk, it was the most balanced and savory cup of coffee I've had in awhile. 

If you're here on the go, don't expect any fast-food service. The lines are usually long and people go there to enjoy the coffee rather than get the caffeine buzz.
author: Fotis M.

description:
This was my first time having a Philz coffee.  It has been highly recommended by friends, and I must say I was absolutely satisfied with the cup of  Julie's Ultimate that I ordered.

The staff at this location was another story.  The one guy was fine, but the guy with the beard and sock hat was a bit of a douche.  He tended to talk down to customers, somehow implying that their sensibilities must be inferior.

I ordered with guy one.  I moved over a bit, and was starting to look at what their pastry offerings were.  Guy 2, the one I didn't care for, asked if I needed help.  I told him his friend helped us, but I think I am going to order something from the case.  He proceeds to tell me that they are all about the coffee, and the items in the case come second.  Great, well my coffee is ordered, now I am ready for something from the case.  Crappy guy says, ....we like to focus on the coffee.  Great.  He stands there doing nothing for 2 more minutes, and then asks me if he can get me something from the case.  Uhggg.  

He seemed to act this way to most patrons.  Most of what he said was right, but his delivery of information and personality were down poor.  

Oh, and Mr. Superior guy, ....I know that paper goes in compost, but the lids go in recycling.  I wasn't born yesterday.

Maybe I am just venting.

....oh, I have been by their store in the Mission, but not into it.  It looks interesting from the outside.  But, ...the place on Van Ness is in serious need of an interior makeover.  It was fairly generic feeling.
author: Travis S.

description: Super good coffee...not so great service (maybe because they were so busy) I need to go back and see if it's different. The flavor of their coffee and mocha's is MAARVELOUS, DAAALING!!! Just wish it was hot instead of lukewarm. Will be there this weekend when I'm back in the area checking out the service and asking for it made hot : )
author: L Z.

description:
Easy the best coffee place I've ever tried, and I have tried many, many coffee places around the country. I have even been to those pretentious, "we have beans from 40 different countries infused with whatever-you-call it", and Philz is not this experience at all. I don't even know how they do it, but they transform a complex coffee transaction into an enjoyable, adventurous occasion. 

The first time I visited Philz, I was a little overwhelmed by the many choices and just kept thinking, "Why can't they just give me a mocha and leave me alone? It's too early for this!" The friendly employee started asking me all these questions, guiding me through the process, and within a minute or two I had a fresh, individually-brewed, personalized cup of coffee that met my personality and caffeine needs perfectly. 

Their service and attention to detail is impeccable, and my only regret is that now I'm hooked and there is no Philz for 2,500 miles from me!
author: Orli M.

description: This Philz rocks. Faster service, less hipsters and none of the 'Friends' ambiance of the 18th st location. A new larger seating area just opened across the foyer where the previous sales office was. I'm a true believer in Philz now.
author: Zac H.

description: So good! The Silken Splendor is the smoothest coffee I've ever had.
author: Amy M.

description:
I used to be a Starbucks-er. That was before Philz. My boyfriend took me here and my life changed. 

Seriously this coffee is amazing.

Everyone who works here is awesome. 

There's not a lot of room to sit around but it doesn't matter, the coffee is so good (and always made perfectly) so it gets 5 stars.

Also -  I was at the Philz in the Castro yesterday and overheard a guy telling someone he came all the way from the East Bay JUST to get Philz....and I totally get it.
author: Alyssa P.

description:
My review only for the "mint iced tea" --

IT WAS SO REFRESHING AFTER I TOLD THE BARISTA I WANTED IT SWEETENED. 

He asked me if I wanted it "semi sweet, really sweet, or moderately sweet". I said I only wanted it "a tad sweet". He scooped 1 spoonful of brown sugar with some hot water and then mixed the drink for me.

It was just right to my expectations. I got a second cup of my $2.50 small drink because he was not able to 'top it off'.  So I literally got a second cup for free!

One 3 person leather brown couch (not the gross kind), three to four small tables. 

Not sure how many power outlets though. 

There is no milk, sugar, hazenut, cinnamon dispensers for you. You need to ask the barista for these condiments. 

Parking - street only.
author: Jboogie L.

description: I want to write this update to let everyone know how awesome Philz customer service is. I had a terrible experience with their hot chocolate a month ago and I wrote a negative yelp review (but it only applied to the hot chocolate). Someone from the Philz headquarters contacted me and offered me a free gift card to make up for the experience. I was delighted and happy to know that there are still honest companies out there. I am glad it changed my mind to go back to Philz because their coffee is really really good. I am a huge fan now!
author: Eva L.

description:
My visit to Philz Coffee was remarkably splendid. The service was superb and my coffee delight was fantastic.  The amount of quality that went into every aspect of my experience at Philz really impressed me.  My barista took the time to nail down exactly what sort of drink i wanted and continually offered to change it until he "got it right." I was floored!! To top it off, the coffee was some of the best i have had away from my own home. The drink was very well made and impressive despite being sort of simple. Trust me, if you drink enough coffee you can really tell when a barista knows how to pull a shot and when a barista does not....


Stellar all around. Will visit each time i go to the city. Would really like a Philz to open up here in Santa Cruz.
author: Bella T.

description:
Philz, your coffee is the bomb, but I will never visit your establishment again. The guy working in your Van Ness location is a DICK. Nobody has ever been that rude to me for absolutely no reason, and my standards for customer service are not high.

I know I'm talking about one bad apple here, but it was enough to turn me off of the tree for good. I sure will miss those mint iced coffees.
author: Shira Z.

description:
MUST HAVE JACOB'S WONDERBAR W/ MINT SPRIG!!! AAAAHHH!!!

I walk a mile and a half out of my way to get this fix.  I literally have dreams about this coffee.  The staff is soooooooo friggin friendly and helpful, they just put you at ease and make you want to have them in your life forever. 

I am a coffee freak and I fly for a living.  I have had coffee all over the country and world, and I reeeeeally don't think I've had a better cup of coffee...i don't know what they do...
author: Patrique R.

description: Over rated now. High price for a single serve coffee and there's always a line. Can't just come here to get my coffee and out. No I have to stand in line with the rest of the people in San Francisco, or at least that's what it seems like. I don't like how they serve iced coffee in a hot cup. What's up with that? You would think that they're profiting enough to buy one of those Eco-friendly plastic cup. I don't get it. Or maybe they think it's cool to be different. As for their coffee,yes we all know its good. But they don't serve latte or machiato or cappucino. Not too much diversity here.
author: J C.

description: Philz is the best! They have a lot of blends to choose from. Whenever I go I describe to the attendant what taste I'm looking for and she/he does the rest. I love the freshness, the taste and the piece of mint that's placed, upon my request, in my cup. The staff members are super friendly people who don't just serve you coffee; they  invite you into a rich and satisfying experience. After each cup is served they ask you to taste it to ensure you like what you've been served. I wish Philz had a branch on my block.
author: Michael J.

description:
Fan-freaking-tastic.  I'll start with the bad - it's expensive - but that's the only negative.  Philz has an extensive (and daunting) list of beans.  I was feeling overwhelmed by the menu (thinking that each of the beans/blends listed was some specialty drink that I'd never heard of) but there was no reason to feel that way.  The very kind barrista asked me about my coffee preferences - light roast, medium, dark, etc preferred sweetness, etc.  I was then set up with a custom brewed  heavenly cup of New Manhattan with light sugar and cream.  (Tastes like warm coffee ice cream). I was so pleased I nearly floated out of the shop.   The caffeine content should also be noted.  I usually want somewhere between 2-3 cups of coffee a day.  I'm feeling very nicely buzzed off of the one cup, so at least that will save me some money.

The shop appears immaculate and it is a very welcome addition to this neighborhood.
author: She-Ra ..

description: Was here January 2011. My decaf mint tea was the best I have ever had. I suspect they use fresh mint or have a good dry mint supplier. I was told that it was a sage based mint tea and I could smell the muskiness of the sage which didn't smell so different from the whiffs of pot I smelled while walking through San Francisco streets. Someone in my party who ordered the Chai latte said it was the best she had ever had. Yummy vegan cookies. I heard from my husband that the horchata cupcake was delicious.
author: J S.

description:
I like this Philz a lot. So much so that I'll walk right by five coffee places to go here on the weekend. It's clean, the staff is great (if occasionally forgetful), and I can't pass up  a (large) Wonderbar (or Julie's or even Tesora) with light cream, no sugar.

And the iced mint mojito does, in fact, show up every other sweetened iced coffee you've ever had. My only gripe with Philz is that it's both pricier and further away than all my other options.
author: Allie H.

description: Great breakfast:  Tantalizing Turkish coffee & Mediterranean bagel.  Friendly (non-snobbish) barristas, and a seperate room for dining, since the place where you order the coffee is a little cramped.
author: Harry F.

description: It's like a BIlly Joel dilemma every time.  Do I dare have a back street fling with Philz coffee?  Or stay faithful to my uptown girl, Blue Bottle roots?   Decisions, decisions, decisions.  Then again, who can resist a lil' bit of cream and sugar luvin' from the wrong end of town.
author: Wendy L.

description: My favorite coffee house in the city. I love both the one on turk and van ness and the one in the mission. get coffee to-go and they'll put a mint leaf in the lid so it doesn't spill in the car. They have so many options which are well described on the menu. Every coffee is brewed to perfection and they add the cream and sugar for you, so be sure to tell them how you like it.
author: Kortni S.

description: Newest Philz fan. I was looking for a coffee joint other than Starbucks that was close to my place. I stumbled upon Philz while on Yelp, and I'm glad I did. I'm currently sitting at Philz drinking my second mint mojito iced coffee of the day. I love it here! Very friendly staff and awesome coffee!
author: Julie R.

description:
Good Lord this is the best cup of coffee I have ever come across. unfortunately we did not make it here until we were leaving for the airport. I would have been there every morning if I had found it sooner.

The employees are very nice and seem like they really want you to have the best cup of coffee. If you don't know what kind of coffee you want, they will help you.

Next time I will be trying the mint mojito mocha- sounds interesting.
author: Melissa S.

description: Stumbled in here by accident craving a coffee. I guess I was clueless and tried to order a latte. The barista fortunately was not stuck up and explained to me how the cafe works and even recommended a coffee for me. Omg I'm coming back an trying one of every 17 coffees they have to offer! I'm so glad I found you!
author: Kristina S.

description:
After reading all of the amazing reviews of this place, I had to come try it out! 

When I walked in, I was definitely overwhelmed by the vast list of coffee options; if I were more of a coffee addict, I'm sure Philz personalized coffee going experience would be heavenlike. 

My barista was extremely friendly and greeted me with such a warm smile that I felt right at ease. I let him know that it was my first time to the shop, and he was quick to sympathize with me. He said that the list is definitely daunting but that he would be willing to try out different combinations until we got the right fit. How great is that? 

I ended up ordering their mint mojito iced coffee with cream and sugar, and it was really refreshing. I would definitely order it again! Even as I was dripping my drink along the floor to the register, my barista kindly told me not to worry because it happens all the time. :) Thanks for not making me feel clumsy!

Great customer service and awesome drinks!
author: Leslie T.

description: Mint Mojito Iced Mocha!!! I drank almost 2 large ones of these each day I was there!
author: E A.

description:
This place is awesome.  Never experienced a full service coffee bar before.  The add the milk, anyone you want, and sweetener for you.  Each cup is individually brewed and cooled to a drinkable temperature.  

Service is excellent, friendly.
author: Wayne L.

description: AMAZING COFFEE. While I was super intimidated by the menu at first glance, the barista helping me out was so sincere and patient with me! She asked me a lot of guiding questions to understand my coffee preference, and then suggested a few brews to choose from, and then proceeded to make me the freshest and most enjoyable cup I've had in a loooong time. I ended up ordering the Soooo Good brew, a light and sweet coffee that definitely made me smile upon first sip. Philz Coffee, most definitely a spot to hit up in the future!
author: Teresa C.

description:
First off, I am not a coffee snob i.e I don't whine about Starbucks. I have a functional relationship with coffee: it keeps me functioning through my typical uneventful day. 
That being said, I walked into Philz today and had an Aromatic Arabic coffee. You know how people use the word term "enjoy" instead of "drink" for coffee? I always thought that was a stupid and contrived thing to say. So when I say I enjoyed this coffee, I really mean it. It was dark, smooth, and I want some more. The only problem was the price. $3.25 for a large coffee? I don't think I'll make it a daily habit to buy coffee from this place, but yeah, good coffee dude.
author: Martin S.

description: Mint Mojito Iced Coffee. My drug of choice. DELISH as usual. Love the mintiness mixed with the nutty flavor of their coffee. While I do wish their coffee was a bit bolder, it's still pretty good.
author: Constance C.

description:
Philz is awesome with their great coffee, pastries, and service. They are really serious about brewing their coffee one cup at a time. When you order, they grind the beans, brew one cup, and ask how much cream and sugar you like in there.

The only problem with Philz is their price and the size of their coffee. A large is about the same size as a medium from Starbucks/Peets and double the price.  Their coffee is absolutely the best I've ever had, but it comes pricey.

I recommend either the Ether or the Jacob's blend. Both are excellent in terms of taste, texture, and finish.

I'm giving it five stars because of how good the coffee is, even though it's NOT cheap.
author: Loi L.

description: Mocha Tesora with milk. Go-To coffee for the rest of my life.
author: Gordon J.

description: I actually just got a bad cup of coffee here. I got the Phil-harmonic and it was luke warm and seriously tastes like regular corner store coffee. Not $4.00 strong fancy coffee. I gave this 2 stars because I have gotten good coffee at other Philz locations.
author: Lisa F.

description: I cannot say enough good things about Philz.  The one at 24th street has been a favorite for years, and stands out as one of the places in the neighborhood that attracts people from all walks of life.  The atmosphere is cozy and unpretentious, the service is great, and it's a wonderful place to have a conversation with a friend or stranger.  I don't even drink coffee all that much anymore but make a special trips here for their decaf, and the whole vibe, at least once a week.  If they can attract me consistently with decaf, then you know they know what they are doing.  I also really enjoy the benches outside for lounging and watching the world.  There are increasingly few places in the city where people simply sit and enjoy life and one another..  Philz is a wonderful example of one that is still going strong.
author: Dan S.

description: The first time I came in it was smiles and welcomes, felt real "San Francisco". My mojito was excellent. In fact, it had me coming in for more throughout the week. My Instagram friends can attest to how often I went in after. Then I discovered order ahead app and I order from this particular location almost 1 - 3 x per week; always ran in, always said thank you as I headed out the door to a resounding "you're welcome!" Or "no problem!" As of late (within the past week) hospitality and quality has gone down. My drinks haven't been sweet or creamy tasting. They don't say you're welcome after I say thank you or do I even get greeted as I once did. Maybe because I'm a "regular" now, they don't have to act like I'm important cause they know I'll come back... So what prompted this new review? My afternoon pick me up of what was supposed to be a yummy sweet creamy delicious mint mojito tasting watered down and, well, yuck. My husband, who picked up the drinks for me, said it wasn't even ready when he go there. My order was set to be done at 405. He got there at about 415. Now, I find I'm forcing myself to drink it because its $4, but I mean, why this sudden decline in quality?! I just had one from the 24th x douglass location on Sunday! Tasting exactly as it should. Pitty. Looks like I'm going to have to start waking up even earlier and going to the 24x Folsom location before work. Too bad they don't use order ahead... Sorry Van Ness team, I really was starting to love you.
author: Kelly Marie C.

description: Two words to describe "HELLA GOOD".  I luv their coffee. Be warned. Very addictive.
author: Willy L.

description: I give these guys due credit for consistently offering a perfected high caliber selection.  Although they aren't exactly sensitive....I hope they stay focused on customer experience because the markets huge and they are succeptible to turning off customers when customer service is neglected
author: Adam O.

description: Last night, I tried this place for the first time. I got a mocha snow storm.  Yeah! A nice change from Starbucks for once! It looks like they have a lot of other drinks I should try! Be back!
author: Randal M.

description:
WooHoo. The TL gets a philz! 

I had never been to a philz before and walked in a little confused. Both the Barista and the cashier were incredibly helpful in helping me decide and even offered to tweek my "istanbul treat" if it was too sweet or needed to be sweetened. It was perfect as is.
author: Sara K.

description: I never used to drink coffee.  At some point though I blacked out during my work travels back and forth between LA and SF.  When I came to, I was holding a latte, an iced coffee and a sandwich.  The sandwich has nothing to do with this story.  Anywho, I apparently love coffee now.  I recently discovered Philz, and upon my first visit decided to try the Ecstatic Iced Coffee.  Yes, I opted for it with Soy Milk.  I went back a week or so later, and then repeated that process a few times over.  If you couldn't tell, I am a fan now. Rest assured, I will be continuing my amazing adventures there.  Philz Coffee is greatness!
author: John R.

description: I didn't know what good coffee was until I had Philz. I never knew one cup of coffee had so many flavors, aroma, and subtleties.  I want to buy Philz coffee for all my friends and convert them! We grabbed Philz while waiting in to be called for Brenda's (brunch). Ah, Ambriosa Coffee of God...
author: Joyce L.

description: Overly helpful employees, an extensive and alluring menu, and the most radiant hipster aura make this joint a coffee snob's paradise. If you're a coffee lover, this place is absolutely essential on your "been-to" list. If you think coffee "is just coffee" and pretentious, prepare to be annoyed.
author: Eliot R.

description:
I give the coffee 4 stars and I give the employees here 1 star, therefore I give them a 2.

I've heard good things about Philz coffee so this review is strictly for the Van Ness location. The employees there are stuck-up and not very helpful. 

When my husband and I walked in (mind you, we have never been there before) we stayed near the door to let others order before us. The first thing the girl says at the register does is laugh at us and says, "come on in, don't be scared." Ummm, we're not. We're being considerate to other customers and letting them go in line while we figure out what we want. So my husband says, "we've actually never been here before, so what would you recommend?" The girl responds by shrugging her shoulders and pointing to the menu. Really????????? That's service? Wow. 

We ended up ordering something that we had seen pop up on several Yelp reviews. The barista asks us, "do you want it perfect?" So we ask, "what's perfect?" Again, he shrugs his shoulders and says, "uhhhhhh, perfect?!?!?!" Ok, seriously? What kind of service is that? If you expect to attract new customers and retain them, quit it with the attitude. 

I definitely won't be going back to this location. The one near the ballpark is much better.
author: Linda I.

description:
I love Philz Coffee!   Coffee is made one cup at a time and you let them know how cream or no cream and level of sweetness.  

Granted level of sweetness (sweet, medium sweet..whatever you want to call it) is kind of subjective but you are asked to come sip your coffee at the bar in case you need more sugar.  

I'm one of those people that need their coffee extra strong (coffee I've made has been labelled will burn a hole in your stomach) and Philz delivers without giving up flavor.
author: Tabitha S.

description: Some of the best coffee I've ever had. I've tried quite a few different kinds here and honestly, I haven't met any I don't like. My favorites are new manhattan and sooo good.  Service is always friendly and efficient. Only reason why I didn't give five stars is because the deli side is slooooow slow slow. Friendly, but it shouldn't take over ten minutes to make me a bagel with butter. That's ok, the coffee makes up for it.
author: Lauren R.

description:
If you are a coffee connoiseur, Philz is the place for you. While you wait in line, decide what type of coffee you are in the mood for today.They have an astonishingly eclectic assortment of very interesting beans that they will brew just for you. You tell them your hearts desire and they brew your choice, one cup at a time. 

I'm coming to realize as I write reviews of the coffee shops that I have frequented, that what I like is more than great coffee. i make great coffee at home. But I am willing to drive across the city and pay top dollar for a cup of coffee or a latte, for a moment in the day where someone is catering to me.  It's about having a moment in the day where someone who can make a cup of coffee as good as I can, is able to  take care of me for a moment. And maybe even offer me a variation, that delights the senses for a moment, but without the attitude that they are going to impose their taste profile on me. There are a lot of different cups of coffee out there. And a lot of Baristas who don't want to create a perfect moment for me or you.  At Philiz you can find a cup that's perfect for you, and a barista that is happy to style you out with a perfect moment of service. 

(I feel like I should be apologetic for this "me" attitude, but when it comes to coffee, its sort of about that- if I want black coffee or weak milky coffee or whatever, its really about someone indulging my desires that makes the experience worth the time and money.)
author: Kari J.

description:
Huge selection of delicious imported coffee beans. Hand prepared one cup at a time using a Turkish brewing process for finer grains and a less water-heavy beverage (or so I'm told). So far, the best coffee I've had in the city.

A little pricier than Blue Bottle, and a bit less ubiquitous (this is their only location). I believe it rivals Barefoot Coffee on pure flavor alone, but the vastly larger selection makes it a real treat for anyone looking to expand their experience with coffee.

I am a traditionally quite pansy coffee drinker (think lattes and capuccinos), but the Jamaican Blue Mountain was so delicious I drank it *black*. No lie, it was delicious, smooth and lacked any hint of bitterness.
author: Philip W.

description: I'm not a big fan of coffee unless it's light brown, which only means it's been doused in ridiculous amounts of sugar and creamer so you can't really taste the coffee.  Hence, why I like milk tea. =)  Despite that fact, Philz's mint mojito iced coffee is the bee's knees!  For one who doesn't drink/like coffee, it's saying a LOT.  If you're in need of a caffeine infused wakeful alertness, this is the place to go.
author: Tori Q.

description:
Holy Smokes this stuff is amazing, PHILZ=CRAP IN A CUP!!

Today i got a cup of coffee around 8am and finished it around 12pm (i wouldn't recommend crushing a cup in one sitting).  I'm still flying off the caffeine high--its almost 10pm. I don't think that I'm going to be able to sleep tonight and i think I'm addicted, so that is why i gave them only four stars
author: Paula Mae P.

description: There is no other coffee place like this.  The coffee is tailored to your tastes and the staff will take plenty of time to help you decide what you are in the mood for.  Very comfy atmosphere.  I have been to all of them.  If you have  a very busy day planned or need to be extremely efficient and quick get the Code 33 and it will last a good 24 hours!
author: April M.

description:
This place has the greatest service I have ever seen. All of the people here are extremely welcoming! I was greeted by a young man name Riad. He took my order AND made my drink and was probably the most polite young man I have ever met. One of the greatest experiences I have ever had with a store. I will never have a cup of coffee from anywhere else but Philz!

Keep up the AMAZING service and GREAT coffee!!!!
author: Jonathan N.

description:
everything a coffee shop should be.

the Philz Lounge next door has plenty of seating to chat, work, read, and relax and people watch on the street.

free WiFi.

mainly coffee, but includes teas.  stuff to snack on like bagels/sandwiches and papusas.

what i appreciated the most was the staff.  i went up to the counter and said i was a new person to Philz.  she smiled and said, "awesome :]" and then just asked me if i preferred coffee or tea, light, medium or dark, sweet, spicy or bitter, etc.  

not pretentious like the Blue Bottle Kiosk on Linden, and not apathetic like Peet's down the street, but warm and inviting.  

every cup is brewed to order.  reminds me of a chemist who loves mixing their brew, and can't wait to see the effects it has on people.

oh!  did i mention their bathrooms are clean and relaxing?!  i dunno... maybe it was the effects of the arabica cup that i was sipping :]
author: Nich B.

description:
my new favorite coffee, iced mint mojito coffee!! ive always been a fan of mojitos but i never thought u could put mint in coffee. mm mm mm i think i will definitely be visiting philz more. 

but pretty expensive at $4 for a small :(

baristas here weren't as friendly as the ones at mission bay and very very soft spoken.
author: JUDY L.

description:
Love Philz coffee!

Hands down the best coffee Ive ever had! 

And is philtered soul not the best name you've ever heard for a cup of coffee?
author: Lynn H.

description:
i don't normally like/drink coffee but this place was AMAZING!  i know nothing about coffee so my friend ordered for me and we got a cup of the tesora with mint leaves.  it was the best cup of coffee i've ever tasted.

i don't think i can ever have coffee elsewhere.

my only complaint is that they don't have a philz coffee in nyc : /
author: jane l.

description:
Is there better coffee in the world? I vote no. Philz is as good as it gets. They offer a wide variety of custom bean blends, and every one I've tried has been unique and delicious. Plus, they make each cup fresh, so you never get a bad one.

Phil is a real character. The first time I came here, he took me on a "coffee tour" where he had me taste a bunch of different coffees, and he charged me for just one cup. Keep in mind this whole "coffee tour" took about ten minutes of his time. He kept telling me to "make love to the coffee with my mouth." Wonderful. By the end of the tour I was more caffeinated than I have ever been in my life. Good times.

This place is the anti-Starbucks, and that is a very good thing. Thanks Phil!
author: Nick H.

description: We all know how delicious the coffee is, so I'm just going to review the location.  Parking is horrible with expensive meters.  But once you get there, it's a good place to work.  They have an empty space specifically for lounging and working which I find very thoughtful of Philz.
author: Alex P.

description: GREAT coffee, great service. A perfect way to treat yourself on a bad day. Try the SoooGood. It's not just a clever name. Really expensive, though.
author: Barbara F.

description: I like that the people that work here really know their coffee. You ask for a recommendation and they can actually discern between the different types of blends. This location is super clean and the baristas are friendly. I haven't had a cup I didn't like here, and there are a dozen+ varieties.
author: Kelly N.

description:
I'm going to have to keep up Philz' perfect score and give them a 5-star rating as well because as far as getting coffee goes, it was pretty perfect.  I'm normally not someone who has especially high standards for my coffee getting experiences because I often times just make a cup of Folgers at the office but I left Philz first of all highly enjoying my iced mint mojito coffee but also impressed by the customer service, attention to detail and the pride the employees take in their work.  

The guy who made my coffee and those of my co-workers asked us to try our order which made me feel as though I was ordering something much more elaborate and special than a cup of coffee.  It was like he was asking  how do you like this one of a kind painting that I made with you in mind, OK I'm exaggerating a bit but he did seem to take pride in our coffee which very much impressed me.  
I didn't know there were so many around the city too! One by work and one by home, great I've just developed ANOTHER addiction. I have to start on my quest to try all their flavors now.
author: Lance D.

description:
Although I found the setup a bit annoying, this very well may be the best coffee I've ever had. Ever. You can't see the menu that describes each blend until you are at the counter needing to order. So you don't have time to read thru all the descriptions without being rushed into a decision because of the long line behind you. The menu that describes each blend needs to be visible a lot sooner in the process as there are lots of blends to choose from. I went with the Philharmonic because I like word games and I heard it being called out a few times so thought it must be popular for a reason. It is sooooooooooo sooooo good (not to be confused with the light roast blend they have called sooo soooo good). Honestly, I felt the need to call people right away and tell them how good this coffee is. That's how good it is.
The turkey sausage and egg breakfast sandwich on the other hand - just meh. 
Also, I paid by debit and they don't have you sign anything, which is a nice convenience but I couldn't tip. If I would have known this ahead of time I would have paid cash so I had some change. I'll catch up with them next time though because there will be a next time.
author: Sara B.

description: If you love coffee, Philz is THE BEST!!!  You gotta try it!!
author: Charmaine C.

description: iced mint mojito. that is all.
author: Alvin D.

description:
Good stuff here. I like all the sofas and potted plants.

Amazing coffee served by knowledgeable, friendly people.

I'll be back whenever I'm in the neighborhood!
author: Mike T.

description: Philz coffe was alright... Wasn't really amazed with their mojito mint ice coffee. I really dislike the bites that I order because it was really messy. I think the next time if I ever come here I would only order something small that isn't from their special menu because it wasn't worth it!
author: Angelica A.

description:
Philz is amazing - and I don't even like coffee! Haha seriously, I randomly stopped by here with a buddy (who is a coffee fanatic) and I ordered an iced green tea. They brewed the tea right in front off me and then iced it to perfection, adding a piece of mint to top it off! 

My friend commented that the coffee was some of the best that he tasted, and he is a self-claimed coffee snob who worked on the corporate side of a large Seattle-based coffee company. 

So the drinks are AMAZING and the staff couldn't be any friendlier. I highly recommend checking out Philz!
author: Mitch C.

description:
i ordered a cup of joe with milk and go to the register.  That will be 3.75
 
holy  #$#  Does it come with a danish...lol!!
author: Kenny E.

description: Every time i come here i have the iced mint mojito, and I Love It! The only thing i wish was different about this place is the parking/location.
author: Karen N.

description:
strong coffee, i'd say. very interesting experience - quite pricey for a straight coffee (mid $3 dollars). 

I feel like peet's coffee has higher grade coffee than philzs but i could be wrong. still a very good place - just a bit pricey
author: SSS K.

description:
as you may know i am a philz coffee FANATIC!! i dream about this stuff in my sleep. philz ALWAYS hits the spots, satisfies my cravings, and always leaves me wanting more. 

however... i dunno if its cuz its not my regular philz spot but this philz just didn't do it for me as much. got my usual ice coffee and istanbul treat and it wasn't as good as my mission bay regular location. the service was a bit RUDE too, minus the cashier guy. the place itself was dark, dim, and uninviting. 

anyway, coffee was delish. but if i had to drive anywhere for coffee it would be the philz mission bayyy
author: Bobbie L.

description: Most favorite coffee to date. First time I drank it I described it as an "out of body coffee experience." And it still is...ecstatic iced coffee, perfect blend of coffees, soo smooth. Also have enjoyed Ambrosia: coffee with convicton and a great coffee flavor to back it up. And Dancing Water: as the coffee enters your mouth you feel the warm liquid sensation down to your tummy, it's like a reawakening!
author: Mesha S.

description:
I'm still not sure if this is coffee or jet fuel.  Either way, I couldn't sleep for 12 hours after 1 cup.  That would have been great, but I had the cup at 4pm.  I shouldn't have finished the cup, but it was too good.


Enough said.
author: David B.

description:
I didn't know coffee could ever taste soooo good!

I've heard about this place through friends but never actually thought of popping into this place until months after I started working in the area.  I can't believe that I waited this long!!

I went with the suggestions and got a small mocha tesora medium sweet!  Oh gosh was my taste buds happier than ever!  Starbucks, Pete's and Seattle's Best you guys definitely don't even come close....Ahhhh--did I just say that?  I mean seriously....every time I walk into one of those chain coffee shops I spend at least $4 a cup if not more and I always think twice. Given that I am a coffee fiend....having second thoughts and reverting to brewing my own is actually NOT a good thing.   Coffee shops would want my business and not want me to think twice, right??  At Philz....thinking twice about even walking into here and ordering up a cup of coffee does not even cross my mind.  I am excited to come in here and I get really sad when I am running late to work and I have to drive by and not get a cup. *siiiiigh*  (Thank God that I only work right by this place 1x per week, otherwise....I'd be in trouble lol)

Service is excellent!  My first time...the man at the counter named the employees at every station.  I was kind of confused and afraid that if I went to one employee and not the other there would be some kind of war lol but no, he explained that everyone was there to help decide on what kind of coffee you wanted if you couldn't make up your mind.  Easy peasy....I was in and out in about 3 minutes.  Regular customer, indeed!
author: Mary-Anne C.

description: Mint Mojito iced coffee is delicious!! Service was excellent too.
author: Steph B.

description: Being a fan of a big cup of joe ultimately gives Philz the "win" for me in the world of SF coffee!  While visiting a friend in Pac Heights for a week, my husband and I had to walk to Philz x3 for coffee.  We both enjoy black coffee, however I hear the way Philz mixes the milk and sugar in for you is pretty amazing.  We walked in after a run our first morning and were greeted at the counter to discuss our likes and dislikes in coffee, given the opportunity to smell the beans, and then patiently waited for our cup.  Needless to say.... I had to come home to NC with a bag of Philtered Soul.  A perfectly smooth blend that gets a hint of hazelnut from being roasted with hazelnut bark, awesome!
author: Jane W.

description: Not being from SF I was totally new here and I must say I wish there was a comparable place in SD! The menu was overwhelming so I just asked what I they recommended. Medium body + slightly nutty lead me to philtered soul. They have a must see method of brewing and added the perfect amount of cream and sugar! The ppl working here are super nice. Philz should open up a spot in SD!!
author: Jennifer S.

description: This is some really good coffee!  It was my first time today and they were very understanding of that! lol.  A very friendly staff.  They suggested i try the Tesora, med. roast.  It was delicious!  I highly recommend this place.  No doubt I will be going back.
author: Big Daddy C.

description: After hearing very good things about Philz, I decided to stop by and am very glad I did. I ordered the mocha tesora and my boyfriend ordered Itz the best - both were just perfect. The best cup of coffee I've had in a very long time, and I love my coffee. There are unique coffee blends and funky varities that you dont see anywhere else with fun names. Next time I go back I plan on trying the mint mojito iced coffee.
author: Christy D.

description: I am sitting here wondering, "what on earth did I do to Phil to deserve the musical assault"  Hey folks, I am sitting in one of the best coffee "home's" in Northern California.  The coffee is great bar none.  Service is great, they really treat you well here as if it is a bed and breakfast.  Presently I am seated in the lounge, a place that I really enjoy.  But Phil, the music I am as eclectic as can be, but this woman just yelled in her lyrics, "here is a song I just F@ckd'ed over last night" and brother she ain't lyin" I will go with Baroque, Coltrane, or some other can't we all just get along music.  Other than that folks get to Philz enjoy the best coffee, the best service, genuine smilez, and a sweet lounge, but them soundz...? I don't know.
author: Dawud H.

description: Regardless of what others say, I'm not a big fan of the mint mojito coffee.  On the other hand...I AM a fan of their ecstatic iced coffee!!!  I would give them 5 stars...but sometimes the wait can get pretty long.
author: Mina Y.

description:
The first time I came here, my experience was a 5 star experience!  

The barista was sooo sweet and helpful and made me a fantastic cup of Jacobs (a dark roast) with just the right amount of sugar and cream!

The second time wasn't as wonderful.  The barista was cordial but not "warm" like the first one.  I told her I tried the Jacobs and loved it, and asked her to recommend another.  She did and it was a medium roast of some name.  It was okay.  Coffee was still smooth and fresh with no gross after taste, but it wasn't like the first cup of Philz.

I must go back and get that first cup love back...then maybe I'll upgrade to 5 stars.
author: Emily C.

description: I wish Philz was walking distance to me! :( Their coffee was amazing! All those crazy coffee hybrids made my mind go nuts. The staff was pretty hysterical, I had a great time crackin' jokes and laugh it up.
author: sherrie A.

description:
Highly recommended !!!

For those who love blue bottle, this could be a perfect substitute. A lot of varieties to choose from, friendly staff and price is on the median side. I wish they use higher quality mill like blue bottle does e.g clover milk.
author: H A.

description: There are places where u you just because they have great coffee. Philz is one like that for me. Not so much for the decor or it's a good place to do work nor bec. you get good interaction with people who work there. It is just they have amazing coffee. I had this turkish coffee. It was really rich with aroma. I like it a lot. But unfortunately, I usually go to cafe where I actually like to sit there for a while and enjoy the scenes. So I probably won't be going here too much.
author: Fung S. O.

description:
Truly excellent coffee.  The staff is great with newcomers, and helps you find a blend you will love.

The food is unremarkable.  The bagels are so-so, the pastries are so-so . . . but the coffee is terrific.  Each cup is individually brewed.  Pricey, but worth it.
author: R -.

description: Very much impressed when I walked in. There were tons of different coffee options to choose form, and had I returned to my coffee adiction after several months of sobriety, I would have definitely gotten one. Alas, it was 7:30pm and I was already running on no sleep so I went with the chai latte. Light and fresh - but it had mint leaves floating on the top that made actually drinking the latte a little more difficult than was necessary. I do love their free wifi and their fancy couches. I'll give it a solid B.
author: Jane H.

description: Large arabica coffee, cream & sugar. best cup of coffee in SF.
author: Stephen M.

description: I love the mint mojito iced coffee. I refused to drink coffee from anywhere else after my first taste at Philz. Nothing can compare anymore! As their menu expands, I do want to try their other specialty drinks
author: Helen L.

description: Firstly, the coffee was delicious, I'm not going to say it wasn't.  However, the process of getting the coffee was very byzantine--bordering on hipster douchery.  First time at Philz, and a friend and I are waiting in a long line going out the door.  Eventually, we caught sight of the menu...however, there are only metaphorical coffee names and prices...nothing indicating *what* was being served. Confused, and approaching the first coffee jockey, I blurt out one of the dark blends.  Next, I go to pay, and wait for my coffee.  When they eventually call it out, I look around for cream and sugar.  Nope.  Not available.  Where is it?  You were supposed to tell the coffee jockey that.  What?  I have to "describe" how sweet and creamy I want my coffee before I've even tasted it?  Yes.  Let's make this process as full of douchebaggery as possible.  If you don't let us put in our own ideas of cream and sugar, you just might ruin the drink that you bought for yourself to drink.  WTF?  Get a grip.  You shouldn't have to guess how to order coffee, nor should you be treated like you are incapable of determining the proper amount of cream and sugar in your own coffee.  Sheesh!
author: Julie T.

description: im hopped up on philz coffee and a coffee donut.  they brew your cup the way you like it after you order it.  cool vibe.  free wifi.  great coffee.  one of the best around.  blue bottle who?
author: I Be E.

description: I'm a fan! I've tried the mocha tesora and iced mint mojito and I love both. I love the mocha tesora more than the mint mojito. The mocha tesora is definitely different from your average Starbucks mocha, much better than the Starbucks version. The mint leaves in the iced mint mojito is a lovely touch. The only thing about the mojito is you can really taste the sugar at the bottom of the cup. When I'm near a Philz, I make sure I stop by and grab a nice cup of coffee. You should, too!
author: Kayla V.
