description: Philz is on par with blue bottle in my book. I love the variety but am a real fan of the Tesora. The food is just ok, but the coffee is some of the best I've ever had. The Van Ness location has never been too crowded and the wi-fi is pretty fast.
author: Cory P.

description: Aaaaahh... I love my coffee. But ever since trying Philz, my typical "coffee" is going to be subpar if not one from one of their blendz!
author: Emily L.

description: MINT MOJITO ICE COFFEE. Philz changed my life. And I'm so sad that Southern California isn't blessed with a philz. I went up for a visit to SF and had to stop at Philz multiple times. Starbucks is overrated and not even comparable to this drink!
author: April T.

description:
best coffee I have ever had...

...and I'm not even sure the name of the coffees I've tried here - they seriously have 20 different kinds of coffee beans (which overwhelms me) so the staff has to pick for me every time.  I just tell them how I like my coffee (sweet or nutty; bold or light; etc) and they'll select the perfect bean for you.  My advice: skip the cream and sugar because the quality is that great!  Yum

This place beats the pants of Starbucks; but then again, Folgers beats the pants of Starbucks.
author: Nicole K.

description: This is the best coffee I have ever had.  Knowledgeable staff can answer all questions and tell you what style of coffee is best for you.  Much more personal than the assembly line coffee shops we're all used to.  You can't go wrong with this place...
author: Jannik C.

description: After browsing at Books, Inc. and finding myself in a book I didn't even realize was out, I needed a coffee. iPod = Yelp = stagger across street. After all the raves, I was surprised to find a tiny, kitchen-sized joint. But, man, were the knit-cap hipster boyz behind the counter ever friendly! And no space means no crowds of surly macbook users nursing their americanos for 6 hours. And a green business, they recycle and compost. And as Vanessa T writes: "The mint mojito iced coffee is the truth."
author: Faith A.

description: what can I say that hasnt already been said, you are the Heisenberg to my coffee addiction, you have the purest stuff and now I'm hooked. I want to give you up Mint Mojito...I want to quit you! but I cant, I cant.
author: Steve O.

description: Philz is so amazing that it offers vegan donuts (that tastes good of course) !!!
author: Wakako U.

description: Try the Philtered Soul, it's so incredibly delicious I will gladly walk there in the rain any day. I love this Philz location as they're friendly have great recommendations and of course is relatively close to my place. There coffee is beyond the best and although a bit more then your average cup it's worth every cent.
author: Kacey H.

description: I tried the Mocha Tesora because it pops up so often in the review highlights, but I didn't find it to my taste at all. A bit to bitter and almost no hint of chocolate. Maybe I'm making a judgement too quickly, and the people there were really nice, but that's what it is.
author: Abhinav S.

description:
Okay, here's my Philz story:

Always on the lookout for new spots to sit & poach a wi-fi signal, I noticed this spot and spent a half-hour here and there posted up, getting things done.  Saw the HUGE list of coffees available, but never tried it, because (a) gimme a break (b) why pay more (c) never felt guilty enough.  
Well, one day I had to sit for a bit longer, and I figured it was finally time to contribute to the business, so I figured sure. . .I'll buy a cup of overpriced, you're-taking-yourself-WAY-too-seriously coffee.  I walk up to the counter, ponder the selection, and decide to be safe & order a mocha.
Uh-oh.
The immediate barrage of questions was simultaneously amusing and annoying (Do you like acidic or smooth?  Full?  Dark?  Cream? How sweet?  Lebron James, or Kobe?)  Now, I'm FULLY convinced that these folks take their coffee *way* too seriously.  I heave a huge sigh, and just say: "Gimme a normal, everyday, the way you always make it mocha, Please?" 
The barrista (does that apply to male and female?  Gotta check) smiles, relentlessly cheerful, and nods, and goes into his routine. . .I mean, picture Tom Cruise in "Cocktail", only in a café.  It's still in that hinterland between aggravation and laugh-out-loud funny, but I deal w/it and finally he deposits a slightly-more-than-warm cup in front of me.
"Try that. . .tell me how it is.  We want to make sure it's just right for you."
I give him the New Yorker Who's Seen It All nod, and pick up the cup, and turn away, raising the cup to take a sip as I return to my laptop and WWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWW
*What* was I just doing?  Where am I, again?  What?  What, what, what. . .WHAT?
Taste *explosion*. 
Long story short (TOO LATE!) This is the Best. Coffee. I've. Ever. Had.  Period. I'm not a believer now, I'm an embarrassing acolyte.  That's right; I'm one of those silly people that brags that their coffeeshop is better than yours.
Because it is.  Trust.
Postscript: Although I don't drink coffee from anywhere else unless I have to, there are a couple of times I've had to, and realized that *Incredibly*, Philz is actually CHEAPER than many places (COUGHStarbucksCOUGH). My small mocha is just 3 bucks; which means it's a bit cheaper than the colored water that other folks are serving up.  Yes, Philz is basically kicking the competition in the @$$.
author: Kevvy K.

description: Hip but trendy.  Hipster, trendster.  And you don't see what they're REALLY doing with your coffee.  Very, very good nonetheless though.
author: Alex C.

description: I only get the Ambrosia because I would hate to be dissapointed by anything less. My favorite barista is the guy who stole Jacques Cousteau's beanie. Think the guy working the cash register is there for the ladies. Swear I saw him get into a mercedes with a Dubai license plate frame.
author: Marcos M.

description: Best coffee, rocks!  This place is a must see, the coffee "creations" are amazing!!
author: John T.

description: Very good! I had the Mint Mojito based on all the reviews and I thought it was refreshing and new! There was TONS of fresh mint in the cup and the coffee was super rich and delicious. If there was a location closer to where I live, I would definitely be at Philz a few times a week!! I'll have to try their regular brews next!
author: Erin Y.

description: I went here and had the Philtered Soul, which was great. I'll definitely be back, and consider bumping my rating to 5.
author: Grant M.

description: Philz is my absolute favorite coffee shop in SF.  One of my top favs in the states.  With that said, I have to deduct on point because the layout is rather awkward, and a few of the baristas are perpetual crabby asses.  Although most of them are lovely.
author: Ryan S.

description: Really tasty coffee, i went for the first time yesterday. Didn't know how to order or what to do. The Staff was really helpful and kind. The barista explained it all to me, asked me what I liked and suggested coffee options for me. All in all, a great first Philz experience, and I'll be back!
author: Alexis C.

description: I love Philz coffee.  I don't live in the city anymore, so mostly I enjoy Philz coffee at home, but once in a while, I get into the cafe and it's soooooo good.  Today I had the Jacob's Sooo Good with sugar and cream. Fantastic, though, I'll probably stick with milk from now on.    The staff are so capable and committed to service.  Truly impressed with this place!
author: Michelle C.

description:
I always enjoy my cup of Philz. I've switched between  Filtered Soul and Ambrosia (try it if you enjoy medium roasts) and it's make perfectly every time by a smiling barista.

Try it if you haven't before. But, please brace yourself for the selections they have. I love the concept of made-to-order coffee, but get so overwhelmed with all the choices sometimes. Regardless, treat yourself to a great cup of coffee, one that Starbucks will never beat!
author: 3beeskitchen ..

description: we had philz harmonic and philz fresh chai. Both were great!
author: bhavya k.

description:
yayyyyy for philz!! one cup at a time never tasted so gude. 

don't matta if you like your coffee black, super sweet or riiiiight in the middle, they will make sure it's the way you like it! and they're nice about it! which only makes philz that much more awesome.

mint mojito ice coffee - bomb.
jacob's wonderbar - amazeballs.
ambrosia - one of my faves.
tesora - mmmmm.
sooo good - sooo good.

go get you some philz!
author: Jessica Y.

description: Oh how i love thee!!  and it' s not just the coffee the barista's are really super awesome too! such nice friendly people.   AND for someone like me who sux at making coffee...I am now happily brewing their beans at home and it's yummy!!  Philz all the way!
author: Michelle B.

description: Divine iced coffee, especially if you like it creamy and sweet! After just two weeks, I'm addicted to this stuff. The one-cup-at-a-time phil(z)osophy makes a huge difference. The wait is usually pretty long regardless of when you go, and I've encountered a few spacey baristas, but overall the line moves pretty quickly. First timers: be prepared to start drinking Philz on the regular, because this stuff gets you hooked.
author: Lauren S.

description: Waited in line a long time & bought a pound of New Manhattan medium roast. This place seems totally overrated. These beans were nothing special.
author: Sam Z.

description: Enjoyed my iced mocha tesla. Next time will order it without milk. My wife loved her ginger snap iced coffee (she has a major sweet tooth)!
author: Joshua S.

description: I visited Philz Coffee when I was on vacation last month.  I came to Philz strictly off of the information provided by Yelp reviewers.  The coffee is wonderful and the staff is even better!  I walked in and mentioned that it was my first Philz experience, I was kindly welcomed and educated on the ordering process.  I answered some questions about my likes/tastes and a few minutes later I had one of the most wonderful cups of coffee I've ever had (Jacob's Wonderbar).  The atmosphere is relaxing, location is outstanding and overall it is now towards the top of my favorite coffee house list (actually, it's at the top).  On that same trip I went back to Philz at least 5 or 6 more times!  I got the wonderbar again and the mocha tesora during the other visits.  Simply amazing.  This was my first stop after arriving in San Fran and it's going to be tradition now.  Every visit to San Francisco will start (and end) with coffee at Philz.
author: Amy G.

description: Yes, the coffee is good, however, the space is terrible. It is always hot, has very little air circulation, and looks like it was previously a waiting room for a dentist's office with some sad "coffee shop art" on the walls. I like independent coffee shops, but Philz needs to take note of the Starbucks and Pete's up the street and get their act together.  The coffee is not that much better to justify the horrendous ambiance. If you like drinking your coffee in a dirty, ugly, old stinky office space, then this is for you.
author: MN O.

description: I love this place. They ask you what you like (ie style, sweetness, strength) and make you something they think you might like. After you try it they ask if it needs any changes and they will fix it for you. I only ordered the mint mojito iced coffee with soy since it is such a unique item. It was tasty! So good that I went three times in two days!! I wish they had this in Vegas! I will be back next time I am in SF.
author: Tiffanie G.

description:
Cof-tastic!  

Seriously, it's melt in your mouth good.
author: Nikki T.

description:
have to admit, was initially put off by their... font.  

was packed in there... moby look alikes, beatniks, lesbians... the grungy hipness of it all was a tad intimidating.  but then the barista was super friendly & helpful.  and then i was offered a sample of bagel sandwich.  and then when i proceeded to smear hardboiled egg all over my smiling mug, i was courteously handed a napkin.

i am in love!

not to mention, it was a damned good cup of mocha too.
author: Miss K.

description: Excellent coffee and personalized service with a smile. The baristas and counter folk here are the best in the business.  I always order a pound of Philz french roast, ground, cone drip delux to brew at home.....because I'm a homebody.....but they have a spacious annex lounge should  you ever wanna get outta the house.
author: Baby J.

description: Delicious coffee brewed by the cup made to order. About 20 coffees to chose from. Only downside is not enough seating, and flies and bugs all over b/c trash cans nearby.
author: Jennifer H.

description: another good alternative to charbucks...like the seperate lounge area at this location...
author: Chris C.

description:
me and my partner in crime-o, jaimo, decided to get coffee at Philz today.

we were greeted at the door. +1
the place was clean. +1
the guy making our coffee asked us if he could help us, soon as we entered. +1
lots of choices +1
not knowing what to get, we asked for a suggestion, and the guy making our coffee asked where we usually get coffee, and what we usually get, and based off our answers he suggested a specific roast +1

those reasons alone are why Philz Coffee deserves 5 stars...but to top it all off the coffee was SO good!  after he made me my cup of coffee he asked how i liked it and i told him that it was like he had sprinkled crack on the coffee after brewing...i could see myself getting addicted to it.

how do i know what crack taste like, you might ask: a crackhead standing outside told me.
author: Ray R.

description: While waiting for our table at Brenda's over the weekend, I see a couple holding cups of Philz Coffee.  I promptly ask them where they got their coffee from and they tell me it's just a block away.  As soon as we walk in, we are greeted by the extremely friendly staff who are just as helpful as they are friendly.  I opt for the Tesora blend which is brewed as you order.  It was definitely one of the best coffees I've had, but then again, I'm no coffee snob and tend to like most coffeeshops around the city.  I would highly recommend this place, especially if you are going to be waiting for over an hour (which is normal) for your table at Brenda's!
author: Charles K.

description: My friend recommended that I go here and I did. Upon entering I was hit with the most confusing menu I had ever seen in my life. But, like all who should in this situation and as the website suggests, just ask the barista. Talk them through your drink and they're going to make sure that's exactly what you wanted. That kind of service is amazing. I love coming in here and knowing that though the descriptions baffle me, I'm going to walk out with something I adore. You may not be able to snag a seat depending on when you go, but it's still worth the trip.
author: Shauna S.

description: Philz coffee is like an orgasm in a cup. I love cafe Cubano, so when I came to order a cup here, they served me gold in a cup. It was sooooooo good that even my husband, who NEVER, and I mean never drinks coffee, was sipping on it and ended up drinking half of my cup. If you are ever in the area, so yourself a favor and treat yourself. Trust me, once you go Philz, you'll never want to drink anything else.
author: Yelena K.

description: Mint Mojito Iced Coffee ($4 Small/$4.50 Large).  It is perfect!  I would say it's kind of expensive considering the most expensive venti sized drinks at starbucks are around this price but it is just so much better than starbucks!  I wish they would open one by financial district because I am definitely a fan of Philz Coffee over Blue Bottle!  :)
author: Vicky C.

description: yes i am hooked on their coffees and now starting to sample their teas.  i love the ambiance of the place, although it can get packed as heck in their with everyone getting on their gadgets (including myself).  all of the staff have been congenial and respectful of their clients.
author: Tamara C.

description: Okay- I have to give Philz props for getting creative with their coffee.  Their processes are completely different and they are reinventing the standard cup.  However, each time I have been there I have found the employees to be completely rude, knowledgeable as they may be, and the coffee to be completely over-roasted. I am not against Philz but I have definitely had a better cup of coffee and a better experience buying it. Call me underwhelmed but I have worked in coffee for a long time and I have had a much easier time getting a high-quality cup of Joe. Thanks Philz, you're a novelty, but I'll be sticking with a more traditional cup.
author: Samantha M.

description:
SO GOOD!!! 

Oh-My-Goodness!!! Every type of beans that I have tried is incredible! I know my coffee- I used to work at Starbucks and have had my fair share of coffee beans and blends. I've been to Seattle- and went on a coffee tour. I also enjoy Peet's, BUT-- Philz surpasses ALL! I generally like my coffee black but their home-made cream is just that good that I make the exception. 

You must try:
1. Jacobs 
2. Tesoro
3. Dancing Water
4. Canopy of Heaven

I work in the financial district and brought a cup of Philz from the tenderloin and someone chased me down the block just to ask me where Philz was. I had to break his heart and tell him that I got it from the tenderloin- he was pretty disappointed. Yummm
author: katie n.

description:
They have GREAT coffee, pure and simple. They have a huge selection of mixed and single origin beans and are more than happy to help you out in your quest for a new personal favorite. 

Speaking of simple, that's one of the things I LOVE about Philz coffee... it's simple. There's no mocha-frappa-everything free-soy-crappachino here. You don't have to tell them what size you want in a foreign language so that you can feel so-fist-a-ma-cated.

I love that your coffee is made fresh, just for you.
author: Sean M.

description: Best coffee EVER hands down.  If you're in the city, you should find a Philz and have your life changed.
author: Dez C.

description: They asked me if the Ambrosia coffee was ok. I said it was great. I wanted to say that it was heaven but I was too pre-occupied with the coffee
author: Alexis C.

description: I definitely enjoy the unique coffee flavors that Phil has to offer. Not only is this coffee place a one of a kind, so are the flavors! They try new things, and the way that prepare the coffee is very entertaining. Would definitely come back if still in the area. Try all the different kinds of coffee, light - dark and all the different mixtures and flavors.
author: Simon L.

description: Iced mint mojito, absolutely perfect. The mint was nice and subtle, not too overpowering like I thought it'd be. I haven't had the other drinks yet, but I'll be back to try! There's pretty much only metered parking in this area, but it's not that bad. Park right in front or around the corner and throw a quarter in. You'll be in and out before the meter expires. I kinda also wish they had locations closer to me, but I guess it's a good thing. It'd be an expensive addiction.
author: Kari G.

description: Went here during the weekend for Hardly Strictly Bluegrass festival.  My friend told us that we absolutely had to go here because it was the best coffee in the city.  I have to say that this is the best coffee I've ever had. I mean that.
author: Jen A.

description: Had a very cute barista kindly help me navigate the selections and I walked out with the most beautiful, smoothly swallowed, sweet mocha made just for me as each cup is made individually. The price is really no different from a Starbucks/Peet's flavored latte.
author: Connie C.

description: Love the latte here. Not going to Peets or Starbucks when i am in the city.
author: Vibrant J.

description: Philz is the best coffee place I've ever been to and most unique coffee I've ever tasted. I was confused on how to order/pay, but I watched the other patrons in front of me and learned quickly. Order your drink, pay for it, then wait for your coffee! I guess you could do whichever first. I was introduced to the famous mint mojito and fell in LOVE. It's the only coffee I want to ingest, everything else is a waste of calories! haha. Sometimes they run out of mint leaves, so I get the ecstatic ice coffee and it's just as delicious!
author: Tiffany P.

description: I'm not picky about most things, but one thing I'm picky is my regular cup of joe.  Philz Coffee brews coffee to perfection.  Jacob's wonderbar brew is my regular morning coffee staple in the morning.  Move over Peets, I "heart" Philz.
author: Stella L.

description: best coffee i have had since i was in kona, hawaii. i only wished that this place was closer to UCSF medical centers. the service staff was very helpful and knowledgeable. definitely plan on going one more time before i leave SF.
author: Anish P.

description: I saw 4.50 for an Mint Mojito Iced Coffee and I was like "Super expensive". After one small sip ... "WOW". Their coffee is 100% worth your bucks. Seriously, you can taste the concentration they put in for each and every cup of coffee. Super friendly staff and very clean joint. Will be seeing me very often. Good JOB! nice find!
author: Frankie L.

description: Amazing coffee, made cup by cup. They offer personal service and will alter the cup to suit your needs after they serve it. Prices are high but worth it, especially by the pound ground. Amazing stuff!
author: G J J.

description: Woohoo! as good as it gets! I come all the way from Daly City to come to this location when I want damn good coffee as well as nice people to talk to! Mint mojito all day! and if you can get it before they run out definitely get a breakfast burrito! They get them shipped every morning from some place I don't know but they're great to have with the coffee. Put me on the wall! = )
author: Jerald B.

description:
More coffee shops should be like Philz. So far, I have had too blends there-- the Tesora, black, and the Mocha Tesora with little bit of cream. Both were excellent.

What really makes this coffee shop stand out, however, is the employees. They are very friendly and helpful, and it seems to be genuine, not scripted. They enjoy what they do and really care about making sure people get the right cup of coffee. Unfortunately I have to go out of my way to go here, or else I would go more often. It's worth the trip though. Probably the best mocha I've had and the friendliest employees I've encountered. There should be one of these everywhere.
author: Bethany T.

description: Redefining filter coffee as an art with a wide range of blends and no milk steamer. For a black coffee drinker who likes more than just mud, this is bliss. I recommend the Tesora blend.
author: Robert P.

description: Best coffee I have ever had (but blue bottle is a close second).  I always get the iced coffee with a little cream and sugar.  If you have never been here you have to try it, you will never go to starbucks again.
author: Sichia B.

description: Walking in to Philz can be a little overwhelming - the options are almost limitless. But the staff are super friendly and helpful, even when there's a line out the door. Great coffee and great bagels. I love their medium blends, but supposedly their mint mojitos are brilliant too if you like that kinda thing. In the words of my roommate "but Americans, we don't want to taste too much coffee." If you do like to be able to taste the coffee, try the Philtered Soul - delish!
author: Tania S.

description: excellent coffee, if you like coffee this is the place to go to. hot or cold.
author: Dave N.

description: While this place lacks the charm and atmosphere of the Mission branch, the coffee quality is definitely consistent.
author: Maximillian M.

description: I believe I was the first person to receive the first cup of coffee at the new fantastic Civic Center location. I arrived around 8:30 ish on Tuesday morning, on my way to volunteer. I was so thrilled about this location opening up since I no longer work near the mission bay location, I have been missing out on my daily dose of Philz. It is the most perfect cup of coffee you could ever enjoy. All your senses are alive. I love the fact that I have the option for a "real" cup of coffee" near my new civic center workspace. I love supporting local business. You should as well.
author: Jennifer S.

description: Best coffee in town, I just love chilling here with my Turkish blend coffee with a little mint in it.... tastes soo cool, also I love people here - the Missionaries, they're very cool and seems like you're sitting in the center of the earth
author: Veronika A.

description: Got to be the best coffee I've had. Blue bottle, Barefoot and Four Barrel all take a spot in line after Philz.  There are 20 different coffee drinks on the wall, of which I've had just a fraction, and I have enjoyed every one.  The coffee drinks are just that. COFFEE.  Not frothy dessert in a cup, confusingly labeled with made up Italian words. Coffee made from beans from different lands, lovingly picked by some indigenous people, prepared in just a slow drip process.  Oh, the Philz coffee buzz is sublime.
author: Marc G.

description: Mint Mojito Iced coffee is a great and refreshing idea. Period. Nothing really else to say except the baristas are super helpful too.
author: Allan C.

description: Loooove Philz Coffee... I've been coming to this corner since it was just a liquor store and even though it has become very popular, the coffee is still to die for! Feeling like one now :)
author: Maria M.

description: Philz is the best coffee I have ever had, hands down. It is so smooth and creamy and nutty and yummeh.
author: Missy F.

description: Oh the coffee is stellar. A few things to know about how they work: there's no espresso machine. It's all pour-over coffee but they do have incredible iced options. Space is tight in this cafe. It's really clean though and run well. The edible options are fairly limited.
author: Catherine C.

description: "Dancing Water" is where it's at!  That's the name of the coffee roast.  Staff was super friendly and happy to answer all of my questions.  Can't wait to try Philz in the Mission.  My only complaint about this location is lack of space and limited seating when you want to enjoy coffee with a friend on a Sunday morning.  It's best to get your coffee to go!
author: Nicole W.

description: Philz has plenty of ratings so there's no need for me to go into too many details. I wanted to try all the dark roasted coffees but I can't stop ordering the Ether (dark roast).  It's SO DAMN GOOD and is the most perfectly dripped cup of coffee!
author: Mel S.

description: The best coffee ever, Samy and his staff friendly and always smiling. This is the place -
author: Bernd P.

description: I always love a good cup of coffee. Normally don't drink coffee much but when I do, I come here and get blue mountain.
author: Akiko I.

description: Another food establishment that allows dogs inside!   Lady with small dog at the table-dog had it's paw on the table where I have eaten before-yuk.  I asked the franchise owner to ask the lady to take dog outside, he suggested "can't you just sit over at the empty table over there."  I explained it's a health code violation and against the law.  He said he would comply.  Came back 5 minutes later-dog still there.  I then said "you just lost a customer."
author: James C.

description: I LOVE this place! I drive from Marin for this coffee, pay the bridge toll and parking for this coffee, and sometimes I do this twice in one day! My favorite is the Turkish with light cream and medium sugar. Also tried the shop in the Mission, parking was more of a challenge there and honestly, I was a little nervous leaving my car, but the staff was tops!
author: Tam H.

description: Well, this place is fine. They make some good coffee. However, I can't help but feel its popularity (and it is popular) is mostly sizzle and not much steak. First, what the fuck is with all the different flavors but no info on what's actually *in* them? Frankly, most of them taste the same to me. And, do you know what cream they use? "Manufacturing cream." This shit has over 40% fat content (more than heavy whipping cream). Hell, you could put manufacturing cream in Sanka and it would taste fucking amazing. So, it's a fine cup of coffee; a little over-hyped in my opinion. Oh, and I'm no neat freak but those fabric seating options = petri dish.
author: Chris M.

description: Small little coffee shop right on the busy part of Van Ness, one sip of their Turkish dark roast and I'm hooked.  It was LOVE AT FIRST SIP.  I also had a sip of the Mint Mojito iced coffee, and I decided that I'm gonna stray from those big corp. coffee houses for the next month or so.  Only if Philz is more easily accessible.  Damn u SB.
author: Tadaa T.

description: I hate giving ANY Philz a 4 star review because I absolutely LOVE Philz and have been a long time supporter and customer. I frequent Philz on an everyday basis and am addicted to the popular mint mojito iced coffee.  I have friends all over the Bay Area so I am always visiting different Philz coffee shops.  Unfortunately I wish they were more consistent.  I have to say the Berkeley Philz is by far my favorite.  No matter which barista makes my drink it is always dead on.   The second best is the Philz by the AT&T park.  They are always consistent as well.  I would say my least favorite is the location on van ness. Everyone working there is amazing, but I have never had a good mint mojito iced coffee there.  Initially I did not want to put up this post because I understand that everyone likes their coffee differently and who I am to say that the location on van ness is doing it wrong?  But I can't help but feel like every other location makes my drink perfectly.  I will still continue to frequent the Philz on van ness when it is convenient, but I do have to say that I am not as excited about my cup of coffee as I am when I am visiting the Berkeley location.  That's all. :).
author: Lena D.

description: Although coffee is coffee to me, my bf's Holy Grail of coffee is here. I have never had a cup to myself but I will say, this is damn good coffee. The employees here are also amazingly great at what they do, and they do it enthusiastically, which definitely adds to the experience.
author: Camille T.

description: I've been drinking Philz for a while now - primarily from the Berry st. location. I'm super excited that they've opened up another location on Van Ness! It works out nicely on my morning commute!
author: Lindsay A.

description: Philz Coffee tastes like sex in your mouth.
author: Matt W.

description:
You can't really find this type of coffee service in the bay area. Others are trying but I don't think it's working.

I believe the Van Ness location makes it better than the Berry location. Always piping hot and not too sweet.

Really can't drink it everyday because of the heavy cream they use but its always a treat.
author: Mei F.

description: After Blue Bottle, Philz is my 2nd favorite coffee place in San Francisco. They drip each cup individually, and you can pick from the seemingly 100's of bean choices. My favorite is, "So Good" and I've heard rave reviews for the "Canopy of Heaven". They shake the milk and make it extra foamy - it looks pretty, but sometimes I have to ask for a bit more milk to lighten it. Everyone is super nice and they often have yummy snacks, too.
author: Maren P.

description:
Fabulous, fabulous coffee. I ordered a mocha, and I was thrilled when they asked me how sweet I wanted it to be (not at all). I like to actually taste the chocolate in a mocha, not sugar. Well, this mocha was perfect! (And if you like them sugary-sweet, you can ask for that, too.) I had a taste of a regular coffee and loved it. This is well-brewed coffee.

It's a little on the pricey side, although if I'm not going to just make my coffee at home I'd rather pay a little more to avoid a chain and get a high-quality drink. It was also a bit cramped with all the people standing around to order/get their drinks/pay. There didn't seem to be enough seating or space in general for the number of people there on the weekend. But still -- great coffee! I'd go back in a heartbeat if I lived in the area.
author: Rachel M.

description: I'm a total sucker for coffee shops and Philz is going on my list of favorites. The place makes each cup to order and personally sweetens your coffee.  Their Turkish Coffee, lightly sweetened with brown sugar and milk and a hint of mint is delicious.  Their coffee was the perfect start to my long days walking around the city. The staff is friendly and welcoming.  The shop is a bit small with few tables to sit so it can get a bit packed.  A medium cup of coffee is about $3.50.  Philz is a must try to coffee-lovers.
author: Leslie C.

description: Okay, I do like coffee, but I am by no means able to tell a good cup from a great cup.  HOWEVER, this place has changed everything.  I like Starbucks, I admit it, and the taste is just what I like.  I like fraps, what can I say?  So my friend who was visiting SF, who LOVES coffee saw this place and dragged me here, even though all I wanted was a carmel frap from Starbucks.  I was unwilling, but they had so many cute flavors and things that I decided, okay, fine I'll try the iced coffee.  AMAZING.  The coffees are naturally a little sweet and creamy tasting, and superb.  I can definitely tell these are top coffee beans carefully selected by taste and flavor.  Nothing fancy with creams, fraps, blends or whatever, but if you want an awesome cup of joe, this is your place.  The baked foods are pretty tasty too (ie, samosas).
author: Josephine C.

description:
A lot of people I know love Philz, but I do not. Yes, they do make better coffee than Starbucks or Pete's. But only marginally. Their light roasts (of which they have the least of) are anything but. They will not tell you anything about their apparently super secret propriety blends (as if from knowing their countries of origin I could somehow recreate them). If you want to experience over-the-top friendly staff that serve entirely unhelpfully named coffee blends with fruity descriptions go to Philz by all means.

But if you want truly good coffee go to Blue Bottle. Or better yet, roast your own, which is what I do most of the time.
author: Ben M.

description: better than Blue Bottle for drip coffee.  But BB has Philz beat on espresso drinks.
author: Seamus M.

description: The search for a great cup of coffee can be pretty frustrating and always subjective. More often than not, if you do luck up on a decent cup... it  will probably be a different experience when you go back the second time. Philz has completely solved this dilemma for me. I've been going everyday for about 2 weeks and have never been let down. Great coffee, super friendly staff... would recommend to all.  Thank you Philz!!
author: Brian W.

description: Wow. This is customer service at it's finest. The people who work here actually want you to enjoy your coffee to the utmost degree. And you do. :) Outstanding coffee, outstanding people.
author: Liisa L.

description: I can't say enough about Philz.  Though the original location on 24th has the most character, they have done a great job with this Van Ness location.  Staff is always pleasant, coffee and tea are great and the atmosphere is laid back, clean and friendly.    LOVE coming to Phiz.
author: michael d.

description:
I was in the city, location scouting with a photographer friend on a blustery summer (if you can call it summer...thanks Al Gore...) Wednesday when I felt some "will probably have an emotional streetside meltdown if I don't get coffee and a snack in the next 30 minutes" tummy rumblings.  Just then Philz popped out of nowhere.  After admitting I had never heard of this apparent San Francisco staple, I was ushered in by my very enthusiastic friend.
I'm not gonna lie - the confusing menu completely threw me off, and I ended up having the following conversation with the guy behind the counter:
(Me) Uhm, tall americano? Do you have a tall americano? Please? Where is Starbucks? I'm scared.
(Guy) *patient world-wise chuckle* Actually all of our drinks are different blends of coffee.  I can help you find something you'll like.
(Me) *Two-year-old on the verge of pouting glare* But...I don't like coffee. I like americanos.
(Guy) Okay. Just trust me. It's 3:00 in the afternoon. It's the middle of the week. I assume you want something that'll pick you up and coast you into the evening.  Nothing too crazy, but a little caffeine, right?
(Me) *mute nodding*
(Guy) Alright, sugar and cream? (More mute nodding)  I'm blending you a Jacob's Special, but I'm also mixing in some Ethiopian decaf, so you don't get too wild. (I feel I am beginning to trust him)
Five minutes later he hands me his creation.  As I raise the cup to my lips he says "You're going to like it.  The Ethiopian blend adds some chocolate notes to the cup." (Now, I'm the type of person who likes wine tasting because it gets you drunk, not because I can taste the "hint of asparagus" in that 07 chardonnay - but seriously, you could taste the chocolate!!!)
Anyway, I went to pay and picked up a lentil sambosa (SO good - spicy and light) on the way.  At $3.00 for a cup of coffee, it's definitely not the cheapest joint in town.  That said, it is an awesome treat, and I was definitely impressed by the counter guy's ability to make me something I would like based on the 30 seconds of semi-coherent ramblings that fell out of my mouth when we walked in the door. Would I stop by on the way to work every morning? No. I don't make that much money.  But would I take a friend here during a day of city hustling and bustling? You bet.
author: Anja K.

description: If your ever in the SF area I suggest you go to Philz and grab a cup of coffee.  They brew their coffee by the cup customizing it to your liking.  Walk in this place and you instantly smell the sweet aroma of coffee beans from around the world. I don't remember which cup of coffee i ordered, but it was indeed amazing I didnt even have to put cream or sugar in it.  It was perfect the way it was.   This place gets really crowded but the service is quick.  I would love to come back to this coffee joint again if only i didnt live so far.
author: Xandy M.

description: The line is always out the door, so that should tell you something!  Forget Sbucks and Peets, Philz should be a must do if you are in the Civic Center area.  They even had Jamaican Blue Mountain (my favorite) by the pound the last time I was there so for that five stars.
author: Jay L.

description: 6 stars for the coffee and selection available. 5 stars for the price. Philz is definitely a pricier coffee than sbux or peets, but it's well worth it. Hands down the best coffee i've had. I tried the Jacobs this morning. Next time I will ask for light cream and sugar bc i like my coffee a little darker/bolder than it was today. But the people there are incredibly friendly and efficient about making your coffee. Glad I found this place.
author: vishal k.

description: What a great coffee shop should be. Each cup is personally dripped, which also means that you may have to wait a few minutes. And the food (though limited) is worth going for- love the fresh NYC style bagels.
author: Katie S.

description: This is the place for coffee. I have a sensitive stomach, but Philz coffee does me no harm. Even the most sensitive tummy can enjoy coffee at Philz. What a joy! They adjust to taste, and work to get it right. Think about the flavor you like in coffee and then just go. If you want to take your date, know what your sweetie likes, and test it before you take him/her. Then promise a great cup of delight. Enjoy! Oh yeah, and don't forget to pick up your scones at SF Scone Works (check to see if they're open before going) around the corner. Double delight.
author: Jessica S.

description: i am a huge fan of philz coffee, in fact it has become my all time favorite coffee shop. but this location is lacking in both service and quality. the blonde-ish girl that works at the first stand where the line starts is not a good listener. i have visited this location numerous times and she always forgets my drinks. i usually order two drinks each time, one for me and one for the wife, and somehow she always forgets either one or both of them. i order a mint mojito and philharmonic, pay for my drinks and stand nearby waiting. she pulls up 4 other drinks,none of which i ordered. i finally walk up to her and say "excuse me but by any chance did someone take my drinks by mistake" and she will say "oh thats right you ordered two drinks, what were they again?" and she would proceed to make them in a hurry. the mint mojito was 90% ice with very little coffee inside. and my philharmonic did not taste anything like a philharmonic. this has happened numerous times and not just a one time thing. if you cannot remember orders, you are forgetting to make my drinks, and then you make the drinks very poorly you are either not suitable for this line of work or you are stoned out of your mind. it does not take a genius to brew a cup of coffee. i have visited over 8 different philz coffee locations and this one by far is the most unsatisfying location i have been to.
author: Al J.

description: I like plain black coffee. Not the flavor, just the part that wakes me up. but after trying Phil's iced coffee I actually crave the taste of the stuff. Who would've thunken! The location sucks but I'll go out of my way especially if I only got 5 hours of sleep the night before which is what usually happens
author: Thom E.

description: Best coffee and tea in the neighborhood for sure. Very knowledgable and friendly staff. I love the Silken Splendor, as well as the Aromatic Arabic. Also, the free WiFi keeps me coming back very regularly!
author: Bass T.

description: Philz has the BEST coffee EVER and the friendliest coffee house staff I've ever had the pleasure of doing business with.  If you want coffee that is like liquid crack, get the "Greater Alarm".  Seriously, they brew each cup with care and have you taste it to make sure it's to your liking.  What other place does this???  Oh and did I mention that the guys who work there are as hot as the coffee?  And they're so nice, it makes me feel like they really care about my cup of coffee (sigh....hearts pop out of my head)...
author: Mark T.

description: Okay, I'll say it up front:  I'm partial to the taste of Blue Bottle (I know, I'm like one of the Orangemen posting on an IRA site), but give it up for Philz; it's great coffee. In a city full of great coffee, they do stand out. It's my second favorite coffee in SF, and the locations are more convenient then Blue Bottle.
author: Syd S.

description: I love Philz but customer service does not exist at this location. I never write reviews but this location def needs one. I waited in line (the only one along w my co-worker) for about 5min before the barista (whom was right across from me) finally looked up & said, "let me know when you're ready." I've been in line for 5min with no one behind and finally you decide to acknowledge me when you've been chatting with your co-workers this entire time? I'm sorry, but a slight nod or even a, "i'll be right with you" would've been fine. I ordered an iced mocha tesoro, but I received it hot. She then tells me it'll be a few minutes to remake it... it's ready in less than 30 sec. I know you didn't remake it. I was a barista for 7yrs and what you gave me was a watered down temperate mocha. I paid $4 for a drink AND I even gave you a $1 tip. Thanks. I'd rather go to the one in the Mission. It's unfortunate since I live around the corner from this place. Maybe their sign that reads, "wait to be called" should be removed.
author: Cynthia H.

description: Went looking for the best coffee shops in San Francisco and Philz inevitably popped up on the list. Generally, I am an Italian coffee drinker and Philz is not exactly that. The atmosphere is fantastically friendly and genuine. The coffee is filtered coffee, but nevertheless of the highest quality. Greatly place. Strongly recommended.
author: Lars R.

description: while growing up in Japan, i tasted the best coffee in the world, but Philz is nearly as good.
author: John G.

description: Easily the best coffee I have ever tasted. Their Tesora is my favorite, although I have tried a lot of 'em from many visits. I would go out of my way to show someone new to San Francisco this place. Surprisingly some people I know could not understand why this coffee was better than the best coffee place they knew in Sacramento. Really?
author: Epicurean _.

description: The philharmonic is the best coffee I've ever had! Ask for a spring of mint on top! So good!
author: Elizabeth K.

description: WOW! I just experienced how Coffee was meant to be. I've never been to a place where they actually grind to coffee grounds for every individual cup. AWESOME!
author: John S.

description: Staff was helpful and outgoing, and I got my drink quickly.  The ginger snap iced coffee was delicious.
author: Stephen G.

description: stayed in the condos above for a bachelorette party weekend. had it's the best, tessera, and the mint mojito.  they need to work on the line though.. people would be standing around waiting behind people who had already ordered.. it was sorta a mess..
author: Cindy C.

description: Whats left to say?  Coffee the way I never knew it could be.  I LOVE YOU PHILZ!
author: Rex S.

description: Out of this world amazingly delicious coffee, witty baristas, great customer service...you get the picture:)
author: Ksenia S.

description:
I look forward to Philz every day! In fact, I'll walk pretty far out of my way for it. The coffee is a little different than the lattes and drip that I'm used to and they're better for it. 

I usually get the Ecstatic iced coffee or black iced tea (awesome w/o anything added but a mint leaf.) 

Go and be greeted by some of the friendliest/most knowledgeable people in coffee.
author: Erika A.

description:
I am super picky when It comes to my coffee and Philz (specifically this location) by far exceeded my expectations.  Here is why!

I had been to 2 other Philz location, one in Castro and the original one in Folsom, and the Vanness location is far superior in service.  The coffee and tea drinks are very fresh each time.  The baristas take their time in making the drinks and always and always ask whether it is to my taste.  In fact, each barista is so nice that I wonder where they found all the nicest people in the world.  The manager of the store, Sammy is super professional and always present with a smile and available to help.  Philz, you guys rock!
author: ebru t.

description: Best coffee in the city, hand down.  The first time you go here it can be a little confusing, almost intimidating....but they sure do make a great coffee.  Its almost like a wine bar, they have about 20 options for your drip coffee, and the barrista will explain the options to you if you aren't quite sure what you want....all in all, this place rocks!
author: Colleen C.

description: probably the best coffee in the city. lots of choices and great bagels. definately recommend the mint mojito. I've also tried the jacobs which is a strong roast. good choice if you love coffee.
author: Kendrick D.

description: I'm not addicted to caffeine, but this place can definitely turn you. I went back the next day to try their iced coffee with mint. Oh so yummy. If I didn't stop myself, I could have easily finished the entire small which I knew would be a very very bad idea. It was good! I want to try their mint mojito iced coffee next time. I hear they put about 20 mint leaves in it!
author: Cynthia P.

description: Unbelievable coffee. I had never heard of brewing each cup of coffee individually. I don't know how it has not caught on and taken over the country. You can go in and you don't have to choose from the 2 varieties they're currently brewing- you get to choose from a huge selection. And the vegan pastries- YUMMY!
author: Mandy L.

description: This Philz Coffee is the "cat's meow".   Hot coffee perfection. It doesn't get much better than their Aromatic Arabian or Turkish coffee. This Philz is small in comparison to their 24th Street cafe.  Unlike the original, however, this place is band new, very clean, and has a very cozy atmosphere.  Unless you prefer to enjoy your brew with smelly hippy wannabees at the 24th Street location, this Van Ness Philz is where it's at.
author: Gregory C.

description: Amazing, I've never seen a place that grinds your coffee for you when you order it per cup!  The staff were super friendly and I wish there was something like this around where I live.
author: Octavio L.

description: Great hipster/poseur cafe. It's often too loud to do much of anything, but the environment is electric for sure. Free wifi wireless internet access, and coffee so strong it hurts your head.
author: Aris V.

description: I really want to like Philz.  Everyone raves about it, the service is super friendly, and there's one just around the corner from me.  That said, I can't get past the fact that I'm paying over 3$ for a cup of coffee.  To be clear: this is drip coffee.  A regular cup.  It's good coffee, sure, and there's a wide selection of beans.  But is it all that special?  Maybe people are too used to coffee sitting in an urn all day, or from a pot on a burner in the office.  I make fresh coffee daily (drip, french press, moka, etc.) with decent beans and get something of similar quality to this - not bitter, custom cream and sugar (ooh!) - in a few more minutes than the baristas at Philz, no special tricks or anything.  Do people just not know how to make their own coffee?  Hmm.
author: Stephen D.

description: Just had my first cup of Philz coffee, and I am in actual awe !  I am a rabid coffee drinker, and I must say that this is THE BEST cup of coffee I have ever had.  Ever.  It almost felt like food.  The people are great, too.  So, either drink Philz, or give up coffee forever - those are the 2 choices.
author: Mary N.

description: They saved my life, they know their shit... trying to function the morning after the Borg Booty Call - Resistance Was Futile, and yeah you know who you are. I was sleepy/tired but not unhappy about it.
author: Jennifer H.

description: Probably the best coffee in the city (I like it better than Blue Bottle and Ritual, etc.). Only downside is how annoying it can be to order and pay for it, but who really cares!
author: Charlie C.

description: Just like everyone else... I LOVE the mint mojito iced coffee! The coffee was really refreshing and it was hard to believe that I was drinking coffee on my first sip.
author: Cris C.

description: i thought i liked coffee. i was wrong. that disgusting sewer water i used to drink isn't even close to what coffee should be. come here just once. you will immediately regret ever drinking that dime a dozen shit you used to drink. i went here for my first time this week. i've been to three different philz this week depending on my location because i need coffee. Fact.
author: Ben T.

description:
Rude customer service. I've gone to Philz often and am a pretty patient person overall but today was the last straw. I've had multiple instances where the baristas are just rude.
 
*I ask for a mojito and I get glared at by the barista. She's looking at me while making the drink and just giving me dirty looks. I don't know why "can I get a mint mojito please" pisses her off but I head over to the purchase line to finish the transaction. I write it off to her having a bad day.

*I come back a different time and I get the same barista (bad news!). I think fine, no problem. I ask for an iced coffee and when I pick it up, the taste is off. I ask for it to be sweetened more and again, I get the glare again while she adds the sweetener. How dare I feel that the drink isn't perfect. 

*I order a coffee and ask for a cup of water. I'm told, "yeah it's over there."  The cashier person looks at the sink across the room and then then moves to the next person in line. I don't receive the water and am just stunned. If I could get it myself I would, but it's behind the counter and I don't have access to it. 

*I walk in and I hear someone say "can I help you?" I look around and no one is looking at me but the barista looks like she's looking down and making drinks and a worker heads over to the bagel stand. I don't know who spoke to me. The barista is making drinks so I look at the menu for the non-coffee options. I'm just looking and decide on a tea. A dude pops up behind the counter, we share eye contact, so I think it's okay to order my tea. After I order, he then tells me to order through the barista because it can get busy during peak hours and to essentially follow the system. Notice, I'm the only one in line because it's NOT BUSY AT ALL. I get it, follow the system. I wouldn't mind that and I usually do order through the barista first but there's no reason to look like you bit into a lemon with a sour look on your face when I try to explain my mistake. WHen the barista calls my order, she's looking at the customers ahead of her and not at the counter when setting the tea down. The cup spills over some tea. Thank you for making me feel special. 

I'm not making a blanket statement that all the baristas are rude. After all, they are actually very pleasant generally and make good suggestions for drinks. However, when spending $3 per cup for coffee/tea, I have higher standards for customer service. It's okay to have bad days but please don't take it out on me.
author: Melanie A.

description: In a sea of mediocre coffee shops along the Van Ness corridor, this is a godsend!  Thank you Philz!!
author: Tom F.

description: Best coffee I've ever had.  But admittedly, I am not a coffee connoisseur and get by with starbucks and panera, so that's all i have to compare it with.  Only con is the wait for your coffee because they actually grind and brew it on the spot.  I guess that's how good coffee is supposed to be made.  Didn't even need sugar!
author: Andy C.

description: Their coffee is AWESOME.  Three days of Outside Lands was made survivable by their Mint Mojito iced coffee as well as a few other cups of the dark stuff with a little cream and sugar.  It's left me really wishing there was one of these over in the Cow Hollow/Russian Hill neighborhood to feed my newly surfaced addiction!
author: Chrys W.

description: A coffee shop that serves REAL Turkish coffee??  Could it be?  Oh yes, it could.  And it was fantastic.  Coffees of all types are made to order (not just the fancy drinks--even the basic coffees are made on a cup-by-cup basis) which means you'll never end up getting something brewed 10, 15, 20 mins ago and kept warm.   Two thumbs up!
author: H B.

description: Philz has been my choice in boutique coffee joint for quite some time. My only complaint is that it is too successful. With their great coffee, their friendly staff, and great atmosphere, I am always grateful for all they do. On top of it, Sammy, is such a great guy who makes me feel welcomed every time I'm there. I always enjoy my times there.
author: Kevin T.

description: OMG!  I simply love the coffee at Philz.  They put the milk and sugar in for you, and it's oh-so-perfect.  Can't wait for my next cup....
author: Kandi K.

description: Philz is bomb.  It is truly the best tasting coffee EVER.  Period.
author: Sarah B.

description:
I can't remember ever being treated so nicely in a coffee shop before.  And I've certainly never had such a delicious, frothy, rich, "regular" cup of coffee before. (It was Jacob's). Top that off with a yummy spinach pie and it's the perfect snack before a show. 

Did I mention what nice, pleasant people they were, too? Pinch me...this is San Francisco?
author: Louise L.

description: Great coffee. Great service. They don't smile a lot but great people ;-). Remember why you drink coffee!  Can be a bit slower as they brew all coffee when ordered (even drip) - worth the wait.
author: Rudy S.

description: Try "Sooo Good" because it's sooo good.  This place is amazing!  Not your typical coffee house.  This place has one thing in mind to cater to the satisfaction of its client.  They make every coffee from the beans to you.  The people are very pleasant and the pasties are delicious.  Try the vegan doughnuts.  It's out of this world!
author: Cris E.

description: Yum.  This is the PERFECT Coffee and great place to hang out.
author: Kelley F.

description: I respect the quality of their coffee very well. Farm cheese danish is my favorite pastry also. The staff are friendly.  Wifi friendly attitude is another good point.  Keep great job, I will continue to come.
author: AI T.

description: Easy 5 star rating - no second guess or post rating doubts.  Best cup of coffee I've ever had and I am a self-nominated, close-friend-confirmed coffee snob.  Challenge?  You're on.
author: scott g.

description: i love philz... nothing beats the original on folsom, but the one on van ness is super convenient and less out of the way.  they have a nice lounge area too where i can sit and enjoy my coffee and use my laptop. only problem is the coffee is a little inconsistent at times... sometimes it tastes a little less strong than normal... but all in all, philz on van ness is good.
author: Joe A.

description: I'm not really a coffee drinker... so this review is for the fresh chai tea. It was delicious!! I had one this morning and I can't stop thinking about it. They ask you how sweet you like it, and top it with fresh mint - which is a surprisingly yummy touch. My boyfriend and his friend got coffee and loved it. Service was very friendly too...
author: lisa l.

description: When my girlfriend and I went to San Franscisco, we decided to check out the coffee in town, and we'd heard great things about the Blue Bottle.  Upon checking it out, and being relatively unenthused, we were tipped off about Philz. This is probably some of the best coffee I've ever had.  You've got to know the drill if you're going to make it out smoothly, but once you understand the order of operations, you'll be very well-rewarded.
author: Eric B.

description:
Attention!  I am gonna sound like 1-800 commercial. But it's the best coffee ever and i don't even like coffee. I like my coffee light roast w/ nice amount of sugar and cream. It's like drinking creme brulee. So good. and it's called " So good"  Seriously. 
It's double the price of starbucks. But i can't drink anymore starbucks or peet's. 

P.S: This neighborhood craved for good music, free wifi, good drink. If the table & chair was more comfy & space was bigger i think i will just move in. So to prevent that kind of effect the chair must not be ultra padded, i guess. 

Supernice people too.
author: E B.

description: Thanks for ignoring me. I ask you a polite question about your coffee and you turn your back to me and pretend I'm not there.
author: K J.

description: brought home a pound of tesora beans and it's still tasty! i wish they had one in so cal!
author: Sarang Y.

description: Enjoyed the service here. The barrista was very helpful and the coffee - good.
author: Rishabh M.

description: Philz has it down.  They pretty much make the perfect cup of coffee every time.  Unfortunately I don't yet share their talents.  I bought half a pound of Tesora, took it home, ground it, brewed it, drank it.  But it didn't taste anything like it does when they do it.  I'll keep practicing, but nothing will replace the flavor of a fresh cup made in-house.
author: Idin K.

description: Delicious coffee and super friendly service, even during the morning rush hour.
author: M T.

description: Oh, Philz, how I heart you.  Let me start by saying that I'm not really a coffee fan...I don't care for the way it tastes, but unfortunately law school made it somewhat mandatory.  That being said, Philz coffee is like nothing I've ever had...doesn't taste like your usual cup of coffee, but I can't put my finger on what's so different about it; it's the silkiest coffee I've ever had.  And it gets me wired, which is a super-plus for us students.  My favorite blends are the Tesora and Amborsia.  If you're a first-timer there, I suggest you start with the Tesora, which is like their "staple" blend.  The barista's are super friendly and cheerful and will take the time to ask you how you like your coffee so that they can suggest the perfect cup for you (coffee or tea? what kind of roast? milk? sweet?).  The manager here is also super friendly and makes sure to wave at me through the window every day I walk by.  Only downside to Philz is that they're a little pricey, but worth it when you want that perfect pick-me-up during the day.  As far as Blue Bottle vs. Philz, goes, I prefer Philz.
author: Jules A.

description:
Philz Coffee is the BEST!  Sammy and Miya are personable and welcoming.  I hadn't heard of Philz until I noticed it was opening at the bottom of the building where I lived.  I waited and waited in anticipation of its opening and it's finally here!  The Estatic Iced Coffee is awesome and the Mint Mojito Iced Coffee is to die for.  

While it can be a bit intimidating at first (definately NOT your Starbuck's or Peet's) the baristas make you feel super comfortable, so the best thing to do is ask them for suggestions.  Tell them what you like and they will be happy to make you something better than you are used to.

Safe to say...I think I am addicted!
author: Marites A.

description: OMG! I am now a coffee snob and Philz addict!!!  I LOVE their coffee so much that it is all I drink at home now!!!  I order the Great Alarm, it has a lot of caffeine but is so smooth and tasty!  Love this place!!!
author: Melissa F.

description: Heard all the raves about this place so I decided to try it out.  The place was small and coming in I immediately tried to look for an "order here" sign.  I didnt see one so I placed my order at the register.  The barista asked the guy on the register what I was having.  He told the barista my order and then said some comment which the guy at a table close to the register said something in agreement.  It was my first time and I guess I ordered at the wrong side but if I did it wrong shouldnt they just say something like...is this your first time...you actually order over there...instead of making snide comments.  I don't necessarily know that the service is any better or worse than any other coffee shop but I was really disappointed since this small company prides itself on exemplary coffee with personal and caring customer service.  Also the girl ahead of me was asked to try her coffee before leaving.  Truly coffee tailored to your taste.  BUT when I got my mocha tesora I didnt get asked diddly squat.  The only good thing about this visit was the coffee..it was actually very good.  Ill try to check out another location and maybe the service there is better.
author: she q.

description: I had no idea what to expect when I walked in the place, but I think this might be the best coffee I've ever had!  I was overwhelmed by the selection and they were kind enough to guide me through the differences between their coffees.  I took their suggested and started in the "middle" with their standard roast.  It was perfect.  They do add the milk and sugar for you so you need to work with them on that or you might get coffee that is too sweet!
author: Priscilla C.

description:
i recommend this place...the people here are beyond nice...it catches me off guard spending the last year in NYC.  

I recommend the mint mojito ice coffee and the new Manhattan for weekday drinking.
author: Andrew P.

description: good coffee.  i hate how they make you taste it before you leave though.  have some confidence.
author: Hammer Time H.

description: over price coffee  snotty staff , i hate to say it but rather go to starbucks
author: matt p.

description: By far the tastiest cup of joe in the Bay Area....insanely kind staff, freshly ground/hand-made/unique blend coffee topped with a mint garnish will put any 9-5er in a better mood. Made specifically to your liking, this is not your average mom and pop coffee shop--the baristas will ask if you want cream and sugar, stir to perfection, then ask you to "try it first and make sure you like it." One of the only stores in Portreo Hill with a public computer, however, not recommended for use. Just bring your laptop (if you have one) and take advantage of their free WI-Fi. I say free wi-fi like it's some sort of new and hot commodity or something...meh. Delicious coffee nonetheless!
author: Jessica U.

description: Thanks for coming to my neighborhood, Philz! I was getting tired of suffering until I got down to 24th or King once I ran out of your Tesora. I'm glad to see bags at WF but, I want it fresher, and now it's a short walk up a mild hill, no better reward than a cup of Philharmonic with cream. I can't start my day without a little Philz and sorry BB, you don't compare once you've found your fav Philz blend! LOVES.
author: Mel N.

description: Still savoring my Ecstatic Iced Coffee right now.  Don't know what they put in there but it's perfect!  Next time I'm going to have to remember to bring my own mug- what a steal!  It was awesome that the barista asked me exactly how I liked my coffee and was able to cater to my palette- and even offered to redo it if it wasn't to my liking.  He initially suggested that mint drink but I'm not a fan of mint.  I'm very happy with the choice I ended up with though.  I regret getting a small... should've gone for the largest size.  Too bad the location is really out of the way for me.  :(
author: Justine L.

description: Amazingly good coffee, friendly staff, and huge variety.  I'm on vacation and I wanted to try San Fran's best coffee.  After finding Philz on Yelp I was excited to try it, so I took the 15 min walk to grab my cup of java and after the first sip of the Jacob's blend I was instantly hooked.  Thanks Philz for the lovely experience.
author: Isaac B.

description: Best coffee I have ever had.  It has a must be tasted to believe aerated texture.  Fantastic and worth the $3.
author: The P.

description:
i thought blue bottle had the best coffee.

i have never had coffee like this.  i was dragged in by a friend one saturday and oh.. my!  i sipped my cup of java for the next 6 hrs (i am not a coffee drinker) and everytime i took a sip, i couldn't help but say "oh wow.  there is no sour aftertaste.. and it is x hours old".  

it is.. perfect coffee.
author: tc h.

description: delicious coffee!  i feel like the staff are always so warm and friendly, and i love to watch them make each cup of coffee.  my fave so far is the jacob wonderbar brew, but i gotta try the mocha sometime.  they also sweeten it and put cream in it for you - yay for the lazies like me!
author: Tiffany D.

description: I consider myself lucky, because once I got to San Francisco, Philz was the first coffee I had... and the second, and the third.  It's apparent that the baristas here really take pride in their coffee, and I appreciate that they aren't afraid to experiment.  They're true pros if they can come up with something on the fly, and it comes out delicious.  The unsweetened mocha black coffee was awesome.  But I'm normally a black coffee kind of guy, and their black iced coffee is possibly the best I've had anywhere.  I'll probably be back at least another six times before i leave in two days.
author: Michael L.

description: Mint Mojito is amazing, and sometimes the baristas are mind readers!   Don't stop in quite as often as I'd like but good people and great coffee!
author: Erika S.

description: Probably the best coffee I had in my life. Real Rap!
author: Terrel R.

description: this place makes good, fresh, drip coffee. and they have a mocha. and it's always hot. the kids that work there are all nice, laid-back, and they never fuck it up. i only wish they had a frequent customer discount cause this place is on my way to work so i end up here about 2-3 times a week.
author: Kyla W.

description: That's some damn good ass coffee, other than my favorite cafe sua da, philz coffee gave my gf and i the best coffee I've ever tasted
author: chris c.

description: This is a somewhat unique place for coffee and some snacks.  Each cup is brewed individually - great for those who like "personalized" service.  Bottom line here is that one gets what one pays for.  The prices are at the high end of the spectrum for a cup of coffee - BUT the quality of the beans and drink, the people, the service, and the atmosphere combine to make for an excellent getaway - even if only for a few minutes.  In summary - I might say that this is an "affordable" luxury for the coffee connoisseur.
author: Antonio E.

description: i cant believe i've never tried this place until this year!  it's hella more expensive than a regular cup of joe but it's sooo worth it.  if you think of lattes and stuff, then the prices are comparable.  at philz, each order is brewed ONE cup at a time.  they add cream and sugar to your liking, and if it's not to your liking, they will brew another cup for you until you're satisfied.  i love their jacob's coffee.  also, the folks here are friendly and knowledgeable.  depending on who's brewing your coffee, the flavor can vary slightly every now and then.  philz have a large selection of coffee that will surely please all coffee lovers.
author: amee m.

description: I'm a huge Philz fan...in fact I haven't had coffee this good since I travelled in Europe (and come to think of it, if there was a Philz at the Trevi Fountain life would be perfecto.)  I told the barista that I tried to make my own version of Philz using their beans at home and could not make it taste the same. I asked him why and he said I was missing the secret ingredient...LOVE. Not true...I do love Philz coffee.
author: Alana S.

description: I work 2 blocks from this Philz location and i am hooked!   Yes, their coffee is wonderful, but it is their mint iced tea that has won me over.  It is the most refreshing and fresh iced tea I have ever had and I never tire of it.  I have my co-workers hooked and one of my co-workes calls me a "pusher".  And, the staff strives for perfection with each cup made.
author: Bernie B.

description: Definitely an expensive cup of coffee but the variety of beans, knowledgeable and helpful staff and painstaking effort put into every cup of coffee make it worth it. The manufacturer's cream is unbelievably creamy and comes highly recommended. Only been there a handful of times but I have to say this was easily one of the best and most memorable coffee houses I've had the pleasure of setting foot in.
author: Andres G.

description: Awesome place, amazing coffee, adorable staff.  Just about every weekend this is the place I look forward to for a treat. I love to sit there, people watch, chat with the friendly staff and also, sip my beloved beverage, Ambrosia, with cream (real cream) - heavenly and sinful. I make a passable effort to watch my fat intake, but this delicious cream is tough to resist...  come for the boutique coffee and relaxed atmosphere!!!
author: Vat S.

description: the mojito iced coffee is simply amazing! my only complaints are that this cafe aint cheap at all and a large really isn't that large.....however most of the staff is pretty cool and friendly the rest can suck it for being snooty barista asses. overall i'll still go here and put up with the snootiness to get my java fix.
author: Ax L.

description: I LOVE Philz!! I had heard about Philz from friends who are coffee freaks. I don't consider myself a coffee addict anymore although I do occasionally enjoy having coffee because I like the taste and I enjoy the caffeine rush. By pleasant coincidence, I was headed out to the War Memorial Opera House for an event, and some friends and I decided to go nearby for a hot drink before the event started. I noticed that there was a Philz a couple of blocks away so we went there. The people working there are super friendly and helpful. And, their drinks were yummy. I love that they ask you to taste your drink and give your approval or they will fix it for you. That's a true sign of good customer service. I enjoyed it so much that I brought another friend there a few days ago for a lovely afternoon tea break. I think I love their tea as much or even more than their coffee. The green tea made with cream, honey, and special Philz spices is delicious. I can't wait to go back! (^_^)
author: Lisa M.

description:
most amazing coffee i've ever had. simply delectable. i would go across the city for this stuff. have literally come up from south san fran to get it. 

it sucks to sit in. drafty, cold - but it's SF I always think it's chilly.

but the coffee is the best ... i think i'm about to go now ;)
author: Doc C.

description: I love coffee, but I'm no coffee snob.  I don't know or care if what I drink comes from Ethiopia or Sumatra.  I just want it to taste good and have a lot of caffeine in it.  So when I go into Philz, I ask for strong coffee, taste-wise and caffeine-wise.  I don't know what it is that they give me, but it tastes perfect.  Best coffee ever.  And the people who work there are really nice.
author: M M.

description: I have ordered the same mocha from all the Philz locations in SF.  This place has by far the best execution.  I love the care with which the server handles all the orders.  How can someone make it so perfect to taste when the only thing I said was "not too sweet" please?!  He politely asked me how I liked my drink and noted that he can fix it to the way I want it after already having spent 2mins on preparing it for the first try.  I know that this level of service is not to be expected if this place gets crowded like the castro or mission locations.  I know because I have been to all of them, and trust me, I can tell the difference in the quality.  I selfishly want the business to be slow here :) and make this my little secret.
author: Adele W.

description: Philz fresh chai - I just love it!! Every time i visit SF i have to grab it!! :)
author: Shilpa A.

description: i went to here this afternoon on the way back home. i can't tell exactly how it was because the place seemed a little different from other caffes to me. i tried a small americano with house blend and midiium roasted. it wasn't that bad. i kind of like that.  Also, someone already mentioned a barista guy was really kind and explained well about their coffee. Another thing i like there was a variety of coffee beens.  They have many different kinds of beens behind a bar. So, if you guys want to try something different, why don't you go and grab a cup of coffee?
author: WONIL P.

description: This review is not about the coffee which is delicious. It's about the slow talking barrista whose arrogance and smugness would make George W. Bush Jr. look like a lamb.  Upon arriving at Philz we were waiting in the wrong spot - how could we know?. The barrista admonished us in a condescending voice "This is more like a bar than a coffee shop. Come over here." Then he proceeded to talk about himself the entire time he was making  our coffee. After I had burnt myself due to his overfilling the cup, instead of asking me how I was, he criticized the way I put the top on.
author: Yanni G.

description: great Turkish blend..not the best surroundings/seating area, but worth coming back for the great fresh coffee...
author: Vido E.

description:
best cup of coffee ive had in SF to date. period.

 love this place, great quality product, helpful knowledgeable friendly staff, un-pretentious. just great. the only draw back i could say id if your in a rush this place probably is'nt for you but the wait is well worth it.


o and being able to order a Large Ether on sunday morning is just funny :)
author: A M.

description: Great coffee, great recommendation by the the very helpful staff. Best cup I've had in a while.
author: Matt S.

description: The best coffee ever!  Its such a drag that I will probably never go back to this location.  When I went in this morning to get my coffee, I was so excited to have a delicious cup of Philz spectacular coffee.  Its a pricey splurge for me.  First two interactions with people working there, lovely.  (Wish I'd gotten names) Let me make it clear, there were NO people in line, so there was clearly time to give decent customer service. Then this happened:  I started out by telling the person who took my order what I would like.  Instead of teaching me with kindness by asking me questions about what I wanted and helping me to understand the best way to ask for it, the person making the coffee decided to look at me like I had three heads, *tell* me what I wanted and then crack jokes about me to his co-worker while I had to stand there waiting for my coffee, hearing every word.  Thanks for a really craptacular start to my morning. The half-assed "take care"  raised the craptacular bar even higher. I really love Philz coffee, and was happy to have an alternative to Peet's, but I'm not going to give my money to a store that makes me feel like I don't "belong" there.  Such a drag. Really, such a drag.
author: Jim E.

description: My fiance and I stumbled over this wonderful small coffee shop and I was amazed by the quality of coffee and service.  They personalize your coffee to your standards and they're extremely friendly.  They treat you like family.  Ever since our first experience I buy coffee there frequently.  Just last week, they were closing for the night when my fiance and I arrived.  To my astonishment they reopened the shop just so we can buy 2 cups of coffee.  HOW AMAZING IS THAT!  They actually treat you like family.  On top of that, it's the best coffee I've ever tasted.
author: Janelle F.

description: oh how I miss by Arabic blend in the morning......painfully miss I should say
author: Charlie W.

description: whoah.  i've never had coffee this good.  got a dark roast with a little bit of milk and little sugar (the guy told me that's how they do it) and it was fantastic. no bitter taste after either.  i always drop by when i'm in the area.
author: shar d.

description: great place,good coffee,wonderful location
author: Antonio C.

description: it makes me sick whenever i pass this place and see all the people trying to be trendy sitting outside smoking and sucking on their disposable cups of  adulterated coffee because one or both of the local free weekly newspapers told them this is the place to be seen. after all, like using your laptop or reading your art history textbook, it's not like you can make coffee at home yourself out of public view. i decided to give Philz (cute, huh?) a try when i was working in the area, had heard the hype and didn't know where else to get a cup of Java so, being un-American, i took my own mug as usual and asked for black coffee. the owner had his young female assistant put on an unsolicited  performance followed by his own personal dash of cardampm. i tried to stop him and asked what he was doing but his "i'm from a foreign country, check me out!" attitude was too important to him and he wouldn't even answer my question. after all, i was only the customer and not wearing the de rigueur  piercings and other paraphernalia. the drink had a funny flavor, to the degree that i could taste the actual coffee, and i was sorry i hadn't just gone somewhere else for a double espresso. call me crazy but i don't like extra junk being dumped into my food or drink, especially if i haven't been asked first and have actually tried to prevent it.  i agree with Keb Mo's lyrics in Keep It Simple and with the bumpersticker Just Give Me a Cup of Joe and Nobody Gets Hurt.
author: Aki T.
